While the food at this location is good, the long wait times make it difficult to recommend. The waitstaff is generally pleasant, but the lengthy wait for food can be frustrating. Consider opting for a different diner or restaurant if you're short on time.

Body Cycle is hands down the best spin class studio I've ever been to. The space is clean and bikes are top quality, the instructors are welcoming and motivating, and the online scheduling system makes it easy to plan ahead. Russell, the owner, is incredibly passionate and attentive to his clients' success. I highly recommend giving Body Cycle a try for an amazing workout experience.

This family diner offers an eclectic buffet with a mix of Mexican choices such as a large chicken leg, tamale, and rolled grape leaves. The fresh melon and friendly, attentive staff add to the overall positive dining experience. The option to order off the menu with all-day breakfast makes it a convenient choice for a relaxed meal with no expectations. Located next to the Clarion Hotel, it's a good option for a casual dining experience.

This Indian restaurant offers a delicious and unique dining experience with a variety of dishes to choose from. The lamb curry and korma were our favorites, and the 10 different types of naan were a great addition to the meal. Don't be discouraged by the exterior of the restaurant, as the food inside is worth the visit. Try something new and you won't be disappointed!

The interior of the restaurant is cute and the owner gave us a tour of the upcoming patio/rooftop area, which will be perfect on beautiful days. The cheese curds were delicious and filling. I appreciated that the sandwiches came with a salad, especially after indulging in the curds. I had the onion, gruyere, tomato sandwich which was good, but needed an extra kick, like pepper jelly. I hope to see more menu options added, such as salads with interesting cheeses. The restaurant offers a variety of beer and wine, with a limited selection of cocktails. Next time, I will try one of the draft wines.

After being a long term frequent customer, I was shocked at the lack of service when I tried to order takeout. Despite the restaurant being only half full, I was told they were too busy. Extremely disappointed and will not be returning. Kanella is a much better option now.

Highly recommended tour! I grabbed a groupon for a great price and enjoyed exploring New Orleans with a knowledgeable guide. The tour was a perfect mix of French Quarter and cemetery exploration. Meeting in front of a grocery store was a bit odd but not difficult to find. Don't miss this tour if you're visiting New Orleans!

I highly recommend checking out this hidden gem for their amazingly amazing wings and homemade bleu cheese. The ribeye was tender, perfectly prepared, and delicious. The selection of craft beers is also a nice touch. Overall, a definite must-visit spot.

Overall, Los Padres National Forest is a beautiful destination for Easter, but the staff needs to improve maintenance at White Rock to remove dead grass and clean up the water to make it more appealing. Compared to Cachuma Lake, Los Padres staff could put in more effort to upkeep the natural beauty of the forest.

We had a party of 6 at this hibachi restaurant and were disappointed with the service. Our waitress brought our separate sushi orders on one plate, making it difficult to distinguish whose was whose, and forgot several items on our order. The restaurant was quiet so we were surprised by the mistakes. The hibachi cook, Francisco, cooked well but lacked the usual lively interaction. The service was lacking and while the food was good, the overall experience fell short. I wouldn't return for the price.

My experience with Shalimar was truly outstanding. I needed my engagement ring resized and they were able to accommodate my same-day request. Although I made a mistake with the sizing, the team was understanding and quickly fixed it at no additional charge. Their exceptional customer service has made me a loyal customer. Highly recommend Shalimar for any jewelry needs.
Milktooth in Indianapolis is an amazing gem recommended by locals. I'm grateful for the opportunity to experience this culinary treasure.

This spot is perfect for happy hour or dinner, with a great patio equipped with fans to keep you cool in the St. Louis heat. The staff is very accommodating and willing to modify dishes to suit your tastes. I particularly enjoy the Veal Milanese with mixed greens instead of pasta. Overall a fantastic dining experience.

Overall, the food at this restaurant is excellent. I especially enjoyed the gnocchi with marinara and the baked eggplant appetizer. While the service was slow, the delicious food makes it worth a return visit.

The Sonoran Dog's bun is key, serving as a cozy and indulgent blanket for the hot dog. While the hot dog and bacon could use a bit more bite to stand out against the mustard and onions, the carne asada caramelo is a standout choice with excellent flavors and a great price point. Plus, the convenience of a drive-through option makes it even more appealing.
I had a delicious waffle and crispy home fries at this place. The waitstaff was friendly and I will definitely be returning for breakfast again.

The service at this establishment, particularly from Douglas, was exceptional and the food was delicious. While on the pricier side (avg 40-50$ for main course), the atmosphere rivals top tier restaurants nationwide. Incredible overall experience.

My husband and I have visited this restaurant multiple times and have always been impressed with every aspect of our meal. The staff is highly knowledgeable about gluten-free options and their recommendations have always been spot on. The wine and cocktail selections are excellent and the food is truly divine. The only downside is the lack of gluten-free dessert options, but it's a minor inconvenience in comparison to the overall experience. We will definitely continue to dine here in the future.

I highly recommend Natalie as a brow specialist at Blow Bar - she does a great job! Victoria also impressed me with her skills, giving my thin, straight hair amazing volume. The salon is beautiful and clean. Victoria will be my go-to stylist from now on.

This cafe is a perfect spot for a productive and enjoyable visit. The black and white latte is exceptional, the soups are delicious even for non-soup lovers, and the atmosphere is ideal for working with the perfect noise level and music. Plus, the presence of dogs adds to the charm of the place. I highly recommend this cafe and will continue to be a loyal customer.
The combination of actual pumpkin pie in frozen custard is mind-blowing. The chunks of pie crust are a delightful surprise. This treat should definitely become a nationwide craze. So delicious!

Upland Brewery in Bloomington, IN offers great beers, burgers, and tenderloins, but their pizza fell short for me. The margherita pizza had a light, cracker-like crust and lacked flavor from toppings. It may work as an appetizer, but I'll be sticking to their other menu items in the future.
I had a great time at the show. Perfect for a relaxed Friday night.

This sushi place is the only option in town, but it satisfies sushi cravings when quick and convenient. The salmon is top-notch, along with tasty options like spicy edamame, tempura, ocean salad, and cabbage salad. Friendly and prompt service adds to the positive experience.

Overall, I was somewhat torn between giving this restaurant 3 or 4 stars. The atmosphere is geared more towards takeout, but they do have a decent dining area. The sushi bowl was good but not outstanding, with limited vegetable choices and an abundance of rice. The Maui roll did not meet the standard set by the 96th street location. However, I would still return for the sushi bowls and recommend trying their bubble tea. Service may be slower than expected, but it is worth the wait for a healthy alternative to fast food in the area.
The beef brisket sandwich and pulled pork were both incredibly delicious and tender. Would definitely recommend for a tasty lunch option.
This Thai restaurant is hands down the best in the area. Every dish is authentic and absolutely delicious. I will definitely be returning again and again.
Overall, disappointing experience with subpar service and average food. Regretful choice for my last meal in town.

Overall, our dining experience at this restaurant was fantastic. The food was excellent, came out quickly, and tasted fresh and homemade. The menu had a great variety of enticing options. We can't wait to return and try more dishes, especially the chef specials!

The food at this restaurant was decent, earning it two stars, however, the service was severely lacking. Despite spending $100 on entrées and appetizers, I had to flag down the assistant cook to ask for additional avocado for my tuna dish, only to be told I needed to speak to my waitress to pay for it separately. Very disappointing experience.

I had an excellent first experience at this restaurant. The atmosphere is welcoming and cozy, making it feel like you're entering someone's home. The wait staff was friendly and humorous, adding to the enjoyable experience. The food was delivered promptly and was phenomenal. I will definitely be returning to this place in the future.

Overall, this spot offers great burgers, fries, and salad with a delicious hint of salt and pepper flavor. The quaint outdoor seating and friendly staff provide a pleasant dining experience. Convenient parking options make it a hassle-free choice for a meal.
. Overall, I highly recommend this store for its exceptional staff, cleanliness, large selection, and great customer service. They truly go above and beyond to make sure all your needs are met.

Took my car in for a manufacturer recall a few years ago. The problem was fixed, but later started hearing another noise. Kevin and his mechanic diagnosed and fixed the unrelated issue for free. Outstanding service, highly recommend.

I recently visited my local Sweet CeCe's and, overall, I love the product. The selection of toppings is great, with a good mix between healthy and indulgent options. However, I have noticed that sometimes the staff can be inattentive or forgetful about deals like $5 Fridays. Despite this, I can't give it less than 4 stars because I genuinely enjoy my experience there.
Fantastic spot in the Funk Zone! Delicious food and wine tastings right next door to the Santa Barbara Wine Collective. We loved the savory croissant - highly recommend. Life is good here!

The Center is a great spot for a relaxing massage, with easy same-day appointments available. I've always had a positive experience with the therapists here and have never been disappointed. Highly recommend!

Check-in at the Peppermill was quick and easy with complimentary valet parking. The hotel is huge and reminiscent of Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, with eight restaurants on site offering a variety of food options. The casino area is also vast, but be aware that some slot machines have minimum bets higher than advertised. Our room in the Tuscany Tower on the 12th floor had a nice view of the pool, spacious layout, and amenities like free WiFi, a large bathroom with dual sinks and a jetted bathtub, and comfortable furnishings. Overall, the staff was courteous and helpful, making for an enjoyable stay.

My boyfriend and I had a great first experience at this deli. I had a delicious turkey, avocado & bacon panini and he enjoyed his buffalo chicken wrap. The food came out quickly, which was a bonus during the busy lunch hour. With a wide variety of options including salads, soup, sandwiches, and hot food, we will definitely be returning to try more items. Love a deli with plenty of choices!
The biscuits are amazing and the cocktails are great. Highly recommend, but it can get busy.

The food at this restaurant was delicious and cooked perfectly. The atmosphere and decor reminded me of a fishing lodge, and the menu was a mix between Outback and Bonefish. We used a Groupon and all three of our meals along with the calamari appetizer were excellent. We will definitely be returning in the future.

Overall, this restaurant is cheap and conveniently located, but the food tastes and feels cheap. The dessert options are good, and the service was excellent. However, the breakfast options were disappointing, and the decor is outdated. The meat slicing station and Mexican station were also lacking. I tried this restaurant three times and was consistently disappointed.

Overall, my experience at this restaurant was tarnished by one pretentious waiter, but was ultimately redeemed by the outstanding service of the bartender, Ben. The location at Hotel Palomar is convenient and the room service was delicious. Despite the initial negative encounter, the genuine and welcoming attitude of Ben made up for it. The bartender truly exceeded expectations and made the overall experience a positive one.
I stopped by after a morning walk in the park and was impressed with the great food, coffee, and customer service. The vibe in this place is fantastic. Highly recommend.

Overall, this restaurant is overrated. The food took too long to come out, the burger was overcooked, and the Seafood Jumbalaya was decent. It's not worth the price and there are better places to eat in the French Quarter. I expected much better based on the hype surrounding this place.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The bed was comfortable, breakfast was delicious, the internet was fast, and the location was ideal. The low price was an added bonus. My only issue was waiting up to 15 minutes for an elevator in the morning on the top floors. Overall, highly recommend this place.

This restaurant falls short in terms of providing a proper dining experience. Patrons are expected to do everything themselves, from getting their own water to paying for drinks. The overall atmosphere is lacking, with dirty yard and lawn chairs. The only highlight was the live music. Overall, a one-time visit was more than enough.

If you prefer a la carte dining and don't mind paying extra for condiments, this restaurant may be for you. The food was decent but nothing special. Be prepared for additional charges for things like cheese and salsa. Make sure to clarify any extra charges before ordering.
The cafe was adorable with a jazz band playing at 8am. The breakfast sandwich was delicious with rolled egg and bacon pieces inside. Great price for a filling breakfast.

This place is the bomb. The duckfat french fries were worth the hype and the Fois Gras burger was incredible. Keith, the bartender, was friendly and knowledgeable. Definitely worth a return visit with friends.

The artichoke dip was disappointing with cold dip and stale chips. Our waitress did not address the issue. The thin crust pizza was pricey after adding toppings and only okay in taste. The server was good overall. Previous experiences during Cardinals games were better. Will look for a different venue next time.

Jasmine Rice is a good choice for a laid back Thai restaurant with delicious dishes like green curry fried rice and chicken and duck pad thai. The duck in particular was exceptional. Service was good overall, though there were some reported issues with other customers. Despite small hiccups, we would definitely return for more quality Thai food.

Courtney is an exceptional hairstylist. She effortlessly understands what will look best on her clients and always delivers stunning results. With her knowledge and great personality, she consistently exceeds expectations. I highly recommend her for anyone looking to look their best.

If you need a quick and reliable oil change or state inspection, this Pep Boys location will do the job. It may not be the most glamorous or exciting place, but it gets the job done efficiently. Just make sure to go when they are not busy to avoid long wait times. Overall, decent and reliable service.
The replacement of two old 70s Lennox units with new ones was successful and the new units have been running smoothly for three years. Great job overall.

The Brewpub offers a wide selection of delicious dishes, including nachos, pizza, and sandwiches, as well as a variety of on-site crafted beers. The service may be slow, but it encourages you to savor the experience and enjoy the patio with friends. The restaurant is kid and dog-friendly, and has options for vegetarian and vegan diets. The half order of nachos and fish & chips are highly recommended. Don't miss out on trying their Pumpkin Seasonal Beer, which is on par with some of the best in the category.

Farmhouse Rustic Chic is a great home store in SB with helpful staff and reasonable prices. The store offers items from Joanna Gaines and more, making it a perfect place to find home decor inspiration. Overall, a fantastic find for those looking to decorate their home in a stylish and affordable way.

My brother and I had a great time at this establishment. We picked up a six pack of good beers for a night in but ended up staying to play Nintendo 64 and enjoy some more drinks. The owner mentioned that the console was donated by fellow patrons, adding to the friendly atmosphere. The food was delicious and the staff were genuinely nice. This place should definitely become a staple in the Northeast.

I really enjoyed the coconut soup and pad thai with protein at this restaurant. The coconut soup was creamy and not overpowering with herbs, which I appreciated. The pad thai had a perfect balance of peanuts, noodles, and sweetness, with generous amounts of chicken that were not dry. Overall, a very satisfying meal.

I had an excellent experience at this diner. The service was great, the food was delicious, and they serve breakfast all day. Despite being busy, the staff was friendly and accommodating. The location off the 295 made it easy to get to. Overall, a fantastic spot for a meal.

This bar is now my Saturday night go-to spot after Lucy's closed. The food, especially the wings and fries, exceeded my expectations. Just be cautious of the wtf sauce. It can get crowded and it might take a while to get the bartender's attention, but the atmosphere is worth it. You might even catch a glimpse of the Always Sunny crew!

The Shellfish Company on the Wharf exceeded our expectations with their delicious rock crab special. Despite initial hesitations about touristy seafood restaurants, this gem proved to be a standout. The rock crab was cooked to perfection, with buttery and juicy meat that was easy to access. The shrimp bisque was also a highlight. With generous portions and great value, this meal became a favorite on our trip. Highly recommended for crab lovers. Make sure to plan ahead to avoid long waits.

Weaver's Way is a great place for single individuals who prefer smaller quantities of items and appreciate locally grown produce and preservative-free foods. The community is diverse and welcoming, not just for "tree huggers". Membership and work hours are manageable for singles, but may not be for everyone. If you value the Weaver Way values, it's the perfect place to shop. If not, stick to chain stores or pay the visitor's fee for occasional visits.

The food at this BBQ spot may not be exceptional, but it seems to have a strong following. Personally, I find it average and prefer other BBQ places. It could be a matter of taste and specific menu items.

The TV shows cost $4.99 with commercials which is disappointing for a hotel at over $150 a night. No complimentary breakfast, only an overpriced buffet. Not the most classy or value for money experience.

I stumbled upon this pizza shop near my hotel and was pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff and great deals they offer, like the buy one get one special. I tried the hot wings and enjoyed the generous amount of sauce on them. I will definitely be returning on my next visit for more pizza.
Termini Bros' cannolis are phenomenal - freshly filled to order with a perfect balance of sweetness. Whether you love cannoli or are unsure, you must try one from here!

While traveling in our RV, we stumbled upon this charming cafe in Granite City. The staff was incredibly friendly and the food had a homemade, comforting feel to it. We enjoyed our meals so much that we ended up dining here twice. Overall, a delicious and satisfying dining experience. Highly recommend.
After trying multiple places in the area, I finally found a gem off of Magazine Street that lives up to the hype. The staff is friendly and the Phò is top-notch. Highly recommend checking it out!
I highly recommend this place for breakfast. The food and service were impeccable once again.

The kayaking tour at Santa Cruz Island exceeded our expectations. Jen, our tour guide, was helpful and informative as we explored the caves. Overall, my husband and I had a wonderful time and would highly recommend this tour.
Highly recommend this place for a flavorful and satisfying meal that won't break the bank. The shrimp and goat cheese crepes are a standout dish that you must try.

After finally visiting this St. Louis tradition after over a decade of living in the area, I can confidently say it was worth the wait. The factory tour, shop, bar, and dining area provide a fun and unique experience. The beer is top-notch, with a variety of options for every palate. The food is delicious, with the pizza and bison burger standing out. The service is excellent, with a staff that adds to the eclectic atmosphere. While on the pricier side, the quality and overall experience make it worth it. I will definitely be returning and highly recommend it to others.
Terrible experience, ordered a plain hamburger and found bacon in it (allergic to). Rude service, no apology given. Will not be returning. Heading to Freebirds instead.
I had a great first experience at this car wash. The service was excellent and I was very satisfied with the outcome. Thank you.

Sushi Nara is a fantastic new spot on the eastside. The staff is friendly, the service is fast, and the sushi is always delicious. The prices are reasonable and the selection is vast. Highly recommend checking it out!
This shop is a hidden gem with a knowledgeable owner who is passionate about his work. They have a unique selection of tires and parts that are hard to find elsewhere.

I have visited this restaurant many times and the food is consistently delicious. The Panang curry is the best I have had in Florissant. This hidden gem keeps me coming back, and I have yet to try their sister restaurant because I am always satisfied here. Highly recommend.

Despite the mediocre food, I will give this restaurant an extra star for its appealing menu, design, and concept. Unfortunately, my experience was less than satisfactory with a weak tomato-basil soup and a peculiar flavored tuna melt. I will give it another chance and focus on the cured Italian meats and baked goods next time. The Nutella bruschetta sounds especially tempting.
The veggie pizza and sub sandwich we ordered were disappointing, with bland tomato sauce, lack of cheese on the pizza, and machine-made dough. Not in a rush to give it a second try.

More Than Just Ice Cream offers a variety of tasty milkshakes, with the black&white malt standing out as the best option. The coffee and chocolate milkshakes could have been thicker, but overall satisfied the ice cream craving. The pumpkin pie ice cream flavor was a standout, indicating that maybe getting ice cream instead of a milkshake would be the better choice next time.

We had an outstanding experience celebrating my mother's 100th birthday at this restaurant. The service was exceptional, with great table, view, delicious extra dishes, and a beautifully decorated cake plate. The servers were warm and attentive, making it a truly memorable occasion for us. Highly recommend for special celebrations.

This place is a gem. The bartender was fantastic and the burger was fresh with local ingredients. The plates of food looked amazing too. The beer is cold and the drinks are mixed perfectly. A dedicated local spot with great employees.

Overall, this restaurant is convenient for those staying nearby with its extended hours and quick seating for pairs. The affordable oysters and seafood shop next door are definitely a plus. However, the quality of the food leaves much to be desired with poorly cleaned raw oysters and lackluster dishes. The ambiance is lacking in comfort and the bathroom cleanliness is a concern. I may return for convenience sake, but would not prioritize dining in again.

This restaurant is best avoided for dinner. The server seemed lost and we had to constantly ask for basic things like setups and water refills. Our order was mixed up, and to make matters worse, there was a fish bone in the dish we received. On the positive side, the drinks were good.

TDS restaurant had decent food at reasonable prices, but the lack of decor, menu boards, and identification for staff made for a cold atmosphere. The policy of charging for extra salsa, even after ordering a salsa trio, was a major disappointment. Overall, not worth returning to due to lackluster atmosphere and stingy salsa policy.

Angela Clifton Photography has exceeded our expectations three times now. The photos are fabulous, the experience is fun, and the prices are reasonable. These pictures will be cherished forever. Highly recommend!

I had a pleasant dining experience at this restaurant with delicious food, though it was a bit on the pricey side. For a quieter outdoor dining option, I would recommend checking out Side street in the French Quarter.

The historic courthouse features impressive art and a quirky spiral staircase. The view from the 5th level provides a stunning panorama of the city. The tower clock room is a fascinating surprise with its intricate mechanical gears. Make sure to schedule an appointment to access the clock room. Overall, a visit to the courthouse is well worth 2 to 3 hours of your time.

I had a fantastic experience meeting with Ann today. She was incredibly helpful and positive, going above and beyond to make my first visit amazing. She has gained a loyal customer in me. Thanks, Ann!

First time trying this place and was pleasantly surprised. The coconut soup was delicious, and the pad Thai met expectations. Great Thai decor and music, top-notch service. A welcomed change of pace in a town with limited food options. Will likely become my go-to spot in Carp.
This venue was a chill and relaxing spot with great music. The artist performing was fun and eclectic, even doing a country version of "Let It Go". Can't wait to come back.

If you haven't been to the Smoothie King Center since it was known as the New Orleans Arena, you're in for a pleasant surprise. The arena has undergone a facelift and now offers a refreshed atmosphere with improved food and drink options. The variety of food choices surpasses expectations, with high-quality offerings that cater to a range of preferences. Additionally, the drink options have been upgraded to include full-service bars, spiked lemonade, and an impressive selection of beverages including bottled and draft beer and, of course, smoothies. The overall experience at the venue now feels more upscale, making it a top choice for entertainment in New Orleans.
Chipotle's steak is the go-to remedy for an upset stomach. Avoiding peak lunch hours ensures a peaceful dining experience. The friendly and fast service is consistent, making it a reliable choice.

I was pleasantly surprised by this Indian restaurant in Tampa Bay. The ambience was great with white table linens and the food was fantastic. The chicken 65 and hot sour soup were standout dishes. The waitress, Angel, was friendly and attentive. I can see this becoming a popular spot for foodies seeking authentic Indian cuisine. Highly recommend checking it out.

After multiple failed attempts, we finally got into this Jazz club in NOLA by splurging on reserved seats. Well worth the extra $20 to skip the hour-long wait in line and support Jazz preservation. The intimate setting and talented musicians made for an unforgettable experience - reminiscent of concerts from 50 years ago. A must-do in New Orleans!

I had a great experience at Keystone Discount Tire! As a new customer without an appointment, they took my car in for a PA State & Emissions inspection quickly. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, and there were no surprise charges or add-ons. The technician even let me look at a minor issue with my tires. Overall, I highly recommend Keystone Discount Tire and their mailing list for coupons!

I was pleasantly surprised by the quick and professional service at this repair shop. They fixed my son's phone in less than half an hour, and it looks good as new. I am thrilled with the outcome. Highly recommend!

Service and management at this Cracker Barrel location were appalling. Our orders were all mixed up, the waiter cursed at us, and the food was cold and inedible. The manager only offered free drinks as compensation. Overall, a disastrous dining experience that I will never repeat. Avoid dining at this Cracker Barrel at all costs.

I have stayed at several dog-friendly hotels before, but none compared to the experience I had at Loews in the city. Upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome and special treatment for my Labrador/Golden mix, Bentley. From treats at check-in to a welcome kit with dog dishes and more, the level of service exceeded my expectations. The other guests even stopped to compliment and pet Bentley, making her feel like a queen. The top floor room and friendly car attendants added to the overall wonderful experience. We were so impressed that we decided to extend our stay. Thank you, Loews, for showing me that a hotel can truly be dog-friendly, even for a big dog like Bentley.

The food at this place is sometimes exceptional, but unfortunately lacks consistency. I ordered a favorite dish that I've enjoyed for years, but the quality varies depending on who's in the kitchen. About half the time it's excellent, but the inconsistency is frustrating.

I have been to this location twice and will never return. The first visit was mediocre, but the second was incredibly disappointing. I had to send my ribs back three times before they were cooked properly. The manager apologized, but did not offer any compensation. Very frustrating experience.

Cheu offers a unique take on ramen with thick noodles and extremely salty broth. While some may enjoy this style, it did not impress a reviewer who prefers a more traditional ramen experience. Great service and a nice selection of beers are highlighted, but overall the reviewer was not a fan. Personal taste may vary, so it's worth trying for yourself.

Federal Doughnuts at the ballpark is a must-try for fans looking for a delicious and indulgent snack. The combination of doughnuts and fried chicken is a homerun. Additionally, the gluten-free concession stand near section 136 offers a variety of tasty options, including pizza, cheesesteaks, brownies, and cookies, making it a great choice for those with dietary restrictions.

Red Kings in Chinatown did not disappoint with their new location. The Dan Dan Noodles and shredded Pork in Garlic sauce were both flavorful and perfectly spicy. Generous portions make for great leftovers. Can't wait to try more dishes and return for a sit-down dinner. BYOB and karaoke rooms upstairs add to the fun atmosphere. Highly recommend!
This Chick fil A location is consistently busy but somehow manages to maintain exceptional service and quickness. It's one of my favorite places due to their consistently great customer experience.
Best place for salads in town! I love stopping by for lunch whenever I'm in the area. The service is quick and the veggies are always fresh. Highly recommend!

My parents and I took the Oak Alley and Laura Plantation tour and had a great experience. Our driver was informative and the schedule was perfect, allowing for free time before and after the tours. The drop off locations were flexible and we enjoyed exploring the French Quarter afterwards. Highly recommend!

We have visited this place twice for brunch and have been thoroughly impressed with the delicious food, especially the grits with scallions and sour cream. However, the room tends to be very cold, so make sure to bring a sweater.
I love this place for their amazing hot dogs and chili dogs. I frequent it as often as possible because they are the best in town. Yum!

Waterline is a sweet spot for live music with friends on Saturday nights. They offer the best local beer in town, and the concept is a step above Fig Mountain. I prefer Topa, and the added bonus of being able to order delicious food from Nook Restaurant and visit Lama Dog within the same building makes the experience even better. I love it!

This tour company provided excellent customer service, going above and beyond to accommodate our group of 7 even though we were slightly out of their pick up area. They quickly corrected a billing error and refunded the extra ticket charge. The tour itself was incredibly fun, with a knowledgeable and humorous guide who showed us many alligators, turtles, and birds. Holding a baby alligator was a highlight of the trip. The ride back was thrilling with the guide performing tricks with the boat. Highly recommend this tour for a fantastic experience!

Westfall did an outstanding job replacing our roof in April. The process was seamless, from start to finish, with top-notch communication and follow-up. The quality of our new roof is excellent and we are extremely satisfied with our decision to choose this company. Highly recommend.

Great vegan fast food option with good food and reasonable prices. The staff is friendly and helpful. Not ideal for dining in, but perfect for a quick grab-and-go meal. Highly recommend trying the Cheesesteak and sweet potato fries over the buffalo bella.

The ramen is decent, but not outstanding. Service is average. It's a convenient option for a quick meal, but may not be the top choice if other options are available. I've been twice and will likely return.

This restaurant has a menu that satisfies cravings for everyone. It is clean, trendy, and delicious. I recommend going early as the wait can get long after 9 am. However, the wait is worth it as you will leave feeling incredibly satisfied.

The brisket sandwich with two sides and a drink for $9.99 was a fantastic deal. The barbecue was delicious and the sides, including potato casserole, creamed spinach, baked beans, and green beans, were all excellent. Overall, great BBQ at an affordable price. Highly recommend.
Incredible food and service! Would love to see more vegetarian/vegan options on the menu. Excited to return in the future!
The food is fantastic, but the customer service is seriously lacking. The older waitresses are not pleasant to deal with, but the owner is lovely. Overall, mixed experiences at this restaurant.

I stumbled upon this gem recommended by a local on my flight to Nashville and I am so glad I did. The breakfast at this spot is out of this world, especially the corn pancake with bacon, salsa, and sour cream. The service was impeccable and we lucked out by avoiding the long line. Will definitely be returning on my next trip to the South. Highly recommend!

Unfortunately, my experience with this detailing service was extremely disappointing. Despite confirming the appointment multiple times, the owner, Michael, was not prepared and did not show up at the scheduled time. His partner, Alex, could not reach him and we ultimately wasted our time waiting around. A complete letdown and not worth the hassle.

This office provided exceptional service during my move, going above and beyond to help me with additional services. The staff were trustworthy and took great care of me throughout the process. I highly recommend this office, they are top notch and I would trust them with my own mother.

The Saint has a beautiful lobby with a cool bar and restaurant, creating a sexy ambiance. The staff is friendly, but our stay was ruined by a large flying roach in the room. After being moved to a new room with more bugs and issues, we promptly checked out and went to another hotel. The staff was apologetic and offered a refund, but we won't be returning.

The Green Project is the go-to spot for affordable building materials and eco-friendly disposal of leftover supplies. With a limited budget of $35, you can find a new door at The Green Project. Additionally, they accept donations of building supplies to prevent them from ending up in landfills. Great resource for sustainable living and home improvement projects.
this establishment to anyone. The bouncer was unnecessarily rude and they overcharge just because of their location on Broadway. I will never visit again and would not recommend it to others.
Stopped in for lunch with my girlfriend and were impressed by the cleanliness of the place. The food was delicious and affordable. Can't wait to go back for another meal!

Although this restaurant has a great setting and good service, the quality of food has significantly declined. The artichoke was clearly reheated, the Greek salad tasted like it came from a bag, and the grilled yellowtail was overcooked and of poor quality. The overall experience was so disappointing that it's not worth a visit. Improvement in food quality is necessary to avoid becoming just another tourist spot in Santa Barbara.

Milktooth is a must-visit spot for a unique brunch experience with great breakfast cocktails. The menu offers twists on traditional brunch items that may seem unfamiliar at first but are sure to impress. Despite the usual wait, the food is worth it with options like Dutch pancakes and raclette grilled cheese. Don't miss out on their michelada for a boozy breakfast treat. If possible, enjoy your meal outside for an added touch.

Overall, the bar and staff at this hotel are amazing. We received a room upgrade for our honeymoon, with a gorgeous view. However, the room itself was not as impressive as expected - with rust in the tub floor and strange stains on the tile. Despite this, the great staff and location in the downtown area of St. Louis make it worth a visit. The only downside was the high cost for valet parking. Recommended for those wanting to be in the heart of the action with plenty of nearby bars and restaurants. 4 stars.

I thoroughly enjoyed the beginning class at this studio. It was well-paced and the moves provided a good stretch. Despite the simplicity, I still broke a sweat and felt great afterwards. The studio is clean and I appreciate the option to purchase Beyond Organic food items. Highly recommend!

My family and I were happy to discover Lobster Haven after getting tired of chain restaurants. The service was fantastic and the food was authentic and delicious. The selection was impressive and we loved the option to purchase live lobster and seafood to cook at home. Highly recommend for anyone craving New England seafood.
This happy hour spot has the best drinks and a fresh menu. If time allowed, I would be a regular customer here.

Men's clubs is an exceptional barbershop with skilled barbers that always deliver fresh cuts. I've been a loyal customer for 3 years and have never had any issues, except for one minor incident that was quickly resolved by Tim. Appreciate the honesty and professionalism. Highly recommend.
My husband and I are regulars at this place and absolutely love it. The food is always fresh and the service is fantastic. Highly recommend for sushi and hibachi lovers.

Chickie's and Pete's is the perfect place to watch sports and indulge in tasty seafood dishes like crab fries and mussels. The atmosphere is lively and fun, making it a great spot to enjoy a game. Just be prepared for crowds during major sporting events and potentially rowdy patrons. Overall, a must-visit for a true Philadelphia experience.
Prompt and professional service on a Saturday for a simple mirror fix. The team made the process easy for me. I have used them in Charlotte before and they were great then, too. Highly recommend.

I enjoyed a delicious meal at Union Station St. Louis, choosing the Ponchartrain dish which was similar to Tilapia. The dish featured mushrooms and a tasty cream sauce. The shrimp cocktail and lump crab cake appetizers were good but not outstanding. The drinks and service were satisfactory. Dining outside on the patio was pleasant, but the inside looked cozy and less casual. Overall, a decent dining experience.

I recently visited this unique spot in St. Pete and was blown away by the atmosphere. The attention to detail in the remodel create a magical experience, almost like being in a Harry Potter movie. The background music was set at the perfect volume, allowing for conversation without having to shout. The bartenders, Michael and Peggy, were extremely friendly and engaging. While I didn't try the food, the prices for meat/cheese trays were very reasonable. I highly recommend checking this place out for a truly one-of-a-kind experience.
Maple Street Patisserie is the bomb.com! Best blueberry muffin ever. Delicious breakfast and lunch spot with amazing specialty cakes. Owner Ziggy is a hardworking gem. Can't beat this place!

The Bourbon Black and Bleu burger was delicious and cooked perfectly to my liking. However, the wait time for our large party of 4 adults and 5 kids was over an hour, which was disappointing. I gave them 3 stars due to the long wait.

Katie's is the perfect go-to spot for out of town guests, offering a variety of deliciously prepared dishes at reasonable prices. The grilled oysters, shrimp and grits, Cuban sandwich, pizza, and daily specials are all fantastic choices. The service staff is warm and friendly, making for an enjoyable dining experience. Just be sure to arrive early on Sundays to avoid a wait, but the bottomless mimosas make it worth it!

After a day at the Zurich Classic golf tournament, I stopped by Creole Creamery for a refreshing treat. The interior is cozy and inviting, and I was lucky to find street parking. The selection of flavors is vast, and I ended up trying the cookie monster ice cream on a cone, which was delicious without being too sweet. A must-visit spot for ice cream lovers in the area.

I am a repeat customer at this funky and lively sushi spot. The atmosphere is young and loud, with great music and plenty of sake. I stick to the rolls, sashimi, and mountains of rice for a satisfying meal. Escargot might be a pass for safety reasons, but overall, this place is a must-visit for sushi lovers.

We are huge fans of this place! The Backyard Bowl is our favorite, but we can't wait to try more options. The kids size or a large to split always leaves us full. The quality of ingredients is top-notch and the prices are very reasonable. Be prepared for crowds, but it's definitely worth the wait. Highly recommend!

The service at this restaurant was okay, with a new server who was a bit interesting. The food presentation was good, but the gumbo could use more rice or potato salad. The Sprite was flat, but not a big deal.

Overall, this pancake place is decent, but it can get a bit chaotic during busy times. The pancakes are tasty but on the sweet side, so it's best for those with a sweet tooth. The prices are reasonable and the fact that they serve breakfast all day is a bonus. However, there is nothing particularly unique about this place compared to other breakfast spots.
I had a great experience at this store! The staff was fantastic and I found some amazing items. Can't wait to come back!

I have been a long-time customer of this restaurant and the staff has always been personable and prompt with service. Yoli and Frank are amazing and the food is delicious, especially the shredded beef burro and cheese crisp. I highly recommend for authentic Mexican cuisine.

Overall, the dine-in experience at this restaurant was disappointing with a lackluster venue and subpar service, earning it only 2 stars. The food, like the lamb kebab, was average but lacked any additional elements like sauces or veggies. Takeout may be a better option for a more enjoyable dining experience.
This middle eastern restaurant is a standout in the area. The food is consistently delicious and satisfying, always leaving me with a happy belly. Highly recommend!

Potito's has the best cannoli in the city - better than Termini's and not as overhyped as Isgro's. I will always choose Potito's for my cannoli fix, it's worth it to skip the long lines and go straight to the delicious treats. Trust me, their bambino cannoli is a must try.

El Limon is a tiny, authentic and perfectly delicious eatery that exceeded all expectations. The Mexican food here is the best in Pennsylvania, with a wide variety of dishes that are all excellent and reasonably priced. The waitstaff is friendly and attentive, and the homemade tamales and free margaritas are definite highlights. Bring the whole family for an amazing Mexican feast at El Limon! Ole!

This new joint has great potential, currently earning 4 stars from me, but definitely has the makings of a 5-star establishment. The food is really good overall, with standout dishes like The Quaker and the Turkey Greek Burger. They are willing to make accommodations for mistakes and the staff is friendly. Some kinks in their pizza and spanakopita need to be worked out, but their fries, onion rings, and baklava are delicious. The Signature Salad is fresh and tasty. If they maintain their high quality standard, I will be a repeat customer.

Planet Fitness is a solid option for those looking for a gym that is open 24 hours and offers a good value for the price. However, it may lack motivation for serious bodybuilders as it seems to cater more to larger individuals. The amenities such as tanning beds, massage chairs, and the sculpt machine are a nice addition for just $20 a month. The policy of not being able to bring friends for the $9.99 option is a downside for some. Overall, the polite and helpful employees help make up for any shortcomings.

I was very disappointed with the experience at this restaurant. We arrived at 2:15 on a Saturday and were informed that the kitchen had already closed at 2, despite their website stating they were open until 5 on weekends. This discrepancy in their operating hours calls into question the reliability and attention to detail of the establishment. Overall, it left a negative impression and made me hesitant to return in the future.
I highly recommend these guys for their timely and high-quality work. They stand by their work with a warranty, making them a reliable choice.
This restaurant is a must-visit at least twice a week. The servers are consistently friendly and the food is always amazing. I have never left disappointed and always leave with a full stomach.

Carrow's Restaurant on Plumb and Kietzke is a truly delightful find. The food was fantastic - the tri-tip salad and tri-tip/chicken combo were both delicious. The dessert options were also fantastic. The prices were very reasonable for the quality of food and experience. Highly recommended!

Rebecca may not have been my birth Doula, but she was an amazing nanny for our first born daughter. Her knowledge and suggestions for pregnancy and childbirth were invaluable, and I always looked forward to talking to her before and after work. She is easy to talk to, honest, and truly loves her role as a Doula. I highly recommend her as a valuable member of your support team.

I recently had my car tinted by Orange Tint and Tune and received fantastic service. Carlos was my technician and went above and beyond to ensure I was happy with my tint choice. The car pick up service within 4 miles of their shop is extremely convenient. The receptionist was pleasant and the owner Dustin even followed up to ensure my satisfaction. Overall, top-notch customer care deserving of 5 stars.

Stayed at TownePlace Suites for three nights on business. The property is conveniently located near the airport, but noise was not an issue. Rooms are standard with useful amenities. The hotel is situated in a quiet area with a mix of other hotels and office buildings. It's a short drive to downtown and the university area. Close to the Pima Air Museum. Limited dining options nearby, but Baggins sandwich place is within walking distance and highly recommended. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast is standard with hot options, and they offer a reception on weekdays. Food and drinks can run out quickly, so arrive early. Comfortable rooms and safe location, but could improve food and drink availability during reception hours.

A hidden gem in Tampa with delicious wood-smoked steaks and reasonably priced wines. Friendly service and great recommendations from our waitress. A must-visit for a unique dining experience. Can't wait to return!

The owner of this Saladworks location is outstanding and truly cares about his customers. The improved service and delicious new summer salads make it a must-visit spot. Highly recommend doing business with him.

This deli in the US is the best I have ever been to. So many options to choose from, especially the huge and delicious Muffalata that can easily feed a group. Live music on Saturday and Thursday nights adds to the great atmosphere. The specials are always a good choice and the sides, like the chili, potato salad, and chips, are top-notch. Don't wait, go now and enjoy!
My dad and I had a great experience at Saguaro National Park with Park Ranger Carolyn. Her enthusiasm and knowledge about the saguaro was infectious. Highly recommend the tour with her.

The restaurant offers a variety of unique wing flavors, including traditional options and New Orleans-inspired choices. The watermelon drink is delicious, and the location is improving the community. Best enjoyed during the day and worth a try. Look out for Skip!

Tom Jones is a nostalgic diner with a variety of menu options at a great price. The blue ribbon breakfast is still a steal at $3.79 and includes everything you need for a hearty meal. The atmosphere is retro with orange booths and a payphone, adding to the charm. Service is fast and efficient with friendly staff. The recent updates to the ATM placement and cleanliness make it a great spot for a family meal. My daughter loves it here, so I'm giving it 5 stars.

Dr. Ferrel is a true hero to me as an amateur athlete. After a severe injury on the softball field, he not only treated me immediately but also provided affordable and effective treatment in his office. His expertise and dedication have led to incredible results, with quick healing and the ability to return to play much sooner than anticipated. Dr. Ferrel will always have my gratitude and trust for his exceptional care.
Attending their shows is always a blast. The atmosphere is relaxed and entertaining. A great option for a fun time and delicious food at a reasonable price.
Love in n out. The craving hits hard sometimes and you just have to indulge. 4 patties animal style hits the spot every time.

Cindy's is top-notch! Their authentic Mexican food is made fresh and delicious. The staff is friendly and attentive, making for a great dining experience. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a taste of Mexico.

Trust Me BBQ had been on my radar for a while, and after a disappointing first visit, I decided to give it another shot. The food was hit or miss, with delicious BBQ sauce and interesting macaroni salad, but dry chicken and lackluster sides. The service was the biggest letdown, with an unengaging staff member who seemed indifferent to our presence. I'll likely be sticking with Down to the Bone BBQ in the future.

I stumbled upon this hidden gem while visiting town for a week and was pleasantly surprised by the excellent pa nang chicken. I ordered it one star spicy and it was served quickly. I will definitely be returning to this cozy little hole in the wall.

This place is a hidden gem for those looking for unique and flavorful combinations. The fusion of different ethnicities and backgrounds in their dishes is innovative and delicious. The on the rocks margaritas and house made sangria are must-tries, making it worth the trip. The addition of a wine bar for overflow and specialty bottles is a nice touch. Definitely recommend checking this place out for Cinco de Mayo or any time of the year.

This hidden gem of a donut bakery in Hermitage's oldest shopping center offers a delicious variety of freshly made treats, including unique options like bacon-topped donuts and doughssants. With affordable prices and friendly service from owner Yeu, this bakery is a must-visit for donut lovers. Plus, they serve coffee to go with your sweet treats!
Attended multiple events including concerts and basketball games, all of which were a blast. The food offered was delicious with many local favorites available.
Exceptional food with a wide variety of appetizers and entrees that were all hits. Reasonable prices and good service. Will definitely be returning.
Unfortunately, the service at this establishment has significantly declined. We were loyal customers but have since switched to a different location due to slow and forgetful service.

The chicken and rice plate was a complete disappointment, with an overwhelming amount of oil despite no sauce being requested. The meal was not only inaccurate to the order, but also incredibly unhealthy. The restaurant's supposed emphasis on healthy eating is a complete joke. Avoid at all costs.

I had a great experience purchasing a washer and dryer from Sears. Despite some negative reviews, I found the selection to be excellent, the salespeople knowledgeable, and the delivery was timely. The level of service exceeded my expectations, with the staff working hard to give me the best price and stay within my budget. They also offered additional discounts and checked for any sales prices. I received honest feedback and all my questions were answered. I highly recommend Sears for appliance purchases.
The food at this place is fantastic, with quick service and a friendly staff that always makes you feel welcome. Highly recommend.
I recently tried the remodeled restaurant and was impressed. The mushroom cheese steak was delicious.

This cafe serves excellent espresso and is the perfect spot for an Americano. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is mellow, and the establishment is always clean. While power outlets are not available, there is unlimited wifi access.

While highly rated by others, my experience at this restaurant was underwhelming. The website was unhelpful in terms of menu details and pricing, and the actual offerings were lacking. The sandwiches were skimpy on meat, overly messy with gravy, and the quality was inconsistent. I suggest opting for the "wet meat" option to avoid an overpowering gravy situation. The atmosphere leaned more towards a bar than a restaurant, and overall, I was not impressed with my visit.

Highly recommend the Whiskey Burger from Village Whiskey for takeout. Although a bit pricey at $26, the burger is amazing with tender meat, crispy bacon, and a generous portion size. The Duck Fat fries are also a must-try, rich and delicious. If you can overlook the cost, this meal is worth it.

Spent $80 on food for the family and it was absolutely worth it. The food was hot and the orange chicken was the best I've had in a while. This will definitely be our go-to spot for Asian food from now on.

I highly recommend this laundromat for anyone looking for a safe, clean, and efficient place to do their laundry. The facility is well-maintained and the staff is friendly and helpful. I was able to complete a large amount of laundry in a short amount of time thanks to the speed of the machines. The amenities such as security cameras, wi-fi, and vending machines make for a comfortable and enjoyable laundry experience. Thank you, LAUNDROMAT, for providing such a great atmosphere for doing laundry!

While the food at this restaurant was good, the prices were definitely on the higher side. The server seemed annoyed when both couples decided to split a plate. The garlic bread was the standout dish, but overall, it wasn't worth the price. I probably wouldn't return, considering the stiff competition in St Louis.

Stopped by Haven to grab a burger during a Seahawks/Saints game and was impressed by the quality of the Haven burger. The place was packed, but it's clear why - the food is fantastic. Will definitely go back, maybe for a less busy lunch on a Tuesday.

I have only tried the vermicelli bowls at this restaurant, but I have enjoyed them each time. The portions are generous and the prices are reasonable. The location is convenient for those in the Alberta Ave neighborhood, and my orders have always been ready quickly, even during peak times.

The Chicken Marsala was thin, tough, and dry, while the pasta was undercooked and lacked flavor. The lasagne also lacked flavor and was disappointingly thin. Service was subpar with plates being cleared before finished. On the positive side, the atmosphere was great with live music and the opportunity to dance. Overall, the high prices do not justify the awful food quality.

This hidden gem offers a great dining experience with an attractive space and convenient location. The diverse menu features delicious dishes such as chaats, beef short ribs, lamb vindaloo, beet salad, breads/pickles, and chai. Don't miss out on the chocolate cake for dessert. The BYOB policy is a plus and there is plenty of street parking available. The option to grab some takeout beer at the nearby bar adds to the convenience. Overall, a highly recommended dining spot that I will definitely be returning to.
This is my favorite restaurant! The ceviche is delicious, the atmosphere is fun, and the service by Alex was friendly, attentive, and thoughtful. 5/5 stars!

This store is a must-visit for anyone looking for fresh and diverse food options. The salad bar is always stocked with tasty ingredients and the selection of ethnic foods is impressive. Highly recommend!

I ordered a Mediterranean chicken shawarma and it had great flavor with a generous amount of chicken in the pita. The food was ready when I arrived and the service was good. I would definitely come back next time I'm in the area.
This place is a gem! The food is delicious, the atmosphere is welcoming, and the staff is top-notch. A must-visit for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. Highly recommend!

Overall, the service was a bit slow at first but once we were attended to, we were pleased with the experience. The gumbo was delicious and the chicken & waffles were a hit. The staff was friendly and the location on Bourbon St offered great people-watching opportunities.

Earl's grab-and-go restaurant at the airport offers a variety of tasty sandwich options, including roast beef with cheddar cheese and horseradish sauce. The portion size is generous and the sandwich is well-cooked, making it a satisfying choice for travelers. The convenient location near the security station and Delta SkyClub makes it easy to grab a sandwich on the go. Highly recommended for a quick and tasty meal before your flight.

Amazing experience at this restaurant! The cheese curds with red pepper jelly were a hit, and both the fish tacos and beer brat were delicious. The portions were generous and reasonably priced. The service was top-notch, with an attentive server and a friendly manager. Can't wait to come back for game day deals and weekend brunch! Highly recommend this place.

I had a fantastic experience dining at this restaurant. The burger I ordered was so delicious that I will have a hard time ordering anything else in the future. The beer selection was great, the staff was welcoming, and the service was prompt. The atmosphere was nice and the restaurant was very clean. I left feeling very satisfied and happy with my experience. I highly recommend dining here.

Overall, this hotel is too big, too expensive and too far from Downtown. The food options are limited and overpriced, valet service is slow and the location makes it difficult to explore outside restaurants. The rooms are nice, but be wary of hidden charges and long waits at checkout. Consider staying elsewhere and driving in for conferences to avoid the hassle.

Overall, my experience at Ava was mostly positive. The appetizer portion size was smaller than expected but the flavors were delicious. The pizzas were tasty, although the rosemary was missing from one. The grouper with Israeli couscous was scrumptious. Dessert was a highlight, with the zeppoles being amazing and the cherry tart being less to my personal taste. I look forward to returning to try more menu items, especially the hand-made pastas. Next time, I hope for a more balanced bread to cheese ratio in the appetizer.

First time dining here and was impressed. Clean environment, friendly staff, and delicious sushi. Will definitely be returning. Excellent service and fresh sushi at a reasonable price. Highly recommend.
This place lives up to its name - the chicken is fantastic. The fried corn on the cob is a must-try. Overall, a top-notch spot for chicken lovers.

Unfortunately, the food at this restaurant was well below average. The pancakes tasted processed, the "homemade" maple syrup was watery and sugary, and the hash browns were greasy and tasteless. The bacon was overcooked and chewy, indicating it had been sitting for a while. Overall, the food was uninspired and did not live up to the hype. There are better options in Nashville.

We had an excellent lunch at this restaurant. The prix fixe menu was tempting, and the dishes we ordered were outstanding. The prime rib po'boy with gruyere and horseradish sauce was a delightful upscale twist, and the tomato fennel soup was tasty. The seafood jambalaya and seafood gumbo were probably the best I've ever had. Would highly recommend.

Pure Design did an exceptional job for our recent event at a nearby hotel. Their staff was professional, knowledgeable, and worked within our budget to provide stunning flower arrangements that received rave reviews from our guests. The arrangements lasted well beyond the event and I was able to take them home afterwards. Overall, I highly recommend Pure Design for any large event.

My husband and I had a fantastic experience at this Par-Tee spot. The server was knowledgeable and welcoming, the beer and liquor selection were great, and the pork belly sliders were a surprising hit. We highly recommend giving this place a try for a fun and delicious night out. We will definitely be returning.

Overall, the restaurant is average or slightly above, but definitely overhyped and expensive. The portions are small for the price, and the added toppings ruin the bison burger. Would not recommend for the price.

I rate this restaurant poorly due to the disturbing and unsettling experience of witnessing a customer get arrested in the dining area. The entire situation was poorly handled, and the lack of communication or apology from the management only added to the discomfort. The only positive aspect of the meal was the awesome server, LaToya. The black bean burger was dry, but the sweet potato fries were good. I do not recommend dining here.
The sliders were fantastic and the perfect size to try multiple. The fried chicken, BLT, monte cristo, and Cuban sliders were all delicious. Can't wait to try the donuts next!

We recently visited the restaurant after it reopened with new management for the third time. The daily specials offer a great value at $7.95 for a plate, ice tea, and soup. We tried the Carne Asada plate, which was delicious. I was able to substitute my rice and beans for a salad. The service was attentive and overall it was a good experience. Specials change daily, so there is always something new to try.

I absolutely love this little shop! The inviting scent of spices draws me in every time I pass by. The large variety of spices available can be overwhelming, but the helpful staff is there to assist. The products are high quality and last a long time, making them a good value. The specialty salts, sugars, and powders are a highlight, with flavors that taste fresher than what you can find elsewhere. Prices are reasonable and the products are well worth it. Highly recommend!
Steve and his partner are top-notch - they offer demo racquets and have a wide selection at great prices. Perfect for any tennis player in need of new gear. Highly recommend!

I visited the new Chick-fil-A in Reno around 6 and was pleasantly surprised by how packed it was. Despite the long line, the staff was amazing and we were served our food quickly. They handled the chaos of opening day well, with only one small mix-up that was promptly corrected. I appreciated the attentive service and the overall efficiency of the operation. I'm glad to have Chick-fil-A in Reno maintaining their high standards.
time relaxing and enjoying the atmosphere. Would definitely recommend for wine lovers looking for a memorable experience.

Beck's is a bit pricey for the portion sizes, but their gator gumbo is worth it. The flavors are savory and the spices are just right. The gator sausage adds a unique twist to the dish. However, the chicken alfredo pasta was a bit dry and not worth ordering again. Stick to the gator gumbo for a great meal at Beck's.
Despite initial concerns about negative reviews, my experience was great. There was a short wait time and the staff was friendly and helpful from the moment I walked in.
The Taint is not the place for me. I found the apathetic atmosphere and Garden District hipsters to be unimpressive.

If you're a fan of Chick-fil-A, you'll be happy to hear that there's a new location in Bloomingdale. The drive-thru lanes were busy but well-managed by friendly staff, and the food was as delicious as ever. The only downside was slightly undercooked fries, but overall a great addition to the area. Welcome to the neighborhood, Chick-fil-A!

This cute spot on Germantown Ave has a great selection of sweet treats, including cookies, bars, and cake scrapple. I tried the Red Velvet cake with cream cheese frosting and an M&M cookie, both of which were delicious. The cookie was soft and chewy with a nice texture from the M&M candies, while the cake was moist and flavorful. A perfect spot for a sweet craving!

The overall improvements made to this place have created a much more comfortable environment. However, the chairs could use some extra padding to enhance the experience, especially for longer events like football games. Despite this, the overall upgrades have significantly enhanced the space.
The food at this restaurant is delicious, but the service is slow. They could benefit from having 1 or 2 more staff members up front to improve efficiency when placing orders.

I tried this place when they first opened and was disappointed. They only had one flavor which wasn't great, everything was overpriced and we left hungry after spending $70-80 for three people. The sauce was not Cajun style, more like a mixture of buffet sauces with fish sauce. I give it a solid three because there are better places to eat at.

I highly recommend the walking tour of Ybor with Raymond as our guide. It was informative, fun, and delicious with great food stops along the way. Raymond was friendly and knowledgeable, making the experience even more enjoyable. A must-do for both visitors and locals looking for a fun adventure in Tampa!

I absolutely love the sweet spiral plain pies at Franzones. Adding onions to the white pizza was a pleasant surprise and a great addition. It's the same great quality as the Bridgeport location I grew up with. Can't go wrong with plain!

The fast clinic at CVS misdiagnosed my daughter's severe sore throat as a fungus infection, prescribing a medication that made it worse. The staff were robotic and unfriendly, rushing us out despite being the only patients there. I would recommend sticking to a primary care physician instead of these fast clinics.
The chicken sandwich at this place is outstanding, especially for being located in an industrial area. Highly recommend trying it out.

Setting up the online appointment was easy and the entire process of meeting and transaction was simple and painless. Opted for a 2-hour side by side ride with guide Matt who was informative and awesome. The four-seater provided great views and overall thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

This bar offers a fantastic happy hour from 4-7 every day with great deals on wine, drafts, pizza, and appetizers. The staff is incredibly friendly and the to-go dinners and lunches are reasonably priced and quick. Highly recommend.

Horrible experience at this restaurant. Waiter was nice, but both my appetizer and my friend's noodles had hair in them. Returned the noodles but wasn't offered a replacement. Will not be dining here again.

ITV is a beautiful and intimate place that offers top-notch food and cocktails at a reasonable price. The beef fat biscuit was a standout dish, and Chef Nick Elmi's presence in the dining room added to the exceptional experience. The foie with apricot miso, pork cheeks, and trout pumpernickel soldiers were all delicious. The cold smoking techniques used in their bar menu added a unique touch. Overall, ITV is a terrific dining destination on East Passyunk with some of the best offerings in the city.
I absolutely love this place! Great hours, impeccably clean, and so relaxing.

Buckingham Pizza offers the best pizza around, especially the plain and speciality pizzas like the cool ranch. Stick to ordering pizzas and sides for the best experience. Avoid the entrees, like chicken piccata, and you'll be sure to love their delicious pizzas.

Cafe Beignet offers the best iced latte and beignet we've tried, with a great atmosphere enhanced by live music. In comparison to Cafe du Monde, we found Cafe Beignet to be superior in both taste and service. There are hardly ever lines, making it a convenient and enjoyable experience overall.

Captain Bill's offers a fun and relaxed atmosphere right on the water where you can watch passersby and dolphins while enjoying great food and excellent service. The menu catered to all members of our dining party, including a picky 7 year old and a 72 year old grandmother. The food was hot, fresh, and exactly as ordered, and the wait staff was attentive and efficient. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that we will definitely be returning to on our next visit to John's Pass. Highly recommend!
Excellent sushi spot in Valrico! The peanut avocado roll is a must-try and the Volcano roll is amazing. Great customer service and worth the drive, even if you're not in the area. Highly recommend!
This Cuban restaurant is decent for lunch with daily specials and freshly prepared meals, but overall it is average compared to other options.
Overall, my husband enjoyed his 6 oz pepperloin meal, but my shrimp kabob meal fell short with only 4 overcooked and small shrimp. The service was good and the restaurant was not busy.

Despite the long line and feeling a bit rushed, the quick service and delicious pastrami sandwich made the experience worth it. The atmosphere inside was unique and visually appealing, with bottle caps covering every surface. The staff was patient and accommodating, making it a great spot for regulars and newcomers alike. My pastrami sandwich was lean and flavorful, one of the best I've ever had. The Punk was impressed by the quirky decor and loved her sandwich as well. A hidden gem for sure.

Heather's new shop on E. Passyunk is a must-visit for anyone in need of a color wizard to craft a personalized look. The vibe is unstuffy and chill, making for a comfortable experience. Heather and her staff are trustworthy and skilled, making it easy to recommend to friends and family. Don't miss out on Heather's tips on caring for cactus houseplants or chatting about vintage bikes during your visit.

Sally's has a great selection of hair supplies and friendly staff, making it my go-to for experimenting with my hair. However, I wish the staff was more knowledgeable about their products and that the store was cleaner and brighter. Overall, I'm happy with Sally's but hope they improve the appearance of the store.

After seven years of getting haircuts from the same guy in Austin, I decided to try Rodney Mitchell Studio based on a friend's recommendation. Owner Rodney himself recommended stylist Allison, who did an amazing job at giving me the cutest shaggy bob I never knew I needed. The studio offers discounts for first-time visitors, students, teachers, and referrals, making it a great option for budget-conscious individuals. I can't wait to go back for my next cut. Highly recommend!

Beautiful Mercer Building location, spacious, friendly baristas, gluten-free goodies, yummy Italian sodas. However, constant loud music is a major drawback for those looking to read, work, reflect, or have a conversation. Tea is served in messy individual filters rather than pots. Overall, a nice spot if you can handle the noise and unconventional tea service.

Spice n Grill offers the best Indian food in St. Louis. The beef nihari, palak paneer, and naan were perfectly spiced and delicious. The seating in the store is not great, so taking food to go is a better option. The owner was very nice, but the restaurant doesn't seem to have many dine-in customers. Overall, I would highly recommend trying their delicious take-out options.

As someone from California familiar with quality boba, I was disappointed with this place's use of artificial flavors and powders in some of their drinks. However, if you're not as concerned about natural ingredients, this spot could be a good fit for you. The customizable sweetness levels and add-ons are a nice touch. It's a great spot for hanging out with friends, playing games, or doing homework, especially for U of A students. Overall, while it may not meet everyone's high standards, it's worth a try for a casual outing.

I have been ordering from Silver Mine's for the past 4-5 years and they have only gotten worse. They charge for additions to soup or chili but don't include them, and often forget free sides like bread. Delivery takes at least an hour. The service is terrible, and the business is in major trouble. Avoid this place at all costs.

I bought my bike from this shop a few weeks ago and had a minor crash, resulting in a mangled front basket. I brought it in today and they fixed the basket and gear shifter for free in less than 30 minutes. The staff was friendly and welcoming throughout the process. Highly recommend this shop!
This store is a wonderland for adults with high prices, but worth it for the experience alone. I love going in just to browse. A must-visit!

Pag's may not have the most appealing menu, but don't let that fool you. The cheeseburger was unexpectedly amazing, reminiscent of a quality Big Mac. The patty was just right, bun was perfect, and the sauce was delicious. The ambiance in the wine bar section was great, although not very kid-friendly. Staff was friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be back for another burger fix!

I absolutely love dining at this restaurant with my boyfriend every two weeks. The food and service are top-notch, with reasonable prices. Weekends tend to get busy, but the wait is never an issue for us. Our go-to dishes are the Indian Pancake and Hainanese/ Curry Chicken, but all the options are delicious. We never tire of coming back!

The service was slow and the waitresses were not very kind. The amount of trash on the outside deck was unacceptable and had the potential to harm the environment. The food was good but the lack of responsibility towards the ocean and poor service make it unlikely for me to return.

Overall, my experience with the pre fixe meal for $22 was enjoyable, with a great combination of tastes on my plate. The chicken was moist, but the veggies were a bit greasy. The takeout/delivery packaging is eco-friendly, which is a big plus for me. While the food may not be spectacular, it is a reliable option with a contemporary atmosphere, excellent service, and consistently good dishes. Prices may be on the higher side, but it's worth it for the overall experience.
While this Chinese restaurant may not stand out from others with its menu, it does offer good lunch specials and prompt service for takeout orders.

Finally had the chance to dine at this eclectic restaurant last night. Enjoyed the onion tart and veal meatballs with polenta, both were delicious. The special of citrus short ribs was flavorful and the portions were generous. The atmosphere was friendly despite the small crowded space. Looking forward to returning to try more interesting items on the menu.

After being turned away from the oldest Italian Restaurant in South Philly, we stumbled upon Angelina's and had an amazing dining experience. The cozy atmosphere, delicious Eggplant and roasted pepper appetizer, and mouthwatering entrees like Veal Osso Bocca, Carbonara, and lasagna had us hooked. Angelina and her husband provided exceptional service, making us feel right at home. Can't wait to go back for more!
I highly recommend trying the lobster mac and cheese at this restaurant. The food is fantastic and the view is breathtaking. It's a perfect combination for a memorable dining experience.
This ice cream store offers super tasty and enormous portions with unique flavors. Overall, an amazing experience that others should try to replicate.

The food is average and the drink specials are great, but the place is rarely crowded. Last time I was there on a Friday night at 10 pm, there were only 3 other parties at the bar. Despite this, they announced last call at 10:15 pm. Needless to say, we left for a different bar in the area and won't be returning for late night drinks.
This place is perfect for satisfying late-night munchies cravings. The food is delicious and the service is quick. Definitely recommend!

Value City may give the impression of cheap value, but the prices are more comparable to Rothman with Ashley Furniture quality. The selection of entertainment centers and TV stands is limited and overpriced, with the clearance section offering minimal discounts. The staff seems more focused on chatting than helping customers, and the dining sets are average at best. The only positive is a few modern pieces, but overall, the prices are high for mediocre quality. It's worth shopping around town or waiting for holiday sales.

I love Franzone's for their friendly owner, who clearly cares about the product. The sweet sauce isn't my favorite, but their cheesesteaks and fries are great. The pleasant atmosphere elevates their rating for me. 4/5 stars.

Bab Cafe is a must-try for Asian food fanatics in Reno. From the incredible flavors of the Jeyuk Top-Bab to the friendly staff and convenient location, this place has it all. The sauce bar adds a fun touch and the included miso soup is a bonus. Great value for a fresh, delicious meal. We will definitely be back to try more dishes!

First meal in New Orleans exceeded expectations. $15 lunch special included a delicious seafood stew with oyster meat, crab claws, shrimp, and redfish, paired with a thoughtful salad. As a non-seafood lover, I was surprised by how much I enjoyed it. The spice, consistency, and tenderness of the meat were all perfect. Well worth trying.
