Biscuit Love was totally worth the wait, even in the heat. The Vegan grits with a biscuit on the side were delicious, and my sisters enjoyed their meals too. The Bloody Mary's are spicy, so beware. The service was excellent despite the 45-minute wait. The line moved quickly, and our food came out promptly. Biscuit Love has their process perfected - thanks for a delicious breakfast!

Ichicoro Ane impresses with its ambiance, food choices, and whisky selection. The katsu and bao buns are must-tries, with portion sizes varying so be sure to ask your server. The cocktail selection is top-notch, with special drinks like the Japanese Old Fashioned standing out. Perfect for group outings reminiscent of Japanese izakayas. The servers have been helpful and pleasant, making for a great dining experience overall. A definite must-visit.
This bakery is a favorite spot for my friend and I on weekend mornings. The breakfast sandwiches, coffee, and donuts are all fantastic! Highly recommend.

Great selection of whiskey/bourbon, best burger ever with fried egg, must try duck fries. Cute atmosphere, although seating was a bit awkward for a party of 4. Overall, a nice place to go and we will definitely be returning.
The ambience at this English pub is top-notch, with a cozy feel and great drinks mixed by knowledgeable bartenders. However, the prices are steep - $7 for a mixed drink - and seating is limited.

This cozy spot is perfect for a drink with friends, with tasty drinks served in pretty vintage glasses. However, the menu is limited with all drinks being some variation of ginger, lime, and honey. The bacon wrapped dates were overly sweet and the noise level escalated when more people came in. The servers were friendly but didn't offer a second drink when glasses were cleared.
This place consistently exceeds expectations with an annual array of fun fall activities such as hayrides and pumpkin picking. Highly recommend for a memorable experience.

Received poor customer service when inquiring about warranty work for my 2015 $110K AMG. Was informed I would have to pay for a loaner car since I did not purchase the vehicle at their dealership. Will not be returning.

This grocery store is like a smaller version of Whole Foods with a variety of options including a salad bar, fresh fruits, and a juice bar. The store is well-stocked and convenient, with a parking lot and within walking distance of other shops. A great find in the city with no comparison.

I absolutely love this outdoor spot. Unique wine selection, great live music, and crafty menu make for a satisfying experience. The ambiance is beautiful and the food and drinks are top-notch. Highly recommend visiting for a relaxing and enjoyable time.
I highly recommend this place for smog checks on cars. The service is great and the staff is very friendly. They are more affordable than most places and always cheerful.
Outstanding restaurant with delicious gluten-free and vegan options. The salad, pizza, and root beer were all perfect. Highly recommend.

The group of 6 of us all enjoyed our burgers and were very satisfied with the portion sizes. The restaurant was very clean and had a nice atmosphere. The sweet potato tots were a definite highlight and a must-try. 5 stars!

Overall, this restaurant has fantastic lighting and a peaceful atmosphere with attentive staff. The food is good, but could use some improvement. The noise level is perfect for a relaxing dining experience. I would definitely recommend giving this place a try. 8.5/10.

This convenience store deli offers delicious made-to-order sandwiches with a limited seating area inside and outside overlooking the ocean. While it lacks the ambiance of a restaurant, the food quality is excellent. I highly recommend trying their Cuban press and breakfast sandwiches. Good alternative to the more popular breakfast spot nearby. 4 stars.

My second visit was better than the first with improvements in service and food quality. Despite some minor issues during the grand opening, the experience was greatly improved with more than one beer bottle opener and improved portion sizes. The ambience still had its flaws but we were seated at a better table this time. The food was excellent and I am excited to return. We had no trouble getting a table on a Saturday evening at 5pm and are grateful to have this restaurant in our neighborhood. Highly recommended!

I love Skyline Chili and was thrilled when a location opened in Clearwater. Unfortunately, this particular Skyline has poor service and slow food delivery. There are often items missing or equipment issues. However, the cheese coney hot dogs are still a favorite. Hopefully, this location can improve.

The eyebrow waxing service is fantastic at this place, but the difficulty in booking appointments makes it not worth the hassle. The lack of availability and slow response times on the phone make it frustrating to schedule a visit. I ended up going elsewhere despite the higher cost just to ensure I could get an appointment when I needed it.

The tacos, nachos, atmosphere, and margaritas at this establishment are all top-notch. Wednesday's triple special day is a great deal and definitely worth checking out. Overall, highly recommended for a delicious and fun dining experience.

Overall, my experience with this car rental location was extremely disappointing. The lack of staff led to long wait times and my car not being ready on time. The cleanliness of the car was subpar and I was charged an expensive underage fee despite being so close to my 25th birthday. I would recommend renting from a different company such as Hertz. Additionally, the fuel option is not worth it as the price ends up being similar to what you can find outside and it's a sneaky way for rental companies to make extra money. The incorrect return location address added to my frustration and wasted even more of my time. I would not choose to rent from this location again.

Todd and Roberta from this cleaning service left my house looking and smelling amazing. They were knowledgeable, friendly, and efficient. My carpets and couch look great, with all pet stains completely gone. The best part is that everything dried quickly and there was no lingering chemical smell. Definitely worth the investment, I highly recommend them and will be using their services again in the future. Thank you Yelp reviewers for the recommendation!

I absolutely love this place! The staff is always friendly and their sips mocha is my favorite. The drive-thru is a huge convenience, especially with kids in tow. And don't get me started on their delicious cakes!

Chateau La Vin has evolved from a simple wine store to a vibrant wine bar with a variety of options for both wine and beer drinkers. They offer cheese and crackers and allow customers to order from local restaurants for delivery. The owner is knowledgeable and welcoming, and there is often live music playing. With a wide selection of wines and a few outdoor tables, it is a great spot to relax and enjoy a drink.

The Hollander Hotel provided an incredible experience for our wedding weekend. The property is charming, the rooms are cozy and clean, and the Tap Room is a great spot for gatherings. The brunch was delicious and affordable, and the staff went above and beyond to make sure every guest felt at home. The management team, especially Nick and Will, treated us like family and ensured everything was perfect. We highly recommend this beautiful hotel to anyone looking for a special event venue or a relaxing getaway in downtown St. Pete.

I decided to try the gyro platter for lunch and was extremely disappointed. The dish was dry, uninspired, and lacking in flavor. The "vegetables" served with it looked and tasted unappetizing. I would not recommend this place for lunch as there are better options in Fairmount that serve higher quality food.

I had a great experience at this brewery for drinks. The environment was lovely, with the brewery right there. The beer was delicious and the waiter was knowledgeable and kind. Overall, a fantastic place to grab a drink.

I had an amazing dinner experience at this restaurant in New Orleans. The BBQ shrimp and bread pudding were delicious signature dishes. The ambience and service were fantastic. Highly recommend the fried green tomato appetizer. A must-visit spot in New Orleans!
The store has a great selection and amazing customer service. Unfortunately, they don't have a location in Ft. McMurray. :(

Horrible experience at the Chippewa location, complete bait and switch tactics. Staff tried to take advantage of me by refusing to honor online coupons and giving false information. Avoid this place at all costs. Go to Creve Coeur location instead.

I was very impressed with this place! The food was amazing and the quick service chipotle-style line ordering made for a convenient experience. The staff was incredibly helpful in guiding me as an Indian food newbie. I can't wait to eat there again!

El Sabor Poblano on Federal may not look like much from the outside, but don't be fooled - the fish tacos are a hidden gem. With a whole filet of fish in each taco, the flaky meat is delicious and not at all fishy. The chorizo tacos are also a must-try, with no gristle to be found. The staff is accommodating and friendly, making for a pleasant dining experience. Definitely worth a visit for a tasty and affordable meal.

I finally made it to this spot I've been wanting to try, and it did not disappoint. Despite a recent burglary, the service was great, and the bartender was friendly. The pint of dark ale was cold and the wings were tasty. The owners were friendly, and the non-franchised, locally owned vibe was refreshing. I will definitely be returning and recommending this spot to others. A great place to hang out close to home and work.

I found this place based on Yelp reviews and they were spot on. The sandwiches were delicious and worth the wait in line. The service was fast and friendly, with our sandwiches being delivered to us shortly after sitting down. Overall, a great dining experience.

The theater has incredibly comfortable recliners, but the downside is having to put your feet down for others to pass by. The bartender at the lounge is delightful and being able to drink in the theater is a nice touch. However, the concessions experience was disappointing with disorganization and burnt popcorn. It may be better to eat beforehand and just stick with the bar for next time.
This hotel is exceptional in every way - clean rooms, friendly staff, beautiful pool, and impressive entrance. I look forward to returning next year.
I visited this restaurant when it first opened and was deeply disappointed with the quality and taste of the food. I have never felt the desire to return and would not recommend dining here.

Visited on a quiet Sunday afternoon with few patrons. Bartender informed us they were out of most food items. Beers tasted average and unmemorable. Staff appeared frustrated and had a heated discussion behind the bar. Cool location but better options nearby. Uncertain about returning.
Disappointing experience at Tony Luke's in terminal F. The Philly Cheese Steak did not resemble the advertised version and the taste of the meat was akin to dog food. Not worth the $10 price tag.
I absolutely love this place. It's the best kept secret in Creve Couer. The 9-hole course is affordable and the staff is incredibly helpful.
"My first visit here was met with slow service and unfriendly employees, but the food was tasty."

I have visited this establishment multiple times and have consistently found the service to be lacking. However, the food is always delicious and worth the visit. Great option for a dive bar with tasty options.

I was pleasantly surprised by the beauty and quality of the art collection at this free museum in Indianapolis. The African Art and Modern Art sections were particularly impressive, although photography in the Modern Art section is not allowed. The outdoor sculpture garden and gift shop added to the overall experience. Highly recommended for art enthusiasts.

While the restaurant is a good option for groups, be prepared for a long wait to be seated, especially if you arrive at peak hours. Reservations are not accepted, and larger parties may not be accommodated in the main dining area. The manager did offer coffee for those waiting, but I wish they had just refilled the pot. The food was good, with 1/2 and 1/2 combos available, though I was disappointed with the amount of sauerkraut in my sandwich. The sunrise chile rellenos dish looked delicious and I would try it next time with a smaller group.
The Shop is a fantastic space with exceptional attention to detail and services. It offers ample options for private meetings and productive work. Highly recommended.

My husband and I celebrated our Anniversary at this restaurant and it was a delightful experience. The dinner was amazing and the customer service was top notch. We will definitely be returning in the future.

The Terrace Lounge falls short of being a great cocktail venue due to weak and watery drinks, spotty service, and unfriendly clientele. The bartenders seem unorganized and lack knowledge of the menu, while the selection of liquors is disappointing. The atmosphere is tainted by the presence of casino gamblers who detract from the experience. In comparison, Cin Cin offers superior cocktails and a more enjoyable environment without gaming machines. Terrace Lounge should consider making improvements in service, liquor selection, and overall atmosphere to attract a more discerning clientele.

Highly recommend this place for awesome service, with staff that are very friendly. Special shoutout to Amanda, the resident comedian. The food was really good and the beer was cold. Great atmosphere overall.

This nail shop is my favorite in the city. I've been a loyal customer for years and love the quiet, serene atmosphere. The staff is always friendly and efficient. At only $25.00 for a pedicure in the South, you can't find a better deal. Highly recommend!

I had a lovely morning at this NJ diner. The taylor ham, egg, and cheese sandwich was fantastic on a hamburger roll, and the home fries were excellent. The blueberry pancakes were fluffy, but the pre-packaged syrup was a downside. The service was friendly and attentive, with good coffee and no judgment for ordering two breakfasts. I can't wait to go back to this great diner!

The server was great and the maple wings were delicious, but the experience was completely ruined by inappropriate and offensive performance by the "piano guys." The rendition of the song was disgusting, offensive, and embarrassing, and completely ruined the birthday celebration. Definitely not worth the $35 paid for the performance.

The new Han Dynasty has taken over the spot where the old Mid-Atlantic restaurant was and offers a more enjoyable experience than the Olde City location. The service is exceptional, with staff going above and beyond to accommodate allergies and make guests feel welcomed. The food may not be as spicy as other branches, but the atmosphere and layout make up for it. Lunch portions are a great deal, making it a great spot for a quick and affordable meal. Overall, a solid choice for a meal out.

Carisma Restaurante has become our go-to spot for excellent food and great service. Owner Jose is friendly and ensures every guest is satisfied. The paellas, salmon, and filet mignon were cooked to perfection and served hot. Don't miss out on their cafe for equally delicious baked goods and coffees. Overall, Carisma offers good, fresh food prepared and served by nice people - a must-try beyond the typical Mexican fare. Highly recommended!

This small hole-in-the-wall restaurant on Woodland Avenue serves delicious Senegalese and West African dishes. The Thiboudienne was excellent, although a bit different from traditional versions. The Jollof Rice was a standout dish as well. The restaurant offers hightop tables for dining in or you can order food to-go. Friendly service adds to the overall positive experience.

Unfortunately, my recent experience with the falafel wrap was underwhelming. The falafels and pita lacked flavor, and the tzatziki sauce was disappointingly tasteless, resembling more of a thin glue than a traditional sauce. The only redeeming quality were the fresh diced cucumber and tomato, but they were buried underneath the unsatisfactory sauce. Overall, not a recommended choice for a flavorful and satisfying meal.

This place strikes the perfect balance between upscale and relaxed, catering to all types of clientele. Whether you're dressed to the nines or in your comfiest athleisure, you'll feel right at home enjoying their fantastic cocktails.

Our group of 6 had a great experience trying something new at this restaurant. The special was a generous amount of food and a great way to sample their options. The chicken, steak, rice/beans, and plantains were delicious. The egg and Yuca were not my favorite, but easy to set aside. Overall, a must-visit for those looking to try something different.

The pulled pork meal and sides at this restaurant were delicious. The red beans and rice had a good kick, the sweet potato casserole was delectable, and the pulled pork was smoky, juicy, and plentiful. A must-try dining option.
The detailing job was excellent. My car was extremely dirty and hadn't been washed in months. I opted for the executive detailing option and now my car looks fantastic. Highly recommend.

During our visit to potentially buy a second home in the area, we found the Lifetime club to be smaller but full service, with a friendly and helpful front desk person, Jen, who speaks highly of the club. We also met Joe, the general manager, who was terrific. The club offers fantastic bathrooms fully stocked with toiletries, and is conveniently located next to the mall. Highly recommend for those seeking a higher level of service.

Decent barbecue with room for improvement. Pulled pork was slightly dry but had a good smoky flavor. The original BBQ sauce was too sweet for my taste. Overall, it was mediocre and I would only return if there were no better options nearby.

Overall, our experience at this restaurant on a Lenten Friday was disappointing. The wait was long and the service was not very helpful. The blackened alligator was greasy and the raw oysters were fresh but not what I had expected. The entrees were also underwhelming, with the roast beef being too salty and the tuna and shrimp kabob being bland. The seafood boil menu looked promising, but we didn't try it. For the price, there are likely better seafood options available elsewhere.

Horrible customer service experience. Called about a promotion, was assured it would be honored, only to be told it wasn't once I arrived. Owner refused to make amends for their mistake. Would not recommend if you value customer service.

This Chinese restaurant is a must-visit for those looking to share delicious and spicy dishes with a large group. Every dish is packed with flavor and never disappoints. A definite crowd-pleaser that lives up to its reputation.

The Bricks of Ybor is a must-visit spot in Tampa. The meat sandwiches are phenomenal, and the pulled pork on Hawaiian sweet bread was one of the best meals I've had in a long time. The owner, Brian, went above and beyond to make us feel welcome, comping us drinks and letting us try new appetizers for free. The diverse crowd and pleasant environment make it a great place to hang out. I highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely be returning on my next trip to Tampa.
The wait was definitely worth it for the amazing crepes and rare-find grits. The pancakes were also awesome. Highly recommended!

My sister-in-law and I visited this restaurant and had a disappointing experience. The hostess was difficult to hear, the TV show playing was not enjoyable, and the service was lacking. The food took a long time to arrive, the blue cheese burger had too much blue cheese, but the fries and onion sticks were good. We had to wait for a carry out box and witnessed another table waiting a long time for their food. Overall, I doubt I will return in the future.

While the food at this restaurant was decently good, it was completely overpriced. The guacamole and Mojito were highlights, but the peach pork medallions lacked flavor. The corn cakes with Barbacoa were enjoyable. The atmosphere was hip and inviting, but the parking situation was a major inconvenience. Valet service should be provided given the price point and limited parking spaces. A three-block walk in the summer heat was not worth it.

The Rusty Pelican had a disappointing start to the evening with a hostess who initially denied our request for a table by the window. However, our server Liz made up for it with excellent service. The drinks, food, and overall experience were great after the initial hiccup.

The winery offers average wines but boasts a beautiful location on the pier with a wonderful outdoor patio. The staff is extremely friendly, but the wine club is expensive and offers limited benefits to its members. Despite the setting, it may be better to visit for a tasting rather than joining the wine club.

I recently got a cheap haircut in NY that left my hair looking like a crazy chimp had chewed it up. In need of a fix for job interviews, I went to Domenick's and had Robert cut my hair. The $35 price tag was a bit higher than I typically pay, but the result was worth it. I now look human again thanks to the great service at Domenick's. Overall, I would give it a 4 out of 5.

Extremely disappointing experience with Monro Muffler. Underfilled our engine by 3 quarts of oil, causing damage. Bergeys discovered timing chain needed replacing, which should last the life of the car. Service associate Joe was unhelpful and rude, even making my wife cry. Lost a long-time customer and won't be returning. Would not recommend.

The shop is beautifully clean with delicious homemade breakfast tarts and chicken pot pies. The sweets are visually stunning and tasty. Some items are pricey for their size, but the quality is worth it. The staff is friendly and engaging. A great spot for locals and worth a visit for those traveling from center city. I will definitely be back and highly recommend it.

Get in line early if you want to try this place. We waited around 30 minutes and found the pancakes to be average, albeit a bit dry. The selection was good, with options like raspberry, sweet potato, san antonio, and sugar and spice pancakes. Overall, the food was decent but didn't live up to the hype. If the line is too long, I would recommend heading to Fido down the street for amazing coffee and breakfast food.
The service advisors at this dealership have declined in quality since Kelly and her team left. It's only convenient for minor services like oil changes before going to another Honda dealer.

This hidden gem serves the best soon-dubu in the city in a cozy and welcoming atmosphere. The vegetarian options are plentiful and the custom-made stews are a must-try. The extra hot and hot temperature options are perfect for spice lovers, and the dol-sot rice is a crispy delight. The Korean BBQ meats are also a great alternative for non-tofu lovers. Overall, a must-visit for delicious Korean cuisine!

This motel offers clean, comfortable rooms at a reasonable rate. However, the breakfast buffet is average and the pool is too small for lap swimming. The spacious and comfortable lobby is a perk. Overall, a good option for a budget-friendly stay.

The lack of empathy and refusal to address cleanliness and maintenance issues at the columbarium site is disappointing. Request for better quality vases on all niches should have been met with understanding and action. Frustration was expressed at the lack of cooperation from the management, suggesting a lack of concern for the families of those interred.

The deli has a welcoming atmosphere with friendly staff and a delicious menu that includes vegetarian breakfast sandwiches and variety of other options. The prices are reasonable and the service is fast and attentive. Don't forget to check out their snack selection, including chocolate bars, drinks, chips, and hi-chew candies. Overall, a great place for a quick and satisfying meal.

Stopped in for brunch and was pleasantly surprised by the delicious food. The 3 meat hash, turkey sandwich, and bagel/salmon were all amazing. Employees were friendly and accommodating. A bit pricey but well worth it. Will definitely visit again if in the area.

This hidden gem at the end of Terminal E in Tampa International Airport offers a nice selection of food and drinks at reasonable prices. The bar has a local vibe, with TVs for catching the game and attentive, friendly staff. While seating may be limited, it is a great spot to relax before a flight. The drinks are tasty and well-priced, with a 22oz Jai Alai costing $8.50. I personally enjoyed a delicious Manhattan for $11. Overall, a great find for Delta travelers looking for a laid-back spot to wait for their flight. 5/5 stars.
The Depot Burger and shishito peppers were absolutely delicious. The food, atmosphere, and drinks were all perfect. Highly recommend!

The quality of this Giant store has significantly declined over the years. The produce is no longer fresh and prices have increased, with organic foods more expensive than competitors like Whole Foods. The store layout and customer service have also suffered, with aisles roped off and difficulty accessing certain areas. Overall, a disappointing experience and I will be shopping at Wegmans instead.

This hidden gem in a strip mall is a must-visit for a modern, romantic dining experience. The food is excellent, with standout dishes like the Fois gras and short ribs. The prix fixe menu is a great option, offering a variety of courses to try. The desserts, especially the caramel tart, are also amazing. Can't wait to go back and try something new next time!

Overall, my group dining experience at this restaurant was disappointing. Despite making a reservation in advance, the service was incredibly slow and inattentive. The food was hit or miss, with some dishes being good while others were mediocre. The atmosphere was trendy, but the service was a major letdown. Would not recommend based on this experience.
The food was excellent for the price. The steak was tender and the shrimp were perfectly cooked. I would definitely consider returning.

Despite the positive Yelp reviews, our experience at Tako was disappointing. The staff did not provide us with ice or a chill bucket for our wine, the appetizers took 45 minutes to arrive and were subpar, and the sushi was good but not exceptional. Overall, the service was slow and we would not order appetizers if we were to return.

The catfish, chicken, gumbo and mac & cheese at this lunch buffet are all amazing. Everything was hot and fresh, and the flavors were outstanding. A local recommended this place to us and it was definitely worth it.

See's Candies is a California-based bakery that has made its way to Florida, specifically in Tampa at the International Plaza Mall. Known for their soft and tasty chocolates, the temporary store offers a variety of delicious options such as lollipops and assorted chocolates. The friendly staff allows customers to sample different flavors before making a purchase, making it a great guilt-free indulgence. With options ranging from nuts to mint to toffee, there is something for everyone to enjoy. Conveniently located close to H&M, it's a must-visit for chocolate lovers. If you're in the area, skip the shipping and stop by the store for a sweet treat.

R2L offers a fancy-cool dining experience with stunning views of the city from the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place. The $35 Center City Restaurant Week dinner menu is a great value with multiple choices for each course. Highlights included the crispy peas/ham/garlic risotto balls, hearty Butcher's Filet with braised short rib and Steuben bean chili, and indulgent milk chocolate hazelnut pudding for dessert. The attentive service and classy atmosphere make for a memorable dining experience.

Becca is a fantastic bartender with great service at the bar. They offer awesome happy hour specials, including land shark, although the food menu is somewhat limited. We hope they continue to attract more locals and stay successful.
Disappointing first visit to this location. Didn't receive change or receipt, was told I already had it. No spoon for chili and old cheese on burger. Will not be returning.

Great prices for family style orders, pot roast was delicious for carry out, well-packaged and stayed warm, enough for a family of 4, amazing green beans, overall recommend for a good family restaurant experience.
Ordered a Caramel frappe at the drive-thru and it took 30 minutes to receive my drink, despite there being only 2 cars in front of me. Disappointing experience.

Overall, this place is a must-visit for anyone with a sweet tooth. The pizza cookies are out of this world delicious and being open until 3am is a game-changer. The only downside is the prices, but the quality of the treats makes it worth every penny. Highly recommend giving it a try!

This restaurant in Philadelphia is a hidden gem among the city's dining options. The tahini and bread were surprisingly addictive, and the organic meat choices were outstanding. The beef shishkabob was perfectly cooked, and the purslane salad was a dream. The unique blend of spices in the dishes left us wanting more. Even the dessert, pistachio creme brulee, was beyond amazing. The service was impeccable, with attentive staff and perfect timing. This may be the only restaurant worth eating at in Philadelphia - well worth the expense. Kudos to the chef for creating such a delightful dining experience.
Avoid this place at all costs. The frozen pizza and skunked beer were a major letdown. Save your money and go somewhere else. 'Nuff said.
Eating at this establishment made my whole family sick. The frozen yogurt was visually appealing but had a poor taste. I would not return or suggest dining here.
This place is a hidden gem for authentic Indian street food. I've tried a variety of dishes and each one was made exceptionally well. Highly recommended for a delicious and satisfying meal.

The Saint provided a unique and memorable experience for a night out in New Orleans. The atmosphere was lively, with typical Uptown characters making appearances. The outdoor seating was a nice surprise, and a good escape from the indoor smoke. It's not for everyone, but if you're looking for something different and don't mind a bit of chaos, give it a try.
The food at this restaurant is top-notch and always fresh. I love that they take the time to cook dishes like Wonton Soup properly. Perfect for families with kids who have their favorite dishes.

The food at this restaurant was excellent, however, the hospitality was extremely disappointing. Despite arriving well before closing time, we were denied dine-in service and told we could only order to go. Despite explaining our situation with two pregnant women and a child, they still refused to accommodate us. This lack of customer care is unacceptable and I will not be returning to this establishment. Very disappointing treatment of customers, especially pregnant women.

This restaurant exceeded all expectations with their superior steak and exceptional staff. Mallory, Max, and the rest of the team worked seamlessly together to provide an amazing dining experience. We will definitely be returning. Love this place!

The staff at this office is incredibly friendly and accommodating. Dr. Dinh was kind and attentive during my exam, addressing all of my concerns. The frame selection was impressive, and the receptionist was patient and helpful throughout the process. Overall, I had a great experience and will definitely be returning for my annual exam.
Horrible experience ordering from this place. Pizza was small, delivery took forever, and the delivery girl was rude and refused to give correct change. Would not recommend eating here.

BK is a must-visit spot for Sonoran hot dogs, though it may not be for everyone due to the numerous components. The guacamole was a standout, while the taco combo was hit or miss with slimy cabeza meat. The salsa bar was a nice touch and the service was good with quick food delivery. Place was busy during lunch on a weekday.

The service at the restaurant was disappointing as despite having reservations, I was told all window tables were reserved when many were actually open. The food was good, with the filet and salmon dishes being highlights. However, the lack of transparency regarding the recommended wine being $75, without prior notification, was also disappointing.
The best Indian food I've ever had! Fresh, delicious dishes served by friendly and attentive staff in a clean and welcoming environment. The paleek paneer and biryani were exceptional. 5 stars!
The smoothies at this place are truly the best in the world. The fresh bread is amazing as well. The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. A must-visit spot for smoothie lovers.

Bell Meade in Nashville exceeded my expectations during my recent visit. Despite not finding the specific bourbon I was looking for, the experience was still enjoyable thanks to the tasting bar and engaging conversation with Max. I even left with a unique bottle of Tennessee whiskey cream. I will definitely be making a point to return to Bell Meade in the future. Five stars from me.

This seaside restaurant at the end of the pier is a must-visit for fresh seafood lovers. The local crab special was a steal at $26 and the fried platter of shrimp, oysters, calamari and scallops for $12.95 was one of the best I've had. The view is gorgeous, the service is excellent, and the food is prepared well. Make sure to arrive early and sign up for a seat as it gets busy quickly. Parking may be a bit of a hassle but the overall experience is well worth it.

Overall, this restaurant was a huge disappointment. The manager and wait staff were incredibly rude and lacked any focus on customer service. The manager's hostile behavior towards a simple request for brown rice was unprofessional and off-putting. The waitresses were clumsy and would bump into customers while they were eating. The food was only okay at best, and certainly not worth the price. Charging for each soda refill seemed unreasonable and excessive. I will not be returning to this establishment.

While my first experience with Nola food started off on a low point, I was ultimately happy to have tried it. Despite some mix-ups with our orders and a lackluster shrimp po'boy, I understand it may have been an off-day for the restaurant. However, the overall experience left me underwhelmed and hesitant to return.

This comedy club is in desperate need of a facelift. The atmosphere feels shady and outdated, making it seem uncomfortable even for adults, let alone children. The service is average and everything appears tired. The comedy club lacks the cheerful and fun vibe expected, feeling more like a dreary banquet room. On a positive note, the parking is ample and the location is convenient. Owners, investing in renovations is essential to turning this place around.

The Orange St location was a fantastic choice for my weekend stay. The spacious apartment had everything I needed and more, including a fully stocked kitchen and a comfortable king bed. Despite a lack of signs marking the location, the guard at the front desk was helpful and provided all the necessary information. The quiet atmosphere and lack of intrusive maid service made for a relaxing stay. I would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend!

I have been a loyal customer at this restaurant for 15 years due to its awesome location and good service. However, inconsistent steak quality and excuses by the staff have been a recurring issue. I am willing to pay more for good quality steak, but it is disappointing when blame is shifted to the server.

The experience at this dealership was an absolute nightmare. From purchasing a vehicle out of budget to the lack of communication and dishonesty from the sales team, it was a complete disaster. They failed to help resolve the issue of the unaffordable purchase and have not been responsive to attempts to rectify the situation. Avoid this dealership at all costs.

Desi Village in KOP lacks ambiance but makes up for it with delicious food. The strip mall location is lackluster and the decor is outdated, but the menu offerings such as Keema Naan, Samosas, Saag Paneer, and Lamb Biryani are flavorful and well-prepared. The restaurant handles food allergies well, making it a reliable option for those with dietary restrictions. Despite the uninspiring atmosphere, the tasty cuisine makes it worth a visit.

LA Smokehouse was a delicious surprise after another barbecue place left us hungry. The pulled pork was amazing, the mac and cheese was a standout, and the owner's personal touch made the experience even better. A definite must-visit for barbecue lovers!

Iris has quickly become my top choice for dining in New Orleans. Their attention to detail in every aspect - food, drinks, service, atmosphere, and overall experience - truly sets them apart. The layout of the restaurant allows for a comfortable dining experience, and the music selection enhances the ambiance without being overbearing. The menu offerings are creative and well-prepared, with a focus on locally-sourced ingredients. The prix fixe menu is a great value for the quality of the meal. I will definitely be returning, regardless of the size of my group. Highly recommended.

Great atmosphere and decor with super friendly staff. Lunch specials, like the Pad Thai with chicken, offer good portion sizes and flavor. Dinner disappoints slightly with small portion of chicken satay, but Panang Curry with chicken is satisfying. No Pad See Ew on the menu, but still plenty of options to try. Staff and manager excel in customer service. Will definitely be back soon.

Petra Restaurant was a pleasant surprise for our family. The Friday and Saturday special rice with lamb was especially delicious, reminiscent of Indian fried rice. Despite its location, the inside of the restaurant was nice and the service was good. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and would recommend trying out their Middle Eastern cuisine.
I had an amazing birthday dinner at The Pearl. The food, wine, and service were all impeccable. The staff were welcoming and didn't rush us even after closing time. Highly recommend this restaurant!

I stopped by Albertsons for some snacks and was pleasantly surprised by the clean and well-stocked store. They had a good selection of bakery items, flowers, and groceries, including locally made snacks like California Kettle Corn and Taco Works. I was able to find the semi-unusual chips I was looking for and grabbed a Diet Coke at checkout. The wide aisles and convenient parking made my shopping experience easy, and the friendly staff was a nice bonus. Overall, I was happy with my visit to Albertsons.
I used to love this place, but new owners have turned it into a double threat of bad food and bad service. Such a shame.

Dr. Gloudemans is a wonderful and proactive doctor who is up-to-date on the most recent research and pro-vaccine. She is friendly, upbeat, and takes a reassuring approach to addressing health concerns. However, there have been billing hiccups that have caused frustration for patients, but these issues were resolved after a phone call.

The meeting for the Homebuilders Association of New Orleans was overall a positive experience. The food was good and the staff took good care of the patrons. The mimosa was enjoyable, and the corn and crab soup was fantastic, although the portion was small. The grits and grillades dish was also fantastic with a good portion size. The price was around $10, which was reasonable. The ambience and quality of the food make it a place worth revisiting. I didn't get a chance to test the Wi-Fi, but based on my experience, I would recommend this place for a repeat visit.

The Frist cafe is a convenient option for gluten-free noshers with affordable prices and quick bites. The Cobb salad is a popular choice, especially with an added egg for extra protein. Be prepared for busy times like Senior Mondays and weekends at lunchtime.

Ghini's offers delicious French breakfast options, with the eggs provencale being a standout dish that is unique and flavorful. The crepes, both sweet and savory, are also a must-try, with the spinach and swiss crepe being a personal favorite. The option to add hashbrowns for only a dollar is a bonus. Highly recommend trying Ghini's for a tasty and satisfying breakfast experience.

I absolutely loved the unique atmosphere of this spot, with graffiti-style art on the walls and delicious food options. The hummus flavors were a special touch, and I particularly enjoyed the Greek steak pita with guac hummus. The prices were reasonable and portion sizes were generous. Can't wait to go back!

Prep & Pastry is a must-visit for brunch in town. The food is delicious, especially the breakfast sandwich, and their sweets are a hit. Don't forget to put your name on the waitlist before arriving to save time. The iced tea is a standout and the staff is super friendly. Highly recommend a visit.

The Fringe festival in Edmonton offers a wide variety of performances, street entertainment, and vendors over two weekends and a joining week. With multiple venues and plays to choose from, plus a vibrant street market, it's a great way to spend a few hours exploring the local arts scene. Don't miss out on the gourmet mini donut truck tucked away behind the farmers market. The location adds to the festival's charm, making it a must-visit annual event in the city.

I used to frequent this location regularly, but was very disappointed with the recent changes. The customer service has significantly deteriorated - our server was unfriendly, unhelpful, and did not offer us a tea to go like they used to. The food was mediocre, and the deterioration of the seating area was noticeable. This was once a favorite spot of mine, but I will not be returning.

While this plumber provided a prompt and clear estimate, we ultimately chose to go with a different plumber due to their higher quote compared to the others we interviewed. However, their communication was impressive and we may consider using them for future jobs as they seem reliable. It's true that quality work often comes with a higher price tag.
Best Mexican food in Florida! Absolutely love it and keep coming back since my first visit. Highly recommend!

Real Thai offers authentic Thai cuisine with the option to customize spice levels. The soups are a standout, while the curries have great flavor but may be a bit runny for some. The veggie eggrolls are not a favorite, but the meat ones may be worth trying. Overall, a solid choice for Thai food.

Jump on the School Bus provided exceptional service for our winery and brewery tour as well as our wedding transportation. Darin and Sierra were easy to communicate with, flexible, and paid attention to every detail. Our driver was knowledgeable and made great suggestions throughout the day. We highly recommend them for any event transportation needs.

Bailey's Range is the perfect spot to bring out-of-town guests, with incredible burgers and unique boozy shakes. The horchata shake is a must-try. The central location makes it easy to visit, and the vibe is great. The burger selection is outstanding, with honest waiters who give their true opinions. The burger showdown is a cool feature. The only downside is some occasional inconsistencies with burger doneness. Overall, a 4/5 star experience.
This breakfast sandwich on a biscuit may be the best ever - absolutely delicious!

This University location of Silver Mine has lost my business forever. The manager did not take my order seriously, the sandwich was cold and improperly wrapped, and the employee was rude. Goodbye Silver Mine!

I had my first visit at this salon and Grace did an amazing job on my difficult hair, which is very long and thick. The atmosphere was modern and clean with no snobbiness. Pricing was reasonable. Highly recommend!

The food at this restaurant was delicious, especially the Sunday Buffet which included fried chicken, greens, smothered steak, corn, and cabbage. The atmosphere was incredibly cozy and felt like eating at your grandmother's house. While not a fancy dining spot, the prices were fair and the locals highly recommended it. The overall experience exceeded my expectations and was definitely worth any wait.

The Passion Passport juice was a delightful blend of passion fruit, banana, pineapple mango, papaya, and raw cane sugar. It was delicious and refreshing, living up to its name. I would definitely order it again!

I had a thoroughly enjoyable private tour with Carrie today. Despite the rain keeping the crowds away, her knowledge and passion for the Civil War was captivating. The Battle of Franklin truly deserves the memorial it has.

I had a great experience with this service. The staff was friendly and treated me well from the moment I called. They offered the best prices in town and were able to fit me in the same day for a windshield repair. The waiting area was comfortable and had complimentary drinks and snacks. Overall, I felt valued as a customer and will definitely be returning for future auto glass needs. Highly recommend!

Based on this review, it seems the customer is extremely upset with TD Bank for not informing them of their new overdraft policy, resulting in unexpected fees. The customer also had a negative experience with customer service, including a long wait time on the phone. The customer is planning on switching banks as a result of this incident.

Overall, our stay at the Four Points for 3 nights in November was pleasant. The check-in process was easy, and we enjoyed a good price on the room with our member and AAA discount. The free breakfast was a nice perk. The hotel's location near the airport was convenient, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable, parking was easy, and it was quiet at night. Would recommend for a business stay.

Located right by Union Station Metro stop, this hotel is a convenient option for those visiting downtown. Weekend rates are a good deal, but prices increase during the week. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows. The bathroom was spacious with a tub and ample towels. The only drawbacks were a poor quality coffee machine in the room and thin doors leading to noise from the hallway. The lobby is a highlight of the hotel. Overall, a worthwhile choice for a stay in the area.

Some of the best Mexican food I've ever had, especially the fried fish taco. The red sauce and birria are must-buys for taking home. Lack of air conditioning can be uncomfortable in monsoon season, but the food makes it worth it.

As an avid runner, I rely on my shoes for optimal performance. Endurance House offers a great variety of shoes and their staff provides personalized assistance to help improve your stride and prevent injuries. The great selection, helpful staff, and personalized service make this store stand out from others. I will definitely continue to return for top-notch products and service.

HipCity offers a super lunch option for those looking for delicious plant-based alternatives. Just be mindful of the crowded space and yoga mats when trying to find a place to stand. You won't even miss the meat with their tasty menu options like the buffalo bella and crispy hipcity ranch sandwiches. Friendly staff and efficient service make this a great spot for a quick and satisfying meal.
The place claims to close at 10PM, but the kitchen was already closed when I arrived at 8:30. It was disappointing and unreasonable for them to turn away customers so early.
This Chinese restaurant is hands down the best in the area with incredibly friendly owners. The wontons given while waiting for takeout are a delicious bonus.

Rosemary's Grill is our favorite restaurant for many reasons. The extensive menu offers delicious Classic American dishes and traditional Turkish cuisine, with the Mixed grill kebab platter being a standout. The portions are generous and the food is expertly prepared with attention to detail, making it a step above common chain restaurants. The cozy, family-owned atmosphere makes us feel like part of the family every time we dine there. The waitstaff and owners are warm and welcoming, and we always look forward to returning for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Highly recommend trying the rice pudding!
The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming, but the crowd was surprisingly light both times I visited. The $3.50 margaritas after 4 on Tuesdays are a great deal and quite tasty.
I would not recommend this place, even if it was the only option open at 2am. The General Tso's dish was below average and not worth returning for. I suggest going to East Cuisine instead.

The food at this restaurant is good, with standout dishes like the blueberry lasagna and chocolate dessert. However, the overall experience was marred by the pretentious and haughty attitude of the waiter, who lacked professionalism and customer service skills. If not for the waiter's behavior, this place would have received a higher rating.

The flavors at this ice cream shop are truly unique and delicious. The Cassis sorbet was a standout, starting subtly and growing more flavorful with each bite. It was well worth a return visit with friends to experience more of their frozen treats.

This place has the best pizza hands down. The owners, a former hockey player and his tough but adorable wife, are a riot. They make their own sausage and mozzarella, and don't you dare mispronounce Ricotta. Every pizza is fantastic, even the crusts which we normally don't eat in our family. Definitely try dipping them in olive oil and vinaigrette for an extra kick. Highly recommend this spot.

The sales staff were friendly and helpful, especially Mike. He took us for a ride in one of the Razors, which was a fun experience. Who knows, we might end up getting one ourselves! Great customer service overall.

I highly recommend this place for delicious food and friendly service. The zucchini muffins are a must-try and I always leave with some for later. Great prices and a fantastic frozen yogurt bar with unlimited toppings. A fun dining experience with yum yum food.

The all-you-can-eat experience was disappointing due to long wait times for orders and being ignored by servers. Rolls contained unexpected extras not listed on the menu, such as sweet mustard sauce which was not enjoyable. On the positive side, once orders were finally taken, the food was made quickly.

The restaurant was beautifully decorated and clean, and all six of us enjoyed our meals. The fried green tomatoes were perfectly seasoned and delicious, but arrived after everyone else had their meals. The chicken salad, fried bologna sandwich, and cheeseburger were all tasty choices. The peach cobbler dessert was shared and highly recommended with ice cream.
The food at this cafe is good, but the cleanliness of the establishment is severely lacking.  I likely will not return unless they improve the overall hygiene of the cafe.
We highly recommend this place for delicious food with generous portions. The chicken parm was especially tasty. Can't wait to return and try more dishes!

Overall, not a bad burger joint. The bacon cheeseburger had perfectly cooked bacon and a nicely toasted bun. Fries and chocolate shake were good too. However, the burger could have been juicier, portion size was small for the price, and the lingering smell of burger grease was a downside.

After reading rave reviews on Yelp, I decided to give this place a shot. Unfortunately, the food was only okay at best. I left and went across the street to Charlie's, where the redtop pizza blew me away. If you want good pizza, go to Charlie's instead.

We have been loyal customers at this location since it was a Wild Oats, and it seems to have only improved since the merger with Whole Foods. The produce, seafood, cheese, and personal care sections are all top-notch. The natural cosmetics and handmade soaps are a favorite, along with the salad bar. The post-yoga lunch options are perfect for cooler months, especially the Carrot Ginger, Split Pea, and Corn Chowder soups. Other must-try items include the curried tofu salad, sushi to-go boxes, everything cookies, and lavender soda. Overall, a fantastic shopping experience.
The Mediterranean chicken quesadillas are fantastic, especially with the awesome sauce. Highly recommend for anyone who loves fresh Greek food!

I am absolutely in love with this place! It is gorgeous, spacious, modern and above all, incredibly clean. The staff, Will, Amanda, and Sal are fantastic and always willing to help, especially when it comes to troubleshooting my devices as a newbie vaper. They have a wide variety of juices, mods, and atty's to choose from, and I love sampling new flavors whenever I visit. Definitely a must-visit spot for anyone in the vaping community, you won't be disappointed!

Great spot for breakfast with delicious options like Jebbs open face and huevos rancheros. The monte cisto is overpriced and not worth it, but everything else tastes great. Addicting coffee and no reservations so arrive early. Recommended for a tasty breakfast experience.

My experience at this place will be my last. I called ahead to request a plain deboned duck, but when I arrived they gave me a whole duck with stuffing I never asked for. The customer service was terrible and they offered no compensation. It's a shame that the food is overshadowed by their incompetence.

I visited the preserve based on reviews and was pleasantly surprised. The hikes were great with lots of wildlife to see on clearly marked paths. The bird of prey aviary was wonderful and the learning center was both educational and a nice break from the hike. Staff and volunteers were friendly and helpful. Highly recommend visiting in the mid afternoon to see the birds up close with the handlers.

This diner in North Wilmington is nothing special, but stands out as one of the better options in the area. The food is typical diner fare and the experience is average overall. Perfect for a quick and simple meal after swim meets.

We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at this restaurant. The food, service, and decor were all fantastic. The manager greeted us warmly and our server, Christina, was delightful. The beer selection was impressive and the chicken rabe sandwich and pepperoni pizza were delicious. The pizza had a superb "well done" taste. The only potential issue was the lack of a children's menu for our picky 7-year-old. We will definitely be returning.

I regularly visit student salons, including the Aveda Institute, for hair cuts and styling. The results can be mixed due to having different stylists each time, but the experience is generally positive. The cut may take longer than with a seasoned professional, but the price includes a relaxing wash, cut, and blowdry style. The student stylists are professional, take feedback well, and consult with their teachers to ensure the cut meets your expectations. Overall, it's a great option for affordable and quality salon services.
Good food and friendly staff make for a lovely dining experience. Quick service and generous portions. Opt for outside seating for a nice touch.
I highly recommend this restaurant for their delicious food, excellent service, and wide menu variety. The Monte Cristo crepes were absolutely amazing - I will definitely be back!

A peaceful alternative to Cafe du Monde, Beignet Oasis offers delicious beignets without the long lines. The early morning ambiance on Bourbon St. is a welcome change from the usual hustle and bustle. While the breakfast options were average, the beignets stole the show. Disappointingly, there was no live music during our visit. Overall, a great spot for a quiet and tasty beignet experience.

Mixx offers a large menu of sushi options at affordable prices, making it a good choice for a quick and budget-friendly meal. While it may not be the best quality sushi in the city, it is a convenient option for a fast sushi fix.

Completely unprofessional and disrespectful customer service. Provided a quote last week that was close to other shops, but when I called to schedule an appointment, the person who answered the phone (Mike or Nick) denied the quoted price and was rude. Refused to let me speak to anyone else and hung up on me. Avoid this place at all costs.

This place lacks a customer service department which leads to frustrating experiences when trying to get answers or issues resolved. Promises made during the purchasing process were not fulfilled, leading to multiple trips back to the dealership and a lack of communication. The lack of accountability and follow-through from management is disappointing. I would not recommend this place to others based on my negative experiences. A customer service department is necessary to improve the overall customer experience.

I absolutely adore this restaurant! The owners are incredibly kind, and the food is absolutely delicious. My personal favorite is the bacon pizza. It's great that there is a play room for kids to enjoy while waiting for their meal.
"The fried rice at this Asian restaurant is absolutely delicious. The prices are reasonable and the food is exceptional. Definitely one of the best Asian restaurants in town."

Harry's Blue Bell is a hidden gem in a shopping center, with a cozy atmosphere and a great beer selection. The food menu is a bit limited, but the bbq pulled pork and chicken wrap were decent. The service was just okay and the portion sizes were on the smaller side. It's a nice spot for a quick dinner if you're in the area but not worth a special trip. I'd give it a solid 3 stars.

Kajuns has made significant improvements by installing smoke eaters, making the air much more breathable for those with sensitivities to cigarette smoke. Although clothing may still retain the smell of smoke after leaving, the overall experience inside the bar has greatly improved. The dedication of the staff to enhancing customer experience is commendable. Thank you, Kajuns!

My friends introduced me to Brio's and I was not disappointed. The complimentary bread and chips, bruschetta, pasta, and salads were all delicious. The service was excellent and added to the overall charm of the restaurant. I highly recommend it.

The overall experience at this Tucson establishment was extremely disappointing. The food was cold and the service was rude, making it one of the worst places in town. They have the right concept but fail to execute it properly.

. The thin crust, rich tomato sauce, and fresh mozzarella make for a delicious combination. The meatballs are a standout dish as well. The vintage decor adds a charming touch to the overall experience. Gennaro's has consistently delivered excellent food and atmosphere, and I can't recommend it enough.

Great atmosphere, friendly bartender, well-stocked bar. The Pear Gorgonzola Melt was fantastic. Good value for around $10. All ages and backgrounds present. Perfect spot for a sandwich and sports games. Definitely worth a visit.

Overall, the restaurant had a great atmosphere and friendly service with reasonable prices. However, the food was a bit bland and not overly enjoyable. It satisfied our hunger after a long drive, but we most likely won't be returning.
I had a great experience at this place for drinks with nice and friendly staff. However, I did not try the food due to concerns about cleanliness.

This Greek-owned pancake house offers a tasty breakfast menu with fun spins on classic dishes like Freedom Toast and Freedom Fries. The service is quick and friendly, perfect for large groups. The energetic owner adds a personal touch to the dining experience. A great alternative to the larger chain pancake houses, the food is delicious and made with love.

Despite previously enjoying my visits to Fresh, my recent experience was disappointing. The service and product quality were not up to par, and the prices were outrageously high. The staff failed to acknowledge my presence and the Vienna Latte I ordered was not only one of the worst I have ever had, but also incredibly expensive. Unfortunately, this visit was one of the worst experiences I have had at Fresh.

Overall, the service for a large group was adequate but not exceptional. One member did experience a delay in receiving their food. The lamb kebab plate I ordered had well-cooked rice and flavorful babaghanoush, but the meat was dry and lacking in flavor. The presentation of the dish was nice. I have had better experiences at this restaurant in the past, particularly during Ramadan when they offer a diverse and appealing buffet. I would recommend trying them during this time, but be sure to arrive early as it can get crowded.
A cool spot to visit on a Sunday morning to check out the birds. Friendly staff and a great place for bird enthusiasts.

While the food at this old club was good, the service was lacking during our visit. Despite enjoying a tasty sashimi plate and burger, we had to constantly ask for basic items like plates, sauce bowls, and napkins. The staff even forgot to bring a drink for our child until we specifically requested one. Despite using a Groupon, the poor service dampened our overall experience. Would potentially return with a different server.

Cuenelli's Peruvian Style Rotisserie Chicken offers a unique and delicious take on traditional rotisserie chicken. The chicken is clearly made with love, with flavorful seasoning down to the bone and a smoky element from the charcoal grill. The tender, well-seasoned chicken is served with two tasty dipping sauces and paired with sides like cilantro rice, spicy pinto beans, and caramelized sweet plantains. Wash it all down with Inca cola or chicha limena for a truly satisfying meal. This chicken will make you rethink what you know about rotisserie chicken - a must-try for any food lover.

I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant, treating myself to meat, bourbon libations, and a salad. The plain burger was perfectly cooked and seasoned, satisfying even without cheese or bacon. The bartender was attentive and made delicious sazeracs to accompany my meal. The salad was basic but well-dressed. I look forward to returning to try a fancier burger option. Great place for a solo birthday date.

I visited this restaurant on a Monday for lunch and sat at the bar. The service was fast and attentive. I ordered the carne asada taco lunch special, which exceeded my expectations. Overall, I was more than satisfied with my experience at this place.
I highly recommend these guys. Tony is extremely helpful and fixed my flat tire for less than expected. Great service!

I had a great experience with my hairdresser. She was thorough in understanding my desired style and checked in frequently during the haircut to ensure I was happy. I was very pleased with the end result.

The sweet and sour chicken and chicken chow mein were both excellent, with generous cuts of chicken in the chow mein. The sushi was also enjoyable. Prices are a bit high, but the quality of the food makes it worth it.

I had a frustrating experience with Comcast as a long-time customer. After numerous attempts to lower my bill, I was only offered a significant reduction once I decided to switch to Verizon. The sudden change in attitude was disappointing and made me question their commitment to customer satisfaction. I have been pleased with Verizon's service and feel relieved to no longer deal with Comcast's lack of concern for their customers.

B's Diner is a hidden gem worth finding. The cozy atmosphere, friendly staff, and unique decor make it a must-visit spot. The community involvement and delicious menu options make supporting this place a no-brainer. Perfect for a laid-back meal with great people-watching opportunities. Must try the Elk sausage and perogie poutine!

The food at this restaurant has drastically declined over the past year, with 90% of the buffet offerings being way too salty. The pulled turkey was tough, the fish tasted odd, and the vegetables were overcooked. The only decent items were the corn pudding and mashed potatoes. The desserts were just average. The service was good, with attentive waitstaff being the only positive aspect of the dining experience.

Despite being the only table in the restaurant, my wife and I experienced extremely slow service at this establishment. The wait for our order and our small pizzas was far too long, and the atmosphere was unpleasant due to staff complaints about the place. To top it off, the food was barely warm when it finally arrived. This restaurant is now on my list of places to avoid.

Fellini's Cafe in Newtown Square is a romantic little BYOB spot with big portions at decent prices. You won't leave hungry! The interior is quaint and perfect for a date night, but be prepared for a noisy atmosphere. The food is delicious with minor hiccups like warm salad plates and partially frozen peas. The service can be hit or miss, but overall, it's a solid choice for a casual Italian meal. I'll definitely be back for another visit.

The overall experience at the Catbird Seat was underwhelming, with an awkward entrance and stuffy atmosphere. The drinks were average at best, the food forgettable, and the prices were high for what was offered. The service was friendly, but overall, it was a disappointing dining experience.

Stitch-It did an excellent job on my dress back in June 2013. They were able to accommodate my rush request and the results far exceeded my expectations. The staff was professional, the service was top-notch, and the fee was well worth it. Maggie O'Neill was my personal tailor and she was awesome. Highly recommend Stitch-It for any tailoring needs.

I had an amazing experience at this establishment. The staff was incredibly talented and made me feel comfortable during my Brazilian and blow-out services. They had great personalities and made me laugh throughout my visit. I can't wait to go back! Special shoutout to Jenne for her exceptional work.

If you're in Camden or anywhere in New Jersey, make sure to stop by Santana's for breakfast and pastries. Their coffee is superior to popular chains like Starbucks and Dunkin' Donuts, and their pastries are incredible. A must-visit spot in the area.

The food was delicious and reasonably priced, but the escargot could be improved. Atmosphere is unique with the option to dine with a ghost for an extra fee. The experience is eerie in a cold, dungeon-like room.

This low-key joint in Philly is serving up some of the best burgers in the city. The menu is creative and customizable, with perfectly seared and juicy burgers cooked on a flattop. The hand-cut fries are crispy and salty, completing the ultimate burger experience. Plus, don't forget to download the SPOT app for some great rewards and coupons. Overall, this place is a must-visit for burger lovers.

Highly recommend these guys for car key replacement! They were referred to me by my mechanic and did an excellent job with my transponder keys. They worked carefully and thoroughly, ensuring the keys opened all doors and the trunk before handing them over. Great attitude and service!

The salon is immaculately clean and organized with a friendly staff. Owner Doug's expertise and training ensures top-notch service and cutting-edge techniques. I wholeheartedly recommend this salon to anyone in need of a hair transformation.

Bab Cafe offers delicious food with a great variety on their menu. The Dak-Galbi Bibim-bab was flavorful and the potstickers were a perfect side. The service was quick despite the lunch rush. The only downside is the challenge of downtown parking. Overall, a fantastic addition to Reno's restaurant scene.

If you're looking for a great brunch spot in New Orleans, Mr. B's is a must-visit! The Brandy Milk Punch is a must-try, and the shrimp and grits are absolutely delicious. The ambiance and the service are top-notch as well. Highly recommend!

I highly recommend this salon for waxing services. The staff is professional and knowledgeable, the atmosphere is clean and welcoming. I had a great experience with Despina who did my armpits, and I will definitely be returning for more services in the future. The prices are reasonable for the quality of service provided. Thank you for a great experience!

Gus, the falafel nazi, truly lives up to his reputation as the best in town. Despite having to wait in line on two previous occasions, I finally got a taste of his delicious food and it was well worth the wait. The chicken cooked over coal was tender and perfectly cooked, and the falafel was delicious. The grapes and homemade pasta added a nice touch to the meal, and there was enough food for two people. Gus's fresh ingredients and attention to detail make his food truck a must-try.
SRS is an exceptional management company that is extremely accommodating to specific requests. Highly recommended.

Fresco in Tucson is a gem for fresh and delicious pizza. Reasonable prices, friendly service, and a passion for quality ingredients make this a must-visit spot. The meat-special pizza was a standout with crispy crust and generous toppings. A five-star dining experience worth returning to. Highly recommended!

Overall, this restaurant was a clean and newly decorated space with excellent and friendly service. The food was delicious for adults, but on the spicy side for kids and grandparents. The dim lighting was a challenge for older individuals reading the menu. The veggie wings and cactus and sweet potato burritos were standout dishes. The guacamole was tasty, although the spicy chips were too intense. The availability of pitchers of margaritas was a convenient option for our large group.

Zaxby's may not be your typical fast-food joint, but the service and quality of food make it stand out. The chicken fingers were juicy and flavorful, though the Texas toast was too greasy. The staff went above and beyond to ensure a great experience, adding a personal touch that felt like Disney employees. The variety of sauces was a plus, though a spicy bbq and blue cheese option would have been a nice addition. Overall, a solid experience with affordable prices, making it worth a try for those looking for a southern twist on chicken fingers.

I cannot recommend Sugar Coated Bakery enough. Every baked good that comes out of their kitchen is top-notch, with full flavor and perfect texture. The delicate detailing on each treat is phenomenal, showing the time and love that goes into each piece. Their signature flavors are delicious, and their cream cheese frosting is a must-try. Treat yourself and your loved ones to Sugar Coated - you won't be disappointed!

Despite its unique location and product offering, this store's lousy service, long wait times, and lack of assistance make it a disappointing shopping experience. The staff failed to meet expectations in gift wrapping, leaving customers like me feeling frustrated and inconvenienced. While I love their products, I will not be returning to this location due to the poor service received.

The staff at this place is a mix of helpful and confrontational. While some ladies go out of their way to assist customers, there is one who can be aggressive if provoked. It's easy to spot the difference and adjust accordingly.

Hendricks in St. Louis is a must-try for barbecue lovers. The meats, sauces, and sides surpass most other barbecue places. The onion rings are massive and the coleslaw is deliciously shredded. The service is friendly and efficient, although there may be a wait for your meal, which gives you the opportunity to admire the unique decor.

I was thoroughly impressed with the variety of food options for a late night dinner with young kids. The person who took our order was friendly and helpful, but what really made our experience outstanding were our waiter Eric and the staff at the grill house station. Eric was attentive, accommodating, and went above and beyond to ensure our requests were met. The staff at the grill house station showed great thoughtfulness and consideration when it came to my allergy. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that I wish we had near us in upper PA.

This coffee spot lacks a menu and caters more towards coffee connoisseurs. The atmosphere is artsy and great for people watching, but not ideal for studying due to loud noise. The servers are friendly and keep the tables clean. Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, but it won't keep me coming back.
5 stars for Milk and Honey thanks to Kyle! He was a fantastic waiter who recommended the amazing honey hot sauce and heavenly biscuits. Definitely ask for him and enjoy a great meal.

Convenient location near 30th Street Station and Drexel University with nearby street parking. Decent service with average tasting appetizers like mac and cheese and cheesesteak egg rolls. Chicken pot pie had plenty of veggies but lacked in chicken quantity. Desserts were large portions but bread pudding and brownie were average in taste.

Had a great time at this bar for a bachelorette party on a Saturday night in April. Arriving early is key to avoiding long lines. The cover band was fantastic and there was a lively atmosphere with multiple celebrations happening. Signature cocktails were good but on the pricey side. Would return for another special occasion, but may skip for a regular night out due to the crowds.

This BBQ joint has the best fall-off-the-bone ribs I've ever had. The pulled pork is excellent with a great smoky flavor. The mac and cheese is creamy and delicious. Service was fast and friendly. The walnut brownie and ice cream dessert was equally as satisfying. Overall, a great find and highly recommended.

Despite a friendly waitress, my experience at Copabanana during university city restaurant week was a disaster. Loud kids playing football near outdoor tables made for a distracting meal. Moving indoors didn't improve things, as the food was subpar - fatty, overcooked steak and rubbery chicken. I won't be returning. 1 star.

This restaurant in New Orleans serves the best shrimp and grits in town. The fresh juices are also delicious. My fiance, who has visited twice in the past two years, still considers it the best he's ever had. Highly recommend trying it out!
This tapas spot in Nashville is a gem. The staff is friendly, the open kitchen adds to the ambiance, and the food is delicious. Can't wait to return and try more dishes.

Super delish seafood with no frills, just great flavors. The sour dough bread was a standout, and the 80s music added a fun retro vibe to the dining experience. Highly recommended for a tasty and enjoyable meal.

Dr. Dechant is personable and establishes a great connection with his patients. The office is comfortable and equipped with high-tech equipment, making appointments more bearable. The selection of eyeglass frames is great, and the staff is friendly. Overall, a highly recommended eye care experience.

I had a wonderful experience at this cute little place with great food. The pear cider beer was delicious and the service was excellent. The ambiance was cozy and the prices were very reasonable. I highly recommend it.

Seasons is a delightful little restaurant that offers a variety of delicious desserts and modernized food dishes. The shaved ice and boba tea are must-try items, with the hula and koko loco being personal favorites. The store is clean and kid-friendly, with friendly and efficient service. The quail and chicken wings are also highly recommended by others. Overall, Seasons is a wonderful place to enjoy tasty treats with friends and worth multiple visits. Check it out and indulge in some goodness!

While the concept of this cafe is adorable, I found it to be overpriced for what you get. It's a cute spot to meet up with a friend, but I prefer my own homemade coffee. Prices could be lower and the product offering could use some improvement.
This place is fantastic with 75 cent oysters and delicious cheesy grits. Great spot for a meal, especially during happy hour.

This restaurant is a must-visit! The organic, fresh, and delicious food is sourced from local farmers and fishermen, with many veggies grown on-site. The menu offers a wide variety of options, with my favorite being the Carly's breakfast - avocado on sourdough toast with a fried egg and sweet potatoes. Highly recommend this place for a delicious and fresh dining experience.

The burgers at this establishment are delicious and full of flavor, particularly the El Mariachi. While the portion size may not be large, the taste more than makes up for it. The salted caramel ice cream was also a standout, tasting homemade and high-quality. I highly recommend trying the rooster sauce for an extra kick of flavor. Overall, a great dining experience with tasty food options.

Had a fantastic late dinner on a Sunday night at this sushi spot. Surprised at how delicious and affordable the sushi was - got a plate full for only $13.00. The staff was friendly and seemed to be having a good time. Will definitely be returning soon. Highly recommend!

This restaurant consistently serves greasy and overly seasoned food that made me feel nauseous. Their hoagies were a disappointment and the buffalo chicken sandwich was covered in too much blue cheese and sauce. The desserts were bland and not worth the money, and the sodas were often expired and flat. Overall, I would not recommend eating here. They need to use fresher ingredients and tone down on the grease and seasoning.

Overall, the non-smoking room we paid for had a smoke smell and ashtrays. The shower drained slowly and the pillows were lumpy, causing a migraine. On the positive side, the room was clean, staff was friendly, and there was free wifi, although it wouldn't connect.
The staff at this pharmacy were not friendly and did not meet the promised prescription pick-up time. I recommend going to Walmart next door if you are in a hurry.

El Camino is a must-visit for seitan lovers with delicious seitan wings and nachos. However, the service can be slow, with one instance resulting in a complimentary meal due to long wait times. The fried pickles were not impressive, with a grainy coating and unsatisfying taste. Despite this, the seitan dishes and margaritas make it worth returning to.

B13 is an excellent place to get a tattoo. I have had two done there and am really pleased with both. The owner was able to fit a group of us in on short notice with a great sketch. Amanda does especially awesome work, but everyone there is great. Highly recommend.

Overall, our experience at this restaurant on a busy Friday night was just okay. The service was hit and miss, with our server trying but not quite hitting the mark. The food was decent, but not enough to make me want to return.

Twisted Twig is a must for anyone in need of floral arrangements - amazing service, incredibly friendly staff, and stunning arrangements. Jen goes above and beyond to ensure your vision comes to life within your budget. You won't regret working with them!
