Overall, the food at this restaurant was delicious with unique options like the Banzai roll. However, the service was lacking as our waiter was unhelpful and unfriendly. The seaweed salad, shiomay, and sashimi were all fresh and tasty. The Banzai roll was a standout dish, perfect for those looking for a no-rice option. The salad dressing was more like carrot puree. I deducted one star due to the poor service experience.

I discovered this hidden gem for brunch thanks to a friend's recommendation. The honeybee crepe and almond croissant were so delicious, I couldn't bring any leftovers home. The seating is limited, so arrive early if you're with a group. Perfect spot for smaller groups. Will definitely be returning!
This location is amazing with made-to-order donuts that are always served hot and stay delicious even the next day. Worth the visit!
What a charming and sustainable spot! Highly recommend visiting. The staff is fantastic and the food and coffee are exceptional.
The food was awful and overpriced, taking over 2 hours for delivery. The customer service was also rude and unhelpful when we called about our order. Definitely will not be ordering from here again.
Evan is the best guy ever and one of the most awesome people I know. He is essential as the door guy at OMALLZ and I wouldn't come without him.

The food at this restaurant was borderline gross and overpriced. The burger was tasteless, the bun was soggy, and the fries were overly salty. Pouring truffle oil over burned, greasy fries did not make the meal worth its $16 price tag. We will not be returning.

I was pleasantly surprised to find a Taiwanese restaurant in Reno, conveniently located near all the hotels. The boba tea is solid and the authentic Taiwanese food is delicious, as long as you know what to order.
Avoid this overpriced mediocrity at all costs. Our family had two terrible dining experiences and "corporate" had to refund our money both times. Don't waste your money here.

Despite initially thinking that this restaurant only served meat, I was pleasantly surprised by their delicious veggie burger and fantastic selection of local microbrews. The fact that they also make their own ice cream was a bonus. I will definitely be returning on my next visit to St. Louis.

After a heartbreaking loss of my favorite Indian food chef, Mohammad Butt, I discovered Zaika and was pleasantly surprised. The fresh, homemade ingredients and attention to detail in each dish make Zaika stand out. The menu is extensive and well-described, making ordering easy. The naan is perfect for mopping up the delicious sauces. The catering options are already popular, with Ramadan orders being negotiated. Only good things can come from Zaika's all HALAL meat approach. Be sure to try the Ras Malai dessert - it's ungodly good.

Busy restaurant with excellent customer service. Unique touch of offering special coffee while waiting for our table. Server was accommodating to dietary restrictions and provided great suggestions. Shared a salad, entree, and Special grits which were all delicious and reasonably priced for a downtown location. Overall, highly recommend this restaurant.

Fantastic experience with super friendly staff that are great with kids. The food is amazing, especially the hash browns. Don't forget to try the tomatoes and grits on the side. Overall, a great value for your money.

While the gelato at this place is undeniably great, the service leaves much to be desired. A friend from out of town had a similar experience, where the day staff was cool but the night staff made them feel uncomfortable by whispering and laughing. Even the young manager failed to improve the situation, as he joined in on the unprofessional behavior. It's a shame to see such a decline in service at a place that had great service less than a year ago.

Overall, this spot offers great hiking, biking, and running opportunities with well-maintained paths and beautiful views. There are also shaded areas which are perfect for hiking in the heat. However, the main issue is the lack of adherence to the dogs on leash rule. In my experience, I encountered multiple dogs off leash and away from their owners, which can be concerning. It's important for visitors to follow the rules to ensure that this remains a dog-friendly spot in the future.

After passing by multiple times, I finally decided to give this place a try and I'm so glad I did. The crab cake appetizer was delicious with a hint of dill in the sauce. The chicken tenders were generous portions of solid, comforting food. The service was fine, albeit a bit slow due to limited staff. The prices were extremely reasonable for the quality of food. Overall, a lovely meal in a nice ambiance. Highly recommended.

This sushi restaurant consistently provides excellent service with friendly staff and amazing food. The quality of the fish is top-notch and the portion sizes are perfect for trying a variety of rolls. They offer frequent promotions which keep customers coming back. Hands down our favorite sushi spot in town!

My boyfriend and I tried Jesse's for the first time and overall had a positive experience. The crab stuffed mushrooms were a bit laughable in size but had good flavor. The French onion soup and Caesar salads were tasty and well-paced. Our steaks were cooked perfectly, although my filet could have used more sautéed mushrooms. Our server, Nikki, was attentive, knowledgeable, and had a great attitude. Despite a few small hiccups, we would definitely consider returning to Jesse's.
I had a great experience at this store. The staff is friendly, the selection is good, and the prices are fair. Would definitely recommend checking it out.

Despite the nice ambiance and good service, I would never return to The Praline Connection in New Orleans. The BBQ Oysters, garlic bread, and chicken wings were all disappointing in taste, temperature, and quality. I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I will never return to this McDonald's location. The food is consistently cold or incorrect, the service is slow and the majority of employees do not speak English. I do not recommend this restaurant unless you have time to spare and can speak Spanish.

Great breakfast spot within walking distance of our hotel. The crepes with fruit were delicious and definitely worth getting again. The tea was a bit questionable with a hint of fennel seed, but overall a solid dining experience.

Had a great experience at Holy Mole! Attended a Yelp Elite event and was impressed by the diverse and delicious dishes. The special cocktail was a standout. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Can't wait to come back for a full meal!

I would not recommend Dinardo's for a dining experience. The restaurant had a run-down appearance and the food quality did not match the high prices. The service was lacking and the overall atmosphere left much to be desired. There are much better seafood options in Philadelphia to choose from.

Starbucks is a guilty pleasure that I only allow myself once a week, but crave everyday. This particular location has friendly baristas, quick service, and delicious drinks like Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate. Their breakfast pastries and sandwiches are tasty, with the Cranberry-Orange Scone being a standout. The drive thru line can be long, so I prefer to go inside to place my order. A great spot for coffee lovers!

My wife and I absolutely loved this diner. The decor was charming, the food was delicious, and the service was top-notch. The cheese steak was especially outstanding - better than Geno's. Our server was fantastic.

Don't judge a book by its cover definitely applies here. JB Dawson's exceeded expectations with its welcoming atmosphere, attentive staff, and delicious food. The twisted shrimp app was a standout, surpassing similar dishes at other restaurants. The Four Cheese Mac & Cheese and fish tacos were excellent choices, and the asparagus was cooked perfectly. The only downside was the limited craft beer menu, but our server Kyle went above and beyond to ensure we were happy with our drink choices. Overall, a great experience and we will definitely be back.

Stopped at this hidden gem for a quick lunch and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. The Greek salad was the best I've ever had, with fresh ingredients and perfect seasoning. The vegetarian plate was delicious and filling, with a variety of flavors that exceeded my expectations. Definitely recommend for a tasty and affordable meal off the beaten path.

This local pho shop has a loyal clientele for a reason - with great food, fresh ingredients, and a very nice staff. Highly recommended for a visit, especially for those who appreciate quality and authenticity.
I absolutely loved the food and ambiance at this place. The carne asada tacos are just like homemade, and brought me back to my roots. Highly recommend it!

While the beer selection at this place is top-notch, the complacent and unfriendly bar staff make it a disappointing experience time after time. We decided to take our money elsewhere for dinner. We recommend checking out Brickside Grill a few miles away for great beer, excellent food, and consistently friendly staff.

My friend and I stumbled upon this place on a Monday afternoon. It's a decent spot for drinks and Mexican food, but nothing exceptional. The atmosphere is very college-like, even during the day. Good for a casual meal, but don't expect anything fancy.

Delicious Designs and Leigh Anne exceeded all expectations with a last-minute wedding cake order. The simple two-tier lemon cake was exactly what I wanted, and the chocolate vegan cupcakes for my daughter were a thoughtful touch. The cake was not only beautiful but delicious as well. I highly recommend using Delicious Designs for any bakery needs in Reno.

I have been going to Grant Nails (formerly Tropical Nails) for years, but recently had a disappointing experience. After my go-to technician, Amy, left, I tried the owner Angela for my nails. Unfortunately, the gel polish she convinced me to get started chipping within a day both times she did them. I called to complain, but the issue was not resolved. Now my nails look like a mess and I don't trust them to fix it. Sadly, I will have to find a new nail salon. Very upsetting and disappointing.
Terrible dining experience at Sake House, waited over 2 hours and still received bad service. Would not recommend.

The only good part about this place is their cool stage setup. Great lights, good sound system, and a big dance floor. However, the food service is terrible. Despite being told the kitchen was closing in 10 minutes, the staff seated and served customers who arrived after me while refusing to take my order for some fries. Very disappointing experience.

Jenna Moore is a hair miracle worker! After struggling to achieve my desired A-line bob for over a year, Jenna finally made it happen. She listened to my needs, communicated her plan clearly, and delivered amazing results. I know my hair journey is a work in progress, but I trust Jenna to help me reach my hair goals. Highly recommended!

Overall, the food at this restaurant was fast and fresh, with excellent carne and guacamole. However, the lack of customizable toppings for tacos and thick tortilla chips were drawbacks. The dulche de leche soft serve ice cream was delicious, but seating was limited and table clean ups could be more timely and thorough.

CURED nail salon in Nashville is a hidden gem with impeccable style reminiscent of a French Restoration Hardware magazine. The upscale polish options, including Chanel, and brand new sterilized tools set it apart. The service was prompt and the extended massage was a bonus. The overall atmosphere is classic and comfortable, perfect for a bridal party or a relaxing visit with friends. The prices are competitive and the location is convenient. A must-visit nail salon in Nashville. Welcome to the neighborhood!

This place has been a go-to for me for years, even after moving to Colorado. The menu offers many great options at low prices and generous portions. The Indian Mee Goreng is my favorite and I could eat it every day. Hopefully one day I can get the recipe and enjoy it in CO.

While the service was good, I was not impressed with the pizza I ordered. I had high expectations based on other pizza places I love, but unfortunately, it did not meet them. I have no intention of returning.

I stayed at this hotel for a week post-Christmas and was disappointed by the lack of insulation in the connecting doors. Strangers' conversations, coughs, and other noises made it difficult to sleep most nights. The staff was excellent, but Starwood should address this issue with better insulation materials. Overall, a noisy and disruptive experience.

The sandwich I got here was disappointing. The jalapeño cheese bread was tasteless and dry, likely old. The tomatoes and cucumbers were mushy from being overripe. However, the staff was friendly. Overall, not a great experience.
This movie theater/bar/restaurant is a gem. The drinks are top-notch, the service is friendly, and the food is delicious. Highly recommend checking it out!

The iced mocha and iced white chocolate mocha were both disappointing with no coffee or chocolate flavor and very watered down. Even with an extra shot added, they still lacked flavor and ended up being thrown away. Not worth drinking at all.

This store used to be top-notch with great prices, a wide variety of products, and helpful staff. I had positive experiences returning faulty or unnecessary items for a refund without any issues. However, it seems like the quality has declined slightly in recent years, but it's still a decent place to shop.

The Crescent Park in New Orleans is a true hidden gem with stunning city views and a relaxing atmosphere. The 1.25-mile path offers art installations, a dog park, and a picturesque walk along the Mississippi River. Don't miss the chance to catch a beautiful sunset for the perfect end to your day in NOLA. Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking to explore the city in a unique way.

I contacted United Van Lines for a moving quote and never received a response after the initial virtual survey. Despite multiple follow-up attempts, including leaving a message on their answering machine, I never heard back. This lack of communication was incredibly unprofessional and left me feeling ignored. I would not recommend using their services based on my experience.
I highly recommend trying their specialty sushi menu, particularly the Snow Mountain and Volcano sushi. The prices are excellent for the quality of sushi you are getting.

This place is the best for gyros with amazing quality food. My go-to is the chicken gyro, but they have a variety of delicious options. Their burgers are great too. The steak fries are thick, perfectly seasoned, and always hot and fresh. The only downside is the baklava made with pistachios.
Surprisingly delicious Taiwanese food in Reno. Standout dishes include 三杯鸡, oyster omlet, and scallion pancake. Regret not being able to try more. Will miss this gem once I leave.

The food was delicious and authentic, the environment was clean and pleasant, and the service was top-notch. While the beer selection was not extensive, it was still a great overall experience and we look forward to coming back.

My fiancee and I had a fantastic lunch at this cozy wine lounge. The wine selection is varied and the snacks were delicious. The mozzarella with prosciutto bacon bits sandwich was a standout. Service was prompt and polite. The atmosphere is intimate and rustic with a low to medium noise level. Just be prepared for a slightly confusing bathroom door lock. Highly recommend for a lunch date!

Fellinis of Media is my top pick for dining out. With a diverse menu to suit any palate, accommodating staff, and a beautiful, relaxing atmosphere, it's the best spot for Italian cuisine. Highly recommended!

This place is a game changer for the neighborhood! The takeout we got was absolutely delicious, and I'm newly smitten by their southern Latin food. The family who owns it are very sweet. It's exactly what the neighborhood needed.

Avoid this nail salon at all costs. The place is dirty and disorganized, with yellowed newspapers and a dusty fake tree in the waiting area. The nail technician, Jenna, did a poor job on my nails, requiring two returns for repairs while being argumentative. Save yourself the trouble and money - there is no future for this place or in your future if you choose to go here. Located in Lehigh Acres.

The bar at this restaurant is fantastic, with delicious drinks and amazing hummus. However, the breakfast experience was a disappointment with long wait times, cold food, and a hair found in our meal. The manager did comp our check, but overall, I would recommend skipping breakfast here.

I really enjoy this theater for its cleanliness and friendly staff. However, it falls short in comparison to other theaters that offer updated seating, wait staff service, and other perks. While the pricing is similar, the lack of upgrades throughout the entire theater is disappointing. It's worth considering other options with more amenities for a similar price.

Overall, I would give this restaurant 4-5 stars based on my first visit. It is worth a try for Thai food fans. The shrimp spring rolls were exceptional, and the tom yum soup was flavorful, although I prefer different mushrooms. The Pad Thai and Drunken Noodles were delicious, with slightly smaller portions compared to other places in Reno. The owner was friendly and attentive, and I appreciated the information on their cooking classes. The bill came out to be reasonable, especially with a deal. I plan on returning in the future.

Kingsway mall offers a variety of shops like lululemon, Jacob, Danier, and more without the crowds of other malls. The food options are great with New York Fries, Orange Julius, and other choices. The food court has plenty of seating and the mall also has Zellers, a dollar store, and Sears. It's a great spot for shopping and dining, but could benefit from a Bay and a movie theatre. Overall, Kingsway is a convenient and enjoyable shopping destination.

While the rice at Indias Kitchen was good, the goat curry was disappointing with heavy salt and tomato in the sauce and tough meat. Naan bread was also below average. Stick to Spice and Grill for better Indian cuisine in St. Louis.

Overall, the food at this restaurant was worth the slightly higher price. The service, once you get your menu, is good and the food comes out quickly. The crab cake and chopped salad were both delicious. However, sitting in the bar area and dealing with small tables can be a drawback. Be mindful of potential issues with overcharging on your card.

As a self-professed sushi snob, I was incredibly disappointed with my experience at this restaurant. The sushi was warm, which is unforgivable in my book. Additionally, the $3 side salad consisted of nothing but plain iceberg lettuce. Needless to say, I will not be returning. This establishment is a check and mate in my sushi snob book.

My partner and I shared the vegetarian platter and were very satisfied. The food was delicious, the staff was exceptionally kind and attentive. They were helpful in guiding our ordering decisions and we did not feel taken advantage of. We will definitely be returning.

The hotel had a great atmosphere and looked classy, but the staff was not up to par. My friend booked a suite for a bachelorette party, but they gave us two separate rooms instead. We had to beg for them to be next door to each other. They tried to make up for it by offering free valet, but the next day her car was keyed. Overall, a disappointing and unprofessional experience.
I highly recommend this place for delicious and accommodating experience. The staff is very friendly and the tamales are delicious. Great service and highly recommended.

Based on our recent experience, I would not recommend this restaurant. The service was slow with our food taking 50 minutes to arrive, which was just average in quality. The atmosphere was marred by loud, offensive behavior at the bar that made us feel uncomfortable. Overall, poor management and lackluster food quality makes me doubt the longevity of this establishment.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience at this restaurant and will definitely be back. The vegetarian options were a plus and the food was delicious, especially the duck and rice vermicelli soup. The beef pho wasn't to my liking due to the meat quality, but I will try a different option next time. The serving sizes were generous and the service was quick and attentive. The decor was a bit dated but the cleanliness of the restaurant made up for it. A great dining option for a tasty meal.

Chickie's and Pete's is a lively sports bar with plenty of seating and a great atmosphere for watching games. The sound booth in the sky adds to the experience, with themed music for Eagles fans. However, the famous crab fries fell short with congealed cheese and not piping hot fries. Despite this, the towers of beer and energetic crowd make it a fun spot to catch a game. 3.5 stars.

Pancake Pantry in Nashville is a must-visit for both its delicious pancakes and the chance to potentially rub elbows with country stars. Despite the long lines, the overall experience is worth it for a tasty breakfast and lively conversations. It's definitely a top thing to do in Nashville.

I have been a loyal customer of Magasin Cafe for years, but have been going to Magasin Kitchen since Cafe closed for renovations. The food and service at Kitchen were good, with even the pho being better seasoned. However, the higher prices and less appealing atmosphere affect the ranking. Despite this, I will continue to be a loyal customer due to the quality food and service.

This restaurant is a must-visit for me whenever I can. The cumin style lamb is a personal favorite, but all of their dishes are delicious. The rabbit appetizer is a standout. While some may debate its authenticity, I find the food here to be well worth it. Highly recommend trying it out.

The Kmart experience is underwhelming with harsh lighting and limited selections. Mainstream movies are overpriced and the attempt at creating a cool shopping atmosphere falls short. However, you can find patio furniture at great prices during clearance days. The pharmacy services are efficient and convenient. Overall, Kmart may not be the go-to store anymore, but it still has its perks.

The Tuck Special at this Nashville spot is worth a special trip from out of state. The combination of brisket, egg, and pimento cheese is surprisingly delicious. My husband wasn't a fan of the BBQ sauce, but the meat was tasty. Expect crowds, but with some patience and menu planning, it's worth the wait.

The restaurant smelled unpleasant and I was disappointed with the service. My daughter and I got our meals to go, but they were placed in the same box, causing a mix-up with our orders. The spicy tuna roll I ordered was mediocre, but my daughter enjoyed her meal. Overall, we will not be returning to this sushi restaurant.

Overall, I love the food at this restaurant. The portions are generous and the menu is constantly changing, keeping things interesting. However, the cramped seating and loud environment make it difficult to enjoy a conversation. Additionally, the coffee doesn't quite match up to Sabrina's. But the latkas and bacon are absolute standouts and worth coming back for.

Yellow Subs in Reno is a must-get for anyone who loves subs and good food. The sprouts on the sub are a game changer and the atmosphere is welcoming and down to earth. The service is fast and the staff are always friendly. The seating layout encourages conversation and the tank tops and t-shirts are a nice touch. I will definitely be returning in the future. 5 stars all around.

I had a pleasant dining experience at this restaurant. Tina, our waitress, was friendly and the food was pretty good for my first time trying it. The only downside was the initial long wait, but overall I enjoyed my meal and would consider dining here again. 3.5 stars.

Love this new local spot! Great ambiance, delicious food, and fantastic drinks. The salsa is to die for and the salads are huge. Perfect spot to hang out with friends, especially on the outdoor patio with a margarita in hand. Highly recommend!

Overall, the service was great but the food was just okay. The soups were not served warm enough and my steak was overcooked, despite requesting it medium. The excellent service made up for these shortcomings.

Overall, I was slightly disappointed with my experience at Nippon Tei despite its positive reviews. The free edamame was a nice touch, but the mango sake drink was not worth the price. The sushi rolls were tasty, but I have had better and found that they were falling apart. The prices were average, but I already have other favorite sushi spots. I may give it another chance in the future.

The screening of Star Wars Rogue One in 3D at this theater was disappointing due to the extreme darkness of the screen. Despite complaints from multiple viewers, the manager refused to acknowledge the issue or attempt to rectify it. This was a disappointing experience and I won't be returning for 3D screenings at this location.

The restaurant had average food served warm, not hot, at overpriced prices. The servers seemed rushed and had trouble pronouncing dishes. Overall, the ambiance did not match the menu prices. The food was mediocre, and the service was lacking. Not worth the high prices.

While the interior layout of the restaurant may be interesting, the overpriced and underwhelming food ultimately left us disappointed. The Sunday brunch menu did not offer good value, with the only decent option being the chicken strips and fries. The seasonal salad was comically small and lacking in lettuce, despite the high price. The chicken was good but not exceptional, comparable to Raising Canes. The service was slow, even with a small crowd. Overall, we wish we had heeded other reviews and chosen a different dining option.

I am not a vegetarian or health-food enthusiast, but this place has won me over. A co-worker introduced me to it and I am hooked. The salads are delicious and the atmosphere is welcoming. Highly recommend.

Absolutely terrible experience at Regis Hair salon. Angie gave me the worst haircut I've ever had, despite showing her photos of the cut I wanted. Ended up with a complete disaster of a haircut that looked nothing like what I asked for. Would not recommend this salon to anyone. Thank you, Angie, for the terrible experience.

This restaurant is the perfect spot for a romantic date night. The sweet potato nachos and "breakfast" dish were absolutely delicious. Everything we tried was top-notch and I can't wait to visit again soon. Highly recommend!

We had a great dinner at Convivio, despite some minor service issues and wine out of stock due to it being a new restaurant. The owner was incredibly kind and the food was excellent, especially the tortelloni pansotti which was the best pasta I've ever had. We will definitely be returning customers.

Crabby Bill's was a convenient choice for a quick seafood snack in Clearwater Beach. The $25 bucket of steamed seafood was decent, but not the best in terms of freshness. It served its purpose as a satisfying snack before a reservation at Bern's Steak House later in the evening. Decent option for a quick bite in the area.

State Street Kitchen's Grilled Chicken, Spinach, Swiss and Honey Mustard Sub with Jalapeno Chips was a deliciously creative and satisfying meal, perfect for a blustery autumn afternoon. The establishment, thanks to the ever-present Micha and her friendly staff, consistently delivers top-notch dishes with a Korean flare. Make sure to visit and experience the welcoming atmosphere and home-cooked flavors - you won't be disappointed.

This place is amazing! The food is delicious, the staff is friendly, and they have rotating specials that are all homemade. The chicken salad is a must-try for making sandwiches at home. What else could you possibly want?

The service at this place was disappointing. The employee who took my order was rude and unprofessional, making me feel unwelcome as a potential customer. Despite the good food, the poor service experience overshadowed it. I will not be returning due to the lack of hospitality and respect shown by the staff member named Neisha.
The staff at this establishment are consistently pleasant and efficient. Appointments are quick and wait times are minimal, making for a smooth and enjoyable experience.

While the cocktails and atmosphere were enjoyable, we were extremely disappointed with the food at this restaurant. The Brussel sprouts and fries were overwhelmingly salty, even after sending them back. The burger and flank steak were just okay, nothing to rave about. It seems the cook may have been heavy-handed with the salt on the night we dined. Overall, we won't be returning.

I absolutely love going to Phillies games at this stadium. The open feel of the stadium and variety of food options make for a great experience. Even when it's sold out, it never feels cramped. The facilities are always clean and the seats are decent, except when sitting below the scoreboard. Can't wait for baseball season to start again! Go Phillies!

My boyfriend and I stopped by for lunch and had mixed experiences. The beans, chips and salsa, and guacamole were delicious, but portions were small. The salsa was fresh and flavored with cilantro, while the guacamole was chunky and made to order. Unfortunately, chips and salsa are not included with your purchase. My boyfriend did not enjoy his steak tacos, finding the meat to be of low quality and lacking in flavor. He's willing to give it another try, but I found the meal to be enjoyable overall.

Plaza Deli in La Cumbre Plaza is a must-visit for delicious sandwiches made with fresh ingredients and amazing bread rolls. As a Santa Barbara local, I have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. The soda selection is also great. While they may not have fancy or exotic options, Plaza Deli is the perfect spot for a satisfying meal. Highly recommend stopping by for a bite!

The Nordstrom's shoe department exceeded my expectations with a wide variety of high-end options and excellent customer service. Sales professional Erwin went above and beyond to locate and price match shoes from other locations, offering free shipping. Nordstrom's has gained my loyalty due to their exceptional service.

The small aquarium in Tarpon Springs is geared towards kids with attractions like a shark feeding show and petting stingrays. It may not be the top choice for adults but is enjoyable for young children. Overall, it's an okay experience.

If you're looking for simple Chinese takeout, this is the best place to go. The food isn't anything extraordinary, but it's less greasy than other places and the staff are very friendly. Great for a quick and satisfying meal.

I had a wonderful experience at this quaint restaurant. The Shrimp Po Boy was delicious, and the fries and cole slaw were the perfect complements. The ambience, food, and service were all top-notch. Can't wait to visit again!

Broussard's was a nice experience overall with delicious food and a beautiful courtyard. The vintage appeal of the foyer is charming, but the dining room could use an upgrade. The service was attentive and the meal was enjoyable, but the ambiance left something to be desired. I would recommend going for a special occasion or to experience the classic New Orleans vibe, but it may not be a regular dining spot for everyone. 3 stars.

Excellent service, great atmosphere, and fantastic raw bar make this restaurant worth a visit. The Alaskan crab legs are a must-try, although other entrees can be pricey. Stick to drinks, appetizers, and burgers for a satisfying experience. Overall, a solid choice for a casual fine dining meal.
Doan's is a fantastic spot where you can count on consistent and delicious food every time. The staff is friendly and efficient, making it perfect for a quick lunch. Highly recommend!

This brick oven pizza joint continues to impress with each visit. The Rotolo, a dough wrapped mortadella and ricotta cheese topped with pistachios, is a must-try at $5. The prosciutto pizza is incredibly tasty and the dough is divine. Great service and good beer selection make this one of the best pizza places in Philly.

This pizza is a game-changer. It's exactly what I've been searching for since moving to Indianapolis. The thick, chewy, cheesy, greasy slices are a pizza lover's dream come true. I felt like Oprah Winfrey giving away cars after my first bite. This is my new go-to pizza spot.
Extremely slow service at this Chinatown tea shop. Waited nearly half an hour for three teas with no other customers in sight. Not worth the wait for any tea.

I grew up eating beef sandwiches in Chicago and this place makes the best beef I've ever had outside of the city. My only suggestions would be to offer a larger sandwich size, add sweet peppers, serve fries, keep the main location open year-round, and extend hours of operation.

Buff Nail Salon provided exceptional service for our Mothers Day celebration. They went above and beyond to accommodate our group of 4 for pedicures, adding an extra pedicurist to the schedule. The modern decor and clean atmosphere created a relaxing environment, and the complimentary mimosas, wine, and champagne were a nice touch. The staff was friendly and professional, and my polish lasted without chipping. The only downside was street parking, but overall, I highly recommend Buff Nail Salon and will be returning.

Pho 51 in Philly is a must-try for pho lovers! The broth is delicious and I found the portion size to be quite filling. I ordered the No. 51 (small) and was very satisfied. Will definitely be returning next time I'm in town.

This place is a unique blend of café and bar, offering a wide range of coffees, teas, breakfast items, as well as bar snacks, salads, and sandwiches. The variety of beers served on tap, bottled, or in cans is also impressive. The casual atmosphere and pet-friendly policy make it a great spot to hang out with friends for hours. It's reminiscent of college days and perfect for a relaxed Sunday Funday.

While the process of upgrading our rental car at Avis Rent A Car was smooth and the staff were professional, the overall cost ended up being quite high at $800 for five days. Despite being happy with the car itself, the revelation that a weekly rate would have been cheaper, along with the high cost of the upgrade, left me feeling disappointed. In the future, I will look into renting from other companies such as Hertz or Dollar and rethink the need for additional insurance.

I recently purchased a used car from this dealership and had a fantastic experience. The customer service was top-notch and I am thrilled with my new vehicle. I highly recommend this place to anyone in the market for a reliable used car. Ask for Andy - he was extremely helpful and knowledgeable.

Jungle Prada Tavern was a pleasant surprise for me after moving to the area. The bartender made a great beer recommendation and the seafood options impressed me thoroughly. The scallops prosciutto, del mar pizza, and crab stuffed portabella were all delicious. The roasted portabella app was also a tasty vegetarian option. I have returned multiple times just for the food and drinks, and even brought my seafood-loving sister who also enjoyed it. Give this place a chance, you won't be disappointed with the options!
This bead store in Nashville is a gem with a huge selection of seed beads and glass strands. Perfect for any beading project and a favorite spot for bead enthusiasts.

I visited this restaurant on opening day and had a fantastic experience. The atmosphere was great, the staff was lovely, and the food was amazing. The green tea (PHO PHREE) was refreshing, the summer rolls with spicy peanut sauce were delicious, and the pho was phenomenal. I will definitely be making this my regular dining spot as I explore Fairmount. Highly recommend!

Don't be fooled by the retro exterior, this small-town diner offers delicious, homey family cooking that will transport you back in time. While it may not be the best food you've ever had, it's perfect for those craving grandma's comfort food. The fluffy pancakes and thick bacon are a must-try for breakfast lovers. With reasonable prices and friendly service, this place is a great spot for a tasty home-cooked meal.

After multiple recommendations from friends, we decided to try this place out. However, we were disappointed to find out that they were only serving a partial menu an hour before closing, which was not clearly stated on the website. The server struggled to understand simple modifications to my order and the overall service was lacking. The food was overpriced for the quality we received. Unless there is a specific reason to return, we will not be going back.

This restaurant never fails to impress with delicious and unique dishes. The butternut squash and goat cheese Rangoons and mushroom yakisoba were both amazing, with great flavor and a satisfying meaty feel despite being meatless. The coconut curry ramen was heavenly. The only downside was the lack of seating while waiting, but the quick service meant we made it to our show on time with full and happy bellies. Highly recommend!

The beer selection at this location is good but not outstanding, especially for someone with friends who brew professionally. The location is industrial and lacks atmosphere, but they do discount beer when a train passes by. There is a loyal following at the establishment, earning it a 3.5 star rating.

Overall, my experience at this salon was a mixed one. The first visit for a "Mini Manicure" was fantastic - great service, friendly staff, and long-lasting results. However, my second visit for a gel manicure in French style left much to be desired. The technician did not have the proper tools, resulting in uneven lines, inconsistent thickness, and poor shaping. The appointment took much longer than anticipated, causing me to be late for work. While I appreciated the effort of the technician, the end result was not up to par, especially considering the high price I paid. I am conflicted about returning to this salon in the future, as my previous experience was so positive. I am now faced with the decision of either living with unsatisfactory nails or paying to have them redone elsewhere before an early flight on Wednesday.

If you're looking for a hidden gem away from the typical tourist spots, this Marigny restaurant is worth the trip. While not perfect, the cheap and delicious food more than makes up for any imperfections. The all-day breakfast option is a bonus, with unique dishes like lox omelets under $10. The menu also includes vegetarian and vegan options, though the inclusion of cheese in these categories may need clarification. Standout dishes include the french fry poboy, mac 'n cheese sandwiches, and BBQ chicken legs. With every entree priced under $10 and $5 Bloody Mary's, it's hard to find a reason not to visit this affordable and tasty spot.
The sangria is awesome and the rotating craft beers are a nice touch. The pizza and calzones are delicious and keep me coming back for more.

This bar is primarily focused on alcohol and serves as a casino bar, meaning prices are higher than average. The drink selection is good and well-mixed, but the food menu is limited and made me ill. The service is lacking, with servers difficult to flag down for orders. Overall, there are better options in Reno to choose from.

The staff at this establishment was incredibly rude and unprofessional when I inquired about availability over the Thanksgiving holiday. They were short and essentially dismissed me before hanging up. I will be taking my business elsewhere due to this negative experience.

I visited this restaurant with a gift card and was pleasantly surprised by the delicious food. I had the sauteed stir-fry over spinach and my girlfriend enjoyed the abundant pile of nachos. The menu has a good variety of options and the day-time bartender was friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a friendly atmosphere with decent food in a sports bar setting. They also have sports playing on the TVs which adds to the overall experience.

My experience with this pizza place was terrible. The pizza arrived cold and soggy after a 2-hour wait, with no communication about the delay. Despite being promised a refund, I was still charged the next day. The service was rude and unprofessional. I strongly advise against ordering from here. I will not be ordering from here again and neither should you.

Incredible service, incredible food, and beautiful ambiance! The black bean ravioli and bone-in steak were both outstanding. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and at home. Highly recommended for a group or special night out.

Timeout Pub and Grill may have potential, but falls short in creating a unique and engaging atmosphere. The lack of authentic sports memorabilia and focus on music rather than live sports broadcasts detracts from the overall experience. The food and drink offerings are standard for a sports bar, but the lack of additional entertainment options may leave customers wanting more. The Happy Hour specials may be a draw for some, but overall, competing with established sports bars in the area may prove challenging.
The onion rings at this place are some of the best I've ever had. The Reuben was also very good. Would definitely recommend for anyone who enjoys onion rings.
This coffee shop in Boise is not only cute and friendly, but also has great coffee. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, making it a must-visit spot for coffee lovers. Highly recommend!

Despite the rave review from friends, our experience at this establishment was disappointing. Despite the sign saying open until 11pm, we were turned away when we arrived at 8pm. The awkwardness and lack of communication left a negative impression, and we may not return.
I highly recommend this place! The food is fresh and delicious, especially the papaya salad and curry. The service is great and they offer take-out options. A must-try for any food lover!

Music City Dental, specifically Dr. Spurlin and her staff, exceeded my expectations. They were gentle, attentive, and made sure I was comfortable throughout my appointment. Despite my fear of shots, I didn't even feel it when Dr. Spurlin administered mine. The option of a pillow, blanket, and entertainment choices further added to the pleasant experience. I am confident that I have found my permanent dentist with Music City Dental.

The food at this Chinese restaurant was good overall, with the shrimp spring rolls standing out as one of the best we have tried. However, the beef noodles were too salty and the fried rice was a bit oily. The chaotic seating arrangement, where the owner gave tables to people behind us despite our reminders, resulted in a lower rating of three stars. Overall, a decent dining experience marred by some issues.

Burger Up has a great community vibe with friendly staff and a welcoming atmosphere. The classic burger is delicious with unique, homemade ingredients. The bar offers a variety of drinks, including creative concoctions. Criticisms of being 'too hipster' seem unwarranted, and personal attacks on the owner are uncalled for. Overall, a great spot with a diverse and representative staff.

Even if you're not a fan of Indian food, this place is worth a try. Let Hassan choose a dish for you and make sure to try the chaat and lassi, they pair perfectly together. Don't overwhelm yourself with the menu options, trust the recommendations and you won't be disappointed.

Overall, Mr. B offers excellent food in a great location. The shrimp and grits and barbecued shrimp were outstanding, while the appetizers were good. However, the bread pudding was a bit dry. The service could have been more attentive, and the restaurant was uncomfortably cold. Consider bringing a jacket for your visit.

My husband and I had a fantastic experience on the Steamboat Natchez excursion in NOLA. The trip was both informative and enjoyable, and the staff were extremely well-organized and accommodating. Special thanks to JoJo for reserving us a fantastic window seat. Highly recommend this tour!

This bar in New Orleans has a potentially perfect business model, but is failing due to a lack of common ingredients and rude bartenders. It is almost comical to see how many items they are out of and how many customers they turn away. With multiple taps not working and limited drink options, it is a wasted opportunity for a potentially successful establishment.

Our experience at Mr. B's was mixed. The bar was busy but nice, and the BBQ shrimp was the standout dish. However, the service at our table was hit and miss, with long waits for drinks and ignored for over 45 minutes. The wood plank grilled fish was disappointing in portion size and value. The rabbit was good, but overall the inconsistent service ruined the experience.

This cute spot with adorable and casual interior offers a mix of Vietnamese and other cuisines, including delicious banh mi and boba tea. The staff is friendly, and the place is clean. The drink card for a free tenth drink and convenient hours make it a great spot to return to.
Disappointing experience at Walgreens, as they do not carry the new ELF Villain's collection. Will have to search other locations to find it. Disappointing.
I had the best Italian food at this small, elegant restaurant. The entrees were delicious, and the cheesecake was fantastic. The staff was incredibly friendly. I highly recommend it for a date night.

I love getting fish tacos at this place, they are amazing and only $2.60 each. My friend tried the beef taco and chicken fajitas and thought they were average, but agreed the fish tacos were the best. The interior and patio are great, and there's a Ben and Jerry's next door for dessert. Overall, a happy visit every time!

I had a great experience getting my dive watch battery replaced here. The service was prompt, friendly, and the fee was very reasonable. With plenty of staff on hand and a convenient location, I was in and out in less than 5 minutes. Highly recommend!

Stopped by last week after reading about it on Trip Advisor. The location was great, quiet, and peaceful under the shade of old trees. Surprisingly only one table open for a noon Thursday visit. Food came out quick, no waiting. My buffalo burger was one of the best I've ever had, while the tri-tip sandwich was dry and just meat on bread. Hubby was jealous of my burger. Worth checking out for a unique atmosphere and peaceful setting. Buffalo burger gets a definite 5++, tri-tip gets a 3 from me and a 4 from hubby.

The Mad Mex University City location is a convenient spot for Happy Hour with great deals on margaritas and wings. The food is average, but friends enjoyed their orders of burritos, guacamole, and enchiladas. The staff could use more training in chaos and crowd management, but overall a good spot if service improves.

I brought my boyfriend to Yuengling for a tour and beer sampling on a Saturday and we were pleasantly surprised by how close it was. It's important to check tour times on their website before going. Despite the insistence on closed toe shoes, many people were wearing flip flops. There is no production on Saturdays, so the brewery was quiet. The 40-minute tour was informative, starting with a video on the history of Yuengling. The guide was knowledgeable and took us through the brewery, lab, and tasting room. Free beer tasting included their Lager, Premium Lager, and Black and Tan. Unfortunately, they were out of Lord Chesterfield. Overall, a great experience that I plan to repeat with my parents.

Overall, my experience at this Marathon location was extremely disappointing. The server's frantic energy and rush to push us out of the restaurant made for a very uncomfortable dining experience. The food was also lackluster. I had much better service and food at their other location on 18th and Spruce. Not recommended.

We arrived for lunch at a non-busy time on a Friday, but service was incredibly slow. We had to repeatedly complain to receive our beverages and were informed 40 minutes later that a beer we ordered was no longer available. The food was good, but the lengthy wait and slow service overshadowed the experience.

Impromptu stop into this organic beer and burger joint was a pleasant surprise. The customizable burger options and rotating beer selection were highlights. Friendly staff and cozy ambiance. Vegetarian options available. Be sure to order sides like fries with your burger.

Overall, my experience at Earl's new American Kitchen was disappointing. Although the food was decent, the service was lacking both times I visited. The first visit was ok, but the bartender was not very attentive. The second visit, the bartender was rude, and I would never go back or recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Jake's offers delicious burgers with a wide variety of free toppings to choose from. The ambiance may not be impressive, but the food makes up for it. The burgers are juicy and flavorful, though the fries were a bit disappointing. Overall, worth a visit for the burgers, but the original location may provide a better experience.

Lame service at this shop on Broad Street. Despite servicing cars, employees refused to give me a jump when my car needed it. Not customer-oriented and unhelpful attitude. Disappointing experience overall.

The Pulled Pork Nachos were absolutely delicious! Instead of tortilla chips, they are served with crispy potato chips which complemented the flavorful pulled pork perfectly. They are the perfect sharing snack to enjoy with a cold beer or Bloody Mary. 10/10 would recommend.

Overall, this hotel is cute, conveniently located near the beach and wharf, and offers clean rooms with nice amenities such as a fireplace and wine and cheese at 5. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the price is reasonable. While there may be some noise from the nearby spa, it is not a major issue. The only downside is that the room can get a bit stuffy, but this can be easily remedied by opening the windows. Would consider staying here again.

I highly recommend Mirna's for delicious and generously portioned pasta dishes at a great value. The free hummus and pita appetizer is a nice touch. Just be sure to call ahead for reservations due to the small size of the restaurant.

Overall, although I prefer independent restaurants, I was not impressed with the overpriced center city Philadelphia restaurant. The space was larger than expected, but the prices were unexpectedly high compared to the online menu. The food and portions were average, but the dessert was unique. The service was a bit disorganized, with the bus help potentially rushing us out before we had finished our meal. The bathroom was also small for the size of the restaurant.

Platoon is an awesome gym with a great trainer in Steve C. The customized workouts helped me improve and stay motivated, leading me to increase my attendance to 3-5 days a week. Steve is a fantastic listener and motivator who sets realistic goals. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and I never had any issues with billing or scheduling. Highly recommend Platoon and Steve C as a trainer.

The food at this place was decent, with good Tater-Tots and a satisfactory burger. It was a quick lunch stop and the staff was helpful in providing directions to local attractions. Overall, nothing particularly special or memorable about the experience.

As a long-time customer, my recent experience has led me to downgrade my rating of this place. The cashier refused to apply a $5 off coupon for our party of three, including a senior, stating it couldn't be combined with a senior discount. This illogical policy reflects poorly on management, not the staff. Disappointing.

Our first visit to SuperGyro was a success! The Chicago dogs were delicious and the only place in a 28-mile radius where you can find them. The only things missing were a poppyseed bun and celery salt. The hot dogs were made with 100% beef and topped with neon green relish, sport peppers, onions, dill pickle, tomatoes, and onion. I'll definitely be back to try more menu items. Overall, a great experience and a welcome change from other fast food options like Sonic.
Wawa is my go-to convenience store for tasty sandwiches and all my snacking needs. While this particular location may not be as friendly as others, it still serves as a beacon in a cold, dark world.

My dad and I stumbled upon this bar on Bourbon Street and were pleasantly surprised by the delicious hand grenades. The $9 price tag with a souvenir cup was worth it as we were really feeling the effects by the end. The atmosphere was lively with a band playing and plenty of open air coming through. We had a lot of fun and enjoyed the nice weather while singing along with the band. Great spot close to Jackson Square for a good drink and good time.

I initially had a mediocre experience at this location due to a lack of friendliness from the staff, but my second visit completely turned my opinion around. The second woman who assisted me was extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and went above and beyond to ensure I had a positive experience. The store is clean and well-stocked with shipping supplies, and while the staff may not be chatty, they provide exceptional service. I will definitely be returning for all my shipping needs in the future. Highly recommended. 5 stars.

The chicken BBQ burritos were delicious and had all my favorite ingredients. The restaurant is a great place to sit down with family for a meal. I wish they had a designated area for kids to play, that would make the dining experience even better.

This cafe is perfect for a quick stop for Chai and coffee. Fast service, delicious Chai, and plenty of coffee options for purchase. A great spot for caffeine lovers on the go. Don't forget to stock up on coffee beans for home! Life wouldn't be the same without Starbucks.

Overall, this young start up company shows promise despite some impatience from customers in the gun community. The owner, Jacob, seems to be a stand up guy who delivers on his promises. The Cerakoted billet lower I purchased at a gun show in Las Vegas had quality machining and finish. Communication with the owner via email was efficient and informative. Patience is key when dealing with this company.

I was very impressed with the menu and food at this place. The fruit bruschetta was a yummy and creative choice, and the Popeye skillet and Roadhouse sandwich were delicious. A couple of areas for improvement are the temperature (it was freezing inside) and the lack of ambiance. Some background music and better lighting could easily enhance the dining experience. Customer service was good but slightly disconnected, likely due to the holiday weekend. Overall, a keeper and I will definitely be back!

I had a fantastic experience getting a fill and gel pedicure at this nail salon. Despite it being close to closing time, the staff took their time and accommodated all of my specific requests. The environment was clean, the staff was friendly, and the hand and foot massages were heavenly. I will definitely be returning in the future. Highly recommended!

I had a fantastic dining experience at this restaurant. The cashier was incredibly friendly and the Devil's Delight burger was delicious. The burger was cooked perfectly and the combination of flavors was amazing. The truffle fries were also excellent. The quality and service were top-notch, although the prices were a bit high. Overall, it was well worth the cost and I will definitely be coming back.

This restaurant is a hidden gem for those looking for healthy dining options. The Be My Bison burger was worth the two mile round trip and exceeded expectations. The convenience of online ordering and quick service made the experience even better. A dream come true for health-conscious diners. Highly recommended!

Overall, my experience at this restaurant was awful. The lack of acknowledgment and poor service during my first visit left me feeling cold and wet while waiting to be seated. The bartender was too preoccupied to assist, and the lack of attention ultimately led to us leaving without even being seated. On the second visit, the service did not improve as the waiter seemed disinterested in our table. The limited menu options did not impress, and the overpriced, mediocre food left much to be desired. I would not recommend this place to anyone, but their take out may be suitable for pets.

Service at the restaurant was good, and the mesquite wings were very tasty. It's best to save some to share or for later, instead of being greedy like me. However, the weak lemonade was a downside - it was the weakest I've ever had.

Taqueria Guerrero is a hidden gem in our neighborhood, serving up the best Mexican food in New Orleans. The menu offers a variety of delicious options, from al pastor tacos to spicy shrimp dishes. Parking was easy to find near the restaurant, making it a convenient choice for dine-in or takeout. Highly recommended for anyone craving authentic and flavorful Mexican cuisine.

While the food at this restaurant was tasty, the overall experience was marred by subpar service and cleanliness issues. The table was sticky and had a dirty fork on it, indicating a lack of attention to detail. The food took a while to come out, and a mix-up resulted in confusion among the large party. Despite these drawbacks, the pork belly tacos and spicy beef pho were highlights with great flavors. However, the wait for the check was long and inconvenient. In conclusion, visit for the food rather than the service.

The second visit to this key-making shop was definitely successful. The staff was helpful and efficient, providing quick and cost-effective service. They were able to duplicate odd-shaped keys that big box stores had previously struggled with. Overall, a pleasant experience.

This place delivers shoddy work with bad attitudes. Their services are mediocre for toes and poor for fingers. Any suggestions or corrections are met with hostility and gossip in another language. Avoid at all costs.

I had a terrible experience at this salon, despite being offered a free service by the owner to make up for a previous bad experience. I specifically asked for "white blonde" hair with no orange tones, but ended up with damaged, brassy, and orange hair. The owner rushed through the process, charged excessive amounts for products, and failed to listen to my preferences. Other clients also left unhappy, and the salon seems more concerned with silencing negative reviews than providing quality service. I will not be returning and strongly advise others to avoid this salon.

The Riviera Mansion was the perfect choice for our destination wedding. The venue is stunning and the pricing was very straightforward, making it easy to manage costs. The layout was perfect for our multigenerational guests, with ample space for everyone to enjoy. Breanna and Eli were amazing to work with, paying attention to every detail and ensuring everything ran smoothly. The bartending service was top-notch, with a custom signature drink that all our guests loved. Overall, a five-star experience that we were thrilled to have for our special day.

Dave at this late night food cart in Santa Barbara was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The dogs were made quickly and were mouthwateringly delicious. The Dave's special, pizza dog, and custom creation were all top-notch, and the grilled jalapeños were a nice touch. More late night food carts like this are needed in Santa Barbara.
My first experience at Wolfgang was disappointing. The restaurant was crowded, the floors were dirty, and the service was poor. The only redeeming aspect was the excellent crisp Chardonnay.

This Wawa store goes above and beyond in terms of pricing and convenience. With gas prices dropping significantly when they opened, it's clear they prioritize customer savings. The automatic start/stop digital air pump is a major plus, offering precise tire pressure every time. Service is friendly and efficient, with a layout designed for speed during peak periods. Overall, a standout Wawa location worth a visit.

Overall, the restaurant offered mediocre food with very slow service. Our dishes came out one by one, with a significant wait time between each one. The servers were rude and it took a long time to receive our bills, which were filled with mistakes. This was a very bad overall dining experience.

The seafood restaurant by the ocean has a mixed review. The clam chowder was excellent, but the cioppino lacked flavor and variety of seafood. The crab salad sandwich was disappointing with overpowering mayo and little crab flavor. Seating outside by the ocean is recommended for a better experience. Service is good but expect a wait for a table. The menu is hit and miss, so be selective in your order. Overall, worth a visit but manage your expectations.
Our family had a great time at this place! The staff was welcoming and attentive, making for a fun and enjoyable afternoon activity.

Chef Kevin Sbraga's lavender honey fried chicken at Juniper Commons is a must-try. The chicken is perfectly brined, coated in seasoned flour, and fried to crispy perfection. The sweet honey glaze adds a delicious twist to this classic dish. Accompanied by a buttermilk biscuit and red bliss potato salad, this meal is a standout. Every dish at Juniper Commons, from the appetizers to the dessert, is outstanding and Chef Sbraga's expertise in fried chicken is evident. Highly recommend trying this dish.

Unfortunately, my experience at Casselli's was disappointing. The waiter was unpleasant, the food was hit or miss, and the ambiance was ruined by an overly loud opera singer. While the parking was convenient, the cash-only policy and overall experience make it unlikely that I will return.

I would not recommend this dealership. The salesman was friendly initially, but once negotiations began, we were left dealing with a manager who was not truthful and seemed uncomfortable dealing with informed customers. If not for needing a specific color immediately, we would have gone to another dealership. Be prepared with research and pricing information if you choose to buy here. Consider other options if possible.

Conveniently located an hour away from Orlando, this casino offers a typical casino atmosphere with the exception of pricey food at the Hard Rock Cafe. Had a fun experience playing the Breakfast at Tiffany's slot machine, perfect for fans of the movie.

Merrigans is a reliable and honest mom and pop shop in Tucson that specializes in fixing older RVs at a fair price. While they may not always be prompt in answering calls, their quality repairs and extensive knowledge make it worth the wait. They have a variety of parts for vintage RVs and offer a free 24 hr. dump station with water. Definitely the go-to place for RV repairs without getting ripped off.
Lisa's talent shines through on TV. She is truly the best at what she does. Highly recommend watching her in action.

Great spot for brunch with a comfortable and cute design. The staff is extremely friendly and the cocktails are delicious. Happy to have a lesbian bar in the neighborhood, will definitely be returning with my mom for Mothers' Day. So glad this place exists!

I will not be returning to this location due to a poorly made pizza and lack of follow-up from the manager. Despite contacting them and providing a photo as proof of the issue, I never received a response or resolution. Disappointing customer service.

Amazing food and great experience every time. Staff is knowledgeable and helpful, wine selection is good, and the cheese platter is delicious. Highly recommend going with a group of about 6 people to make it more affordable. Outdoor seating with live music adds to the ambiance. Must try the bacon wrapped dates and goat cheese and mushroom dish. Overall, a fun and enjoyable experience. Highly recommended!

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at this establishment while seeing my son's band Last Frontier perform. The staff was exceptional and the food, particularly the pork belly and fish nachos, was outstanding. The whisky selection was impressive and the sound system for the band was top-notch. Overall, a fantastic evening.

I have always had a positive experience at this paint store. The staff is friendly and helpful, and they carry everything you need to complete your painting project. They keep your paint information on file for easy reordering. Look out for sales, such as 30% off, to save on quality paint like the interior Super Paint. Highly recommend this store for all your painting needs.

Had a fantastic dining experience with delicious food and top-notch service. The outdoor deck provided a beautiful setting, and we were lucky to see dolphins. Will definitely be returning in the future.

Whole Foods in Reno presents a mix of irony and luxury, positioning itself as a 'value' food store despite other options like Trader Joe's offering better value. The store impresses with pretty food, lovely displays, and a feeling of smugness. While it may not be the most budget-friendly option for regular shopping, it's a great spot for lunch or a special treat. The convenient location near the freeway makes it a convenient stop for travelers.
This restaurant consistently provides excellent service and delicious food. We are regular customers and highly recommend it. Stellar experience every time!

The Chopped Italian salad from Fresh was disappointing, lacking in flavor and variety of ingredients. A few more Italian-inspired additions would have elevated the dish. Consider trying a panini next time for a more satisfying meal.

Tyson provides exceptional service with quick turnaround times and reliable follow-through on promises. I brought my RV with a ford front end to him and he had it repaired ahead of schedule. The parts were ordered and the team was able to complete the bumper replacement in just 3 days. I highly recommend Tyson for any vehicle repairs, as he and his team provide top-notch service. As a business owner, I trust Tyson with all of my vehicles and would not go anywhere else. Manny and Tyson make a great team!

My experience at Johnny Rockets in the casino was pretty hectic during lunch, but our server Lyndel was awesome and attentive to our every request. The food was delicious, and I left feeling very full.

This place is a hidden gem. The food is exceptional, the service is top-notch, and the atmosphere is cool. The staff is very nice and generous. I find myself coming back almost every weekend just for their amazing Cuban espresso. Highly recommend!

Great pizza spot in Hatboro! The owner Pete is always around and super friendly. Their California, Meatlovers, and Veggie pizzas are top notch. Unfortunately, they are currently closed due to a fire in the neighboring laundry mat, but I can't wait for them to reopen. The lunch special of 2 slices and a soda for $3.99 is a steal. Best local pizza joint in the area.
The buffalo chicken cheese dip at this establishment is amazing. The wait staff is friendly and the prices are reasonable. Highly recommend!

The pizza was delicious and the customer service was outstanding. Despite a minor mix-up with the online order, the employee went above and beyond by personally delivering a free pizza and brownies as an apology. Will definitely be ordering from this delivery joint again.

Celebrated my 21st birthday at this restaurant with family. Food and drinks were delicious but overpriced. Lobster mac and cheese was a standout. Complimentary desserts were a nice touch. Overall, great experience but not worth the cost.

I highly recommend this place for drinks and food. The ambience is versatile, catering to both a fun date night or a casual hangout with friends for sports. The open kitchen adds to the experience. The beer selection is excellent and the rosemary fries are a must-try. My fiancée loved the house burger. We will definitely be returning.

I would give this place a solid 3 stars. The beer was underwhelming and lacked flavor, but the food was delicious and well portioned for lunch. Overall, a good spot for a meal, but don't expect much from the brewhouse side of things.

This newly opened boutique taqueria near Rivers Edge Apartments offers a diverse and flavorful menu created by a James Beard nominated chef. The indoor and outdoor settings, along with a bar, provide a welcoming atmosphere. The fresh, local ingredients used in each taco, including options for vegetarians and meat eaters, make for a truly enjoyable dining experience. The mushroom and short rib tacos are personal favorites, but every option is worth trying. A great spot for a delicious lunch or dinner, I will definitely be returning soon.

Capofitto is a hidden gem near Franklin Fountain with no line and better-priced desserts. The gelato, especially the chocolat scurio and pera combo, was amazing. Can't wait to come back for the pizza. Highly recommend.

A.I. DuPont Hospital is the best choice for families on the East Coast. They offer easy access to multiple MDs in a day, top-notch care, and excellent accommodations for caregivers. The renovated wing and friendly staff make for a positive experience. Highly recommended for families seeking exceptional care.

I highly recommend Vetri in Philly for the Chef's Tasting experience. The 9 courses were exquisite and truly delicious, paired perfectly with amazing wine. Don't miss out on this culinary gem in Philly!

This classic American diner has been serving delicious food made entirely from scratch for years. The fried chicken is some of the best I've ever had, and the bottomless coffee for $1.75 is a great deal. Polite and attentive service adds to the charm of this timeless establishment. Don't forget to save room for a slice of their delicious pie!

Avoid this place at all costs. They hassled me about a Groupon and then failed to change my oil filter without informing me. Terrible customer service and rude attitudes. Look for a better option elsewhere.

I recently attended the #welldoneTBO tweet-up at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza and had a fantastic experience. The customer service was top-notch and we were able to sample a variety of delicious menu items. The Philly Cheesesteak Pizza was a hit with my 10 year old, while I personally loved the Cauliflower pizza. The caramelized onion-smothered wings were a standout, as were the meatballs, ribs, and salad. We also enjoyed a half and half pizza with pepperoni, sausage, and mushrooms. Overall, a great evening and I will definitely be returning. If they offered liquor on the menu, this would have been a five-star experience for me. Thank you Anthony's!
I had an amazing dining experience with awesome service and delicious food. The dry ice fog added a cool and unique touch to the overall atmosphere. I highly recommend trying it out!

If you're looking for mouthwatering, authentic New Orleans cooking, this is the place to be. Despite being busy, we were seated promptly and opted for the a la carte menu over the buffet. It ended up being the highlight of our trip - highly recommended!

This restaurant is a popular spot for breakfast/brunch on the weekends, making it perfect for visitors from out of town. Expect long wait times after 9:30 AM, but the delicious menu options and great bakery, coffee, and gelato counter make it worth it. Service is a bit slow, but the food is worth the wait.

The food was excellent, but the service was lacking. Felt rushed, unimportant, and cheated by the waitress who withheld my coins. Disappointing experience overall. Will likely give it another try, but will bring exact change and adjust tip accordingly.

The sushi at this place is pretty good, especially the Mesa rolls. However, they would be a 4-star restaurant if they improved their pick up estimations as they often lag behind and have orders ready after customers arrive.
This place serves the best burger in Philly - fresh bread, juicy meat, friendly service, and affordable prices. Highly recommend!

The outdoor ambiance is perfect for wine and cheese, but the food options left something to be desired. The bacon-wrapped dates and brussel sprouts were unimpressive, and the sardines were clearly past their prime. Stick to the drinks and atmosphere here.
The Po-Boys were delicious, but lacking in catfish filling. Service was excellent.

The worst Mediterranean food I have ever had. Burned pita bread, excessively oily hummus, and poor customer service from the manager. The overall experience was unpleasant and left me feeling sick. Not worth a return visit.
The bagels at this place are fantastic, but it's a shame they close early. The staff could be friendlier, but it's worth it for the great bagels.

Overall, this hotel was fantastic for a week-long business trip. The location was great for easy access to the office in Wayne. The room was spacious and impeccably clean, with a well-stocked kitchenette. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Opting out of housekeeping for a $5 credit at the restaurant was a nice perk. The pool and hot tub were enjoyable, although the bar's drink selection was slightly limited. The breakfast spread was good overall, with the omelet station being a nice touch. Some issues with weak or gritty coffee, but the positives of this hotel outweigh the few minor drawbacks.
The falafel wrap was decent but overpriced and the atmosphere was cold and uninviting. Better options can be found in Manayunk.
I had a great experience at this place after experiencing car trouble while driving cross country. Brian was extremely helpful and got me back on the road in less than 30 minutes. Highly recommend.

While the location of this eatery is great for exploring the Quarter, the food was a disappointment. Out of 8 dishes ordered, only the jambalaya and file gumbo were tasty. The rest, including red beans/rice, meatloaf, Mac and cheese, shrimp po boy, and chicken wings, were bland and a waste of money. The staff was nice, but overall, the food was mediocre.

For the freshest seafood in Santa Barbara, head to this no-frills spot with a fantastic ocean view. The wait can be long, but the variety of fresh shellfish cooked to perfection is worth it. Put your name down and take a walk on the pier while you wait. You won't be disappointed.

I have always enjoyed my experiences at this restaurant. The food is creative and tasty, and the house wines are decent. The cocktails are well made, although on the smaller side. Service has always been good for me, and the patio is a great spot to hang out with friends. Overall, a solid choice for a meal out.

Skyway Cafe (formerly Skyway Jacks) offers huge plates of delicious food at cheap prices. The banana pecan pancakes are a must-try. The bovine decor adds to the cozy diner atmosphere. The service is friendly and efficient, and the coffee is always flowing. Don't miss out on their morning breakfast deal for a great start to your day. Highly recommend trying this local gem.
Horrendous experience - waited over an hour just to be turned away right before my turn for a shot. Complete disregard for customers. Avoid at all costs.
Customer service experience was disappointing, as it was difficult to find assistance when needed. Good luck getting help from anyone at this establishment.

Fair Grinds in New Orleans is a great spot for a caffeine boost. The atmosphere is relaxed and perfect for working or catching up with friends. The cold brew with vanilla was smooth and delicious, and the gluten-free zucchini bread was a tasty treat. The option to add tip to your card purchase at the fancy touchscreen register was convenient. The only downside was the limited gluten-free options, but overall, a delightful experience and a place I'd frequent if I lived nearby.
I had a wonderful experience at this place, the sweets were diverse and delicious. The gooey butter cookies were fantastic and the German chocolate cupcake was simply incredible. Highly recommend!

Decent frozen yogurt spot with an array of topping options and 8 froyo flavors to choose from, allowing for lots of combinations. However, prices can escalate rapidly when weighing your cup. Limited seating inside, friendly but unenthusiastic staff. Bubble tea was underwhelming.

This place is worth the drive from Tahoe for the delicious food, especially the Chicken Basil. Don't listen to the nay-sayers - the authentic Taiwanese food is definitely worth a try, along with their tasty Boba Tea. Highly recommended!

CRU is a charming wine bar with a modern atmosphere. The wine flights were enjoyable, with standout wines like the Vespucci Primitivo and Il Fauno di Arcanum. The food menu was diverse and the Farmers Plate was a standout, offering a variety of delicious cheeses and meats. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, making it a great spot to relax and enjoy a glass of wine with friends. I can't wait to return!
This spot has consistently served top 3 steaks in the city for years. The name change hasn't affected the quality of the food. For a different option, try the chicken cheesesteak.

Pina's in Roxborough is a hidden gem with amazing stromboli and the best Sicilian pie I've ever had. Their sandwiches and pizza are just okay, but the chicken parmesan is excellent. Overall, a satisfying dining experience.

While on the pricier side, this cafe offers delicious food and a diverse selection in the grocery section. The vegan sandwich and tofu melt are standout dishes, and the variety of vegan sweets is always impressive. Great option for those looking for plant-based options.

This burger restaurant in New Orleans is a must-try. The service was excellent, with timely delivery of fresh, tasty food. The Gator and deer burgers were a hit with my friends, and the buffalo wings were delicious. We will definitely be back before we leave. Don't forget to try their drinks, they're also very good!

Came here twice with my boyfriend and loved it each time! The old school vibe with 3 floors adds to the charm. The veal, clams casino, mussels, pasta with oil and garlic, and homemade garlic bread were amazing. Recently tried the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce and it was my new favorite dish. Must eat! Staff was nice and helpful. Highly recommend.

Home Wine Kitchen's "No Menu Monday" is a unique and exciting dining experience in St. Louis. The three-course meal with wine pairings is a great value at $30 plus $12. The personalized menu created based on your preferences makes for an interesting and delicious meal. The lamb meatballs and swordfish steak were standout dishes, while the staff was friendly and professional. The atmosphere is casual yet upscale, with a lively crowd of industry types. Overall, a must-try for food enthusiasts looking for something different in the fine dining scene. A return visit is definitely in order.

Overall, my friends and I had a special reunion dinner at this swanky restaurant. The food was worth the price, although some of my friends found it expensive.
