The lobster bake was delicious but not fantastic, and the Neopolitan Old Fashion was made perfectly. The waiter was fantastic, attentive, and even brought out a dessert for my friend's birthday. The bill came out to $170, which some of my friends found unexpected. Service gets 5 stars, food gets 3 stars, ambience gets 4 stars, and price gets 2 stars. I was satisfied with my experience.

Susanna Foo holds a special place in my heart, as it has been a cherished dining destination for my family since I was a baby. Despite its reliable food and impeccable service, I find the menu lacking in excitement as an adult. The decor and ambience remain top-notch, but I would love to see Susanna incorporate more exciting flavors or return to her Chinese roots for a more ethnic menu. I hope for a revitalization that will reignite my love for Susanna Foo.

I ventured outside of the hotel dining room and stumbled upon Spiro's in search of something different while in town. Despite its small ad, the Greek food was a pleasant surprise. The Greek lemon soup was a standout and the Moussaka was delicious, although the Sea Bass was recommended by the attentive waiter. Overall, a great dining experience and I will definitely return if in the area again. Special thanks to Neil for the excellent service.

As a barbecue judge, I can confirm that this establishment falls short of true barbecue standards. The brisket resembled fatty pot roast with no evidence of smoke flavor and a mushy texture. My sandwich was mostly fat, with big meatless chunks. It seems like the owner either doesn't care or has left the business in inexperienced hands. Overall, you can find much better barbecue elsewhere.

Our second favorite sunset spot north of Tampa offers a lively atmosphere with clapping crowds and lively music. The rocky beach lacks sand for swimming, but the view and atmosphere make it a perfect end to the day. Food and drinks are average, but the experience never disappoints. Great for families, as we've been taking our boys since they were babies and they still love it at fifteen.

This longstanding ice cream shop has definitely perfected their craft since 1958. Their soft serve and scooped ice cream cones, boats, floats, and sundaes are all top-notch. With reasonable prices, it's easy to see why this place has stood the test of time. Definitely worth a visit!

I stumbled upon this gem while craving authentic Mexican cuisine and was not disappointed. The pazole was delicious with a mix of pork, hominy, and toppings, although the wilted lettuce was a minor downside. The taco lunch special was also good, but the salsa was too sweet for my taste. The pineapple water was a pleasant surprise. The service was great, and I look forward to returning to try the burritos. A must-visit for those in the area!

The atmosphere at this restaurant is lovely, with white brick walls, rustic furniture, and attractive employees. The lighting is perfect for a blind date, and the service is good and timely. However, the prices are high for the portion sizes and the kitchen is not accommodating when it comes to substitutions. I was disappointed by the small portions and inability to make a simple substitution, which left me feeling unsatisfied. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and not worth the price.

I would consider dining here again, however mainly due to the lack of better options in town. The decor, noisy atmosphere, and funky vibe make for an interesting dining experience. The servers appear trendy, but the service was rushed and inattentive. Not recommended for Gluten Free individuals as the options are limited and the GF buns were subpar. The house catsup is not GF. Parking is a hassle for those with a car.

I highly recommend this place for its delicious food and drinks. The pulled pork and fried chicken po boy were exceptional, and the mac and cheese was a standout dish. The prices are very reasonable, and they have a great draft list. Plus, the fact that they serve food until 1am is a big plus. Great spot overall.

Avoid this place at all costs! The service is terrible, the restaurant is dirty, and the food is mediocre and overpriced. There are much better breakfast options nearby like First Watch and Pinky's. Don't waste your time or money here.

El Arado provides decent food, affordable drink prices, and accommodating staff. Despite some initial table sanitizing issues, the food was fresh, hot, and met everyone's specific requests. The margaritas were a hit and the Mexican beers were reasonably priced. Overall, a good spot for a satisfying meal before a night out in Fountain Square. Just be prepared for a mind-numbing strip club experience afterwards.

The Loew's hotel is exceptionally clean and aesthetically pleasing with outstanding service. The breakfast is fantastic and futuristic according to my son. The rooms are spacious and parking is convenient. Overall, a 5-star experience that my family and I wanted to extend for a month.

Yayyy for honeygrow! I can't believe it took me so long to try this place. The Sour Cherry BBQ stir fry with chicken was amazing and low calorie. The line moved quickly and the employees were friendly and efficient. Will definitely be going back for a healthy meal option.

This restaurant offers superb cheeseburgers with a thick, evenly cooked patty and delicious sauce, accompanied by tasty zucchini bread. The service is good, with a nice selection of gin and tonics, and a cool ambience. The convenience of being located downstairs from my apartment is a major plus. The only downside is the expensive prices, and there may have been a slight issue with the waitress's attitude, although this has not been confirmed. Overall, I am looking forward to returning.

Overall, the venue offers a variety of dining options and entertainment choices, but the smokey environment may be off-putting for non-smokers with allergies. Prices for food and drinks vary, with a nominal fee for beverages. The hotel is on the pricey side, but parking is free. There is also an ATM available, though it may be risky for some individuals. Gambling is available, but it is advised to only participate if you are willing to lose money. Enjoy the experience, even as an observer.

This restaurant was disappointing given its 4.5-star rating. The burgers were mediocre and the atmosphere felt like a generic chain restaurant. Perhaps it's better on the weekends, but based on our experience, we won't be returning.

This is my favorite brewery in the world! We recently did the "Beer School" and it was awesome. I highly recommend it, especially if it's your first time visiting. Make sure to do the brewery tour first to see the Clydesdales and learn about the brewery's history. Can't wait to go back for the "Brew Master" experience! Budweiser, see you next time!

Extremely unprofessional service. Arrived early for a reservation, only to be ignored and told our reservation was never recorded. Hostesses blamed it on a new employee and showed no remorse. No effort to accommodate or apologize, just brushed us off. Will not be returning.

The food was delicious, but disappointing experience with honoring Yelp offer. Offered 10% off for checking in and reviewing, but not honored until next visit despite 4 hours to redeem. Great food, but questionable business practice.

I have only visited this location a few times, mainly to send packages, and appreciate the convenience of having an automated machine. However, the standout experience was when my husband and I had our passport applications submitted. The representative we worked with was efficient, friendly, and extremely knowledgeable. She made the process quick and easy, even providing follow-up information. I hope all future visits are as pleasant. She should be a trainer for the entire team.

This store is a fantastic place to start on a health journey, with a wide variety of vitamins, dietary supplements, beauty products, and homeopathic items. The staff is helpful and assisted me in finding items to make my own moisturizer. The rewards program and acceptance of digital coupons are major positives. Highly recommend!

I absolutely love this shoppe! The staff is awesome and the atmosphere is great. They offer a variety of healthy and tasty treats, as well as delicious croissants. Their lunch and breakfast options are also fantastic. I have yet to try anything here that wasn't absolutely fabulous.
The Cranberry Orange Muffin and Caffe Latte were delicious, the ambience was great, and the service was fast. Perfect start to a Saturday morning. Highly recommend.
My favorite place for sushi with friendly and welcoming staff. The menu is excellent and the overall dining experience is always outstanding. Highly recommend as a top choice for sushi lovers.

This coffee shop is a gem in the city with unbelievable food and a cool, edgy vibe. The fresh and delicious dishes, along with the comfortable seating options both inside and outside, make it a must-visit spot. Perfect for a coffee break or a meal, this place is definitely worth checking out.

This family-owned burrito shop is easily the best in town with delicious burritos, great salsas, and a relaxed atmosphere. The chicken and chorizo combo is a personal favorite, but the smoked brisket is also fantastic. The medium burrito is plenty unless you're a competitive eater. The prices are reasonable and the service is excellent. Highly recommend for those interested in good, healthy food.

The lunch menu at this place is a real treat! The sandwiches are absolutely delicious, though a bit on the small side. Prices are a bit high but the quality is well worth it. Can't wait to try their steaks! Service is excellent as well. 5/5 for food, 5/5 for service, 4/5 for price.

Delicious selection with a preppy atmosphere. The What's Up Doc omelet is a must-try, though portion sizes can vary. French toasts and Fancy Breakfast Sandwich are also top picks. Mimosas are a great addition to complete the meal. Substituting prosciutto with bacon is highly recommended.
This store is a must-visit for fans of 50's-Midcentury modern decor. While prices are higher compared to other stores in STL, the unique and one-of-a-kind items make it worth a visit.

As a gold member and frequent guest of Hamptons, I was extremely disappointed by my recent stay. The hotel seems to be under constant construction and my room was dirty. On top of that, I was turned away for a four-night stay despite being told I could come back the next night. Stay away from this hotel.

The fried rice at this Vietnamese restaurant is the best I've ever had, and the Pho is on par with some of the best I've had in Seattle. Highly recommend trying it out, whether it's your first time or you're a seasoned Pho lover. Don't miss out on this gem in Nashville!

I walked to this awesome place from my condo and was pleasantly surprised. The sliders and donuts were delicious and the unique drinks were a great touch. The atmosphere was awesome and the staff was incredibly friendly. Definitely will be returning in the future.

Casa Video is the ultimate video rental store with a knowledgeable and friendly staff. The vast selection sets it apart, carrying the newest releases and unique finds like VHS tapes of classic hockey fights. The low cost is an added bonus. Chicago needs a place like Casa Video.

I had a satisfying experience ordering a la carte at this sushi restaurant for a late weekend lunch. The total cost was just under $20 with tip, and the rolls were fresh and delicious. The standout item was the chocolate mochi - creamy and tasty. It filled me up enough without leaving me overly stuffed. Perfect for when you want sushi but don't want to commit to AYCE or spend $25.

I had a positive experience at this store, quickly finding what I needed with courteous employees. The store was clean, organized, and well-stocked. Despite this, I have concerns about their longevity in the area due to other nearby closures.

Five stars for sure! This place has the best pizza in town, hands down. The staff is friendly and the beer selection is top notch, always cold and well maintained. And you can't beat the deal of a slice and a fresh beer for just 5 bucks. A must-try for any pizza and beer lover.

Federal Donuts more than lived up to the hype for me. As a vegetarian, I can only speak to the donuts and coffee, but my husband raves about the chicken, particularly the buttermilk ranch flavor. The donuts are truly incredible, especially when paired with an iced coffee. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating even during busy times.

Despite easy and convenient location, friendly staff and great bar, the dishes at this restaurant are consistently disappointing. From dry turkey patties to fish and chips served in a box, there have been three strikes and they are out for us. Our last visit sealed the deal - we won't be returning.

Sapore offers a taste of Italy in a strip mall setting, with a cool, dark interior providing a refreshing escape from the heat. The customizable drinks, including a unique martini with an anchovy garnish, are a highlight. The menu, though not mind-blowing, offers solid options like Chicken Marsala and a tasty tiramisu for dessert. Overall, Sapore is a good choice for a casual Italian meal with a twist.

This version of Burger Up may not be as trendy due to its location in a strip mall, but it delivers delicious, messy burgers with fresh ingredients. The truffle fries are outstanding, as is the creamy and perfectly made chocolate milkshake. Perfect for those wanting an upscale burger experience with all the classic fixings.

I dropped off my car for a check engine light appointment in the morning and was told it would be ready the next day. However, my car was not looked at until the following day and I had to wait for an hour to pick it up due to poor organization. Despite no repairs needed, the inconvenience and lack of efficiency is enough to deter me from returning in the future.

RH&B was once the go-to spot in south Jersey for BBQ and blues, but after a recent sale, live music has been cancelled. The food was only decent and without the music, the overall experience suffered. The only thing worth missing are the workers at the restaurant. Overall, I can no longer recommend RH&B.

I used to rely on this place for sandwiches, but the last two were disappointing. The cheesesteak was light on meat and the roll was stale - one of the worst I've had in Philly. I hope it was just an off night, but I'll be waiting a while before giving it another try.

As a SPG Gold member, I had a disappointing experience at this property. Despite paying a good amount for my room, the staff was unhelpful when I requested a larger room due to noise from adjoining doors. I received no assistance in moving rooms and had to deal with the noise throughout the night. The service and overall experience left much to be desired, and I would not recommend this hotel to others.
Overall, the food was fresh and tasted great. While it wasn't amazing, the price was fair and the staff was very helpful and nice.
Overall, it's a decent hotel for a business traveler with comfortable beds and a decent cafe. The hallway could use some maintenance, and room cleaning could be more thorough. Good for a short stay.

Henry's is a standard neighborhood coffee spot with a lacking atmosphere and bitter iced coffee. The lack of uniqueness and quality of the coffee left a disappointing first impression. Willing to give it another chance with a different drink in the future.

This hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. From the welcoming scent of fresh baked cookies upon arrival, to the clean and well-stocked rooms, to the thoughtful amenities such as the book borrowing program and smoking area with swinging benches. The complimentary breakfast was a pleasant surprise, offering a variety of options that changed daily. The pool and hot tub were well-maintained and the late check-out time of 12:00 PM was a nice touch. The staff was genuinely interested in our feedback and made us feel at home throughout our stay. Highly recommend this hotel for a comfortable and enjoyable experience.

Buying a car can be intimidating, but with proper preparation and research, I was able to negotiate what I believe to be a fair deal at Toyota of Santa Barbara. The salesman, Sam Ladd, was courteous and allowed me to test drive multiple vehicles before making a decision. Frank Flores, the sales manager, was upfront and addressed my concerns during the negotiation process. As long as the car performs as expected over time, I am happy with my purchase. Be prepared and stick to your position throughout the process for a successful experience.
Fantastic bar with a welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff. The mixed crowd makes everyone feel at home. The BBQ truck outside is a must-try.

The staff at this Italian restaurant was friendly and accommodating, but the food was mediocre and served luke warm. Despite a variety of appetizers, including fried gnocchi and calamari, the dishes were just okay. The main courses were unadventurous and lacked flavor, with unimpressive sauces. The lackluster food quality outweighed the positive service experience, making it unlikely to return.
Overall, this Chinese restaurant is one of the best and friendliest places to grab a tasty meal. The double treasure dish is a must-try option on the menu.

I have been a loyal customer of Reno Vulcanizing for several years and will not take my vehicles anywhere else. Ken, Bruce, and the entire staff are always honest, courteous, and helpful. Highly recommend their services.

Overall, the city tour received 1 star, with complaints about lack of communication, uncomfortable seating, and limited sightseeing opportunities. The plantation tour, on the other hand, earned 5 stars for its informative guides and historical content. Although the focus was more on landowners at Oak Alley Plantation, the tour provided a balanced perspective. The swamp tour received 4 stars despite not seeing alligators, with praise for the knowledgeable guide. The large buses provided a comfortable ride back to the hotel for all tours.

Avoid this pizza place at all costs. The pizza was the worst I've ever had, with soggy thin crust, low quality toppings, and a salad that was a rip off. The only decent item was the knots, but overall, not worth the money. Stick to quality pizza from places like Grimaldi's, BJs, or Mellow Mushroom instead. The experience with this place was a reminder that quality is more important than convenience. Never ordering from them again.
Disappointed by the lack of dark beer options in February, but found the establishment to be visually appealing and the staff to be friendly. Summer beer in February was underwhelming.

Buddy Brew in Tampa is a must-try spot despite the parking and crowds. The baristas are friendly and the food options are tasty. The care put into roasting the coffee is evident and makes this one of my favorite places.
The restaurant is overrated and the burnt crust on the pizza was a turn-off for us. However, we enjoyed the cauliflower salad and the fried dough ball dessert was delicious.

I received a gift certificate for this place and recently had the pleasure of trying it out. The mixed salad sandwich was amazing and will definitely be a craving in the future. The homemade ice cream was also delicious and we can't wait to go back.
I absolutely love this Italian restaurant! The food quality and quantity exceeded my expectations, and the service from the girls, particularly Alexa, is always amazing. Thank you for being awesome!

The bar in the Quarter is a sophisticated spot to enjoy delicious drinks made by a charming bartender. The Manhattans were top-notch thanks to Carpano Antica Formula vermouth. The food was hit or miss with the lamb meatballs being just okay, but the spring rolls were excellent. While the drinks were pricey, they were worth it for a special night out. The manager, Eric, was welcoming and professional, making us eager to return for another visit. A perfect place for a civilized break in the Quarter.

I used to frequent this restaurant for the lunch special which was a great deal. However, my husband isn't a fan so we haven't been as often in the past year. Prices have gone up but the meals are still consistently satisfying.

I recently had the classic burger and fries at this place and was overall pleased with my experience. The burger was well seasoned and the fries were tasty. The service was excellent and I also indulged in a spiked milkshake, the Bananas Foster, which was delicious.

I was extremely disappointed with the service at this location. Despite being almost full, there were still empty tables available. However, it took far too long for our order to be taken and even longer for our food to arrive. The waitress seemed disorganized and we were left wondering who was actually serving us. An adjacent customer who arrived after us received their food before we did, which was frustrating. The explanation given for the delay was unsatisfactory, as there didn't appear to be a significant influx of new customers. In the end, we decided to leave without our food after waiting 40 minutes and received no apology. It was a waste of our time and we will not be returning.

We had an amazing experience at the bakery! The tres leche cake was just like grandma used to make, the cannoli was delicious, and the Italian wedding cookies were perfectly crunchy with a delicate Anise flavor. The dark chocolate florentine was surprisingly good despite my dislike for coconut. We will definitely be returning for more treats in the future.

Excelente lugar para pedir pizzas para llevar o comer en el local. Personal amable, ambiente limpio y acogedor. Las pizzas tienen un sabor delicioso, con ingredientes frescos y bien balanceados. Recomiendo especialmente la pizza de prosciutto y la de hongos. Sin duda, merece cinco estrellas.

Overall, had a fun time celebrating a friend's birthday at a cozy and uncrowded spot. The service was quick and staff were friendly. The burger was decent, though not as advertised in terms of cooking method and doneness. Enjoyed exploring the nearby river as well. Good vibes on Paradise road.

After reading numerous reviews, I decided to try this restaurant. The oysters were the only good thing because they were raw. Everything else was dry and tasteless. The space was cramped and we had people coughing on us at the bar. The 2 half and half baskets we ordered were not worth the high price of $60.

Village Whiskey in Philadelphia lives up to its reputation as having the best burger in the city. The bartenders are top-notch, crafting creative and delicious whiskey cocktails. The Village Burger with applewood bacon and homemade thousand island dressing is a must-try, while the duck fat fries are crispy and flavorful. Be prepared for a wait due to popularity, but the experience is worth it for the great drinks, food, and service. Can't wait to return.

Decent neighborhood sushi spot with a limited roll menu but accommodating staff. Service is attentive and speedy, with all staff eager to please. Rolls were fine but not outstanding, overall competent and acceptable. Great option for quick sushi near home, worth returning to.

Flanagan's Pub in the French Quarter is a hidden gem away from the chaos of Bourbon St. We were drawn in by the friendly atmosphere and found ourselves returning multiple times in one day. The bartenders and patrons were welcoming and the punk rock music added to the cool vibe of the place. Definitely worth a visit for a more laid-back and authentic New Orleans experience.

The Daily Bread is a disappointing ripoff of St. Louis Bread Co/Panera Bread. The food is basic and lacks flavor, with sandwiches and pizza only being okay. The real issue lies in the poor service, with uninterested staff, long wait times, and dirty tables. Despite multiple visits, the lack of organization and cleanliness has led me to write off the Daily Bread and opt for a better dining experience elsewhere.

Overall, I had a positive experience ordering delivery from this restaurant through Yelp. The food took about 45 minutes to arrive, but the delivery driver was friendly. The BBQ chicken pizza was delicious, with the toppings spread out over most of the crust. The mozzarella sticks were not what I was expecting as they were deep fried instead of breaded, but they were still tasty. The two free cookies that came with my order were a pleasant surprise and were the highlight of the meal. The price was fair and I would definitely consider ordering from this restaurant again, despite the slightly long wait time.

This gym is fabulous with a lot of fitness opportunities for the cost. The class schedule is great for those with varying work hours, and the trainers are excellent, especially in spin and row classes. The We-Fit class is a huge challenge, but worth it. The facility is clean with little extras like blow dryers in the women's locker room. Time will tell if they can maintain this level of cleanliness. Overall, a great find for those looking for a versatile gym experience.

Bottom line: Prestigious is a fantastic body shop with a clean and professional environment, knowledgeable staff, and top-notch quality work. The color match on my repair was perfect and I was 100% satisfied with the end result. I highly recommend them for anyone in need of high-quality repairs.

As a Colorado visitor to Santa Barbara, I was extremely impressed with the dining experience at this restaurant. The quality of the food, excellent customer service, reasonable prices, and fast service make it a must-visit breakfast spot in Santa Barbara. Highly recommended.

After years of curiosity, I finally tried this spot for lunch and was impressed by the layout with a choice of tables, booths, and a lunch counter facing the cooks' area. The staff was busy but not rude, and my waitress was sweet. I ordered the fried shrimp po boy dressed with a side of red beans, though I was tempted by the delicious-looking burgers being cooked. The food was average for a tourist spot in the Quarter, but I may return for one of their burgers.
These people are truly great. We have experienced everything and seen many doctors, but these are the best. They are true animal people and you can always count on them. Highly recommend!
We had a great experience at this family restaurant. The po boys were flavorful with perfect bread. The mac 'n cheese had a nice kick to it. Service was fabulous. Highly recommend.

Mr. B's provided the best dining experience in NOLA during my trip. The Sunday Jazz Brunch was worth the 40-minute wait. Our server was friendly and attentive, allowing us to take our time with the menu. The seafood gumbo and sea bass were outstanding, accompanied by delicious sides and sauces. Dessert options like chocolate orange ice cream and creme brûlée were a hit. Seating where Ronald Reagan once sat added a unique touch to our visit. Although the bill was $100+, the exceptional food and service made it worth every penny. I will definitely be returning to Mr. B's if I'm back in NOLA.

I highly recommend staying at this hotel in Indianapolis. The AAA discount saved us money, the parking was convenient, the urban art throughout the hotel was impressive, and the service was excellent. The room was luxurious with great amenities like a Keurig coffee machine and comfortable California king bed. Plat 99 had delicious food and drinks, and the proximity to Bankers Field house was perfect for our Pacers game. The buffet breakfast at Market Place was tasty. Check out was easy and the concierge was friendly. The hotel is like a modern art museum with interesting pieces everywhere. Overall, a fantastic choice for a quick getaway in Indianapolis, especially if attending a game. Will definitely be staying here again.

The setting of the restaurant is nice with TVs, a bar, and a downtown patio, but I had a disappointing experience with my order. The cashier tried to add a beer to my to-go order and I did not receive the fish taco I ordered. Instead, I got two beef tacos that were not what I asked for. The Sonoran dog I received was soggy and unimpressive compared to other options. The place was packed and loud, leading to a subpar eating experience. Unless you want to risk receiving the wrong order during a busy time, I would recommend finding another spot to eat.

Sam's is one of the top sports bars in Nashville, offering a great patio atmosphere during the warmer months. However, compared to sports bars in other cities, it falls short in terms of service and ambiance. The food is decent, but the beer selection and mixed drinks could be improved. Overall, Sam's is a good option for watching sports in Nashville, but there is room for improvement.

This restaurant has a great location with delicious food and friendly staff. The limited seating often results in a crowded store, especially during lunch rush. Online ordering seems to be a popular option to avoid long wait times. It's a perfect spot to grab some food and enjoy it in Rittenhouse Square. Both vegetarians and meat eaters have enjoyed their meals, making it a great option for group outings.
Terrible experience with this company. They were over an hour late without any communication, and their customer policy is abysmal. Avoid at all costs.

I'm glad Michael & Lucy opened their new family restaurant on Santa Claus Lane after Tony's on Linden closing. The food is good and reasonably priced, with a slice and salad special worth trying. The Tuscany design is pleasant and the owners are friendly. They offer local beer on tap, multiple HD sports TVs, and even have TVs dedicated to surf videos and kids shows. The location may be tough, but I hope they succeed in this Renaissance of Santa Claus Lane. Good luck!

Despite being located in a shopping center, this restaurant is truly amazing. The staff, especially Curtis, goes above and beyond to ensure a fantastic dining experience. The scallops small plate is a must-try, but overall, the entire experience is top-notch. Highly recommend dining here.

I absolutely loved this breakfast joint! The bananas foster was incredible and the colorful decorations really captured the essence of New Orleans. Highly recommend for a delicious breakfast in a convenient location.

The birthday cakes at this bakery are truly exceptional. However, the cupcakes and cookies out front can sometimes be stale. However, the customer service is excellent and they made up for it when I brought it to their attention. I would definitely return for the amazing birthday cakes.

Service at Loco was a bit slow for Saturday lunch, but not unbearable. Understandable for a new establishment finding its footing. Avoid Friday nights, long lines and chaos. Margaritas and cilantro chicken enchiladas were great. Outdoor seating under umbrellas was pleasant. Prices are reasonable and overall a promising addition to the neighborhood. Give them time to work out kinks, but looking forward to returning. Hope Loco thrives long-term.

Nary's nail salon is a gem! The staff are all friendly and the atmosphere is lively. The nail designs and options are top-notch and worth the wait. Just be sure to set your budget beforehand. Can't wait for my next appointment!

This place in Treasure Island is definitely a must-visit! The char-grilled oysters are a standout, the staff is great, and the big outdoor seating area is perfect for enjoying a meal with your furry friend. As a pet lover, I appreciate the pet-friendly policy and would highly recommend this spot.

This restaurant offers a wide variety of mostly fried seafood at surprisingly high prices for its working class atmosphere. It evokes a New Orleans vibe and is suitable for a casual family meal, but the food quality falls short of expectations.

This place was recommended by family, and it did not disappoint. Despite being busy, the service was fast and friendly. The food was tasty, with a focus on basic breakfast fare. The Cajun tasso omelet was a standout, not too spicy but just right. The fluffy hash browns and other dishes like French toast and eggs were also delicious. Everyone left satisfied and full, and we will definitely be returning on our next visit.

My group of four had a great experience at this restaurant. The appetizers were interesting and tasty - we tried dumplings, wings, and specials. The noodles were fresh and delicious. The portions were not huge but the quality was great. It's a great deal and BYO. Overall, a fantastic addition to 10th street.
The sandwiches at this St. Louis spot are top-notch and I could easily eat here everyday. The friendly crowd adds to the enjoyable dining experience.

This place in Reno, NV is a great lunch or dinner stop. The manager, Tyler, runs a tight ship and it shows with the great staff and overall results. Fantastic beer and wine selection as well. A must-try spot in the area.

As a childless woman, I was pleasantly surprised by my experience at Chuck E Cheese. The staff run a tight ship, ensuring quick service and safety for all guests. The one-token games are a nice touch, offering a variety of options for entertainment. The food was plentiful and the staff attentive, particularly for birthday parties. The only downside was the crowded birthday area. Overall, a fun trip down memory lane for me and a great time for the kids.

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at this restaurant. The fresh organic food and variety of coffee options were a nice change of pace. The Sasquatch brew was particularly delicious. The ambiance was casual, relaxed, and comfortable. The owners were friendly and welcoming, making for a great overall dining experience.
Delicious ice cream made fresh from hormone and antibiotic-free cows. Best place around for a sweet treat. Cash only, but definitely worth the trip to the ATM.

Despite being our second choice due to Rio Mar being closed for Mardi Gras week, we had a great meal at this restaurant. The service was excellent, the bread and butter were delicious, and the beets salad was a standout dish. The main courses, G's Choucroute and crab ravioli, were both delicious. The bread pudding for dessert was a perfect finish to the meal. Overall, a memorable dining experience that exceeded our expectations, especially for a hotel restaurant.
Found 51st Deli on Uber Eats and it was amazing! Can't wait to try it in person.

I highly recommend the Honey Apple grilled cheese sandwich at Meltdown. The staff is friendly, the decor is cool, and the food is delicious. Avoid the Meltdown in Montgomeryville which lacks in service and ambiance. Stick with the original Meltdown for a great experience.

This restaurant offers great combination deals for rolls and sushi, making them affordable. The rolls are on the smaller side, so ordering up is necessary to get full. Surprisingly, the sashimi is fresh despite the low prices. The small size of the restaurant and slow service are drawbacks, but being BYO allows you to bring your own drinks while you wait.

While the food was satisfying, the service at this restaurant was severely lacking. Despite ordering orange juice for my children at the start of the meal, we waited until nearly finished eating before receiving them. Additionally, the establishment only accepts cash or checks. Overall, the experience was okay, but improvements could certainly be made in terms of service.

I have been a long-time customer of this restaurant, but my last visit was disappointing. The quality of the food has significantly declined. The salsas were watery and poorly chopped, while the main dish was flavorless and covered in excessive cheese. I hope they prioritize the quality of their food over cost-cutting measures in the future.

I recently got 2 tattoos at Stigma and I couldn't be happier! I chose them based on their good reviews and website. My tattoo artist, Eddie, was friendly, fun, and extremely talented. He listened to my ideas and executed them perfectly. The entire staff was welcoming and accommodating, especially considering my back issues. I even got $10 off for checking in on Yelp! The owner, Chino, has developed his own tattoo ointment which is soothing and all-natural. I highly recommend Stigma for anyone looking to get inked. You'll be in good hands with great artists and a friendly atmosphere.

This place is a blast! The outdoor patio with hip hop music and indoor dance area with salsa provide a great variety of music and atmosphere. Plus, the option to easily switch between the two is a nice touch. Overall, a fun and dynamic venue.

Although the decor and wait staff were great, the food at this restaurant fell short. My friend enjoyed the fish special but found the portion size small. The fattoush salad lacked flavor and texture, with limp lettuce and no olives. The prices were high for lunch, causing us to not want to return anytime soon.
The Animal Clinic treats our pets like family and provides excellent care. The only downside is the challenging location for leaving. Overall, highly recommended. 4/5 stars.
This Taco Bell is the worst I have ever been to. Filthy restaurant, terrible service, and consistently incorrect orders. Save yourself the trouble and find a different place to eat.
The food at this Neuvo-Latino-Americano restaurant is delicious and the new, larger location is a plus. The chips & salsa are always fresh and tasty. Overall, a great dining experience.

Stumbled upon Player's while passing by and was greeted by friendly staff. The service was top-notch and the atmosphere was relaxed. Had a fantastic shave and haircut at a reasonable price. Overall, a great experience.

The food at this restaurant was terrible and the manager's rude behavior when I tried to return my meal was appalling. The frogs legs were rubbery and tasted awful. The manager should be ashamed of herself for treating customers so poorly. I have never been treated so horribly.
The location and building are dated with unclean and worn out features, but the bed was comfortable. Disappointing overall compared to other Doubletree experiences.

Overall, my experience at this hotel was fantastic. The boutique feel added a special touch to my birthday party at the restaurant. The service was impeccable and the rooms were beautiful. The only downside was the loud air conditioner in my room. The hotel's proximity to Printers Alley was a major plus. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future.

Cool spot in a great location with friendly bartenders and perfect drinks. Avoid the crowds by going early. The Rye Manhattan was a game-changer and the burger was the best I've ever had. Will definitely be returning.

I highly recommend this breakfast place. The food was excellent with standout dishes like biscuits and gravy, extra crispy bacon, sausage links, and challah French toast. The service was also top-notch. It's now my new favorite spot for breakfast.

We were pleased with Terra's work as our wedding florist. She took the time to understand our needs and budget, and the florals for the ceremony and reception were beautiful. There were some concerns with wilting flowers in the bouquets, which may have been due to the heat. Overall, we were happy with Terra for our wedding.
This restaurant offers excellent healthy options with plenty of to-go choices. I enjoyed the turkey meatballs and spaghetti for lunch, making it a wonderful dining spot.
This takeout spot in Northern Liberties is a gem. The food is fresh, tasty, and satisfyingly healthy. It's a convenient option for busy nights when you want a quick meal on-the-go. Highly recommend!

I attended an alumni event at this cozy, dimly lit spot that felt like an old library. It was a great quiet, casual spot with good drinks. The happy hour cocktails like moscow mules and old fashioneds were a hit with everyone. Highly recommend for a low key evening out.
The burgers are truly fantastic and worth the visit. The French fries are just okay, but definitely opt for the onion rings instead.

I had a disappointing experience dining at this restaurant twice. The steak was overly salty, the fish was dry, and my salad was frozen. The service was also subpar. I am puzzled by the positive reviews this place receives.
Modesto in St. Louis is a standout Spanish restaurant, even compared to those in NYC. The food is exceptional and it is a place I miss dearly since moving away. Highly recommended.

Terrible spa experience. Small, dirty, and staff was unprofessional. Technician was sick, cut my cuticle, and gave a terrible massage. Receptionist was unhelpful and fees for room charges. Avoid Spa Aria at the Monteleone.

I highly recommend getting the hot shave at this establishment. The service includes 6 towels and a facial massage with oils, creating a relaxing and satisfying experience. The shave was excellent and the environment was top-notch.

My go-to spot since it opened, Taco del Mar is always decent and super fast. Owned by Subway, it has a similar feel but much better quality. The build-your-own burrito and taco options are fresh and well-stocked. Plenty of vegetarian options available - I love loading up my veggie burrito with lots of veggies. Also enjoy their chips and "medium" salsa. Check it out if you're in the Delgado area!
This store is only worth a visit for items not carried at Trader Joe's. However, it is overpriced and lacks sufficient staff. Not recommended.
Proper barbeque joints serve smoked ribs that are meant to be a little tough, not fall-off-the-bone mushy. If you're looking for tender meat, look elsewhere.

This place is a must-visit for delicious lassi and elegantly presented Karachi style chaat. The lassi is creamy and sweetened perfectly, while the chaat brings a taste of tradition. However, the chaat doesn't quite match up to the amazing lassi. I will definitely return next time I'm in the area.
We had a stunning wedding reception at Hendel's Cafe. The ambiance was beautiful, creating the perfect setting for an unforgettable night with our loved ones.

This hotel was a disappointment. The presence of a cockroach in my room was a major turnoff, and the slow wifi was reminiscent of internet speeds from the 90s. To top it off, having to pay $10 for a chair at the private beach was frustrating. I will not be returning.

El Sol was an absolute gem for my daughter's birthday celebration. The attentive staff, delicious drinks and food, and festive atmosphere left us all blown away. The surprise cake, sombreros, and fireworks were the perfect touch. I can't wait to make regular dinner visits and enjoy their generous portions of fajitas. Good job, El Sol!

Taco Son is a hidden gem of a restaurant with delicious, made-from-scratch food and generous portions. Skip the long lines at Taco Bus and come here for a great meal. Their breakfast burritos are a must-try after a night out.

I recently purchased a used car for my son from Conicelli, which was supposedly in safe condition with a new state inspection. However, the front left tire blew out the day after we brought it home, costing us $450 for replacements. The tire was completely dry rotted and fell apart, putting our safety at risk. I would not recommend Conicelli after this experience.

The food at this restaurant is excellent, but the condition of the bathrooms was disappointing on the Friday night I visited. The toilet didn't flush and there was no toilet paper or paper towels. Overall, the cleanliness was lacking. Deducting one star for this issue.

While the food I ordered was delicious, the service at this restaurant was incredibly disappointing. Despite placing an online order and arriving before the estimated pick-up time, I ended up waiting an additional 20 minutes for my food to be cooked. The staff did not show any concern for the inconvenience and still charged me full price. Overall, the lack of customer service left me feeling upset and frustrated.

This cute Japanese restaurant in Old City has fresh sushi and amazing ramen. The customer service is excellent, making it my new favorite go-to for sushi and ramen. The menu offers a great selection of dishes.

I enjoyed the ambiance and felt pampered and relaxed during my visit. However, the difficulty in placing a drink order was frustrating. Despite asking four people, I was eventually directed to call room service on the white phone. This issue prevented me from giving a perfect rating.

Dr. Jeffers is a top-notch vet who shows compassion for all animals and can quickly diagnose any issues. Her prices are very reasonable, especially compared to other vets in the area. She accepts reptiles and has a wide range of machinery to accurately diagnose pets. Overall, a great vet comparable to Dr. Pol. Highly recommended.

The Mahi Mahi dish was fantastic, with a generous portion size that could easily be shared. It is important to enjoy smoked fish flavors to fully appreciate this dish. The server was also friendly and provided excellent service.

Melissa is the best lash technician I've ever been to. She is skilled, efficient, and delivers results that outshine other lash lounges I've visited. She doesn't overdo it with excessive stacking and gets you in and out quickly. I highly recommend booking with Melissa for top-notch lash services.

The best casino in Reno with top-notch amenities such as 4 deck and 2 deck blackjack, real drink glasses, and stunning decor. The restaurants inside are a cut above those on the strip, and the rooms are excellent for the price. Don't forget to indulge in a hot tub for ultimate relaxation.

This restaurant offers delicious fish and chips with a crispy batter and generous serving of fries. The homemade tartar sauce adds a great flavor. The salmon tacos and chicken tortilla soup are also tasty, although the salmon was slightly overcooked. The portion sizes are smaller than some other places, but the flavors make up for it. Overall, a great place for a satisfying meal.

Cake Life's Lemon Cake is a deliciously heavy treat that is just as good as it sounds. After trying their cupcakes on my first visit, I couldn't resist coming back for more. With great flavors and quality desserts, Cake Life has become a must-visit spot for me. Can't wait to go back again!

The service at Beef's was extremely slow and disappointing. Despite being seated promptly, it took 40 minutes for our sodas to arrive and our order was never even entered. The manager was apologetic but the overall experience was a letdown. The boneless wings were decent but not worth the wait. Would not return or recommend. Look for better dining options elsewhere.

Wildflower is a charming and delicious restaurant with a great lunch menu. The Vermonter salad and tuna plate were both fantastic, made with fresh and local ingredients. The patio is adorable and the service was wonderful. The only downside is the limited vegetarian options on the menu. Overall, a great dining experience and would love to come back for breakfast.

This roast pork sandwich was the worst I've ever had. The broccoli rabe was lifeless and freezing, the cheese didn't even melt because it was so cold, and the bread was soggy and wet. Horrible experience, would not recommend – would have returned it if not in an airport.

While the appetizers at this restaurant are delicious, the entrees are lacking in flavor and quality. The Pad Thai was overly sweet with no spice, and the other entrees were mediocre at best. For the price point of around $8 per dish, you get what you pay for. The Indian pancakes and chicken satay were highlights of the meal, but overall, I was disappointed by the lackluster entrees. It was a cheap option for a night out, but I wish I had enjoyed it more.

This place is a must-visit for sandwich lovers. Everything is made to order and worth the wait. As a self-proclaimed sandwich expert from Chicago, I can confidently say this place deserves every bit of those 5 stars. Well done, guys!

The Devils Food Cake with vanilla buttercream icing was absolutely delicious and indulgent. Even those who typically avoid high calorie sweets couldn't resist. The staff was friendly and accommodating, making the experience even better. Can't wait to visit the Old City location for another slice of that amazing cake!

Great talent may be present at Perfect Arch, but unfortunately that doesn't matter when time is more valuable. Despite opening at 11am, there were no employees present to provide service when I visited on 3/23/18 at 11:28am. Disappointing experience. Tsk, tsk Perfect Arch.

Spasso in Media is a must-visit for a delicious dinner experience. The food is unique with a twist on classic Italian dishes. The service is exceptional, with server Oana being knowledgeable and attentive. The bread and eggplant/pepper topping are a refreshing start to the meal. The Caesar salad and pappardelle porcini are standout dishes, both fresh and flavorful. Overall, Spasso is highly recommended for a satisfying dining experience in Media.

Overall, my experience with this credit union has been positive. Despite some errors, the customer service at the branch has been helpful in resolving issues. I have been with them for 4 years and have accounts for my business, parents, ex-husband, son, and myself, and all have been satisfied with the service provided.

Despite multiple visits, we were disappointed with the numerous issues at this establishment. The atmosphere is often rowdy, drinks are frequently spilled, service is slow, and the food is mediocre for the price. The staff is rude and inattentive, and management shows a lack of concern for customer satisfaction. We will not be returning and do not recommend this place to others. Hit-and-miss experience not worth the time or money.

If you're in St Pete and craving authentic Mexican food, look no further than this small but delicious spot. The chorizo taco is a meat lover's dream and the fish tacos are a must-try for seafood fans. Avoid the weekend crowds and go during the week or day for a shorter wait time. A great spot for a casual meal and a cold beer.

Chatham Tap in Indianapolis is a must-visit for wing lovers! The wings are meaty and delicious, with a great sauce that you'll want to take home for later. The onion rings are also highly recommended. The atmosphere is fantastic, with a diverse crowd of sports fans and attentive staff. The service is top-notch, and the large beer selection is a bonus. Definitely worth a visit for a great meal and fun time with friends.

Great sushi at a great price. Service was quick and efficient. One suggestion for improvement would be to include photos on the menu to help customers visualize the dishes before ordering. Overall, a fantastic dining experience with authentic flavors and healthy options.

First time at this restaurant and had a great experience. Alison was a fantastic server, knowledgeable and attentive. We enjoyed catching up with old friends without feeling rushed. The food was delicious, from steaks to meatloaf, and all prepared perfectly. Can't wait to come back and hope for the same great experience next time.

Jonny's is a dive bar with a great happy hour and laid-back atmosphere. The food, made from scratch, is surprisingly delicious, especially the naked wings and Jon's salad with grilled chicken. They offer fun games like trivia and bingo with great prizes, including 1 cent pitchers of beer. Just be aware that it's a smoking bar and can get crowded on game days. Overall, a great spot to enjoy cheap beers, half-price pizza, and good company with friends.

This restaurant offers delicious food and has options for vegans. The staff is friendly, and the spacious layout with a bar and stage area make it a great venue for events. The guacamole is especially tasty. Highly recommended for a fun dining experience.

West Ave. Grill in Jenkintown is a charming spot filled with locals dining outside with their furry friends and little ones. The staff is friendly, the owner is hands-on, and the atmosphere is welcoming. The food is consistently good, with standout items like fluffy pancakes and the Kansas City breakfast. While the salads could use more toppings, the staff is quick to address any concerns and aims to please. Overall, a nice place to dine with a homely feel. Give it a try.
First time trying the hot chicken and it was amazing! Definitely the best in Nashville. Will be a must-stop every time we visit.

This cafe inside the grocery store serves the best tuna melt I have ever had. The service was exceptional and very attentive. I can't believe it's located inside a store – they should consider expanding without the attached store as it would be incredible.

I am thrilled to have found a spot in St. Louis where I can enjoy sautéed seafood in a plastic bag. The sauce was delicious and added a fantastic flavor. The service was also top-notch. Overall, a great experience.
Do not recommend this drive-thru experience. Many menu items were unavailable and overall service was lacking. Not worth the risk, would suggest avoiding this establishment.

This place has amazing gravy fries that are a must-try. The staff is friendly and entertaining, adding to the unique character of the bar. It's the perfect spot to watch Philly sports teams, particularly the Phillies. Plus, they have a decent selection of beers.

My wife and I had a great time at this bar with a festive atmosphere. Santa and Mrs. Claus made a fun appearance, adding to the holiday cheer. The service was a bit slow, but we didn't mind as we were enjoying ourselves. Overall, a nice spot for a drink or two.

We stumbled upon this hidden gem in South Tucson thanks to Yelp and were pleasantly surprised with our meal at this reconverted 1960's A & W chain stand. The catfish smothered in poblano sauce was a standout dish, tasting authentic and not like the typical farm-raised variety. My wife's chile relleno was fresh and delicious. The enchiladas and chimichangas were enjoyed by the younger members of our group. Overall, a wonderful meal at a reasonable price. Thank you Yelp for another great recommendation!

"Delicious and authentic Indian cuisine with vegetable pakora that was a standout. Entrees were superb and sauces were so good I wanted to drink them. Reasonably priced with okay service. Great addition to Media's dining options, especially with a promising lunch buffet."

If you own a VW, Howard is the go-to guy. While he may be a bit difficult to schedule with, his thoroughness, reliability, knowledge, and efficiency make the wait worth it. Highly recommend for all VW needs.

Dark and Sinister is hands down the best dessert I've ever had. The chocolate ice cream used in their creations is unbeatable. Overall, the desserts here are amazing and a must-try for any chocolate lover.

I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant's oyster happy hour. The dozen oysters and glass of champagne my boyfriend and I shared were a great value at $24 with tip. The staff were attentive and friendly, making us feel right at home. I wish we had tried their famous to-go cups. Overall, I would definitely go back for another visit.

Prep & Pastry is a must-visit for weekend brunch, but be prepared for a wait because it gets busy. The food is amazing, with standout dishes like green eggs & ham. Don't miss out on their delicious cocktails like bloody marys and mimosas. They even gave me a free pastry on my birthday! The fact that they serve EXO coffee, a local favorite, is just the cherry on top of a great breakfast experience.

I love the variety of coffees and teas at this cafe. My current favorite is the iced dirty chai. The staff is friendly and welcoming, never making you feel rushed. The tables are a good size for everyone, and I appreciate the local artists' art for sale. Overall, a great vibe.

The worker provided excellent service, but the overall cost is too high. Hourly pay may incentivize efficiency, but a flat rate option would be more cost-effective for customers. Hiring through Craigslist may be a more affordable alternative.
The Bacon-Bleu cheeseburger is a standout option and one of the best fast food burgers I've had recently. It would make Dave Thomas proud.

Overall, my experience at this cafe was mixed. The carrot cake was decent but overpriced, and the packaging was unnecessary. The ambiance was appealing, but the service left much to be desired. Despite the unique and cute atmosphere, the wait time for our order was frustrating. A good place to go with friends, but not recommended for those seeking prompt service.
: The food at this restaurant is amazing and the service is top-notch. The burgers and pulled pork are the best we've had in the Reno/Sparks area. This will definitely be our new go-to spot.

The Smoked Salmon Frittata at this restaurant was just as delicious as it sounded. The combination of smoked salmon, egg, potato, red bell peppers, goat cheese, and horseradish-dill crema was a perfect balance of flavors. The dish was also accompanied by fresh fruit, making it a satisfying meal. Overall, a great choice for brunch, dinner, or private dining.

Celebrating a 70th birthday at this restaurant was a fantastic experience. Despite the high cost, the steaks and entrees were outstanding, and the service was top-notch. The ambiance added to the special occasion, making it a great choice for a memorable meal.
The food, particularly the fried pickles and smash fries, is delicious. However, the customer service was disappointing.

Despite hearing good things, I was disappointed by this place. Parking was difficult and it took 30 minutes to get our 5 tacos, which were only slightly warm. The taste was average at best, with the buffalo chicken being particularly underwhelming. Overall, it wasn't worth the effort and I don't plan on returning.

MBSC at City Fitness South Street is aimed at pushing people to their limits with intense, varied workouts. It may appeal to those looking for a challenge, but the lack of personalization and repetitive routines may not suit everyone. The environment is geared towards a younger demographic and the cost is on the higher side. Consider trying an introductory program before committing to a monthly membership. Overall, I would rate MBSC at City Fitness South Street 1.5 stars.
Decent BBQ joint with a large cheeseburger and moist pork sandwich, but lacking in flavor. Good BBQ sauce, okay Mac & Cheese. Price is reasonable, but food quality is more like 2.5 stars.
I enjoyed the wide selection of dishes at this Indian buffet, which offered good value for the price. While nothing stood out as exceptional, I would definitely consider returning in the future.

Staff member rude and unaccommodating, forcing us to pay for a one day pass instead of using a guest pass. Ended up going to Retro Fitness for a free trial and had a better experience with superior equipment and environment. Would not recommend this gym.

Brixx is a consistent winner for picky pizza lovers like me. The gluten-free and lunch options are top-notch, and the bar is perfect for post-work relaxation. Arrive early if you want a spot on the popular patio.

This restaurant is a great option for individuals with varying dietary preferences, catering to meat eaters, vegetarians, and vegans alike. I have visited multiple times and have consistently been impressed with the quality of the food. It's a wonderful choice for those looking for a healthy dining option.
The frozen yogurt at this Central Bucks spot was the best I had tried initially, with friendly staff and great flavors. However, I recently discovered another location that rivals it.

The apartment complex in St. Petersburg, FL is simply awesome. Surrounded by lakes, it offers a peaceful environment. The staff at the leasing office are extremely helpful and friendly. Overall, I had a very nice experience staying here and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful stay in St. Petersburg.
A must-stop in NOLA for a prohibition-era bar experience with a fantastic Jazz band and cozy seating area perfect for sipping cocktails. The Vieux Carre was a standout drink.

The sushiritos at this new location definitely had fresh ingredients, but the balance of flavors was off in the slammin' salmon. The Japanese fried chicken was a bit dry and the sauce too sweet and sour. The green tea and lemonade were good, but not standout items. Overall, while the place has potential with its prime location, the high prices for a gimmicky meal make it unlikely we'll return.
Enzo's is a good take out option in the area, with a tasty meatball sub and garlic knots. While I prefer nabruzzi's pizza, I still recommend trying Enzo's for their quality food.

Stopped at Bareburger in Philly after a Prince tribute show and found one of the best burger places on Earth. Huge thanks to Alya and the staff for a fantastic dining experience! Highly recommend. -Andrew von Gregor, Pro Session & Touring Guitarist.

I have visited this Cosi location multiple times while traveling and have always enjoyed their flatbreads and salads. The BBQ chicken flatbread is particularly delicious and comes in a good portion size.

The quality of this place has declined since they began expanding. The owner-operated store on Linbergh had amazing food and service, but now it seems to have gone downhill. Not worth returning to in my opinion.
Overall, my experience at this place was extremely disappointing. The egg roll was terrible and the sushi was chewy. It's no surprise that I was the only one there. I would not recommend dining here.

Overall, this hotel is a great choice if you want to be on Bourbon Street. The staff is hospitable and the room is nice and big. However, the thin walls made it difficult to sleep with noise from vending and ice machines. Would have rated 4 stars otherwise.

Overall, my experience at Ocharleys on a Sunday afternoon was a bit disappointing. The server seemed overwhelmed and forgot multiple items throughout the meal. Despite the mishaps, the manager was able to rectify the situation with the coupon. I may consider giving Ocharleys another try for lunch instead of dinner.

This place is not worth the money. Terrible service, overpriced mediocre food, and lack of innovation. Same disappointing experience on both visits. Save your money and go elsewhere, especially if you're looking for a quality dining experience. Not recommended.
No, there is currently no 12-step program specifically tailored to managing a Reanimator Coffee problem.

What a wonderful addition to the area! With 2 meaderies now within close proximity, we are truly lucky. The flavors of the Goober Vitis, Suzy's Cherry Pie, and coffee meads were pure and perfect. The space itself is welcoming with ample seating inside and out. Highly recommend checking them out!

I highly recommend Pina's for delicious dinner specials, cheesesteaks, calzones, and seafood dishes. The shrimp scampi appetizer and steamed clams are not to be missed and are reasonably priced. The service is consistently flawless, making for a great casual dining experience. Overall, Pina's is a very good option for a tasty meal.

Chatham is a great spot to watch footy while enjoying cheap drinks and delicious food. The fish and chips were a unique and tasty experience. The atmosphere was lively and I had a great time watching my team win. Overall, a solid pub to catch a game.

This nail salon is worth the drive! After trying multiple salons in Tampa, we finally found a place that exceeds our expectations. The talented staff, specifically Pamela and Steven, were able to do exactly what we wanted and the designs were amazing. We will never go anywhere else again!

Belinda and Jerry at this storage facility in Boise went above and beyond to provide exceptional customer service. Despite my late arrival on a snowy evening, they stayed late to assist me and even drove me to my storage unit. Their kindness and helpfulness made my storage experience a positive one. Highly recommend to others!

I had a wonderful experience with Unique- the team was professional, transparent, and honest. The technicians were efficient and friendly, and the pricing was fair. The salesperson and manager were top-notch. I highly recommend them for any home services needs.

This takeout place is our favorite go-to spot. They serve great food with exceptionally fast service. They deliver right to my door, which many places don't do. The staff is friendly, makes great pizza, and runs the business excellently. Highly recommended.
This place offers top-notch street tacos and excellent service, with the added bonus of hand-made horchata. A must-try stop for taco lovers.

I recently went in for a mani and pedi at this salon. My student was friendly and we had a nice chat, but unfortunately, the manicure took 3 hours and my hands look terrible. No one checked in to see if the work was done properly. The pedicure, however, turned out fine and feels great. I don't mind that it took longer due to being a student, but I believe I should not have been charged for the manicure, or at least should have had someone else redo them. After only 15 minutes, my nails already looked bad. Additionally, my pedicure was ruined as soon as I put my shoes back on, despite being assured it was dry. I would rate the service 0 stars but gave 2 stars for the friendly student. Definitely not worth the $34 I paid. See the pictures for yourself.

This restaurant offers a cozy and peaceful atmosphere with a selection of Chinese and sushi dishes. The Szechuan chicken, hot and sour soup, and prime rib and shrimp hot pot were all delicious and portion sizes were just right. Service was exceptional. Highly recommend.

Frank is an exceptional dentist who truly cares about his patients. He has a gentle manner and takes a sincere interest in providing top quality care. I have been going to him for years and highly recommend him to anyone in need of a great dentist.

I had a great experience at this spot with sidewalk lounge seating and a DJ outside on Friday night. The walk up bar was a nice touch and the decor inside was impressive. The appetizers were delicious and the location in a trendy waterfront area added to the overall ambiance. I would definitely recommend checking it out.

I highly recommend the Friday happy hour special at this office. Great deal, delicious food and drinks, and a fun atmosphere. The pork sliders and beignets were standout dishes. Friendly staff made for a wonderful experience overall.

Stopped in for a light bite and was impressed by the great service, fresh food, and beautiful atmosphere. Lisa was a fantastic host who made the evening more enjoyable with her knowledge of the menu and frequent check-ins. Will definitely be returning for more.

Lush in New Orleans is my favorite out of all the ones I've been to in various locations. The store has a strong, inviting scent that you can smell from a block away. Visiting on Halloween is always a fun experience. Highly recommend checking it out if you're in the area!

Love this place for Happy Hour and dinner! The Asian Nachos are a must-try, they are almost like a meal on their own. The creme brulee and other desserts are amazing. The blueberry mojito and mango sling are delicious. Great place to celebrate special occasions. The bar area can get crowded later for Happy Hour. Parking around the mall is always a challenge. Overall, a nice atmosphere for dining. Brunch is okay, not as great as expected.

I have consistently had a great experience at this bakery. The pastries are delicious and made with top tier ingredients. The poor ratings are unjustified, in my opinion. The service is always friendly and accommodating, even for someone like me who can be demanding. I am thrilled to have them making macarons for my wedding. Highly recommend.

While the ingredients are fresh and the service is great, the pizza at this place is disappointing. The thin crust makes it cold within minutes, and the pizza is bland and floppy. With many other pizzerias in the area, I won't be returning.

The tap room at bier is a great spot to try out unique and constantly changing beers. While I struggled to find beers that I loved on my first visit, I appreciate the commitment to rotating taps and creativity. The atmosphere is fun and lively, with a lounge area for relaxation and conversation. I look forward to giving them another chance to impress me in the future. 3 stars for now, but potential for improvement.

Sweet Confections provided a beautifully sweet ending to our trip in NOLA. The cupcakes and truffles were delicious, with the mocha filling and raspberry truffle standing out as favorites. The coffee was a wonderful addition, not too strong or bitter. The seating was cozy and the service was excellent, although one more staff member may have improved the experience. Overall, a great spot for a sweet treat on Magazine St. 4 out of 5 stars.

The pulled pork sandwich was delicious, but the Lucky Bun burger was a disappointing letdown due to the use of a frozen beef patty. The toppings and sauces were great, and the bread was good, but the processed patty killed the flavors. If a fresh ground meat had been used, it would have been a great gourmet burger.

This family-friendly cafe is perfect for kids with a variety of treats like juice, cake, and homemade popsicles. The atmosphere feels like a tea party for the little ones, while adults can enjoy items like homemade doughnuts, patbingsu, and classic coffee with cream and sugar. Highly recommend trying their diverse menu options.

Always awesome! The best crust ever with fresh ingredients and unique toppings. The staff is friendly and the salads are great. The patio area is perfect for enjoying a beer or glass of wine while savoring the best pizza in town.
This gas station is a lifesaver for me working at a beachfront hotel. I send guests here regularly and it's the only one on Clearwater Beach open 24/7. Highly recommended!
This place in St. Pete is amazing and a must-visit. Everything on the menu is delicious and will leave you in a food coma. 5 stars!

I had a great experience at this Chipotle location. I appreciate the recognition for Teacher Appreciation Week. The service was quick and the food was fresh and tasty. My go-to bowl with steak and all the toppings never disappoints. Don't forget to grab some fresh tortilla chips to complete the meal!
Overall, Jimmy John's offers the standard fare with nothing particularly outstanding or disappointing. The restaurant was exceptionally clean, providing a pleasant dining experience.

During my family vacation in St. Petersburg, Dooners was hands down my favorite meal. The food was delicious and the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the area and I would gladly return for another meal.

The bar at the Alexander Hotel is a must-visit for cocktail enthusiasts. The vintage cocktails, especially "The Elephant in the Room," served in its own decanter filled with cherrywood smoke, are a highlight. The comfortable seating and beautiful deck with street views make for a great atmosphere. The added bonus of watching people work out at the CityWay YMCA through the glass is a unique touch. And don't forget about the addictive truffle oil and sea salt popcorn - it's as good as it sounds. Grab a beer, enjoy the cocktails, and start collecting those popcorn bags - you won't be able to stop.

This hotel in the heart of Philadelphia is a true gem. The rooms are spacious, modern, and beautifully decorated, giving off a cozy and charming vibe. The free breakfast is a convenient touch, and the 24/7 lobby offerings of coffee, tea, water, and fruit make for a comfortable stay. The staff is polite, helpful, and attentive to guests' needs. Despite some noise concerns, the location and amenities of the hotel make it a great choice for travelers. Just be prepared for the tight street and stand-up shower, and don't expect a remarkable view. Overall, a highly recommended stay in Philadelphia.

This hidden gem in NE Philadelphia offers delicious and generous portions for a great price. The oxtail soup (Sancocho) was flavorful with a hearty broth and beefy potatoes, while the flat steak (Carne Asada) disappeared in seconds. Reminiscent of Nanzhou, this place is a must-visit for those craving cheap, delicious eats. Don't miss out on this spot!

I recently visited this place with my friends and we tried a variety of donuts, all of which were delicious. However, the standout for me was the fried chicken sandwich. It was incredibly tasty and I highly recommend trying it out.

If you're willing to splurge a bit, this place is worth it. Delicious food, including a must-try green eggs and ham breakfast biscuit. The Santa Barbara tri-tip sandwich was excellent, and the cold brew coffee hit the spot. Cute space, although a bit hard to find. Lots of good choices in the grab-and-go section, like the salami and pesto sandwich. Overall, a great experience and I would definitely return. Just be prepared for the higher prices typical of Santa Barbara.
The food is delicious, but the service is consistently slow, even when it's not busy. This inconsistency is disappointing and should be improved.

This Indian restaurant is a favorite of mine for its delicious meals. The ambiance is casual but pleasant, with prompt seating and friendly service. The food is the real highlight here, with soft naan and flavorful dishes such as Masala and Vindaloo. While not as spicy as I prefer, the dishes are still flavorful and satisfying. Don't miss out on the Rice Pudding and Gulab Jamun dessert for a sweet finish to your meal. Overall, a great choice for tasty Indian cuisine.
burger I have ever tasted. The flavor profiles and quality of the meat make it truly exceptional. I highly recommend trying it.

Based on the review, it seems like the stadium has several shortcomings including poor food options, lack of vendors, small TVs, and messy surroundings. The reviewer also warns about rude and drunk Philly fans, recommending visitors to bring their own food and be cautious. Overall, the stadium is described as a disappointing and unpleasant experience.

I absolutely loved this place! The old school diner vibe was fantastic, and the workers were incredibly nice. The gumbo was delicious, even for someone who doesn't like shrimp. The split pea soup was the best I've ever had. The prices are insanely affordable, we ordered a lot of food and beers for only $25. Great deal!

This jewelry store is a gem! Ali and Albisia are wonderful owners who create stunning and unique pieces that are hard to resist. The store has a great atmosphere with music and wine offered while you browse. I can't wait to visit Tampa again and add more of their beautiful jewelry to my collection!

The menu at this place is good and the ingredients are solid, but the sandwiches are poorly assembled. The Turkey and Brie Wrap and Spinach Florentine Wrap were more like crumples than wraps. The staff seemed confused and rushed, with no clear direction for customers. Signs to direct traffic would be helpful.

This bakery is absolutely amazing! The employees are super attentive and the desserts are crafted perfectly. The banana puddings are a must-try, with multiple layers of deliciousness. The upside pineapple cake is also fantastic, with a dense and flavorful cake. Highly recommend this place for delicious desserts, just be sure to bring cash for tipping as they only accept payment through an iPad.

I recently visited the new Paoli location and was impressed by the wide selection of delicious donuts. Compared to Dunkin's offerings, these donuts are a delightful change with flavors like Salted Caramel, Bacon Maple, and Lemon. The breakfast sandwiches, muffins, and bagels were also tasty additions to the menu. Overall, a great spot for a morning treat.

After a disappointing experience, the Hermitage O'Charley's manager Chris reached out to offer a second chance. Despite initially declining special attention, the follow-up visit was wonderful with attentive service, delicious food, and a great overall experience. Subsequent visits have also been consistently enjoyable. Highly recommend giving this location another try.

I am in love with my haircut! The prices are very reasonable and this is my second time visiting. The first time, the cut and style were amazing but the color was slightly off. Nonetheless, I still looked good and will continue to be a returning customer. Highly recommend!

This Thai restaurant goes above and beyond with their attention to detail in both the food and presentation. They prioritize healthy and delicious options, offering unique ingredients like Japanese squash and white and black sticky rice in their dishes. The sauces are outstanding and there is a wide variety of menu options to choose from. They easily accommodate special dietary needs and even provide thoughtful touches like welcome snacks and rose-shaped straw wrappers. This will be our new go-to spot for Thai cuisine.

This grocery store in Mid-city is a hidden gem with a fantastic deli, soup, hot bar, and salad bar. It's like a more affordable version of Whole Foods with the added bonus of weekend crawfish or lobster boils. The fried chicken is a must-try! Would definitely make this my go-to store if I lived in the area. Plus, supporting a local business is always a plus.

I absolutely loved my experience at this local cafe/coffee shop in the French quarter of New Orleans. The food and coffee were fantastic, the atmosphere was friendly and casual, and the Victorian architecture added to the charm. The service was a bit slow, but the barista was personable. The variety of seating options, including indoor and outdoor tables, a booth, and a counter, made it perfect for relaxing. The dog-friendly policy was a nice touch, although not for everyone. My only complaint is that I could only visit once on my trip.

While the teas offered are of good quality, the high pressure sales tactics and exorbitant prices make them hard to justify. I would recommend exploring more affordable options such as Republic of Tea or Twinings.

Despite the convenient location, ample parking, and spacious tables with a fireplace for ambiance, my experience at Millers was disappointing. Despite the long wait times, the food was ultimately underwhelming. The portion sizes were huge but lacked flavor, and the presentation and taste left much to be desired. The service was good, with our server being attentive and pleasant, but the overall dining experience fell short. The plastic dishes and high prices did not match the quality of the food. I won't be returning to Millers, and my husband will only consider takeout for the wings.

not so poor. Despite the nice facilities, the lack of attention to detail and subpar cleaning services are major drawbacks. Frustrating experience for a member who has been coming for 6 months. Communication issues with non-English speaking staff further complicates the situation. Potential for improvement is evident, but the disappointment lingers.

The Libertine offers a unique and refreshing experience, with fresh ingredients used in their drinks down to the crushed ice. The atmosphere is welcoming, but the restroom signs may be confusing due to dim lighting and similar faces on the pictures. Overall, a good choice for a first-time visit to a liquor bar.
