Came here based on a recommendation and was not disappointed. The pizza was top-notch and the staff was friendly. Quick service and an overall solid experience. Would definitely return and recommend to others.

The cheddar curds from the Collingswood Art Festival are a bit pricey but definitely worth it. They are perfectly flavored, not greasy, and incredibly delicious. The cheese is stringy and melty, and the sauces complement it perfectly. Once you try them, you'll want to have them again. Well worth the splurge. A must-try for cheese lovers.

Yats offers delicious Cajun creations at an affordable price. The variety of choices written in sidewalk chalk on a blackboard, including vegetarian options, makes it easy to find something you'll love. The split plate option and the amazing garlic bread are definite highlights. Plus, owner Joe Vuskovich is a local celebrity known for his secret spice and support of the community. Highly recommended for a unique and tasty dining experience.

Pi is a consistent favorite with excellent service and delicious deep dish and thin crust pizzas. The hostess went above and beyond after our previous dining disaster, seating us promptly and even comping us garlic bread. Highly recommend.
Overall, I had a positive experience getting my wisdom teeth removed at this dental office. However, the inconsistency of seeing different dentists over the past 5 years has been a drawback for me.

This place was recommended by a fellow Yelp Elite. We arrived on a Saturday morning and there was already a line forming. The takoyaki was delicious and the fried octopus was good, but could have used more mayo. The ramen noodles were overcooked and didn't quite fit with the dish. The broth was flavorful, but the red chili broth was too spicy for my liking. Pricing was reasonable and the decor was nice, but screaming kids running around made the meal less pleasant.

After trying numerous top breakfast spots in Philly, this small cafe stands out as the best. The dishes are fresh, flavorful, and simplistic. Despite the cozy space, the menu could rival even larger establishments like Parc. Highly recommended for breakfast fanatics.

This diner exceeded my expectations. Despite its humble appearance, the food was fantastic. The biscuits and gravy were exceptional and the portions were very generous. I would highly recommend dining here.

Lüke is a trendy and hip spot, though maybe too loud and casual for some. The food is definitely worth trying, from crispy Brussels sprouts to delicious pork schnitzel. The staff is attentive and friendly. Reservations are recommended as the place gets busy. Overall, a solid 4-star experience.

Amazing beers, especially the porter, double IPA, and table gutt. Food is killer, especially if you like Russian cuisine. Special with sausage and sauerkraut was tasty, and pickled everything appetizer was a great choice. This place rules.

Rickshaw is hands down the best sushi spot in Reno for those who value fresh fish over fancy rolls and sauces. Their Nigiri and sashimi options are top-notch and unbeatable in terms of quality. If you're a true sushi aficionado, Rickshaw is definitely worth checking out.

Overall, my first visit to this restaurant left me unimpressed. Parking was difficult, but the beer selection was good. The fried olives were a standout appetizer, but the rest were just okay. The blue cheese chips, calamari, and meat/cheese platter didn't wow me. I might give this place another chance, but I wasn't thrilled with my experience.
The restaurant has a nice ambiance and location, but the limited menu and average food don't live up to the hype. It's fine for a wait, but nothing special worth writing home about.

This place was amazing! The ice cream was delicious, especially the pumpkin cake and nutter butter flavors. The brownie sundae was a huge hit, and the service was friendly and accommodating. Can't wait to come back to try the hot chocolate next time!

The restaurant, located where an O'Henry's once stood, was fairly empty for a Friday lunch. We were seated upstairs, which lacked ambiance but decided to stay. The Catfish Acadian was delicious, with a mystery sauce that paired perfectly with the fish. The vegetables were also well-prepared. The pork chop was not as impressive. Our waitress Bria was attentive and personable. The food was good, but the atmosphere was lacking. Might return for dinner to sit on the balcony as suggested.

Overall, my first experience at this establishment was extremely disappointing. From the undercooked appetizers to the lack of jumbo wings and finding a feather in my food, it was clear that the quality at this place was lacking. The waitress' attitude towards us, compared to other customers, was also concerning and made me feel unwelcome. The manager did eventually comp our entire meal, but that does not make up for the overall poor experience. I will not be returning and would not recommend this place, especially for same-sex couples. 1 out of 5 stars.

This review expresses frustration with the continued existence of a K-Mart store that refuses to go out of business despite being outdated and poorly managed. The reviewer longs for a superior retailer like Target to come and replace the outdated store. They cite multiple instances of false advertising and price manipulation as reasons for their dissatisfaction with the store.

Don't be deceived by the exterior, this place is surprisingly charming inside. The food is tasty and affordable. The papaya salad was a bit heavy on the fish sauce, but the triple flavor duck and king tofu soup were both winners. Plus, it's BYO which is always a bonus!

The Mazzoni Center provides a comfortable and inclusive environment for individuals needing sensitive healthcare services. While the physical space of the clinic may feel exposed, the staff prioritizes respect for your identity and needs. Drop-in appointments may result in long waits, but calling ahead for advice on timing can help. Occasionally, there may be lapses in communication, but overall, the service provided is attentive and understanding. If the doctor you need to speak with is unavailable, leaving a message with reception will result in quick assistance.

This BBQ restaurant does not meet Texan standards. The sample platter was disappointing - chicken tasted like frozen meat, ribs were all cartilage, sausage was bland, and the sauce was overly sweet. Prices were high for what felt like a child's portion. Would not recommend to anyone.

Overall, this is a really great place for wine lovers. The happy hour deals are fantastic, with $5 glasses and $5 off bottles. The food, especially the cheese plates and sandwiches, is delicious. The ambiance is warm and inviting, especially in the enclosed patio area. The service is also top-notch. Highly recommend for a night out with friends or a romantic evening.

The staff was rude and unable to get a simple salad order correct. The prices for slices were also overpriced. Despite being the only customers, the wait for food was excessively long. Save your money and avoid this place.
Authentic and delicious Mexican cuisine that rivals homecooked meals. Standout dishes include the enchiladas with mole and carne asada tacos. A must-try for those craving authentic Mexican flavors.
The Cinnamon Rolls from the bake house are a must-have for anyone seeking pure happiness and delight. Pair it with a cup of coffee and a fresh salad for a perfect Saturday morning breakfast treat.

I was very disappointed with the carrot cake at this bakery. It had a strange taste of licorice and baking soda cooking powder, and the addition of chocolate chips did not work well. It's a shame because everything else at the bakery looked delicious.
The unlimited food prices are unbeatable, but the quality varies. Delicious sushi, subpar salad, and disappointing crab Rangoon. Will go again, but have had better overall dining experiences.
The chicken at this Bourbon St. establishment is truly exceptional. Both the chicken itself and the sauce are top-notch. Overall, a fantastic choice for a delicious meal.

The burger at this restaurant is on the pricier side at $16, but it is incredibly delicious and worth the cost. The patty size is generous and the unique ingredients, such as gruyere stuffed in a pepper, enhance the flavor. The fries are crispy and well-seasoned, and the bun is top-notch. The atmosphere is cozy and there are plenty of craft beer options available. This spot may be busy on weekends, but the quality of the food makes it worth the potential wait.
Disappointing breakfast experience on 12/2/17. Slow service, cold coffee, warm grits, and long waits for food and payment. Better breakfast options in the area. Should have gone elsewhere.

Termini Brothers is simply the best! Their dessert trays are always a hit at our family events. Being from an Italian family, we always have their cannolis on hand and they never disappoint. Highly recommend their delicious treats!
This hotel is fantastic with excellent service and great dining options. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Highly recommended for a pleasant stay.
After our trip to New Orleans, returning to Reno made me appreciate this place even more! The shrimp po boy is a must-try and the corn bread is absolutely delicious. Highly recommend!

Overall, the people at this place are friendly, but avoid going to Katie. She rushed through my hair appointment, slapping on color and cutting it quickly. I felt like she was in a hurry to leave, which was upsetting considering the high cost of the service. I left feeling shaken up by the experience.

This spot near Vandy is a must-visit for breakfast in Nashville. The banana pancakes are a must-try - they're like banana bread in pancake form. Be sure to park in the back lot and grab a parking ticket from the machine for free parking. It's always busy, but worth the wait. A perfect breakfast spot that I never leave Nashville without visiting.

MexiCali in University City offers a variety of delicious vegan options that are easily customizable by holding the cheese. The marinated tofu burrito is a standout, with a chewy texture and protein-packed ingredients. The sweet potato and plantain burrito, veggie tacos, and guacamole burrito are all tasty choices for vegans. The restaurant has a loyal following and efficient service, making it a popular choice for a satisfying plant-based meal.

The breakfast fare at this establishment was overall great with standout items like the eggs provençale and pastries. However, the inconsistent cooking of the eggs and horrendously bad coffee were major drawbacks. The presence of misspellings on the menu also raised concerns about attention to detail.

This restaurant offers a lively atmosphere with big screen TVs, but is not your typical sports bar. The location is cool and there is a good selection of beer. The food is delicious, but may not align with traditional pub grub expectations. Great for a bustling and energetic experience, but not ideal for a casual burger and beer outing to watch a game.

I had a fabulous, quick, and stress-free windshield repair experience with this company. The best part was that it didn't cost me anything out of pocket. I would definitely use their services again and highly recommend them to others.

This meal was truly outstanding from start to finish. The service was exceptional and the food was some of the best I've had in New Orleans. The oysters good enough were a must-try starter, and the scallops and swine with butternut squash purée was a standout entree. The dessert, cafe au lait panna cotta with mini glazed donuts, was a delightful ending to the meal. The house made 'cellos were a unique and delicious touch. Overall, an amazing dining experience that I would highly recommend.

BARRA exceeded all our expectations during Restaurant week. From strong and delicious blood orange margaritas to flavorful veal and beef meatballs, every dish was a hit. The fishermen stew was a surprise standout and the steak with cauliflower puree was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The service was top-notch, with a waiter who guided us through the menu and checked in frequently. BARRA is a must-visit for those seeking great food, excellent service, and a cozy atmosphere at a reasonable price. Highly recommend!

Despite the long wait and tight seating, the breakfast at this bustling restaurant was worth it. The cornmeal pancakes were hearty and fluffy, and the banana pancakes were delicious as well. The only downside was the limited amount of bacon in the side dish. The service was good considering how busy it was. A recommended spot for a tasty breakfast, just don't expect great coffee.
Disappointing experience at this bar on a Monday. Asked the bartender to put on the NBA game but was told she was watching Netflix. Lacking in customer service. Won't be returning.

The Pearl deserves more stars than I can give. The food, service, and ambiance are all top-notch. I thoroughly enjoy every visit and it truly is more than just dinner - it's a dining experience. Treat yourself to a meal here and pamper yourself.

The bagels at this place are pretty good, but be sure to ask for extra cream cheese if you like a lot. The staff is always pleasant, which is unique to Dunedin. However, I was disappointed to learn that the guy preparing the food doesn't wash his hands or wear gloves. He handled money, used the phone, and wiped his nose before making my bagel. This unhygienic behavior has led me to decide not to return. If cleanliness is not a major concern for you, the bagels are still worth a try.
While my husband's cut turned out great, unfortunately, my son's did not meet expectations. It may be worth sticking with the original stylist for consistency in the future.
Overall, the steak was good but on the pricier side. The guacamole was nothing remarkable, despite being made in front of us.

I love coming to New Day Meadery in Fountain Square! The variety of meads and ciders is excellent and the staff is always friendly. I usually go for the South Cider or Shelby Blue Ribbon, but I recently tried the seasonal Paulding Light and enjoyed the unique mix of flavors. It's not as sweet as I usually like, but that's what I appreciate about New Day - something for everyone. Definitely one of my favorite spots to visit!
I believe this location is an improvement over the Philadelphia one, but Szechuan House in Hamilton, NJ remains the top choice in my opinion.
The food and service at this restaurant are exceptional - everything is fresh and bursting with flavor. I will definitely be returning.

Disappointing experience at Make Up For Ever KOP. Bought $75 worth of products, didn't like them after trying for 5 days. Couldn't return because opened, had to exchange and spend more money. Not in love with products, won't be buying from them again. Sephora in KOP has better return policy for same products.

My favorite happy hour spot in Center City! Discovered it during center city sips in 2011 and have been hooked since. The appetizers are amazing, especially the mac & cheese. Great beer selection and cozy basement space for private parties. Occasionally some unwanted guests wanting to use the ATM and restroom, but don't let that deter you. Just go and enjoy!

Consistently receiving the wrong drink (peach tea lemonade instead of green tea lemonade) on three separate occasions is frustrating and inconvenient. Having to turn around and go back inside to have the drink remade is a hassle that could easily be avoided with better attention to detail.

The pizza was average and the experience was not exceptional. The staff making the pizza were friendly, but the cashier lacked enthusiasm. It was fast and efficient, but nothing to write home about. Wouldn't go out of my way to return, but may consider it if already in the neighborhood.

The restaurant had a friendly hostess and impressive remodel, but suffered from a strong dirty mop water stench. Limited menu options were surprising, but the "Knuckle Sandwich" was delicious. However, the mushroom swiss burger was small and bland, and the chicken strips lacked seasoning. Service was hindered by the loud dining room and lukewarm beer. Overall, room for improvement but potential for success. 2 stars.

I had a delicious breakfast at Tuttini a few months ago, but my recent lunch experience was disappointing. Despite the sign stating they serve lunch until 2:30 PM, I was turned away at 1:45 PM. The kitchen closed early, and I had to go elsewhere for lunch. The inconsistency in service left a negative impression.
I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant. The service was quick and friendly, the portion sizes were generous for the price, and the pancakes were cooked to perfection. I highly recommend it.

I keep coming back to this restaurant because the food is fantastic, the atmosphere is calm and quiet, and the staff are friendly. The crepes are the best I've ever had - amazingly delicious. I highly recommend this place to my friends and have always heard great feedback from them as well.

Tires Plus in Flourtown has consistently provided efficient service every time I have purchased tires from them. My recent visit for mounting new Michelins was no exception - my car was worked on promptly and returned to me within an hour. Highly recommend for quick and reliable tire services.

Wildflower Cafe is a fantastic spot for brunch. The Wildflower Triple option was a hit for us, allowing for customization and delicious choices. The food was top-notch and the service was very welcoming. We are considering returning during our stay in town.

My partner and I had an amazing time at happy hour thanks to the exceptional service from Vaughn and Mark. The free appetizer was delicious and the slot machines added an extra element of fun. We will definitely be returning for more of the same great experience. Highly recommend!
This place offers delicious yogurt and crepes. Definitely worth a try!

The event was extremely crowded and lacking in wine options. Most vendors were advertising or selling beer and food. By 3 o'clock, many tables were already out of supplies. Not worth the money and likely won't return next year.

Overall, my experience at this restaurant has been great. The servers are attentive and dedicated to making sure you have a fantastic dining experience. The seafood was good, considering the lack of fresh options in the area. The sauce options were tasty, with a unique Asian twist. The price range is comparable to other similar seafood establishments, making it a decent value for the quality of food and service. I would recommend giving this place a try and I plan on returning in the future.

The food at this restaurant was well prepared and fresh, with the homemade oso bucco ravioli being a standout. However, the ravioli were light on filling which affected the flavor. The service was great, but the loud environment made it difficult to have a conversation. The cramped tables make it not ideal for a date night. The BYOB policy is a plus, but overall there are better options in the neighborhood with less noise, more space, and more flavor.

Moving to Philadelphia from the Midwest as a 19-year-old, Yuengling Lager quickly became one of my top five favorite beers. Smooth, sweet, and cheap, it feels like me in a bottle. I appreciate the rustic bottle caps and the varying taste per batch. The relatively low alcohol content is a plus for me. The tour was enjoyable, with a funny British guide who took a liking to my grandpa. The facility had a nostalgic 50's feel, similar to my high school. The tasting was fantastic, with ample opportunities to try the lager. The fact that Dick Yuengling prioritized rehiring laid-off workers after a closure earns this family-owned business an extra star in my book. A must-visit for beer enthusiasts looking to support a local brewery in the face of big beer companies.

During Mardi Gras weekend, this place is convenient for its proximity to the parade route and outdoor seating area. However, the service was lackluster with bartenders who were terrible at taking drink orders and had no knowledge of basic beer terms. The pizza was also disappointing. The only positive was the availability of Port-O-Potties.

I highly recommend this place for a relaxing and friendly pedicure experience. The environment is clean and the staff are very nice. Great place to treat yourself to a pampering session for your toes.

The new burger spot downtown, part of the Harry & Izzy's chain, offers tasty burgers but be prepared to order sides separately. They take reservations and provide excellent service. However, if you're looking for non-burger options, this may not be the best spot for you. A lunch special during the week could attract a bigger crowd during work hours. Overall, a great experience worth checking out.

I was disappointed with my experience at this restaurant. The salad was good, but the pizza was boring, tasteless, and unsatisfying. The interior was cold on a chilly night, adding to my disappointment. This was my third visit and I won't be returning.

Overall, the experience was disappointing as the sandwich bar was closed and the burrito was reheated in the microwave, tasted unpleasant, and was overpriced at $8. The combination of cream of chicken and old cheese on top was unappetizing. I would recommend going to Taco Bell instead for a better meal.

The brewpub has a nice old-school atmosphere with plenty of games for children. The beer selection is good, although some more adventurous offerings would be appreciated. The food is hit or miss, with tasty burgers and desserts but some items being too salty. Overall, a nice place to relax with a ploughman's plate and beer.

Zen Yai offers excellent prices for their curry dishes, with most priced under $12. The cozy atmosphere is both a pro and a con, as it can be a nice experience without a wait, but can get crowded on busy evenings. The decor is vibrant and colorful, adding to the overall ambiance. Service was quick and efficient. The Pineapple curry was delicious, although the green curry was disappointing for a seasoned green curry lover. Overall, a solid option for affordable and flavorful Thai cuisine.

After several stays, this hotel has become my favorite. The staff is truly exceptional, from the housekeeping to the valets. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and special touches like Sucre chocolates at turn-down service make it feel welcoming. Special K was amazing and the valet service was efficient. The Gold Status reception was a nice touch. The only issue was a mini-bar charge, which was quickly resolved. Looking forward to returning.
The rolls and sake were fantastic. The bamboo room added to the experience, but it may not be suitable for everyone due to its accessibility.

I love that they offer food delivery, and the gyro I ordered was huge and delicious. The tzaziki was perfect and the meat was tender. I didn't even need the fries that came with it. I will definitely be a repeat customer.

I stopped in for takeout and a drink during happy hour. I tried the dragonberry iced tea which was refreshing but not overly cocktail-like. The lemongrass chicken and rice was fantastic, although I wished the crab rangoon had more filling. Overall, the food and service have never disappointed me in my multiple visits.
I highly recommend the #1 Deluxe at this establishment. The quality and service are consistently great. Amanda provided exceptional customer service, going above and beyond.

I had high hopes for this charming hotel in a great location, with unique rooms that suited my style. Unfortunately, my experience was tainted by the presence of bed bugs. The management was accommodating in dealing with the issue, but the inconvenience, expense, and worry about bringing the bugs home made me decide I would never stay here again. I would caution others to think twice before booking a stay here until all carpets and mattresses are replaced to ensure the bugs are eradicated.

I arrived at the restaurant at 8:30am on a Saturday and was seated immediately with no wait. I ordered the sweet potato pancakes with cinnamon cream syrup which were good, but the hash browns were borderline awful. The total bill came to $24.43 before tip. The lack of paper towels in the restroom was disappointing. Overall, I probably wouldn't return, but I would rather buy the syrup and make pancakes at home.

Although the store is never crowded and easy to navigate, the state of the red baskets is off-putting. It's nice that they have opened up aisles for easier access, but it always seems like they are short on cashiers. Despite this, the selection of products at Marsh is always good. Fix the baskets and staffing issues for a better shopping experience.

Creative food and good quality ingredients shine at this restaurant. The coffee and tea served while waiting to be seated are top-notch, and their Bloody Marys are a must-try. Every visit is an adventure with interesting dishes on the menu.
This place has a great atmosphere and a wide variety of beers to choose from. The Asian chicken salads and Cajun pasta were both delicious. We will definitely be coming back.

I have been a fan of this place since I first discovered it 25 years ago at the University of Delaware. I'm thrilled to see it expanding to more locations but I can't wait for it to come to Huntsville, AL. This specific location had plenty of seating, was clean, and played good music. The only downside was the lack of Herr's chips, but that's a minor issue. If this location is anything like the others I've been to, it will be great!

The prices seemed reasonable at first, but ended up being deceptive due to the additional charges for every little thing. The food quality was subpar, with hard and dry rice and sad, limp burritos. The waitress we had on both visits had a horrible attitude. The only saving grace was the guac and strong margaritas. The strategy seems to be getting customers drunk enough to overlook the poor food and service.

My boyfriend and I tried out a new Italian restaurant in Trolley Square and we were blown away. The waiter was friendly and knowledgeable, the food was fresh and delicious, and the portion sizes were generous. The prosciutto wrapped shrimp and Penne Alla Vodka were standout dishes, and the cannoli was the best we've ever had. Overall, a fantastic dining experience with a great deal on the night we visited. Highly recommend checking this place out for a tasty Italian meal at a good price.

The restaurant deserves 3.5 stars for not serving alcohol, which was disappointing after a long week. However, the margherita pie was delicious and the Greek salad was full of fresh, tasty veggies. Overall, a good choice for a flavorful meal.

I love Mr. Wizard's for their healthier frozen yogurt options and customizable combinations. The outdoor seating only limitation can be inconvenient in colder weather, but overall a great spot for a tasty treat.

The restaurant offers a wide variety of menu options, from breakfast to dessert, and is open 24 hours. The food was excellent, the staff was friendly, but the significance behind the name and logo remains unclear. Overall, a great spot to visit when in town.
I had an incredible dining experience at Spasso with my friends. The seafood special over pappardelle was to die for and the service was amazing. Can't wait to visit again soon!

I returned to the salon for a fill, but canceled my pedicure when I found out it would be over $85. The owner initially seemed nice but completely ignored me once I refused to pay their high prices. She even reassigned my nail tech without explanation. The owner prioritized new customers over me, which showed poor customer service. I ultimately left without being serviced due to the flaky business practices. Not everyone is willing to spend hundreds of dollars at a nail salon, regardless of the quality of products used.

While the ice cream at this Belmawr spot wasn't anything special and felt overpriced, it did satisfy my sweet craving. The service was friendly but slow, and the cozy decor added to the charm. If I lived nearby, I might return, but it's not worth making a special trip for.

Devlin's is the best auto body shop in Philadelphia, in my opinion. Ed Devlin worked his magic on my Honda Fit, which had accumulated nicks, dents, scratches, and lime deposit stains. When I got my car back, it looked brand new. The work was affordable and I was pleasantly surprised by the final bill. Ed Devlin is a miracle worker.

45 may not have anything flashy about it, but it's a comfortable "Cheers" bar where everyone knows your name (if you can see through the cigarette smoke). The laid back vibe and game day spreads make it a favorite hangout spot, especially for Red Sox fans. Plus, the food truck outside is a tasty bonus. Perfect for pre or post-show drinks if you're catching a gig at Tipitinas nearby.

The coffee is definitely top-notch, but the process of having to ask for cream and sugar can be off-putting. It's a bit pretentious and unnecessary for something as simple as coffee customization. Just give me my coffee the way I like it without the added hassle.

While all I've tried at this brunch spot are their grits, they are so amazing that it's hard to resist ordering them every time. The portion is huge and can easily be shared with another person. The option to top your dish with additional ingredients is a great bonus, and I love adding on avocados, red bell peppers, bacon, cheddar, and mushrooms. The grits themselves are perfectly creamy and flavorful. I'm sure their other courses are just as fantastic, but for now, I can't get enough of their grits.
Great staff, delicious chili cheese etoufee, and the option to sit outside on a nice evening. The only downside is that it's cash only. Make sure to try the garlic sauce! 4/5 stars.

The outside tables offer a nice view, perfect for enjoying a drink. The food and service are standard beach fare, but the location is great for a casual and relaxing atmosphere. Ideal spot for a drink with a view.

I would give six or even seven stars if possible. Lou at All About Hair is absolutely fantastic. After a three year search for a great barber, I finally found this gem. Lou not only gave me an incredible haircut, but also provided great conversation and a welcoming environment. I haven't written a Yelp! review in a long time, but I had to share my amazing experience at All About Hair. Highly recommend.

Overall, the experience at the previous trip was not ideal due to the poor performance of the derma bond, resulting in a scar for a young child. Despite this, the reviewer would still consider taking their kids back to the same place.

This hotel offers stunning airport views and the unique experience of dining at the only revolving rooftop restaurant. It is conveniently connected to the airport with various dining and shopping options. The panoramic views from the restaurant overlooking the runways and control tower are truly memorable.
I absolutely love this place! The turkey, beans, and biscuits are phenomenal. The pecan pie could be better, but that won't deter me from returning.

The restaurant has a large menu, clean facilities, and friendly staff. Despite being busy during our visit, the service was prompt. The sandwich we had was delicious and they offer a decent selection of draft beer, wine, and mixed drinks. The family-friendly atmosphere with crayons at each table and large sheets of paper for kids to draw on added to our enjoyment of the meal. Overall, a great experience for a family style restaurant and bar.
The crab cocktail was delicious and my husband loved his steamers. The only downside was the restaurant's high humidity, a fan would be a nice addition.

Freddy's offers the best fast-food style burgers with fresh meat and fantastic toppings. Their delicious fries with "fry" sauce complement the meal perfectly. The custard is rich, creamy, and absolutely delicious. Overall, Freddy's is a must-try for burger and custard lovers.
Delicious and affordable donuts! The blueberry cake and apple fritter were both amazing. Will be returning for more.

While I had a wonderful experience at the Nashville location, my visit to the New Orleans location was disappointing. Arriving late at 10pm, we waited for 25 minutes without any service or apology due to the kitchen being behind on orders. I hope this is not a reflection of other locations in the chain.

Overall, Allegro's offers cheap and fast pizza with a great variety of options including stuffed crust. However, the service can be occasionally rude and the atmosphere may be less than ideal due to the presence of "crazies" talking to themselves.

The Peppermill Casino in Reno is a must-visit. Top-notch service, clean rooms, and excellent amenities await guests. The casino boasts the loosest slots in town, along with great happy hour deals and unique attractions like the Fish bar with a 40-foot aquarium. While the bright lights may be disorienting, the friendly staff and overall experience make this a repeat destination for visitors. Just remember to keep your key sleeve handy for navigating the expansive casino floor.

I had two great experiences at this restaurant. The burger was excellent and the pulled pork was very good. My wife loved her egg white and goat cheese omlette. The beer list was solid and the spicy bloody Mary was delicious. The service was great and there was a fun eclectic playlist.

The management at Peppermill failed to acknowledge or thank a guest who intervened in a violent situation, instead telling them to go to their room or be considered a trespasser. Despite attempts to reach out for resolution, the guest received no response. Ultimately, poor treatment and lack of follow-up from the staff left a negative impression, resulting in the decision not to return to Peppermill in the future.

If you are on a student budget, consider staying at hotels across the street from the convention center for more affordable options. The conference center is massive with great amenities like shuttle service and well-executed meals. Food inside the center is pricey, but there are chain restaurants nearby for more budget-friendly options. The quality of the hotel might be lacking, but it's a good choice for saving money. Overall, a good option for budget-conscious students attending conferences.

Despite the kids loving the personal pizzas at this restaurant, the lack of flexibility with customizing the pizzas, particularly with using BBQ sauce instead of tomato sauce, was disappointing. Despite having gotten it this way before, staff insisted they couldn't accommodate the request. As a result, we had to leave and go to a different restaurant for lunch, ultimately deciding not to return in the future.
This place is super cute and the employees are very nice. The cookie dough is absolutely delicious. A must-visit spot, especially if you're lost in town.
Overall, the tacos were just okay and the chips and salsa were lacking. Not the most memorable dining experience.

I am thrilled to have this new spot in Reno! The matcha and ube flavors are delicious and authentic. The staff is super friendly and the soft serve, cake, and sauces are not overly sweet. I hope they add more flavors in the future to enhance their already solid base. A must try for dessert lovers!

I stumbled upon this restaurant after a quick Yelp search and I'm so glad I did. The small, pleasant interior with hip hop playing sets a great mood. The Duck Fries were heavenly, smothered in smoked gouda, shredded duck, and scallions. The scallop and foie gras tacos were a special and absolutely delicious. The pork roll burger was incredibly juicy and perfectly cooked. I will definitely be coming back here.

Three Muses in New Orleans offers delicious tapas style plates meant for sharing. The blue cheese stuffed dates, lamb sliders, and steak and cake were standout dishes. The goat cheese with the lamb was a perfect pairing, and the crab cake was the best I have ever had. Would recommend skipping the fish tacos. Overall, a great dining experience.

Overall, I enjoyed the ambiance and decor of the restaurant. The presentation of the dishes was impressive, but the food itself was just okay. The potatoes were undercooked and the pancakes were greasy. I would be willing to give it another try, especially to try the french toast and omelette that looked good. The service was excellent and I am interested in trying their lunch menu as well.

This place is fantastic! The food is delicious, the service is super friendly, and the homemade flan is exceptional. The prices are just right, but a liquor license would really take this place to the next level.

Had a wonderful breakfast experience with the family thanks to the great food and service provided by Jonathan. The restaurant was busy but we were seated immediately on a Saturday morning. Definitely a hidden gem worth checking out.

The Praline Connection provided a delicious and satisfying meal for our family, especially for Dad who couldn't stop raving about the soul platter. The fried chicken was a standout dish, with flavors reminiscent of his childhood. While the ribs were a bit difficult to eat, the overall experience was positive with tasty sides like potato salad and cornbread. Mom enjoyed her meatloaf and sides as well. The only slight disappointment was the mac and cheese being a bit bland. Overall, a recommended spot for authentic southern cuisine.

Buddy Brew in Hyde Park Village is a trendy coffee shop with flavorful coffee and beautiful latte art. The modern design and free parking are a plus, but limited seating and cold temperatures may make it more suitable for grab-and-go coffee.

V Vegaz is a hidden gem in the East Loop, offering edgy haircuts with a modern interior design and a great vibe. Callie is a fantastic stylist who understands how hair grows and moves, delivering consistently great cuts. Highly recommend this full service salon for anyone looking for a unique and high-quality hair experience.

The lady who works here is a miracle worker! I needed several alterations on short notice, and she not only completed them all in a day but did an excellent job. The suit fits me perfectly now and is ready for my trip. They accept all credit cards and have convenient hours. I'll definitely be returning. Highly recommend!

The Irish Pol is a hidden gem with a great selection of beers on tap and a fun atmosphere on weekend nights. However, the happy hour experience left much to be desired with a dark and dingy ambiance and limited drink options. Stick to Saturday nights for a good time at this unmarked bar.
The spaghetti and meatballs at this restaurant are unbeatable. The cozy atmosphere only adds to the overall excellent dining experience. My new favorite Italian spot.

Happy Hour at this restaurant is a must-visit. The 50 cent oysters and half price drinks were a great deal. The beet salad was divine and the mussels and flammenkuchen were excellent as well. The flammenkuchen, topped with caramelized onions, cheese, and bacon, was a standout dish that exceeded expectations. Highly recommend trying it out.

I have dined at this restaurant three times and each experience has been consistently good. The atmosphere is smoke-free and quiet, making it a great choice for families. The food and service have both been top-notch every time. I have tried something new each visit and have always been satisfied. I will definitely be returning to this restaurant again.
The pizza was delicious and the atmosphere was inviting. The service was friendly and quick. Great experience overall.

Richard's is a great new addition to downtown. The Caesar salad and bread were fresh and tasty, while the cheese ravioli with pesto cream sauce was absolutely delicious. The pesto sauce was perfectly balanced and complemented the pasta well. Pairing it with a Dunham cabernet made for a delightful dining experience. Welcome to the neighborhood, Richard's.

I had a delicious breakfast at this restaurant last weekend. The French toast and fried egg were tasty, and the vanilla latte was perfect without any added sweeteners. The atmosphere on the patio was lovely, with fresh breezes flowing even indoors. Despite a mishap with my egg, the staff promptly replaced it. Overall, a great dining experience.

The atmosphere at this restaurant was inviting and the staff was friendly. The food was good, but not outstanding - the quiche crust and croque madame bread could have been better. However, the fresh fruit and great coffee were highlights. Overall, a positive experience and I would return again.

My family thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Salty's. It will definitely be on our list of places to return when we are back in town. The kids menu offered a variety of options to keep little ones content. The Crabby Dip was enjoyed by all, though a bit pricey at $14. Our main courses, the Salty Burger and macadamia crusted grouper, were excellent choices. Overall, a five star experience with spot-on service.

While the ingredients may not have been as fresh on this particular visit, my boyfriend experienced severe nausea after eating the chili beef nachos and I had stomach cramps after the chicken burrito. However, we have loved the shredded beef in the past and will likely still return. Just a warning for others to be cautious about freshness.
This awesome throwback spot has great music, but be prepared to stand as seating is limited to the first 15 people in line. 4 stars.
I strongly recommend going to Blue Fin or Masamoto instead.

Overall, the Best Western Pepper Tree Inn was a decently priced option in pricey Santa Barbara. The clean and cozy rooms had comfortable beds and nice amenities like Bath and Body Works products. The exterior and grounds were charming, but the decor was a bit dated. There were some minor issues with the toilet and door, and no hair dryer or complimentary breakfast. Despite these drawbacks, the location and price range made it a good choice for a bachelorette party.

Johnny Rockets never disappoints with their classic, delicious meals. The recent barbecued pulled pork burger was flavorful and filling, especially when paired with endless fries. The move to a new location resulted in the loss of their entertaining singing and dancing, which is a downside. Overall, a consistently great dining experience.

This salon is absolutely disgusting. Cobwebs, dust, old and broken equipment, and unprofessional technicians make for an unsanitary and unpleasant experience. It's shocking that the health department hasn't taken action to shut them down. I would not recommend this salon to anyone.

I highly recommend supporting this local business. They offer a wide variety of products and even provide free popcorn for customers. Why pay for snacks at big chain stores when you can get them for free here?

I continue to adore this place for its friendly staff, spacious layout perfect for group gatherings, and delicious tea options. The Awake Fizz Tea is a personal favorite, but the taro bubble tea was a pleasant surprise. The only downside is the distracting music, easily solved by bringing headphones. Overall, a wonderful spot to enjoy a relaxing cup of tea.

Yah Man is a must-visit spot in Tampa for delicious Caribbean fare, excellent service, and a great atmosphere. The beef pie, chicken, island sampler plates, and bread pudding are all outstanding. You'll leave full and happy after dining here. Don't miss out on this gem if you're in the area! The staff is friendly and welcoming, making for a truly enjoyable dining experience.

My favorite place to go in New Orleans for a chill backyard bar with great local music options. Seating can get tight for larger groups, but the wine and cheese bar up front serves the live music venue in the back. The cheese trays are lovely and you can choose from a great selection of wines at mid-range prices. Perfect for a night away from the tourist crowds. A well-known hot spot worth checking out.

I had a great lunch at this restaurant. The chicken Caesar salad I ordered was delicious, and my dining companion enjoyed their custom salad. The waitress had a great personality and did not rush us at all, allowing us to linger. The space was also great, hidden from the outside. Overall, a fantastic dining experience.

Overall, the experience at this establishment was disappointing due to the lack of organization in honoring reservations. The cocktail, food, band, and atmosphere all earned a solid 5 stars, but being placed in the back next to the bathroom despite a reservation made over a week ago was a major letdown. The excuse of the new employee not inputting the reservation correctly is not satisfactory. It is recommended to always call and confirm reservations to avoid any potential issues. Despite previous great experiences, this visit fell short.

My husband and I had a fantastic experience at this professional tattoo shop. Bryan did an outstanding job on our new ink and we highly recommend him. The employees were all very nice and it's no surprise this is the city's top tattoo shop. Be sure to check out their new location at 1418 N. Clairborne, Suite 5 upstairs.

My wife and I love this place. The best view in Santa Barbara and awesome wines. Tom and Gillian are always generous hosts. The Conway cabs are the best in SB. The Conway 13 reserve Syrah is beautiful, thanks to Tommy. Rolos red is a bottle any wine snob would love, but great for those new to wine as well. Our 5-year-old son always wants us to go wine tasting here when we're at the pier. We're never disappointed. Highly recommend.
The draft latte was incredible and the customer service was top-notch. 10/10.

This restaurant is incredible! The BBQ shrimp and truffle fries are must-try dishes, and the truffle butter filet mignon is fantastic. Save room for dessert, the bread pudding and white chocolate brownie are both delicious choices. Highly recommended for food lovers!

This wine and cheese shop offers a unique and enjoyable experience unlike any other. The atmosphere is cool and inviting, and the process of selecting your own cheeses and meats adds an interactive element. The end result is a beautifully curated cheese board complete with nuts, spreads, and artisan bread. Highly recommended for a special evening out or a unique dining experience. The option to order from the kitchen is available for those who want more, but the cheese board and wine were satisfying enough for us.

I had an extremely enjoyable dining experience at Smiley's. The owner, Smiley, is a true gem and the food was absolutely delicious. I enjoyed it so much that I am already planning on having it for lunch again today. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in Manayunk - it's a hidden gem that shouldn't be missed!
This steakhouse offers above average steaks with great service and an excellent wine list. Comparable to Ocean Prime and Ruth's Chris, it's a top contender for a high-end dining experience.

My friend and I had dinner at this small restaurant on Sunday. The seating arrangements were surprising, with some tables shared with other parties. The restaurant can get loud, but the service was excellent. The food was decent - the Kale Caeser with a delicious soft egg was a standout, but they were out of watermelon for the salad that accompanied the fried chicken. Overall, a decent dining experience.

Unfortunately, I was rather disappointed with the service at this brewery. The wait staff ignored us after seating ourselves and the beer flight we ordered took too long to arrive. The beers were also unimpressive, with one even tasting like soap. Overall, not a great experience.

This breakfast spot has a confusing set-up and inexperienced staff on Saturday mornings. The food is mediocre with some inconsistencies in quality. The self-serve coffee and lack of proper service may not be for everyone. Overall, it's a cheap option but not recommended for those seeking a traditional breakfast experience.
This classic Greek diner impressed with a delicious Greek omelette and great service. The griddle home fries were a tasty side dish. We plan to visit again when in the area.
Extremely slow service with only miso soup and drinks served after over half an hour of waiting. Still waiting for the rest of the food to be cooked and served. Frustrating experience.
This doctor is fantastic--friendly, attentive, and professional. Plus, they have a great sense of humor. Highly recommend.

The Ramen at this restaurant may fall short compared to other places in NY, but the Steven roll is absolutely worth trying. It was one of the best rolls I've ever had. I will definitely be returning when I visit Philly again.

The service at this restaurant is extremely disappointing unless you fit a certain demographic. The waitstaff clearly favored older, wealthier customers in suits, neglecting younger patrons. Our waitress ignored us for long periods of time and failed to check on our meals. The management was also unresponsive. Overall, a subpar experience despite the high price tag.

I highly recommend Paris Hair Salon for anyone with thick, unruly hair. The staff is knowledgeable and takes the time to listen to your needs. I have always been pleased with the results, from cuts to color and highlights. The salon offers a warm and friendly atmosphere, making it a truly enjoyable experience. Plus, the prices are reasonable. Overall, Paris Hair Salon is my go-to for all my hair needs. -Maureen Kerfoot

While I was excited to have a Chick-Fil-A closer to me, the double lane drive-through is a disaster due to Nashvillians' inability to use it properly. The drive-thru going around the front of the restaurant is also confusing. However, the free WiFi is a nice touch for those long waits in line. Overall, I'll stick to visiting Chick-Fil-A in Rivergate or Cool Springs for my waffle fry fix.

I had a great experience at this restaurant. The service was efficient and the food was fresh and tasty. I particularly enjoyed the chicken taco salad and plantains. The drinks, especially the mojito, were also delicious. I will definitely return to try more dishes in the future.

I recently worked with the Sultans of Schlep for a small move in center city and had a great experience. Tom was attentive, responsive, and easy to work with. Their prices were fair, the movers were on time and efficient, and they provided wardrobe boxes at no extra cost. Plus, they have a cool and funny name. I would definitely work with them again!

I recently got a pedicure and was thoroughly impressed. The place was clean and luxurious, with no wait time. The staff were knowledgeable and my pedicure was amazing. I can't comment on the massage portion, but I highly recommend this place for a fantastic pedicure experience.
Yats offers the best Cajun food we've ever tasted at an affordable price. The eclectic menu changes daily, providing a surprise each visit. A regular spot for my wife and me. Highly recommended.

I was impressed with the selection at this pizza place. The roast beef sandwich I ordered was delicious, but did take some time to come out of the kitchen. Seating is limited inside, but there is a community patio nearby. Excited to try their pizza based on the good things I've heard.

We visited this location on July 4th and had a fantastic experience. The staff was friendly and helpful, particularly the nurse and doctor who helped my daughter with ear pain. The nurse was compassionate and patient, although ultimately unsuccessful, the doctor was able to remove a large chunk of wax. We were able to get prescriptions filled at the nearby Target for a better price than at Med Express. Overall, a great place for immediate care while on vacation at the beach. Thank you!

The veggie wings at this place are hands down the best I've ever had. I can never stop thinking about them. The fried pickles are also excellent, but the drinks are a bit weak. I recommend sticking to a Mexican coke when you're here.
Overall, our experience at this quaint diner was pleasant. The Yankee pot roast was mediocre, but the fresh veggies made up for it. The omelette my wife had was enjoyable. Service was outstanding.
Disappointing meal with no rice in the Chicken Teriyaki Lunch Bento Box. Zero stars.
Brooke's music needs a refresh. Moving away from pop EDM would create a more authentic sound.

Overall, this hotel provides good value for the price with a prime location and spacious rooms. The only downsides were the firm bed and rough sheets. However, I would still consider staying here again.

The food was delicious, with perfectly cooked pasta, delicious chicken parm, and good pizza. The service was seamless and impressive, with one cashier/waitress managing a packed place with ease. Highly impressed.

I had a fantastic first dining experience at this beachside restaurant. The food was great, but the real highlight is the stunning view and peaceful ambience. Sitting outside with the sound of waves in the background is simply sublime. Plus, they sell beer which is a bonus. A must-visit if you're in the area, and worth a drive even if you're not. I will definitely be returning.

Had a great time at a party at this venue. Private room with own bar and bathroom was a nice touch. Buffet was good and service was prompt. Great ambiance for conversation. Would definitely host a party there.

I was nervous for my first visit to LF, but Tori was fantastic. She turned my hairstyle idea into reality and provided great suggestions for my fine, thin hair. The salon was clean and modern, parking was easy on a Saturday. Overall, a great experience!

The burger was fantastic, well-cooked and full of flavor. The sides of homemade potato chips and waffle fries sweet potatoes were delicious. The outdoor patio was nice, but would be better without smoking allowed. Our waiter, Jesse, provided excellent service. A hidden gem off the beaten path that is definitely worth a return visit.

I have been going to Mark at Blades for 2 years now and have been consistently happy with my cuts. As someone used to paying $35 plus tip at high-end salons like Dominic Michael, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and affordability of Mark's services. Mark's salon experience and expertise shine through in his work, and I highly recommend him for a great cut at a reasonable price.

The modern decor of this restaurant is perfect for a younger crowd. I tried the mahi mahi with pita chips and hummus and it was delicious. The fish was tender and flavorful. The service was also good. Overall, a great dining experience.

This restaurant is a gem for dim sum lovers in Reno. While I wish they had a larger dim sum menu, the quality of the dishes here is outstanding. CaiE's oriental cafe seems to offer pre-frozen dim sum in comparison. Ordering in advance and dining in is the way to go, especially for chicken feet and siu mai cravings. The combo meals are also a hit, with delicious options like sesame chicken with fried rice and beef and broccoli or shrimp and vegetables. Overall, this is the best spot for dim sum in town, unless you want to make the trip to Sacramento.

Great experience at this restaurant for lunch with a group of eight people. No wait despite previous reviews mentioning crowds. Parking lot was empty, but watch out for opening doors. Excellent server handled our rowdy group well. The cheeseburger and fries were delicious, perfectly cooked with crispy fries. Overall, everyone had a great time with no complaints. Highly recommend!
The bayou burger is hands down the best I've ever had. The staff is fantastic too. Big thumbs up all around.

The corporate event in the private dining room exceeded expectations with a limited but impressive food menu and bar selection. The service was impeccable and the passed hors d'ouevres were both creative and delicious. The lobster consommé and filet were standout dishes, perfectly cooked and seasoned. The stunning view from the private room added to the overall experience. Highly recommended for events or special occasion dinners.

Lazos serves the best pizza in the Fairmount/Art Museum/Brewerytown area. The pepperoni was crispy and delicious, as were the wings. The fact that the wings weren't soggy was a pleasant surprise. While they did mix up my drink order, everything else about the pizza and wings combo was excellent. Will definitely be ordering from Lazos again.

The old school decor at this restaurant sets the stage for a delicious and satisfying meal. The express lunch is a great deal, offering a choice of soup with the entree of the day. The gumbo and crab bisque were both excellent, with rich flavors and just the right amount of seasoning. The garganelli with roast pork ragu was a standout, with tender pork and a light sauce that blended the flavors perfectly. Overall, a great dining experience with top-notch food.

Overall, the hotel is fantastic with a prime location. The staff went above and beyond to assist us throughout our stay. The proximity to popular attractions such as Bourbon Street, Harra's, and Jackson Square is unbeatable. However, the high cost of parking at $38 per night is a minor inconvenience.

I recently visited this store and was highly impressed with their selection, particularly the Chloe and Marc Jacobs items and discounted Chanel pumps. Although the store's price range is higher than some, I found the value for money to be great. The staff is friendly and helpful, making it my new go-to store for quality clothing.

Although my friends and I won free happy hours here a few times, my experience with the staff was frustrating. The woman in charge of happy hours was unresponsive and unhelpful, and the bouncers and bartenders were unfriendly and slow. The crowd seemed unappealing and the lack of organization regarding the guest list was irritating. Despite the free booze, I wouldn't recommend this place for any other reason.

The 7 Eleven appeared clean and pleasant, with a good selection of food. However, a pricing discrepancy revealed potentially unscrupulous behavior from the staff and manager. This experience left a negative impression on the reviewer.

This nail salon provides a terrible experience from start to finish. The staff are rude and unprofessional, with one even making a hurtful comment to a customer. The service is rushed and sloppy, with little care taken in the work done. Overall, a highly disappointing and unpleasant visit that could easily be improved with better customer service and attention to detail.

I absolutely loved the gelati from this place, especially on a hot day. Despite the calories and diabetes concerns, it was worth it for the cool relief. Five stars for their delicious frozen treats! Also, check out their website for more tasty flavors like Vanilla Ice.
Love the all-you-can-drink brunch at this place! $20 for brunch item and unlimited bloody marys or mimosas on Sat and Sun is a steal. Perfect for a fun and boozy Sunday Funday. Highly recommend!

The restaurant offers good Chinese food and a great beer selection. Haven't tried the sushi, but can vouch for the quality of the other dishes. The staff may not be the friendliest, but they are sufficient for take out. Don't expect a fancy atmosphere, but prices are reasonable.

Stephanie at Andres Richard Salon on Locust St worked magic on my hair with a balayage fix. She was sweet, attentive, and catered to my request, leaving me with exactly what I wanted. After a year of disappointments at other salons, I've finally found the perfect stylist who I trust with my hair. If you're looking for expert hair care, look no further than Andres Richard.

Overall, I had a positive experience at this restaurant. The festive atmosphere and variety of Spanish music created a fun dining environment. The service was attentive and they were able to accommodate my picky order. The chicken soup was highly recommended by a culinary expert, who claims it is one of the best he has ever tasted. The salad could use improvement by using a different type of lettuce. The queso fundido is also reportedly delicious, but it is recommended to order it plain and request chorizo on the side to avoid it being too greasy. I would definitely return for the chicken soup and try out the queso next time.

Extremely disappointed with the service and quality of drinks at this Starbucks location. Despite 4 baristas working, waited 15 minutes for a tea latte that was essentially water. Returned it twice with no improvement. Baristas need serious training on drink preparation. Will not be returning.

After moving from Brooklyn, we found the pizza we were searching for here. The thin, crispy crust was delightful, and the service was superb. Highly recommend for pizza lovers seeking excellent customer service. Will be returning regularly.

Outstanding food and service! Despite arriving just before closing, Jules was friendly and accommodating, providing excellent recommendations and samples. The steak shwarma with rice was delicious and filling, with a healthy touch. Will definitely be back for more. High recommendation!

I absolutely loved the atmosphere at this cozy restaurant. The staff were friendly and attentive, striking the perfect balance between conversation and ensuring customer satisfaction. Despite its small size, the space felt roomy and comfortable. The Crabby Wife and chicken & waffles dishes were both delicious and highly recommended. A fantastic dining experience overall!

Surrey's is a hidden gem outside the city center with the best shrimp n grits in town. The fresh juices and delectable crab omelette are must-tries. Be prepared for a wait, but it's worth it for the delicious food.

I like the store for its large and clean layout and wide selection, but I was disappointed with the customer service during my recent visit. Despite being the only customer in the store, no one offered assistance while I struggled to fit my french bulldog into sweaters. Even when my dog was briefly swatted by a cat, no one came to help. I left without making any purchases and doubt I will return due to the lack of attentive service.

I highly recommend this shop for any service needs. The staff are great guys who are honest, hard-working, and communicate well about the situation at hand. They pay great attention to detail and have been a reliable choice for our older cars since relocating to the area.

This place offers a nice, clean, and bright atmosphere with a variety of frozen yogurt and toppings to choose from. The cashier was very friendly and accommodating, allowing me to pay with a credit card even though I was short on cash. My son had a great time here, making it a pleasant experience overall.

Stopped by for Sunday brunch a couple of weeks ago and had a great experience. The food was delicious and satisfying, drinks were nice, and our server was pleasant. The cafe space was cool and overall I would recommend it.

While the atmosphere was nice and the staff friendly, the food at this restaurant left much to be desired. The chicken fajitas were bland and mediocre, with lackluster ingredients and underwhelming presentation. Unfortunately, I don't plan on returning.

The coffee house-like atmosphere and large outdoor patio at Gelateria create a relaxing and enjoyable experience. The delicious gelato and baked goods make it my favorite place in St. Louis to indulge in a sweet treat. Highly recommend!

I had a great time at this small sushi bar near Dale Mabry. The sushi chefs are friendly and the food is fresh and tasty. The Wahoo is a must-try! Prices are reasonable and I will definitely be back for more. Highly recommend!

Cheap food and large selection, but the poor customer service ruined the experience. Our order was forgotten, resulting in a 15-minute wait with no apology from the staff. Not worth the inconvenience.

Larry's Steaks has become my new go-to spot for the perfect philly cheesesteak after my beloved Dallesandro's took a turn for the worse. The meat is finely sliced and covered in melted cheese, with onions and mushrooms adding the perfect touch. The sandwich is greasy in all the right ways, making for a flavorful and satisfying meal. If you're in search of an authentic and delicious philly cheesesteak, Larry's is the place to go. Skip the tourist traps and give Larry's a try.

I agree with previous reviews that this place is terrible. The service was exceptionally poor and the food arrived cold, leading to a frustrating experience. It seems management needs to improve standards for both service and kitchen staff before I would consider returning. Overall, I would recommend avoiding this establishment.

I enjoyed my visit here a year ago before the e.coli/colliform scare, but have not returned due to safety concerns. They should improve meat cooking temperatures, serve food hot, and source produce from US only to avoid contamination issues.

Unfortunately, my order was completely messed up despite clearly specifying my preferences. The employee seemed confused when I requested no ketchup. This should not be a difficult task to get right. Disappointing experience overall.

I recently tried this restaurant for breakfast based on a friend's recommendation and was not disappointed. The service was quick and friendly despite it being a busy Saturday morning. I ordered the veggie omelette with fruit and rye toast and it was delicious. The menu had a good selection to suit all tastes and the prices were reasonable for the generous portion sizes. I will definitely be returning in the future.

Wells Fargo provides a fantastic atmosphere for all ages. The Flyers consistently host exciting games, regardless of where you are seated. I highly recommend attending a game, even if you are not a hockey fan.

Great spot for late night eats with a convenient drive through option. The new menu items and variety of veggie options are a nice touch. However, be sure to double check your order as they may forget to include dessert, leaving you disappointed.
The spinach and feta hummus is amazing, and the chicken caesar pita was wonderful with flavorful dressing and high-quality greens. Despite the location in an old garage, it's well worth trying.

I absolutely love this place! The fact that almost all menu items can be made vegan is a game-changer. The Pad Thai with tofu, veggies, and cashews is delicious and the avocado egg rolls are a must-try. Overall, a favorite spot for sure.

NOM NOMS in Downtown is a swanky spot filled with attractive professionals enjoying drinks and appetizers. The food is like little art works of flavor, with delightful surprises in each dish. The cocktails may be hit or miss, but the service is on point. Pricey for food, but worth it for the experience. A cool place to impress or have a girls' night out.

Despite some minor issues with the order, the excellent customer service at this Asian/Thai restaurant sets it apart from others. The curry and shrimp fried rice were both delicious, though the wait time was longer than expected. The dedication of the staff to ensure customer satisfaction is worth noting. 4 stars.
Delicious, fresh-made pies with tasteful and crunchy crusts and generous toppings. The Cowboy steak pizza was a standout, irresistible whether with or without BBQ sauce. A must-try in Philly!

Overall, this mailbox service is convenient and reliable for someone who travels frequently and wants to keep important mail secure. The annual cost is reasonable and the added feature of receiving phone calls for large parcels is helpful. While the location may be a bit sketchy, the staff are friendly and efficient. FedEx shipping services are preferred over using the store for shipping parcels and Canada Post for packaging materials. Printing services are satisfactory.

Jenne at Heads and Tails provided a reassuring and comfortable experience for my bikini wax. She talked me through the process and my sensitive skin was not an issue. The salon is clean and the staff is excellent. I highly recommend it to anyone in search of a great waxing experience. Will definitely be returning.

Although the food was tasty, the service was horrendous. After waiting 2 and 1/2 hours for delivery without any utensils or napkins provided, I had to eat my meal with my fingers. Would not recommend ordering from this place again.

The sushi at this restaurant is delicious and beautifully presented. We ordered the J Sushi and Fire Roll and both were fantastic. The service was excellent and the prices were great value. Highly recommended.

My wife and I recently moved to the area and were hesitant to leave our favorite Mexican restaurant behind. After finally trying the local spot we had passed by numerous times, we were blown away. The traditional ambiance and excellent service made for a memorable dining experience. We appreciated the touch of serving glass bottle sodas. The Taco Sombrero and Chimichanga were both incredible. This place is a solid 6 stars in our book.

Absolutely terrible service and food quality at this restaurant. The server was constantly on her cell phone, the shrimp portion was minuscule for the price, and the tostones were over salted and deep fried. Would not recommend wasting your time and energy here. Service and food both deserve a one-star rating.

The customer service at this rental service is excellent and outshines other car rental companies. I wish I could rent from them more often, as my experience was top-notch. Highly recommend renting from them if possible.

Cafe Piazza is a charming spot that has taken over the original Benton Park Cafe location. The atmosphere is quintessentially St. Louis, with a unique mural on the ceiling adding to the eclectic vibe. The food is great, offering a creative twist on standard breakfast fare and is both fancy and approachable. I highly recommend this restaurant for its decor, location, and delicious, reasonably priced menu offerings.

I am a groupie of this amazing chef whose chicken is the most tender and smoky I've ever had. The side dishes are creative and awesome too. I am sad I only got to try his dish once and now I can't find him due to construction in the market. I hope he is back soon.

Had a fantastic experience at the company corporate holiday party held at the Tuscany Ballroom with an overnight stay in the Tuscan Tower. By far the best resort in the area with a cruise ship like first class experience. Didn't notice any second hand smoke despite being in a casino. Bonus was having breakfast with the friendly Peppermill CEO/GM John Hanson. A truly unforgettable experience.

Incredible experience at this hidden gem! Initially skeptical due to the appearance of the plaza, we were pleasantly surprised by the traditional Indian/Thai setting and delicious food. The Tamarind Duck and Panang Curry with calamari were to die for, and the mussel appetizer was tasty. Prompt service and reasonable portion sizes for the prices. Will definitely be returning to try more dishes, especially the sushi and other styles of duck. Happy tastebuds all around!

Corropolese is a must-visit for tomato pie lovers in the area. They are known for their delicious tomato pie, which is a staple for my family at events. While they offer other items, the tomato pie is the standout and is unmatched by any other place. Highly recommend for a tasty and satisfying treat.

Went to this restaurant for a birthday party and was pleased with the experience. The beef n lobster was cooked well and the sides were tasty. The crab and cheese balls were bland and lacked seasoning. The Creme Brule was solid. Service was good on a quiet Tuesday. Shaky table was a minor issue. Would go again and recommend to friends. 4/5 stars.

Debbie was exceptional and provided fantastic service. The food was very good, fast, and prepared perfectly. The Mac n cheese burger was a hit, and drinks were spot on, especially the whisky sour. Will definitely be back for more.
This independent store is a great spot for holiday gifts. The staff is friendly and helpful, making the shopping experience a pleasant one. Hooray for a fun and unique shopping destination!

Based on previous Yelp reviews, I visited this unique art house meets coffee house meets Animal House environment and was not disappointed. The atmosphere and service were great, with delicious beverages and an interesting menu. However, the food was good but not great, warranting three stars instead of four. I will return to try other items on the menu due to the excellent atmosphere and staff.

Joyce is fantastic! The treatment is painless and worth the drive from Palm Harbor. Her high-tech machine sets her apart from others and eliminates any worries based on friends' horror stories. I highly recommend her services!

"The Quarter Stitch in NOLA is a hidden gem for knitters. Conveniently located within walking distance from my hotel, I was thrilled to find a special Mardi Gras yarn in stock. The selection was fantastic, prompting me to make a second visit during my trip. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, making the experience even more enjoyable. I will definitely be returning to this store in the future."

Great ice cream, but absolutely terrible service. The staff seemed unprofessional, ignoring us, throwing napkins around, and yelling at my son for no reason. No greeting, no smile, and no respect for paying customers. The fun atmosphere was overshadowed by the rude attitude of the staff.

This tiny seafood spot on the wharf offers a limited menu of only shellfish, but don't let that deter you if you're not a seafood lover. The fried shrimp was delicious and not greasy, with tasty onion rings on the side. The crab sandwich, however, was served on plain white bread and left something to be desired. The service was excellent, and despite the noise level, we were seated quickly at the bar. If you love seafood, this spot is worth a visit for its great location and fresh shellfish options.

Avoid this place at all costs! The worst restaurant experience I've had in 7 years in Tucson. Terrible customer service, lack of accommodation for allergies, and unprofessional behavior from staff and management. Would not recommend to anyone.
I highly recommend this place. Their sandwiches are unique and perfect for anyone looking for healthy or vegan options.

The Brew Bros. Burger challenge was a fun and filling experience, though I fell short of finishing the massive meal. The staff was supportive and the food was tasty, but be prepared for a potential stomach ache afterwards. I didn't get to try their beer, but my friends raved about it. Overall, a great deal for $24, especially if shared with friends (although that's against the rules of the challenge). I would recommend giving it a try, unless you plan on drinking beer as well. I will definitely be back to conquer the challenge next time I'm in Reno.

Great breakfast options and excellent service. The Sunny side skillet paired with a pancake was delicious and affordable at under $8. The atmosphere and store selections set this location above all others. A must-visit for a satisfying meal.

The food truck offers good and fast service with juicy meat and great BBQ sauce. Prices are reasonable, making it a worthwhile stop for a satisfying meal. Highly recommend trying it if you come across the truck.

While I really wanted to like this place, my experience was a letdown. The chicken was average at best, the mac&cheese was salty and messy, and the bananas foster pie was lacking in filling. The highlight was the birch beer soda. Overall, the food did not match the cost and I left feeling disappointed. The concept, decor, and menu are good, but the quality needs improvement. 2 stars.
The service was incredibly slow, even with multiple servers present. The food was average at best. Would not recommend for groups larger than 4 due to long wait times.

This restaurant is definitely worth the price for fantastic service and delicious food. The ribeye steak was beyond amazing, and the burger was huge and packed with flavor. The bread pudding is a must-try dessert. I highly recommend going at least once and sharing some meals with friends for a great dining experience.
The menu features locally sourced food that constantly changes, offering a delightful experience for your taste buds. Be sure to plan ahead as reservations can be difficult to secure.

The veggie burger was amazing and unique with grilled mozzarella, pickled veg, arugula, and guac. The spicy fries were seasoned well and not too hot. The atmosphere is dive bar-like and on the small side. Overall, a spot-on meal.

Vegetarian options in New Orleans can be challenging to find, but Tomasito's falls below the usual standard. The bean and cheese burrito was decent, but the lack of vegetarian rice was disappointing. Service was average and the flan was tasty, though it only came with one raspberry. Overall, it's nice to have food options as a vegetarian in New Orleans, but Tomasito's didn't quite hit the mark.
This Mexican restaurant is the best I've been to in a while. The food and drinks were excellent, and the prices were reasonable. Highly recommend!
The venue offers a lively atmosphere with really loud live music on the first floor, but a more subdued bar on the second floor provides a quieter setting for conversation.

Steve from Roto-Rooter saved the day when we had a sewer back-up at our new house. He was able to fix the issue quickly and efficiently. We are relieved and grateful for his service. Highly recommend Roto-Rooter for any plumbing needs.

Extremely disappointed with the lack of communication and response from Jay Fatimo at the auto repair shop. All I needed was a written estimate for a simple factory navigation unit replacement in my Denali, but after multiple emails with no response, I had to take my business elsewhere. Frustrating and unprofessional experience.

I have been a longtime fan of this bakery. The hazelnut cake is fantastic and their other cakes are just as delicious. The butter cookies are a must-try and make great gifts. Prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this place for all your sweet cravings!
The lunch experience was great for a first visit with an extensive and flavorful gluten-free menu. Good food and friendly service made for an enjoyable meal.

The service at this restaurant was excellent when they hosted us for an event, but unfortunately, the food did not live up to the same standard. The brisket was mediocre and the bread tough, but the mac and cheese was tasty. The beer glassware was dirty, chilled, and they were out of draft options. Overall, a mixed experience.

The Mississippi River tour is a great option for a laid-back day with a passive activity. The cost is average at around $28.00, with the option to skip the lunch offering. Be aware of typical tourist traps on the tour, such as photographers. Researching the history of the Natchez Native American Tribe can enhance the experience, and grabbing a drink can add to the relaxation. Overall, a pleasant way to spend a few hours on a steamboat tour.

Just visited The Fat Ham with my girlfriend and had a fantastic experience. The small but inviting atmosphere, impressive whiskey display, and friendly staff set the perfect tone for our evening. The bartender Dan provided efficient and friendly service, while the drinks and food were delicious - particularly the shrimp & grits and hot chicken.
