The raspberry cobbler was underwhelming, but overall, the experience was top-notch. Great service, high-end comfort food, and decent prices make this a place I will definitely be returning to.

Initially, we loved this place for its delicious Greek salad and gyros, as well as its fresh taste and cute ambiance. However, our recent visit was disappointing as the tables were dirty, lamps full of dirt and dead bugs, and the food quality had significantly decreased. My salad only had one bite of potato salad and tasted off, while my daughter's fajita bowl had gross tomatoes and rubbery, overcooked chicken. Even the baklava was stale. I hope they clean up and return to the high quality they had when they first opened.

. 

Carrollton Market in New Orleans is the best brunch spot I have ever been to. The local flavors and amazing service make it a must-visit. The "biscuits and debris" dish is life-changing, and the oyster-filled French omelet is everything I could ever want in a meal. Thank you, Carrollton Market, for an unforgettable dining experience.
The beer selection at this establishment is great, but the service at the bar was a bit slow.

This restaurant offers great food with standout dishes like fish tacos and nachos. The atmosphere is perfect for both family outings and date nights, with music, a beach bar, homemade ice cream, and even a playground. Overall, it's a great spot for a fun and delicious dining experience.

O! Wings has the best wings and bulgogi wrap! The Hot Momma and Original are must-tries. Even my picky dad loved them. Their service is friendly and accommodating - they handled a last-minute order change with ease. Can't wait to go back for more!

The reviewer had a negative experience with New York Pizza Grill due to their employees distributing unwanted fliers in hotels and potentially causing discomfort and fear among guests. They highlight the issue of trespassing and urge potential employees to think twice before working for such a company. The reviewer ultimately advises against dining at New York Pizza Grill due to these actions.

First time visiting this car wash with a coupon and was pleasantly surprised. Despite being busy, the process was quick with a 15-minute wash time and a cool, spacious interior to wait in. The kids loved the "soap gun" and there were drinks, snacks, and accessories available for purchase. The car was clean and vacuumed, though they missed the front window which I easily fixed myself. Overall, a great experience with friendly staff and fair prices. Will definitely be returning.

I love visiting this place in Indiana when seeing family. David does exceptional pink and whites. The shop is clean and the staff are professional and friendly. The new management, although three years old, is outstanding in my experience.

I had a disappointing experience with my order from this restaurant. Despite quick delivery, my order was completely wrong and when I called to address the issue, they refused to provide the free meal they had promised for the mistake. I was left feeling frustrated and will not be ordering from here again.

The shopping spree at Blush, beer at Hops and Crafts, and lunch at Turnip Truck in the gulch make for a perfect afternoon. The variety of products at Blush and Turnip Truck make for a great experience, but it would be nice to see a rewards program return. The chipotle chicken salad wrap at Turnip Truck is a must-try. Overall, a fantastic way to spend an afternoon in the area.

The happy hour and brunch at this place are great. I've only had dinner there once and it was only OK, but I think it was because I ordered something I don't typically eat. I'll definitely be giving it another try.

My co-workers and I stopped in for a snack at this well-decorated and spacious spot after landing in Reno. Despite the empty space, we were able to wait for happy hour to order. The cocktails were hit or miss (Mint Julep was a miss, but the gin drink was fantastic), and the food (mac and cheese, fries, pretzel) was delicious. Great prices during happy hour. Will definitely return next time I'm in town!

Muriel's Jackson Square offers a great option for vegetarians seeking Southern / Cajun comfort food in The Big Easy. Make sure to make reservations ahead of time as they can get busy. Their cocktail selection is impressive and the veggie options on the menu are expanding. The Goat Cheese Crepe is a must-try, but be cautious of seafood-based sauces. The Veggie Soiree offers a variety of flavors, although some dishes could use improvement. Overall, a satisfying dining experience for vegetarians in New Orleans.

Puckett's offers a delicious and satisfying meat-and-three experience with tasty dishes like squash casserole and meatloaf. However, be aware that their cornbread is more like a corn fritter or hoe cake than a traditional slice of cornbread. Overall, a great spot for classic Southern comfort food.

I had always stayed at The Grand Sierra but decided to try the Peppermill due to construction at my usual hotel. The Operations Manager, David Fuller, made my stay unbelievable with a double upgrade to a Tuscany Balcony Suite. The staff went above and beyond to ensure my experience was better than expected. I will definitely be back to the Peppermill in the future. Highly recommended!

Hilton properties have some of the oldest and most run-down facilities in the industry, with consistently poor customer service. Despite booking a 1 bedroom suite, the room wasn't ready and I was given a lesser room with false promises of an upgrade upon return. When I came back, I was told my original room had been sold. The lack of transparency and unwillingness to rectify the situation left me disappointed and without a satisfactory resolution. I will not be returning.
The burger was mediocre and overpriced. The atmosphere was cramped and impersonal. Service was average. There are better value and tastier burger options in St. Louis. Not recommended.

Pete and Ron provided the best quote out of several I received and proved to be reputable. Arbour Bay assured me I would be in good hands with them and they delivered. They efficiently removed two large oaks with a crane while I was at work, leaving minimal damage in my yard. I highly recommend them to others.
The sushi rolls were good but overpriced at almost $20 for 2 basic rolls. Portions were big but not filling enough to justify the high cost. Will not be returning at those prices.

The atmosphere and service at this establishment were top-notch. The live music added to the experience and was very enjoyable. The food was good overall, though the burger wasn't the best I've ever had. Despite that, I had a good time and will definitely be returning.

I attended a 2 1/2 day corporate conference in June and was impressed by the excellent service, nice facilities, and impressive catering at this venue. It is a great spot for conferences or small conventions, conveniently located near the airport with complimentary shuttle and parking. Highly recommended for business events.

This place is a must-visit for cheese lovers looking for a cozy spot to enjoy a variety of delicious cheeses and drinks with friends. The knowledgeable staff and extensive drink list add to the overall experience. While not the cheapest spot for drinks, the quality of the cheese makes it worth it. 5 stars.

Disappointing experience, as the food did not resemble authentic Middle Eastern cuisine. Side dishes were subpar and seemed to be pre-packaged. Would not recommend for those seeking genuine Middle Eastern flavors.

I absolutely loved this place, especially the Salmon dish. I have only been for lunch, but it has never been a problem. The restrooms are spotless and the service is top-notch. I will definitely be adding this restaurant to my lunch rotation. Highly recommend.

This place is a must-visit for top-notch service, fantastic ambiance, and incredibly creative and delicious food. The brunch experience was the best I've ever had, with standout dishes like the french toast and chicken and waffles. The "flinstones pushup-pop" drink was a creative touch and even the deviled eggs were exceptional. Overall, a great experience that I can't stop thinking about. Ignore any review that isn't at least 4 stars.

We stumbled upon this place randomly and I'm so glad we did. Their happy hour from 3-8pm everyday offers half off all beers, $3-$4 glasses of wine, and $8 hookah. The hookah on non-happy hour is $13 with a wide selection of shisha flavors and unique options like an ice chamber or smoking from a fruit bowl (extra charge). While I didn't try the food, the plates coming from the kitchen looked appetizing. Overall, a chill place to relax with friends and enjoy a great atmosphere. A truly enjoyable experience.

I absolutely love the Monaco Hotel in Philadelphia. The lobby is adorable with comfortable seating and they serve wine daily from 5 to 6 PM. The staff, including Jasmine, Kayla, and concierge Roshid, are amazing. The rooms are immaculate with fantastic bathrooms, especially in the king spa rooms. The decor is attractive and everything is in perfect condition. The hotel is a must-visit for anyone traveling to Philadelphia. Steps away from the Liberty Bell and historical museums, the Monaco makes you feel right at home. Highly recommend staying here for a memorable experience.
I absolutely adore this store! The savings on top brands like Bebe, Banana Republic, and BCBG are insane. I always find amazing deals and can't resist coming back for more. Highly recommend!
I am thrilled to have found a family-friendly spot to watch football in Carp. The atmosphere was fantastic, the service was quick, and the pizza was delicious. Highly recommend!

This Acme location is typical of the chain, with slightly narrower aisles and a smaller selection compared to other stores. However, upgrades to the frozen and refrigerated food sections were noticeable. Service was satisfactory overall.

My wife and I recently moved to the area and have been exploring local restaurants every weekend. The Roost has quickly become our favorite breakfast spot. The homemade breads and pastries are a standout, especially the raisin bread and sugar-cinnamon toast. The cornbread casserole is also a must-try. The service was prompt, attentive, and friendly. Highly recommend giving The Roost a try!

This small and crowded breakfast spot may be hectic, but the food is delicious and portions are plentiful. The wait staff is efficient and keeps up with the chaos. Overall, a great place for breakfast.

I finally decided to try this cozy restaurant after passing by it many times. The interior design is pleasing with wood palates and two tone gray walls. The prosciutto fig arugula Parmesan flatbread appetizer was delicious and perfect for sharing. The grass-fed beef burger was huge and tasty, and the truffle-coated fries were a nice touch. The seafood soup was flavorful and had a good amount of spice. I would recommend this place, especially if you enjoy a nice selection of wine and craft beer. Be sure to go early as it tends to get crowded and they don't take reservations.

While some reviews praise the quality of the food, I found my experience at Dragon Buffet to be less than impressive. The dinner buffet was mediocre at best, with dried out meats and soggy fried foods. They do charge extra for crab legs, unlike some other buffets in the area. Service was friendly but slow, possibly due to being short-staffed. I likely won't return given the other Chinese buffets in the area that I prefer. Perhaps with more guests, the food turnover and quality will improve.

This restaurant is consistently good with friendly, attentive service. The pasta pockets with pear filling are a must-try and the BYOB policy is a plus. The cozy family atmosphere makes it a great spot for any occasion. Highly recommend.

This bar with ties to a popular TV show offers $4 White Rascal's and pricey gravy fries. The steak fries with gravy and mozzarella cheese were tasty but expensive at $11. Service was friendly but sometimes slow. Overall, it's an average spot with a cool theme but overpriced food.

I visited this bike shop based on Yelp reviews and was pleased to find that everything said was true. The staff was exceptionally helpful and willing to answer all my questions. I will definitely be returning for all my bike repair and maintenance needs.

Overall, this hotel offers a great value for the price with a luxurious king bed, tastefully furnished room, and fun rotating Carousel bar. The rooftop pool is a fantastic way to cool off on hot days. The only downside is noise from the street, so request a room away from the street if staying over the weekend. Also, watch out for extra charges for incidentals.

The handmade Orangina is absolutely delicious, surpassing the bottled version in taste. The croissant sandwiches are also amazing, making for a perfect pairing with the refreshing drink. Highly recommend trying both!
Consistently delicious food with great milkshakes, ice cream, Chicago dogs, and cheese fries. Affordable prices make it a must-visit spot.
The food at this restaurant is fantastic, but the lack of Bud Light on tap is a major downside. I appreciate the friendly and attentive servers, especially Jamie White, who is the best.
Delicious food, great prices, and planning to return. Five stars.

I have been coming to this hotel/casino for a year now and have had a great experience each time. The rooms are clean and comfortable with nice views of the pool. I love the convenience of checking in online and using the express kiosk to avoid long lines. The pool is relaxing and never overcrowded, and the slots are easily accessible. The spa is a bit pricey, but overall, this is a nice place to stay and play. Looking forward to trying more of the amenities in the future!

I had a delicious pork roll, egg, and cheese bagel sandwich on an everything bagel this morning for a fair price of $4.23. The on-site made bagels were fresh, but the place seemed understaffed to handle the crowds efficiently.

The restaurant offers a set tasting menu on Sundays, serving dishes "family style." However, portion sizes are the same whether dining alone or with others. While the food was tasty, the business practice of giving one person portions to multiple diners was unacceptable. It is advisable to request separate plates if dining as a couple. As a result, I will not be returning to this establishment.

I had a fantastic time at this wonderful place for a pizza making class. The instructor, John from Ornesto, taught us great techniques and I met some amazing people. It's like Disneyland for bakers, chefs, and aspiring cooks. I already signed up for another class and bought some of their store goods. Just be aware that the lighting is a bit dim, but overall a must-visit spot!

I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant. The vegetarian and organic menu was impressive, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the coffee was delicious. I will definitely be returning in the future.
This place is amazing! The veggie burger is the best in town with a handmade patty and the pretzel buns are delicious. Highly recommend!

I recently tried Ploy Thai for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. As a recent transplant from Los Angeles, where I was disappointed by the food in Tampa, I give Ploy Thai 4 stars. The dishes were flavorful and made with fresh ingredients. Overall, a great dining experience.
The pizza crust was dry and the Delmar lacked enough bbq sauce, making it dry as well. The server was good, but the pizza took an excessively long time to come out after we finished our salads.
Great food and coffee, but there is always a long wait due to only having one cashier. They need to add another cashier to speed up service and prevent customers from getting frustrated.

Peppermill continues to exceed expectations with top-notch service and accommodations. The gaming experience is exceptional with favorable outcomes on slots. The food is delicious and reasonably priced. Overall, Peppermill is the best in Reno.

The breakfast sandwiches at this restaurant are overpriced and underwhelming. The portions are smaller than advertised, the sausage was cold, and the bacon was greasy. Can get similar quality food for a fraction of the price at McDonald's. Disappointing experience overall.

While my initial visit at Music City Optical went well, my experience went downhill after they switched my contact brand. I experienced pain, redness, and irritation with the new brand and had difficulty getting a timely response from the staff when trying to switch back to my original brand. When I sought a second opinion, it was confirmed that my symptoms were due to the new contacts and not allergies as Music City Optical had suggested. Their response to my negative review was accusatory and unprofessional.

The Italian Centre provides an excellent selection of Italian delights, with friendly staff to guide you through the overwhelming choices. The Mossimo pizza was a standout, with fresh toppings, bubbly cheese, and a perfectly baked thin crust at a great price. The Cream Horn pastries were pricy but absolutely delicious, fresh and creamy. A perfect spot to enjoy a coffee beverage and pastry before or after shopping.

The service at this nail salon has significantly declined in quality over the past few visits. From uninterested front desk staff to rushed and uncomfortable services, it's clear that the new staff members are not up to par. Additionally, the unexpected price increase was also disappointing. Sadly, I will be searching for a new nail salon.

Boulevard Pizza in Sparks/Reno is our favorite spot for delicious pizza. The decor may be old-school, but the taste is top-notch. Fun arcade games for the kids add to the experience. Highly recommended!

This coffee shop is a must-visit for coffee lovers in the area. The pure black and draft latte are the best iced coffee drinks I've ever had. The drip and espresso are also delicious and strong. The only downside is the long line, but the efficient and friendly staff make the wait worth it. Highly recommend stopping by for a great coffee experience.
I had a great experience at this bakery in Indy. The plain glazed and glazed lemon filling donuts were delicious. I would definitely return if I'm in the area again.
The food and drinks at this place are amazing, especially the $1 jumbo wings on Wednesdays and the Dirty Lemonade. Highly recommend checking them out if you're in Indianapolis.
Don't judge this place by its appearance - the food is fantastic. The gyros, fish, and chicken are all delicious and well-seasoned. Make sure to save room for dessert, you won't regret it.

The newly opened establishment in Reno was packed but well organized on its first day. My family and I were impressed and will be returning multiple times a week. Thank you for choosing Reno as your location.

Baguette Deli is an awesome spot for Vietnamese cuisine, with delicious BBQ pork and fresh rolls that rival sit-down Thai restaurants. The staff is friendly and accommodating, adding extra jalapenos without extra charge. The bubble tea is a must-try, and I'm glad to have found another place in town to get it. Overall, a fantastic first dive into Vietnamese cuisine - I can't wait to try more dishes! Go now to Baguette Deli!

I love dining at this restaurant at least once a month, and even more frequently when I can. The brisket tacos and brisket quesadillas are absolutely delicious. I highly recommend coming during happy hour starting at 3 for 2-for-1 drinks.

Xtreme Tacos has quickly become one of my go-to spots for delicious Mexican food. I have ordered from them numerous times and have never been disappointed. The homemade chips are a must-have and the salsa and queso are perfect for dipping. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, making the overall experience even better. I highly recommend giving Xtreme Tacos a try!

As a woman who recently moved downtown, I was on the search for top-notch service in every category, including car maintenance. Cabrillo Union 76 and their staff exceeded my expectations and I give them a well-earned thank you across the board. Trust is essential when it comes to auto service, and I trust this shop for their quality repairs and smog services for all my cars. Thank you, Ray, for providing such reliable service. Sincerely, Cheyenne.

Great location with a mix of edgy and chill vibes. Popular spot with a good selection of local microbrews. Ahi fish tacos were tasty, but the use of premade taco shells was a disappointment. Brunch menu looked promising.
"Amazing breakfast pizza, bottomless mimosas and bloody marys, and exceptional service. A rare find in today's world. Highly recommend!"

I highly recommend Bing's boba in Tucson! The Taro snow is my favorite drink, and the best boba spot in town. The place is clean, has board games, and the staff is helpful and friendly. They went above and beyond to ensure my husband had a drink he liked when it wasn't at the right flavor level. A great spot for boba lovers!

I highly recommend Venus Nail salon. I found them through a Google search and have been impressed by their amazing service and atmosphere every time I've visited. Ivy is fantastic - she created a beautiful look for my birthday trip that I absolutely loved.

Unexpected gem in a small town! The Indian food here is amazing - the Naan with peach chutney is a must-try. The Lamb Korma is perfectly spiced and cooked, not too overpowering. The decor is lovely and the staff is friendly. Service is quick and efficient. Definitely worth the drive, even if you're in Tampa. Highly recommended!

Greko is a hidden gem with delicious rotisserie chicken pitas and amazing salads. I couldn't resist going back for dinner and lunch the next day after trying it for the first time. The Horta Greens and Athenian Chicken are must-try dishes. Greko is the perfect spot for a quick and casual meal.

Compere Lapin at Brother Rabbit is a trendy and delicious spot in New Orleans. The house cider and Oban 18 were highlights of the drink menu. The house biscuits were fantastic, but the crispy chicken skins could use more flavor. The marinated shrimp and jalapeño jus dish was bright and refreshing. The dobeger cake with lemon curd and chocolate ice cream was a perfect way to end the meal. Great for groups or a date night out.

Imo's delivery was efficient and the food arrived hot. The St. Louis style pizza with provel cheese was not impressive and difficult to separate pieces. However, the toasted ravioli was outstanding with a flavorful meat mixture. Sauce was too watery but still tasty. Thumbs down on the pizza but thumbs up on the toasted ravioli.
"Mazzaro's is the real deal when it comes to authentic Italian cuisine. Their sauce and meatballs are unbeatable, reminding me of home-cooked meals. A must-try for any Italian food lover!"

The Mandarin is a trendy dance club offering higher-end cocktails and beers, along with your usual well drinks and domestic bottles. The door charge for guys on certain nights is standard. The huge enclosed patio is a great feature, allowing for plenty of space even in winter. The music can be hit-or-miss, ranging from classic hip-hop and pop to more obscure tunes. The atmosphere is loud inside but more conversational on the patio. If you're in the mood to dance in the CWE, the Mandarin is worth a try.

A hidden gem on Frenchmen with a lively atmosphere and talented piano player. The tapas menu offers a unique blend of Asian and Latin flavors, with standouts like the smoked hanger steak and lobster eggrolls. Happy hour deals are a steal with $4 tapas and $5 wines. Looking forward to returning.

The food was satisfactory, but the dining experience felt rushed and crowded with too many tables and not enough space. We frequently had other servers and customers bumping into our chairs, making it difficult to enjoy our meal in peace.

Avoid the crappy restaurant with awful service and rude waiter, and head to La Baia on 17th and Lombard for a fantastic BYO Italian dining experience. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious food make it a must-visit spot.

I used to frequent the Randall's off Jefferson, but now that there is one in West County, I am thrilled. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and they have a great beer selection with competitive prices. Definitely worth a visit.

Deseree has been my go-to hair stylist for over a decade and I wouldn't go to anyone else. She has done everything from blonde to brunette, long to short, and always nails it. She's even styling my hair for my wedding, along with 6 bridesmaids, and I know it will be perfect. Deseree is accommodating, reliable, experienced, and not to mention hilarious. I highly recommend her.

The Sockeye Grill left much to be desired. Terrible service, warm and tasteless salads with watered down dressing. The salmon was excellent, but the finger steaks were mushy. The atmosphere was lackluster, more like a barn than a restaurant. TVs everywhere playing depressing news. The only highlight was the dark lager recommended by the waitress. Overall, a disappointing experience and we won't be returning.

We had a fantastic dining experience here on St. Patrick's day for my sister's birthday. The server and bartender were incredibly kind, serving us cake and a delicious St. Patty's cocktail. The food was overall wonderful, especially the rotisserie chicken and tri-tip. The veggie burrito was a bit lackluster, but everything else made up for it. Reasonable prices, good portion sizes, and excellent service - we will definitely be returning in the future. Great spot, just maybe not for vegetarians!

Anders Osborne's performance at this venue was a highlight of my trip to NOLA. The streetcar conveniently took me to Bourbon Street after the show, but I wish I had stayed longer to enjoy the delicious smelling food and reasonably priced drinks. The crowd was mellow and added to the overall enjoyable experience.

Despite high praise from locals, our experience at Ralph's was underwhelming. The grilled calamari appetizer was overpowered by salty red sauce, and the pasta bolognese with filet mignon tips was lackluster in quality. The black lobster ravioli, while decent, was also overly salty. Overall, we expected more from the oldest Italian restaurant in the country.

The Catalina Mountains offer a breathtaking high desert oasis that is perfect for running or hiking. The beauty of the canyon is truly mesmerizing and we can't get enough of it. #MCLifeTucson is a must-visit for nature lovers seeking a unique outdoor experience.

The beer service at this burger joint fell short, with lackluster service and off-flavor beer. The bartender did not investigate the issue when the first beer was sent back, indicating a lack of beer knowledge. The use of glassware was also disappointing, with inferior shaker pint glasses and inappropriate glass selections for different beer styles. Overall, the beer knowledge of the staff was not up to par for a place with a large craft beer selection.
Orangetheory is an amazing fitness studio with the best full body workout I've ever experienced. The variety of classes offered makes it convenient to fit into my busy schedule. Love it!
The tour was fantastic with a knowledgeable and friendly guide, Raymond. The food stops were delicious and the experience was definitely worth the time and money. Highly recommend.

Ron's continues to be a reliable favorite for me. The craft beer selection is usually great, especially this week. The food is tasty as long as you stick to the right items on the menu. It's a regular stop for me for a reason.

This place is fantastic - the donuts are made fresh to order, so they are always delicious. The wait was worth it to enjoy them warm. The clean location is not too busy, with the added bonus of a parking lot. Definitely the best donuts in Philly and the Delaware Valley. A must-try for all donut lovers!

This Econo Lodge experience was absolutely terrible. The rooms were dirty and the staff was unprofessional. The manager, Neil Patel, was sarcastic and unhelpful. Rooms were not properly cleaned and the overall experience was unsanitary. I would not recommend staying at this Econo Lodge or any other of their locations. It is best to choose a more reputable hotel brand for a better experience.

Cafe Soleil is a must-visit bakery with authentic and delicious French pastries. The croissants are buttery, flaky, and better than some found in France. The imported ingredients and French baker add a noticeable difference in taste. The only downside is the location being a bit far, but worth the drive for those with a sweet tooth. Highly recommended.

Authentic Italian fare at a reasonable price with welcoming service in a great neighborhood byob spot. Generous portions and a variety of menu options make it a must-try for Italian food lovers. Great option for a pre-sporting event meal, just make sure to make a reservation in advance.
Todd Cobell consistently delivers top-notch performances and his music is always a crowd-pleaser. You can't go wrong with any of his songs, making him a go-to artist for any music lover.

This restaurant is a must-visit for great atmosphere, excellent service, and delicious food. The pizza is top-notch and the dinner specials are incredibly flavorful and generous in portion size. The staff, especially Selena, Jayna, and Chris, are friendly and accommodating. A truly fantastic dining experience.

Despina at EWC is a waxing godsend! She is quick, friendly, professional, and uses high-quality wax. My eyebrows have never looked better thanks to her. I actually enjoy my waxing appointments now, all thanks to Despina. She is truly the best in the biz.
The driver was nice and the pizza tasty, but it arrived barely warm for the second time. Considering trying a different place until the issue is resolved.

Impeccable food and service at Sbraga's chef's counter 6 course meal with wine pairings. Pricey but worth every penny for the front row view of deliciousness. Standouts include Gruyere popover with foie gras soup, saffron spaghetti with blue crab, crispy Arctic char, and chicken liver mousse. Well matched wines and special birthday surprise made for an unforgettable experience. Can't wait to go back!

GlobalQ is a must-try if you're looking for something unique in the area. Their quesadillas and wraps are all fantastic, with a range from good to phenomenal. The portions are generous, with the quesadillas being particularly large and full of unique combinations. The wraps are so big that you'll likely have leftovers for the next day. I recommend trying the 'Montreal' or 'New Orleans' wraps for something different. The 'French Dip' quesadilla is also a standout, even though it's not listed on the menu. And the best part? They deliver.

Recently tried Wendy's after a long time and was pleasantly surprised. The addition of sea salt to their fries was a nice touch and the overall quality of the food exceeded my expectations for fast food. Definitely worth a try, even for those who typically avoid fast food.

While I used to enjoy dining at this restaurant, my recent experiences have been disappointing. The service was poor and the food underwhelming. It's not worth the money and I probably won't be returning.

I was disappointed with this particular DSW location. The layout felt more like a warehouse and the quality and selection of shoes were not as good as other DSW stores I have visited. The lack of attentive customer service was also frustrating. I recommend checking out other DSW locations for a better shopping experience.

While That BBQ Place has a neat atmosphere and friendly service, the overpriced menu, lack of proper amenities, and mediocre ribs make it unlikely that I will return. However, the restaurant's popularity with locals suggests that my absence won't be noticed.

This store is severely understaffed, resulting in long wait times of up to 25 minutes at the checkout. It is best to avoid this store if possible, as the workers are aware of the issue but it seems to be a deliberate strategy to boost profits. Customer service may suffer as a result of the understaffing.

I had a fantastic experience at Mel's for a late lunch. The turkey club sandwich was amazing - full of fresh turkey on tasty multi-grain toast. The cook/waiter was friendly and welcoming. The sight and smell of the pork roast being prepared for the next day's sandwiches has me excited to go back for more delicious food, including breakfast. Can't wait to return!

If you're in the mood for delicious tacos and tortas, look no further. This place offers quick service and authentic Mexican fare that will truly satisfy your cravings. Don't forget to try their baked goods too, they are a hidden gem!

The Monteleone is a perfect choice for a romantic getaway in New Orleans. The historic hotel has lovely decor, accommodating staff, and a fantastic location for exploring the city. The rooftop pool offers amazing views, and the jacuzzi tub in our room was a relaxing touch. Can't wait to return!

The dining room of this restaurant needs some improvement, however the salad was good but the bread portions were skimpy. Disappointingly, they did not offer sweet tea. Additionally, there was a booth with unsupervised children who were left unattended for at least 30 minutes. It seems as though an employee brought them to work with her, which was concerning as they were small and alone.
My brother and I dined here to celebrate my college graduation and I left feeling completely satisfied. The restaurant had great vibes, our waiter was exceptional, and the food was delicious.

Unfortunately, my first experience at Blaze Pizza was disappointing. Despite the posted hours stating they were open until 10pm, I was turned away at 9pm with no explanation. It would have been more courteous for them to provide a reason for the sudden time change on a Tuesday night.

Dr. Dayley is the best dentist I've ever been to! His personable nature and skillful work have helped calm my dental anxiety. I trust him completely and have had a great experience with wisdom teeth removal. The entire staff is welcoming and sweet, making for the best dentist office experience. I highly recommend Dr. Dayley to everyone I know, as he has become the go-to dentist for my whole family. Thank you for the exceptional care!

P.F. Chang's fast food restaurant offers a quick and satisfying meal with amazing flavors at an affordable price. The atmosphere may not match their traditional dining experience, but the efficiency of ordering at the bar and receiving your food quickly makes up for it. A must-try for fans of P.F. Chang's.

I highly recommend this salon for blow outs. The staff is talented and friendly, and it's convenient to book online. I usually see Krissy or Bianca, but everyone is great. I also suggest getting a vital shot with your blow out for deep conditioning that lasts about a week. It's great for keeping blonde hair healthy.

Overall, I was very disappointed with my experience ordering from this restaurant. The presentation and prompt delivery were the only positives. However, the sushi was warm and mushy, the calamari was undercooked and falling apart, and the lettuce wraps were not as described on the menu. The only redeeming dish was the spicy white tuna roll. I will not be ordering from here again and will stick to Niji's on 5th.
The service from the bartender was poor and frustrating. She only seemed to serve regulars, ignoring customers standing at the bar with money in hand. Not recommended.

Normand's Bistro is a convenient spot for a post-show snack near the Winspear, open late on weekends. While the menu may be a bit pricey, the food is fresh and flavorful. The smoked salmon Carpaccio is a standout dish and the beer selection is interesting. Overall, a decent option for a late-night bite in the area.
The customer service at this store is exceptional, especially Tonya who went above and beyond to assist us with our damaged shirt exchange. Highly recommend.

I and my dogs absolutely love this place! The wide variety of toys and well-stocked inventory make it a go-to for us, especially during sales. The staff is caring, friendly, and always helpful in answering any questions. Despite being a chain store, it feels like a cozy neighborhood pet store that we enjoy visiting.

The service and staff were friendly, but the food was disappointing. The German togo item ordered was simply a pretzel and a piece of sausage in a box, which was lacking in variety and flavor. Perhaps it was just a bad day in the kitchen.

I have been a long-time fan of Charlie's and recently returned to find jeans that fit. The staff member who helped me was attentive and patient, pulling multiple pairs for me to try and explaining all the details. I ended up buying two pairs of Sebastian McCalls and am thrilled with my discovery of this brand. Super cute and comfortable, I love this store!

I had a disappointing experience at this car wash on Senior Discount Day. Despite paying for the Super wash, my minivan was not properly cleaned and vacuumed. The manager's attitude towards my concerns was dismissive and unprofessional. Overall, I would not recommend this car wash based on the poor customer service and subpar cleaning job.

The seafood combo at this restaurant was delicious, especially the catfish. The portion size was huge, and the red beans and rice and coleslaw were also tasty. The margarita I ordered during happy hour wasn't exceptional, but with 2 for 1 specials, it's definitely worth trying out this place for a good meal.

I have been a regular at this massage therapy center for some time now and have always had a positive experience. The facility is clean, the staff never rush through sessions, and they take the time to address any specific issues you may have. Felicia, in particular, is exceptional and provides a top-notch therapeutic massage. Highly recommend this place for anyone in need of a relaxing and effective massage treatment.

The Sunrise Family Restaurant offers a small-town, homey atmosphere with prompt and friendly service. The Monte Cristo sandwich was disappointing, but the fries and salad were satisfying. I'd be willing to give other menu items a try, especially for breakfast. I'll definitely return to see what else they have to offer.

My first visit to Butcher & Bee with my husband and co-workers was a mixed experience. The restaurant has a cute farmhouse feel and cozy booths for some privacy. Despite being a bit tight for our group of 7, we were seated promptly. I enjoyed the pork belly gnocchi, but felt it lacked texture without crispy pork belly. My husband was disappointed with his trout sandwich, which he felt was more like a tuna salad sandwich. The coconut macaroons for dessert were good. One co-worker liked the KFC sandwich. Overall, will give this place another try. The use of books for bill holders was a cute touch.

Overall, this beer event is a great time for beer enthusiasts with a wide variety of options to try. The drinks are affordable, but the food is a bit overpriced. VIP may not be worth the extra cost, but it's worth it for some. The venue has its drawbacks, with expensive parking and additional costs on site, but it's a fun event for those who love beer.

Kiwi Nail consistently delivers subpar service with shortcuts and sloppy work. The nail techs do not take the time to properly fix mistakes and the quality of service is lacking. Additionally, the expectation of tipping in cash only is frustrating for customers. Overall, it is not worth the hassle to visit this salon.

Chick-fil-A stands out in the fast food world with its high-quality food that doesn't feel like a bunch of fillers. As someone not typically into fast food, I appreciate the step above that Chick-fil-A offers.

Square 1682 is a fantastic hotel bar with great food, excellent service, and an upscale atmosphere. The friendly crowd of people, whether hotel guests or locals, always makes for a nice experience. The standout feature is bartender Dan, who goes above and beyond to make sure your experience is top-notch. He remembers your name and your drink preferences, making your visit personal and memorable. I always make sure to visit on Mondays when Dan is working – he's just that good! Overall, Square 1682 is a must-visit for a great night out.

This cafe is a must-try with a decent selection of coffees and a small but efficient menu. The food comes out quickly and is always fresh, with the Wilburt Skillet being a standout dish. Arrive early to avoid waiting and leave full and satisfied with a smile on your face. Overall, a reliable and enjoyable dining experience.

I had a mixed experience with European Wax Center in Philadelphia. My first wax with Despina was subpar, as she was uncommunicative and missed chunks of hair. My second wax with Amy Jo was slightly better in terms of friendliness, but the results were sloppy and I had to finish the job at home. The staff at the front desk were also rude and pushy about tips. Overall, I won't be returning and will continue my search for a better waxing experience.

I absolutely love this brunch spot! The atmosphere is amazing and comfortable, and the flavor combinations in the dishes are incredibly unique. The Cuban Lamb Frita with an egg is a must-try, and all of the side items are delicious. The staff is friendly and efficient, especially with coffee refills. I will definitely be making this my new regular brunch spot.

Overall, this place is good despite the small portions for the price. The drinks are cheap and the service is great. The piano adds a nice touch to the ambiance. Definitely try the incredible cheesecake.

Beat the crowd and enjoy a fantastic breakfast at this gem. The only downside is its small size, but the food more than makes up for it. The menu features delicious options, including vegetarian and vegan items. The french toast specials are a must-try. Perfect spot to fuel up before Mardi Gras parades. Highly recommend!

I highly recommend Butch's tour for a relaxing and informative experience with good stops to eat and see the cemetery. Going on this trip at the beginning of your stay will help you know where to go during your trip. Butch is also fun and does a great job overall.

I absolutely love this food truck! The Captain Crunch tilapia burrito is a unique and delicious treat, with flakey fried fish and fresh toppings like cabbage, tomatoes, avocado, and Sriracha mayo. The katsu and curry chicken are also flavorful and satisfying. The Thai tea hits the spot every time. The prices are great and the staff is friendly. It's worth the drive from Jersey just for a taste of their amazing street food.

I had a terrible day with a migraine and sinus infection, but found relief at Massage Envy. They were able to fit me in last minute, provide the specific massage I needed, and even accommodate my father at the same time. Jen was understanding, kind, and provided helpful techniques for at-home relief. The foot massage my father received was also excellent. The membership program is cost-efficient and convenient for my busy schedule. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is great, and the environment is calming. I feel much better already and will definitely be returning for a 90 minute massage in the future. Highly recommend!

This place is a hidden gem for delicious roast chicken. The chicken is moist, skin crispy, and flavor smokey and delicious. The double chicken family meal is enough to feed a family of four with fries and cole slaw. The dipping sauces are amazing, especially the mustard base with a chipotle flair. The portion size is generous and worth the price. The owners are friendly and provide great service. I would choose this over Popeyes or KFC any day. Can't wait to come back for more mouthwatering chicken.

If you're not a fan of traditional Japanese sushi but still want a taste of Japanese cuisine, this place offers delicious rice bowls and tempura. The location is not too busy, so there's minimal wait time. The catering options are great for events. Service is quick and the food is satisfying for a fast lunch or dinner option. Great for those on a tight schedule.

I recently moved to Westchase and needed a new dentist. After reading great reviews, I made an appointment with Dr. Creech-Gionis and Dr. Stern at a location only .5 miles from my home. The entire staff is wonderful and both dentists are outstanding. They made my visits less painful and I am 100% satisfied. Highly recommend.

Despite the great reviews, our experience at Amigos on our 40th anniversary was disappointing. The atmosphere was lacking, the food was mediocre, and the prices were high for what you get. The salsa was overhyped, and the chips were nothing special. We miss Gloria's, despite its cleanliness issues. Overall, not worth the $47 spent with drinks and tip - better off trying one of the taco trucks in Boise for better flavor.

Heather was an excellent waitress and bartender at this restaurant. Everything I tried was fabulous, especially the tenderloin sliders with French fries. I will definitely be coming back as often as I can, you will not regret trying this place.
The bouncers at LEX are aggressive and unpleasant, reflecting the negative atmosphere of the establishment. Avoid this place unless you have no other options.

This sandwich shop near the beach offers gourmet-sized sandwiches at the price of Subway. The owner provides friendly service and the daily specials are delicious, such as the shrimp tacos with kiwi sauce. The only drawback is the limited outdoor bench seating, but the food quality makes it worth it. Great option for hotel guests and soon to offer delivery. A local favorite with 5-star food.

This modern place offers a beautiful view and is conveniently located near public transportation. However, those on the train side of the building may experience noise disturbances. Overall, it is a great place with a charming yolk nearby.

I went in for a full set and requested long nails, but they were cut short. When I pointed out a crooked nail, it was not filed properly and ended up getting shorter and shorter. This was not my first visit, but it will be my last.

I highly recommend going on a Tuesday for half-price tapas and $5 Sangria/margaritas. The Fried Manchego, Hot Cauliflower, and Camarones were all delicious and unique. A must-try experience with great value.

If you're a fan of live Jazz music, this place is a must-visit. The lack of alcohol and food may be a downside for some, but the focus solely on the music really lets the talent shine. The venue does a great job at showcasing the vibrant culture of New Orleans through their music. At $15 a ticket, it's definitely worth the experience.

If you prefer a peaceful shopping environment free of crowds, this mall is the perfect spot for you. The atmosphere is calm and relaxed, making it an enjoyable place to browse and shop without feeling overwhelmed. Highly recommended for those who value a tranquil shopping experience.

This restaurant was a great choice after a busy day. The staff accommodated our request for a quiet table and the service was top-notch. The aged ribeye steak was recommended and it did not disappoint. Splitting the 18-ounce portion was the perfect decision. The shrimp cocktail and iceberg wedge salad were also delicious. The only downside was the limited wine selection, but overall a solid 4.5 star dining experience.

The worst Italian food I have ever tasted! Terrible service, bland entrees, and overall disappointing experience. Would not recommend Caruso's and would suggest trying Contessa for authentic Italian cuisine instead. Disappointing and not worth the money.

Despite my usual aversion to strip mall bars, I decided to give this one a chance based on a recommendation from a friend. The food was surprisingly good and I look forward to trying their pizza next time. The addition of a craft bar was a nice touch and the prices were reasonable. Overall, a pleasant surprise and worth checking out.
I had the Buffalo chicken salad from here and it was amazing! Fresh and crispy greens, delicious chicken, and a smooth blue cheese dressing. Definitely going back for more.

Luke Restaurant in New Orleans is a must-visit for French-German cuisine. The historic ambiance and views of the open kitchen add to the dining experience. Although seating without a reservation was initially difficult, the food and service more than made up for it. The cocktails were flavorful, the entrees were satisfying, and the desserts were decadent. The server was attentive and engaging, making the overall dining experience memorable.

Although the dental work was done well, the prices at this clinic are high and some procedures may be unnecessary. The TVs in the exam rooms may be more of a perk than a practical distraction during dental work. Overall, I was impressed with the service, but the cost was a significant factor in my experience.

Yesterday was my first visit to Paris Parker and I had a great experience. Stacey did an amazing job with my full highlight appointment, getting rid of all the brassy tones in my hair and leaving me with a natural and vibrant blonde. She was not only skilled but also pleasant to chat with during the appointment. Highly recommend, although she may get booked up quickly!

I love the wide selection of ready-made teas and the ability to mix my own concoctions. The loose tea can be pricey, but the quality is worth it. The staff is incredibly friendly and always remembers my preferences. Overall, a great experience every time I visit.

GRI is the place to go for a one-of-a-kind engagement ring. Terry and Nirali are incredibly knowledgeable and helpful, guiding you through the process with ease. The custom design options are amazing, and the end result is stunning. The whole experience feels like meeting with friends, not just a business transaction. Highly recommend GRI for all your jewelry needs.

Great place for cocktails with unique glassware and delicious drink options like Dragon's Tear and Blackmail. Despite higher prices, the experience is worth it. Laid back atmosphere with fitting music and cool decor. Food options could be improved, but will definitely be returning for the drinks.

Pizzaville exceeded my expectations with high quality food, generous toppings, and excellent service. The pizza crust was perfectly balanced between crunchy and chewy, with good quality cheese and tangy tomato sauce. The "breadsticks" were more like amazing garlic bread strips that I couldn't stop eating. The employees were friendly and the store was clean. I can't wait to try their lunch buffet next time!
The service and staff were pleasant, but the food was lacking in flavor and the drinks were mediocre. If you're in need of a quick lunch spot, this could be an option.

I thoroughly enjoyed the modern and cozy ambiance of the restaurant. The decor was tasteful, although the lighting was more suited for dinner than for taking selfies. Our waiter was a bit rushed and impatient, but the food was delicious overall. The Shrimp Breaux Bridge, Balsamic Salmon, and Pesto Crusted Idaho Trout were all cooked and flavored very nicely. The Zangria White sangria was good, although it was missing some of the advertised seasonal fruits. Despite the service issues, I would return to try more dishes on the menu.

The burgers at this spin-off from Rouge are surprisingly better than at the flagship restaurants. The options for toppings are constantly expanding, making it easy to customize your burger. The Kobe Beef burger is worth the extra cost, especially when paired with truffle cheese and grilled onions on a brioche bun. The truffle oil fries are a must-try, and the fact that they are open late on weekends is a bonus. Highly recommended for burger lovers.
I was disappointed with the pizza at this place. The previous restaurant had much better, homemade food. I would have preferred to stick around there instead.
Stopped by for lunch and tried the jalapeno burger, which was fantastic. The patio seating was a nice touch. Will definitely return.

Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Reno. The spa, rooms, and customer service are all top-notch. The only downsides were the lack of bathroom fans and a small oversight with room service.

Overall, this place was great for anyone looking for an interesting tour, good beer, and a lively atmosphere. The variety of activities like sports on TV, board games, live music, and tours every hour kept things interesting. It can be a bit overwhelming at times, but it all flows well together. Perfect for a fun time with friends or a date.
This place is a disaster. The service is atrocious, the food is terrible, and the cleanliness is unacceptable. I'm deeply concerned about getting food poisoning after eating here. Avoid at all costs.
My favorite wine and liquor store in Nashville. Friendly and helpful staff, good selection and prices. Only downside is the high curb when pulling in. Be cautious to avoid scraping your car.

Circle of Friends daycare has been a great fit for my family. Linda and her staff are caring and my kids have been flourishing emotionally and academically. I appreciate the low turnover and the positive environment they provide. Highly recommend.
The new location on Central is fantastic with great staff and atmosphere. It seems like they have found a spot where they will truly thrive.

Nice location and very friendly service, but the food lacks flavor and taste in comparison to other Ethiopian restaurants. The ambiance gives a true Ethiopian dining experience, but overall it is just average and nothing special. 6/10.

I tried this restaurant for the first time and was impressed with the delicious seasoning on the seafood. We ordered oysters, a $45 combo, and garlic chicken wings for a family of six, which was more than enough food. The only downside was that our order was slightly incorrect.
The chicken was salty and I only received 2 pieces of plantains despite ordering 1/2 chicken, rice, and plantains. Not worth the $8 I paid. Will have to reconsider ordering from here in the future.

Initially my experience at this Chinese take-out restaurant was average, with the food being neither outstanding nor terrible. However, after a second visit, I was highly impressed with the excellent food and flawless delivery service. I would definitely recommend giving this place a try! 5 stars.

The Rib Cook-Off in Sparks is a must-do event for us every year. Taking the bus eliminates the hassle of parking and allows us to enjoy a few drinks before diving into the delicious food. The JA Nugget app makes navigating the event a breeze. Be sure to bring cash and explore the non-rib vendors too. Don't miss out on the cheap deals on Monday evening. A great event for food and fun!

Excellent food and extensive drink menu at this bustling bar, but the service was a bit slow and inattentive. The crab bisque and Poulet Grand-Mère were delicious, but the wait staff could afford to be more attentive. Overall, a good dining experience, but may explore other options in the area before returning. 4/5.

Delicious food, especially the chocolate chip pancakes. Quick service and efficient payment process. Line can be long, so go early to avoid waiting. Highly recommend for a tasty breakfast in Nashville.

The Sunday brunch at this restaurant is definitely worth the price for those looking to indulge in a variety of delicious food and bottomless mimosas. The buffet spread is extensive, including seafood, custom sushi rolls, desserts, and more, while the bottomless mimosas were heavy on the champagne and never-ending. The a la carte menu also offers delicious options to choose from. The cozy atmosphere and attentive service made for an enjoyable experience, even during bad weather. If you don't mind overeating and overdrinking, you'll leave with a full belly and a good buzz!

On our way home from a camping trip, we stopped in Santa Barbara for fish tacos at this highly rated spot. The food was delicious and we were pleasantly surprised by how tasty our tacos were. The kitchen was accommodating and gave us a whole platter of battered shrimp to try. We enjoyed our meal on the veranda, soaking up the December weather. We will definitely be back next time we are in Santa Barbara. The staff was also very friendly.

I have been to On the Border in Mount Laurel over 50 times and have fallen in love with their chips and salsa. The chips are nice and salty, and the salsa has a little kick to it. I mostly sit at the bar and enjoy beer and snacks, with decent beer specials. The vegetarian sides are a great option, and I particularly enjoy the cheese enchiladas. Service is usually great when dining. However, the experience with bartenders can vary greatly. Joann is fantastic, while Nikki provides subpar service. Overall, On the Border offers good appetizers, cold beer, and moderate prices.

Busy but worth it. Must try the peach shake, it was amazing. Reasonable prices and variety of options. Long wait in the heat, but overall a great stop in St Louis. Ordering at the window was a bit confusing with multiple lines.

Delicious desserts but sub-par service. The cakes were amazing, but the wait time was long and the to-go packaging was impractical. The barista's lack of basic coffee-making skills was disappointing. Hopefully, this business is still improving.

I cannot say enough about the accommodations at the JW. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate a working mom in need of a private space to pump during a trade show. Nathan was quick to help and provided a clean and private boardroom for me to use. The facilities were impeccably clean and the staff was incredibly kind and supportive. Kudos to the JW and their staff for making arrangements to support working moms - they totally made my day!

Overall, Joe's offers delicious food at a great price, particularly the beef tacos and hearty meatloaf with mashed potatoes. The salad was also fresh and generously topped with bleu cheese crumbles. The atmosphere is lovely with a variety of menu options. However, the service was lacking on both visits, with servers not informing us of specials or being knowledgeable about the menu items. Despite this, Joe's is worth a visit for the tasty comfort food and beautiful ambience.

The food at this establishment is truly excellent. The welcoming atmosphere and extensive menu choices make for a satisfying experience. The sandwiches are filled with delicious meat and the hand-made toasted ravioli is some of the best in town.

After hearing about St. Louis BBQ, I decided to try this place and was impressed by the customer service. The homemade BBQ sauce is a mix of sweet, tangy, and spicy, which may be overpowering for some. The pulled pork sandwich, beans, and Cole slaw were delicious but may be too much for someone not accustomed to this type of cuisine. Overall, a great experience for BBQ lovers.
The chicken salad sandwich was disappointing with only two cubes of chicken and mayo. The salad consisted only of a bowl of lettuce, leaving me hungry and unsatisfied.

Overall, our brunch experience at this restaurant was enjoyable. The food was consistently delicious, with sumptuous omelets and tasty beverages, including a fun bloody mary bar. The service was efficient and courteous, although we did have to ask for fresh bacon. The budget breakfast option was satisfying, and the fish tacos were also tasty. We especially enjoyed dining al fresco on the patio. A great spot for a pleasant brunch.
This place is worth the wait in line. The basic breakfast I had was fabulous and the service was great. Definitely plan to go back, despite the challenging parking situation.

I had a perfect wintry in-home dinner thanks to C & B's via Order Up Delivery Svc. The Swanky Frank with fries was delicious and the seasoning on the fries added a nice touch. The beef chili was packaged nicely and perfect for a late-night snack. I also appreciated the sour cream and crackers on the side for warming. 100% recommend using Order Up for a cozy chili at home this winter.

Overall, the food at this restaurant is delicious and flavorful, but it can be a bit expensive. The menu is constantly changing, so you never know what to expect, but everything is consistently amazing. The donuts are a standout and are definitely worth trying for their uniqueness.

After a visit full of indulgence and great company, my next must-order items at Livery are the Carriage House Margarita for a unique twist, all the empanadas for a guilt-free treat, The Red Drum for a delicious fish dish and a taste of the yuca fries, and the decadent churros (definitely don't share them!). Highly recommend copying my order on your next visit.
Great service, delicious food, and a welcoming atmosphere. The Black and Blue burger was incredible and the sweet potato fries were some of the best I've ever had. Will definitely be returning.
The best donut place ever, wish they shipped their products. I moved to Florida and missed it so much. Only in New Orleans, sad face!

Katie's is a longstanding neighborhood restaurant serving classic New Orleans dishes with an Italian-American twist. The meatballs are a standout dish, and the atmosphere is filled with classic New Orleans charm, with older patrons dining early. Manage your expectations and you won't be disappointed.
I highly recommend this place for oil changes. The service was excellent - fast, friendly, and professional. This is now my go-to spot for all car maintenance needs.
I would not recommend this place for Latino customers. The lady who cut my hair was rude and unprofessional.

This restaurant desperately needs a makeover. The decor is tacky and run down, the food was subpar with a charred burger and lackluster dishes, and everything felt sticky and dirty. The only positive aspect was the friendly servers. This place should definitely be featured on a show like Restaurant Impossible to bring it up to standard.

I highly recommend this restaurant for its impeccable service and ridiculously good food. The huevo rancho and best sandwich were standout dishes, and the grits were also very good. The owner is a very nice gentleman who clearly enjoys food, making the overall dining experience even more enjoyable. Say hi to him if you visit!

I had a fantastic happy hour experience at this place. The oysters were delicious, we had two dozen along with some tasty cocktails. The Riverbend and champagne au poir were standouts. The sides of fries and grits were also amazing - the best grits I've ever had. The server provided just the right amount of attention. I will definitely be returning.

Bella Vista Designs is a fabulous team of professionals who consistently deliver innovative and beautiful designs for events. Their can-do attitude and affordable prices make them a standout choice. Guests are always amazed by their work, saying "Wow!" at the Santa Barbara Historical Museum and Goleta Valley Historical Society events. Thank you for the hundreds of successful and magical moments created!
I recently relocated to Tucson and needed to find a new dentist. I had a great experience at this office and would highly recommend it to others!
Highly overrated with subpar food and terrible service. Completely messed up my order with no apologies. Definitely better options on State Street. Avoid this place.

I couldn't agree more with the previous reviewer. The food, service, and prices at this restaurant are excellent. The beef gyro, falafel, and hummus were all fresh and delicious. The owner is very kind and the portion sizes are generous. I highly recommend trying this spot in Manayunk, as it is still relatively unknown but definitely worth a visit. I will be referring all my friends to support this hidden gem.
Overall, great food and excellent service at this restaurant. The only downside was that our entrees came out a little too quickly after our appetizers, but it didn't ruin the experience.

This restaurant is located in a mediocre strip mall and has a lackluster interior. The food is decent but nothing to write home about. It's not dirty but doesn't look very clean either. Overall, an average dining experience.
"Phenomenal place to eat with delicious food, especially the Hickory burger. Will definitely be returning!"

I had a unique and flavorful experience at this restaurant, with a knowledgeable and passionate server. The food was different with unbelievable flavors, making it a must-try for foodies. However, the portions were small and the interior was not to my liking. The dishes were too complicated for frequent visits, as the menu changes every year. Overall, an interesting place to try, with talented chefs and successful owners. Booths would have been a nice touch.

Overall, the experience at this Asian restaurant showed a solid improvement since my last visit. The service was much improved, with Dillon providing excellent service. The ambiance is very casual, with the option to order and sit while they bring the food to you. The food was tasty and offered plenty of options, although not fancy. The prices were very affordable, with a family of four costing about $30, making it a great deal in today's market. If you're looking for a quick and casual Asian dining option, this place is worth a try.

Using the Yelp app to get on the waiting list was a smart move for a busy Saturday morning. The menu had a lot of options, with the cinnamon French toast standing out as a highlight. The traditional breakfast options were solid, but the extras on the menu are worth exploring. The strawberry orange juice was excellent. The restaurant could have been cooler for a more comfortable experience. Service was very good and the dual payment counters were a nice touch for a speedy exit.

Shaving Grace is a welcoming and comfortable barbershop with a vibe reminiscent of my old shop in Philly. The option of a complimentary beer added to the experience. The staff is friendly and skilled, providing a great cut while engaging in interesting conversations. I have definitely found my new go-to spot for haircuts and will be returning.

The food at this restaurant is excellent, and the staff is incredibly kind and genuine. The eggs Benedict were good, but the toast underneath was exceptional. Our server, Tina, even brought us a cream pancake to try, which was the best pancake I've ever had. Full of vanilla flavor and soft as a pillow, it melted in my mouth without needing any additional syrup. Stellar experience overall.

The service was excellent and the food was delicious. My husband enjoyed the cheese and bacon burger, while I loved the crawfish sausage po'boy. Both dishes were well made and flavorful. Highly recommend trying them.
I had a fantastic experience with JT at Ashley Furniture store. He was extremely helpful, especially when I needed to make changes to my order. Highly recommend!

I highly recommend Cucina Zapata food truck at Drexel University for a unique and delicious lunch option. The graffiti-style truck stands out among the others on campus. The thai short rib tacos and cap'n crunch tilapia burrito were visually appealing and tasted amazing, even with hot sauce. The food exceeded our expectations and left us with a 5-star experience. Prices are reasonable and the quality of food is excellent. Check out Cucina Zapata for a great meal that's a step above typical food truck fare.

I had a fantastic experience getting my haircut with Jessie Becker at this salon. She was able to remove the damaged ends and listened to exactly what I wanted. Jessie is sweet, talented, and great with children. I highly recommend checking out this salon and booking an appointment with her.
This place serves great ramen with wonderful service. I'm really happy to have discovered it. Highly recommended!

While the place is cute and the servers are nice, the dish sizes at this restaurant are disappointingly small. I left unsatisfied and believe that restaurants should be more generous with their portions, especially when they are in a neighborhood setting.

Recently dined at this restaurant for the first time and the hype was justified. Girlfriend had the Greek Salad, I had the Chickpea Vegetarian Pita with substitutions. Delicious and filling portions, friendly staff, and pleasant environment. Will be returning for sure!

Overall, a great experience at this bar and restaurant with a spacious layout and many TVs to watch the game. The fact that it is attached to the O'Fallon brewery is a bonus. The House Special IPA was excellent, not too bitter. The only downside was the lack of desserts. Look for Troy behind the bar for excellent service. 4 stars.

This neighbourhood dive bar on the eastern part of Whyte Avenue is a decent spot for a night out with a younger crowd. The decor is average with some pool tables and a foosball table. Drinks are reasonably priced and they have cheap wings with a carrot and celery stick. The pizzas looked good but I didn't try them. The staff, including the young servers and the owner, were pleasant. Overall, a solid option for a casual night out.

After growing tired of buffets, we tried this Chinese restaurant near the Peppermill. Located next to auto repair shops, the low-quality Chinese food left much to be desired. Our orders were repeatedly wrong and the dish we finally settled on was unpleasant. Would not recommend.

Overall, had a great experience at this restaurant despite a small issue with the Yelp coupon. The food was excellent, especially the chicken caeser salad which was loaded with chicken. The subs were fresh and delicious. The option of beer was a plus, but I opted for a Dr. Brown's cream soda which was great. The location is convenient, just a mile from the Wagon Wheel flea market. Would definitely recommend.

I had an incredibly positive experience at this optometrist. Dr. Neel and Robin were both friendly, knowledgeable, and incredibly helpful. They patiently answered all my questions, helped me choose some stylish frames, and fitted me for contact lenses. Overall, they were the best optometrists I have ever been to and I highly recommend them.
I had an amazing breakfast at this place with huge pancakes and simple home fries. The owner was very sweet and generous. Definitely a new favorite spot for me!

Stayed at this charming hotel in the Big Easy with my family for six nights. From the doorman to the brunch wait staff, everyone was friendly and helpful. The Carousel Bar is a must-visit. Great location, will definitely return on our next trip to New Orleans.
The chicken stew was disappointing and tasted like leftover fried chicken thrown into a pot. It was flavorless and made me feel nauseous. Would not recommend.

Wei Hong in St. Louis failed to impress with its take out service and mediocre food quality. The steamed dumplings were too doughy, and the beef and broccoli had an inedible texture and off flavors. The general Tao's chicken and orange beef also suffered from strange textures and gloopy sauces. Overall, the experience was disappointing and we won't be returning.
Cecile was incredibly helpful in assisting us with loading plywood for Hurricane Irma preparations. We greatly appreciate her assistance and support during this stressful time. Thank you, Cecile!

I had a fantastic dining experience at this restaurant. The chicken tagine was exceptional, with tender meat and flavorful seasoning. The carrot salad was a perfect complement with its mint and cumin flavors. The service was good and the atmosphere was cheerful and well-lit. The total cost was very reasonable at around $13. I highly recommend trying this place for a delicious and affordable meal.

While the atmosphere and service at this place were pleasant, the food was extremely disappointing. We received our food quickly, but it seemed like it was not made fresh as everything was either room temperature or undercooked. The Caesar salad was overdressed, hush puppies flavorless, and chicken wings undercooked. The only decent dish was the chicken and biscuits, although the biscuit was cold in spots. Overall, we would not dine here again due to the poor quality of the food.
After ordering online 30 minutes before pickup, I was disappointed to skip the line only to be told they had nothing in their system. Thanks for nothing.
If you're in Philly, you have to try the cream filled donuts from this place. They are absolutely incredible and worth the drive back for more. Don't miss out on this heavenly treat!

This place is not worth your time or money. The owners and bartenders prioritize over-serving gamblers rather than maintaining a clean and welcoming environment. The kitchen has mold issues and smells terrible. The staff only care about tips from drunk gamblers. It's a sad excuse for a chicken joint or sports bar. Save yourself the trouble and go to a fast food place across the street instead.

First time visiting this restaurant and it was a great choice. Excellent service and friendly staff. Waitress went above and beyond to help my family, even assisting my wife with her jacket while she was holding our baby. The Chicken Katsu Curry Ramen, Shrimp Katsu Ramen, and Shoyu Ramen were all delicious. The pork buns were a standout, not traditional but still tasty. Overall, a great experience.

Brew D Licious has the best coffee in town, hands down. The owner, Brigitte, is extremely knowledgeable and always ensures her coffee is fresh. I buy in bulk because it's that good. Can't wait for the new location to open and escape the funky smell of the Hollander Hotel. Highly recommend trying this place out.

If you're in the mood for fantastic pizza and knots by the beach, look no further! The location is excellent with a cool street presence. It's clear that these guys know what they're doing. Highly recommend.

If you're an oyster lover, this is the place to go. Fresh and delicious oysters that are bound to impress. Don't expect the servers to know the specific type, but trust me, it won't matter once you taste them. Highly recommended!
Just tried the food and it was excellent, the best I've had in the area. The kung pao beef and basil shrimp with pork fried rice were all very good. Fast delivery too. Highly recommend!

My wife and I had a delicious meal at this place that offers more than just deli food. We tried the Philly and the club sandwiches, both of which were tasty and reasonably priced. Our total for four bags of chips and two sandwiches was just over $20. Make sure to come hungry, as the portions are large.

Despite some questionable reviews, my personal experience with this place has been nothing but positive. The staff may not be overly friendly, but their competence in dry cleaning and alterations is unmatched. They were able to remove decade-old stains from a jersey and have consistently provided a quick turnaround time, even during peak seasons. I highly recommend their services and will continue to bring my clothes here for future alterations and dry cleaning.

This location is larger than the Rittenhouse one, with the added bonus of street parking. The server was friendly and helpful in recommending dishes. The Groothie was too sweet for my liking, but the Udon Noodle Salad was delicious.

First time dining with family, Bailey was excellent - friendly and attentive. Food was incredible, generous portions and fresh. Impressed with the quality as a first-time visitor. Will definitely be returning.

Overall, the entrees were tasty and the prices were reasonable at this Fazoli's location. The breadsticks were a highlight, but the lackluster service and attitude from staff members detracted from the overall experience. With some improvements in customer service and efficiency, this restaurant could easily earn a higher rating.

Overall, the car wash at Riverside Plaza was convenient and entertaining with iguanas and parrots in the waiting area, as well as a view of the auto wash system. The basic $12 tchoup treatment was quick and my car was ready before I finished checking out. However, there were still some missed spots on my car, making me question if the price was worth it compared to my favorite car wash in Los Angeles. I may try a touchless system next time for potentially similar results without the extra entertainment.
The turtle tank has been replaced with a colorful fish aquarium, but the fate of the turtle is unknown. Despite this, the update is still recommended highly.
This Starbucks location excels at drive thru service, with quick-moving lines and efficient staff. The interior and outdoor seating options are also ample. Overall, a great Starbucks option.

I specifically requested a scissor cut for my straight hair, but the stylist insisted on using clippers despite my clear instructions. As a result, 90% of my hair was cut with clippers. I would recommend finding a different salon if you are seeking a scissor cut, as you may end up with a high and tight military-style fade instead.

Had a fantastic lunch experience at this restaurant in NOLA. The artichoke and crab salad was incredibly delicious and the grilled and roasted vegetable platter was also top-notch. The ambiance and location added to the overall great dining experience. Highly recommend trying this place!

The lunch at this Nashville airport spot was recommended to me and did not disappoint. The funky and eclectic atmosphere added to the experience. The menu offered great and healthy food choices. The standout dish for me was the sweet potato casserole with coconut and dried cranberry – it was truly fantastic. Overall, a highly recommended dining option.
This intimate venue is a must-visit whenever we're in town from Orlando. The staff is fantastic and the service is top-notch. Be sure to request table #4 for a great experience.

This place delivers on all fronts - delicious food, welcoming atmosphere, and top-notch service. The Belgian Waffle with Nutella is a must-try, though prices are a bit steep. Overall, a consistently great dining experience worth coming back to.

Overall, this late brunch spot is a solid choice with no wait after 1 pm on weekends. However, the lack of an organized seating system can be frustrating. The food ranges from ok to awesome, with the waffle being a standout. Service can be hit or miss, but overall is attentive. The clean restaurant and good value make it worth a visit.

Overall, I had a mixed experience at this place. While the reuben sandwich was disappointing due to the rye bread, my fiancee's sandwich was amazing. The spice chicken soup and corn bread were great, but the chai latte was not up to par. The prices are a bit high, but the atmosphere is nice and the staff are friendly. Give it a try and see what you think.

Target is a great alternative to Walmart with a wide selection of products, including makeup, groceries, and household items. The prices are usually cheaper than other stores, and the store is well-organized with plenty of registers open for quick checkout.
I had a great experience at the Oyster Bar, particularly enjoyed the "firecracker" made by Kentrelle. Oysters were spectacular. 5 stars but rating dispersion makes me question generosity.

HMV's largest location in the city offers a wide selection of gifts and titles, including older and less mainstream options.
