The staff at the tills are efficient and not pushy about signing up for their rewards program. However, the prices are average and the ordering process can be slow. Overall, a great option for hard-to-find items.

Wow is all I have to say about this restaurant. The friend oysters are a must try, along with the crawfish bisque and shrimp with grits. Everything we ordered was delicious. Just be sure to make a reservation in advance as it gets busy.

After a frustrating search for the perfect coat, I finally found my dream coat at Ross Dress for Less. The manager went above and beyond to exchange the coat for me, even though I had no receipt or tags. Excellent customer service and I will definitely be returning to Ross in the future. Highly recommend!

HipCityVeg is an excellent choice for a delicious and satisfying meal. The Udon Noodle Salad and Crispy Hipcity Ranch are particularly outstanding. The staff is friendly and the service is fast. Plus, they offer delivery service for added convenience. Highly recommended.

Philadelphia, I love you. This wood-fired pizza joint captures the essence of true Italian flavors. The Marinara pizza was simple yet delicious, while the Salsiccia pizza with roasted fennel was a stroke of brilliance. The cocktails were expertly crafted and served with a hipster-cool touch. The Rotolo with mortadella and pistacchio pesto was crazy amazing. The dessert of Italian cookies and Affogato was the perfect ending to an exceptional meal. The service was friendly and top-notch. 5 stars all around!

This store offers high-end designer clothing with excellent customer service. The staff are friendly and not pushy, allowing for a more relaxed shopping experience. While they carry casual clothing, their specialty is suits, dress shirts, and fancy clothing. Standout option in West Edmonton Mall for men's dressy wear, but be prepared to spend. Overall, a great place to find quality clothing.

The food at this Mediterranean food truck is tasty but not exceptional. The portion size could be improved for the price, but it's still fair. The late-night spot offers plenty of seating and a clean, quiet atmosphere amidst the busy nightlife. The servers are friendly and efficient. Overall, a unique experience worth returning to.

This bait shop is fantastic. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always offering helpful suggestions on where to fish. The bait is top quality and the tackle selection is great with unbeatable prices. I used to buy from big box stores but now only shop here. My only complaint is that there aren't more locations in town! Highly recommend this place for all your fishing needs.
Nigel is a fantastic guy, and his candy is top-notch. It's definitely worth driving for. All my friends absolutely love the Bon bons he sells - they can't get enough of them!

Muriel's in the French Quarter offers a delicious 17.00 lunch special that includes a soup or salad, entree, and the option for a 4.00 Bloody Mary or martini. The Bloody Mary was spicy and well-sized for the price. The restaurant's atmosphere is lovely, with open shutters and a great location. The servers were a bit forgetful, but the food was excellent. The turtle soup and pork chop were highlights, although the cornbread was dry. The portions were generous and left us satisfied until bedtime. Overall, Muriel's is a fantastic choice for a classic New Orleans meal at a reasonable price. Highly recommend for anyone visiting the Quarter.
Stopped at this place based on shuttle driver's recommendation and was not disappointed. The red velvet ice cream was incredible - rich and creamy with delicious cake pieces throughout. Yum!

While the woman at the counter was friendly and accommodating, the food at this American-Chinese restaurant was just average. The vegetarian options were tofu-based, which was a nice touch. The lunch specials are a good deal, but unfortunately, I got food poisoning after eating here and will not be returning.

Overall, the restaurant was delicious with a standout deep dish pizza featuring a unique cornmeal crust. The bianco salad was tasty but lacked excitement. The only downside was the lack of reservations and high prices. Nonetheless, a visit is worthwhile if you are in the area.

Indy Reads is a must-visit bookstore in downtown, supporting adult literacy with its great selection of new and used books. The cozy atmosphere is perfect for browsing, chatting with fellow book lovers, and attending book readings. Prices are affordable and all proceeds go towards a good cause. The only downside is the jam-packed $1 children's book section, but overall, Indy Reads is a fantastic bookstore worth checking out.

The customer had a negative experience at this tire shop due to the rude and unhelpful staff. They were not able to make an appointment and faced a long wait time. Ultimately, they went to a different tire shop, Mr. Tire, where they received quick and efficient service. It is recommended to read reviews on Yelp before visiting this particular tire shop.
Wonderful experience with this flower shop! I gave them creative freedom within a specific budget and they delivered a bright and cheery arrangement promptly. Highly satisfied, thank you!

Overall, this review highlights the disappointing experience at this particular restaurant. The lack of prompt service, strange food presentation, and poor quality of dishes are major factors contributing to the one-star rating. The reviewer suggests not wasting time at this establishment, hinting that even Taco Bell may be a better option.

Karyn's coffee shop is a charming spot with a welcoming atmosphere. The coffee is top-notch and being able to utilize the convenient drive-through is a huge plus. Karyn's friendly demeanor adds to the overall positive experience. Highly recommend stopping by for a delicious cup of coffee.

Ed's offers endless entertainment with a variety of activity spaces, restaurants, bars, and lounges under one roof. It's reminiscent of a cruise ship experience with pool rooms, video games, bowling, dance areas, and live music. The venue hosts a mix of well-known and lesser-known bands, providing a platform for emerging musicians. It's a great spot for young kids, birthday parties, and music lovers alike. Overall, Ed's is a fun and vibrant destination for a day or night out in E-town.

While I may have a different perspective due to my extensive culinary experiences in Asia Pacific, I found the rave reviews of this place to be a bit exaggerated. However, the enjoyable conversation and company that accompanied the meal definitely enhanced the overall experience.

I was disappointed to learn that they no longer offer the salad and pizza bar. I used to frequent their other location and was excited to have salad there again. Unfortunately, they only offer whole pizzas now. Not the same experience as before.

Poblano's used to serve a delicious Amiga bowl with shredded grilled chicken and rice, but recently replaced the ingredients with dry chicken crisps. When expressing my disappointment, the manager insisted that this was the dish they had been serving for years. The soft tacos were also disappointing, with stale shells and bland filling. It seems like they were struggling in the kitchen due to a walkout. Overall, a disappointing experience - two thumbs down for Poblano's.

Despite its convenient location and appealing crust, Dewey's main downfall lies in the overwhelming saltiness of their pizzas. The pepperoni, socrates revenge, and bronx bomber all tasted excessively salty, making it difficult to taste any other flavors. The salads, while a good size, seem to lack the value compared to their price. If Dewey's can adjust their salt levels, it would greatly improve the overall dining experience.

Overall, my experience at PF Changs was a mix of highs and lows. The server was attentive and friendly, but the food fell short of expectations. The egg drop soup was good, but the rest of the food arrived at room temperature and lacked flavor. The shrimp with candied walnuts was overly sweet and the brown rice was bland. The chocolate cake for dessert was amazing, but overall, I left slightly disappointed. The restaurant does cater well to food allergies like gluten.

The rib dinner and pulled pork on a bun were flavorful, but the ribs were tough. The mac n cheese was delicious and worth the hype. The baked beans were average and the cole slaw had a strange aftertaste. The unique experience of dining in an abandoned car wash was memorable. Overall, worth a try for the mac n cheese alone.

The fries are the standout at this restaurant - absolutely delicious and worth going back for! However, the beef kebob sandwich was disappointing with too many onions and not enough meat. Willing to give it a second chance due to great service and fair prices. Smoothies tasted artificial, but the mom and pop feel of the restaurant adds to its charm.

Taqueria Burrito's Grill is a hidden gem in New Orleans East, offering truly authentic Mexican cuisine. The green sauce is a must-try and their cheese enchiladas are delicious. The Mexican rice is also top-notch. With new ownership and a recent move from Houston, you can expect quality food and service. Open 7 days a week with breakfast served from 9am-11am, it's the perfect spot for a satisfying meal. I'll definitely be a frequent customer! YUMMY!
The portion size of the Mexican Roll and Philadelphia Roll was disappointing for take-out, and the taste was bland without anything special.

Living near Mass Ave shopping can be limited, but the options are competitive. Silver in the City is my go-to for trendy home and style items, and they even allow dogs in the store. However, the constant watchfulness of the employees can be off-putting. Overall, a great spot to find unique gifts. 4 stars.

The takeout from this restaurant was delicious, especially the puttanesca which had the perfect combination of salty spiciness. The menu offered a wide variety of options including the ability to create your own dish. However, I was disappointed that there was no gluten-free dough option available, as my stomach will likely suffer from this indulgence later on.
The food was fantastic, especially the crab cake Benedict which was delicious. The service was great and they had amazing smoothies. Highly recommend!

I finally tried Grillades for breakfast at this diner-style restaurant in New Orleans and it was well worth it. The slow roasted beef with peppers and onions in a brown gravy over creamy Gouda cheese grits was absolutely delicious. The service was quick and our server was great. A must visit for future trips to New Orleans.
One of the worst experiences I've had with a rental company. Unresponsive staff, misleading information, and no concern for customer satisfaction. Avoid at all costs.

Sierra and India from JOTSB provided impeccable care for my family reunion in Santa Barbara. They were organized, thoughtful, and went above and beyond to ensure our needs were met. Highly recommend for any event planning needs in the area.

I was underwhelmed by this place. Despite the lack of bagels and unappealing signage, the food was just alright. The pastrami portion was lacking and the cheese wasn't melted. My wife even had spoiled creamer in her coffee. We'll be sticking to Einstein's or St. Pete Bagel in the future.
Great Italian restaurant with friendly staff, reasonable prices, and delicious homemade salad dressing. The food is top-notch, making it a must-visit spot for Italian cuisine lovers.

I highly recommend the breakfast burritos at this place. The bacon, egg, cheese, and potato combination is delicious and well-balanced. The potatoes are seasoned perfectly and cut small, so you get a good mix of flavors in every bite. The salsa bar offers a nice variety of options, and the staff is always friendly. The only minor complaint is that it could use a bit more cheese. Overall, a great spot located conveniently close to home.

New to Tucson and tried a variety of pizza places near U of A, this is the best so far. Best pizza I've ever had, even beats NYC. Magical crust and perfect spiciness in the five alarm. Highly recommend trying it out.
Despite the crowd, Honey's lived up to the hype for my birthday brunch. The food was delicious, especially the French toast and Jewish apple cake. Can't wait to go back!

Tria is a go-to spot for beer and wine enthusiasts thanks to their knowledgeable staff and great selection. The outside seating during warmer months is a bonus, but the real star of the show are the drinks. The bustling atmosphere adds to the experience. Although I haven't tried the food, the drinks alone make it worth visiting.

Mae's is a hidden gem on the east side, with a welcoming atmosphere, fresh and delicious food, and excellent service. The prices are very affordable, making it a great option for families. Lunch specials are a must-try! Highly recommend giving Mae's a visit.

This place is a must-visit gem in Tucson! The flavors are incredible, especially the strawberries & champagne, toasted marshmallow, and cheesecake. I was thrilled when they opened locations in the valley after I moved to Phoenix. I will definitely be a frequent visitor here!

This location has severely declined in quality over the past few years. With only 2 staff members working, the service was slow and the food was barely edible. The sandwich I received was on hard, burnt bread. They need to improve drastically or close down.

The cemetery is quiet and well laid out, with impressive gravestones and angels to photograph. However, the presence of witches and the girly's creepy obsession with the cemetery may turn some people off. On the bright side, there are no zombies to be found.

I chose Holiday Inn Express in Port Richey for its two-bed option, price, proximity to family, and complimentary breakfast. The staff was friendly, wifi was free, and breakfast was tasty with hot and cold options. However, the beds were too soft and uncomfortable, affecting my sleep quality. The thermostat control for the AC was unreliable. Overall, the stay was just okay compared to my usual Hyatt Place/House experience.
The staff at this restaurant seemed more interested in socializing and watching TV than helping customers. The food was decent but not outstanding. Overall, I would rate my experience a 2 out of 5.

The food at this place is excellent, but the customer service and portion sizes have drastically declined over time. I have been a loyal customer for two years, but recently the portions have become significantly smaller. When I expressed my concerns, I was told I was wrong and then berated for not taking the food I ordered. As a result, I will not be returning to this establishment.

I had a great dining experience at this restaurant. The staff was friendly and helpful with menu suggestions. The house margaritas were delicious and the Happy Hour is a good deal. The chicken poblano dish was excellent and my friend enjoyed his enchiladas, especially being able to have three different types on one plate. Overall, highly recommend this place for good food and a great atmosphere.
The salted caramel chocolate cake was the best we ever had, and the Apple Brown Betty was also awesome. The beer selection was good as well. Highly recommend trying these desserts.

This bar is great for the college crowd with its laid back atmosphere and cheap drinks. The projectors for watching the big game are a nice touch, but the screen could be wider to prevent the picture from going off the wall. The spacious layout during the day gives potential for a great night scene.

Terrible service. Staff seemed confused and constantly got my order wrong. Ordered a half sausage half cheese pizza, but received all sausage. This is the second time in a month that I've experienced issues with this establishment. Very disappointing.

I would not recommend eating at Marmont Steakhouse. The crab bisque soup was cold, the calamari was bland and rubbery, and the lobster ravioli turned out to be beef, despite multiple warnings about dietary restrictions. The staff's response to the mistake was nonchalant and insincere, leading to a disappointing and ultimately ill experience.

Tako is hands down the best sushi spot. Fresh and delicious dishes, fun private rooms for a festive night out, BYO policy, and affordable prices. Personal favorites include the jalapeño yellowtail, kani salad, bird's nest roll, and naruto. Highly recommend for a great dining experience.

The local ice cream shop offers delicious custom-made flavors, including Expresso Chip, Moose Tracks, and Graham Slam. Each flavor is unique and satisfying, making it a must-try for ice cream enthusiasts.

My husband and I have been bringing our trucks here for years and have been satisfied with the service. The Wednesday ladies day discount is a nice perk, and the $5 car wash is great for a quick clean. While it's not a hand wash, it's still a good option for a basic wash. They also offer specials on auto detail packages, which we always take advantage of and have been pleased with the results.
Overall, this place is average. The food is decent but nothing special, and the service can be hit or miss. The drunken noodles and Thai green curry were both just okay.

Redemption is truly a hidden gem in an old church setting. The service was impeccable and the food, like the paneed smoked soft shell crab and seafood stuffed filet of fish, was exceptional. A must-visit for food enthusiasts looking for a memorable dining experience.

I absolutely love this place! It's conveniently located down the street from me and I find myself there almost every other week. They rotate their flavors regularly and have a variety of toppings available, some of which are kept under the counter. The intense EDM music they play adds to the overall experience and makes it truly unique. Highly recommend checking this place out!

This restaurant offers amazing dishes such as Steak Tartare, Caribbean Seafood Pepper Pot, and Curried Goat. The Tartare is possibly the best I've ever had. The goat dish with sweet curry and gnocchi was unique and delicious. The lime cheesecake was top-notch. The service was exceptional, even in a town known for hospitality. Overall, a great dining experience.

This restaurant offers a unique and varied menu in a stylish, masculine setting. Despite a somewhat unattractive location, the interior is warm and inviting. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. The food is creative and well-executed, with some items being standouts while others fell slightly short. Prices are reasonable for the quality of the food. A great spot for a quiet, intimate dinner.
"High Score! This frozen yogurt spot is a winner in my book. Delicious flavors, even the fat-free ones are indulgent. Convenient location on South Street for a sweet treat. Definitely worth a visit."

I was highly impressed by the exceptional service at this restaurant. The quality of the food and decor were average, but the servers went above and beyond to handle demanding customers with professionalism. The server, a smaller girl with purple hair, managed multiple tables effortlessly and expertly explained the menu. Kudos to the staff for their outstanding customer service. Five stars well deserved.

Hallmark dealership offers a smooth and transparent shopping experience with fair prices, competitive certifications, and warranties on used vehicles. The staff is friendly and not pushy, making it a refreshing change from other dealerships. While I didn't purchase a vehicle here, I would recommend checking them out for a stress-free car-buying experience.

I had a disappointing experience at this restaurant. The white meat fried chicken was slimy and salty, and the sides were cold and flavorless. The service was strange, with the server laughing during my order, which made me uncomfortable. Won't be returning.
The lobster rolls at this restaurant are delicious, both the warm and cold options. The bread is amazing as well. While it may be on the expensive side, the quality of the food makes it worth it.

The Habit Burger is a top-notch burger joint that rivals even In-N-Out. The double char burger and chocolate shake at the Goleta location were delicious, and the onion rings were also a stand-out. A solid choice for a tasty burger fix.
My husband and I have been regulars at this place for the past 8 years. The food is great, served quickly, and they have fantastic drink specials. Highly recommend.

Delicia in Broad Ripple is a charming spot with a trendy atmosphere and delicious cocktails. While the lack of reservations can be frustrating, arriving early is worth it for a table. The guacamole was tasty, but be cautious of nut allergies. The Harvest salad and entrees like Veracruz Trigger fish and Serrano Scallops were all excellent. The Tostones were a bit dry but paired well with the flavorful Stewed Black Beans. The lack of gluten-free, dairy-free dessert options was disappointing. Overall, a great spot for a lively meal, just be prepared for potential noise issues.

Jackson's offers a delicious panini Reuben with great use of garlic and well-melted cheese. However, serving the sandwich directly on a plate can lead to soggy bread if it sits too long. The salad coming out at the same time as the sandwich was also not ideal. Despite these minor issues, the high prices are justified by the quality of food and drinks offered. The wait staff is friendly, but service can be lacking at times due to the hustle expected. Overall, a good experience with a great wine and beer selection, making me likely to return.

While I had a great experience with Young for my pedicure, I was disappointed with my gel manicure done by the owner. She didn't fully remove the old polish and the application was uneven with noticeable bumps and uncovered sides. I may not be returning due to this.
The trio appetizer was amazing and the pizza was delicious. Highly recommend trying both!

This hidden gem on the Westside of Tucson offers delicious food at a reasonable price. The Indian taco and sweet fry bread are must-tries. Don't miss out on their daily specials, like $1 tacos on Tuesdays and Fridays. Personally, I eat here at least once a week and highly recommend it.

This bakery not only offers delicious cookies, cupcakes, and puddings, but their salted caramel cake is exceptional. The four layers of moist cake with caramel buttercream were both elegant and delicious, made from real ingredients like butter and sugar. It's a rare combination of taste and quality.

If you're looking for a sweet treat after dinner, skip the fancy dessert and head to this place on Broadway. The homemade ice cream is delicious, especially the Cake Mix flavor. It's a great spot to top off a date and take a leisurely stroll. Highly recommend!

I stumbled upon this local sushi spot and couldn't be happier. The sushiya roll was delicious with fresh salmon and perfect miso soup. Will definitely be a regular customer from now on. 10/10 recommend.

The Thai food at this restaurant is absolutely delicious. It's the best I've tried in the area. The red curry, pad thai, and chicken satay with peanut sauce are all standout dishes. I only wish I lived closer so I could enjoy it more often. The lunch specials are also a great deal. Highly recommend!

I visited this place with my family and daughter for the first time and my daughter had a great time with plenty of activities to enjoy. However, the cleanliness of the place was disappointing with dust everywhere, hanging electrical cords, and no staff seen cleaning during our visit. Management should definitely prioritize maintaining a clean environment, especially for the price we paid for admission. I hope they take this feedback seriously and make improvements. 2 stars.

I had a great experience at this salon as a walk-in. The location was clean, the staff was friendly, and Tammy did an amazing job on my eyebrows. As a first-time guest, I received free service. They also offer great packages for various waxing services. I will definitely be returning.

I am disappointed with the quality of food at this restaurant. The sushi was poorly cut and tasteless, while the dynamite was overly salty and filled with mayonnaise. I had to leave most of it uneaten. This was the worst dining experience I've had at a supposed 4.5 star restaurant. Avoid at all costs.

The service at this restaurant is extremely poor, with waitresses ignoring tables in favor of chatting with friends and even suggesting that customers order to go instead of dining in. Save yourself the frustration and get delivery instead. Not worth the hassle.

This Caribbean restaurant offers the best food in town, with fresh, perfectly cooked dishes that are not too heavy. The stewed chicken and curried chicken were excellent, as well as the plantains. The owner was friendly and attentive, ensuring that we enjoyed our meal. Prices are unbeatable and there are hidden gems like oxtails not on the menu. BYOB adds to the charm. A must-try spot deserving of all 5-star reviews. Be sure to visit and spread the word.

Overall, Momo's Ouzaria is a cool place with an upbeat ambience, making it great for a group or first date. The tapas plates we tried were all enjoyable, especially the pan-seared scallops. Portions were generous, so pacing your order might be wise. The Greek salad dressing was too sweet for our tastes, but the gyro meat was good. The Spanish granacha wine was excellent at just $6. The belly dancer was fun but a bit awkward. While I've had better Greek food elsewhere, Momo's is a good choice for a night out. We'll be returning.

The service at this store has significantly declined in recent years. Staff members are stuck up and overly critical, making the overall shopping experience uncomfortable. Despite fond memories of the store from the past, repeated poor service has driven me away for good. Not worth the hassle of visiting again.

The jazz show at this legendary venue is worth the inconvenience of standing in line and sharing a wooden bench with strangers. The lack of heat or A/C adds to the unique charm of the space. A must-try experience at least once, with a high likelihood of becoming a repeat attendee.
The experience is lackluster and not worth the $5 per person fee. The layout is confusing, the self-guided tour is boring, and it is recommended to save your money and visit the courthouse instead.
If you're in St Louis, MO, don't miss out on the best frozen custard in the city. It's simply unmatched and a must-try gem.

While the ambiance may not be on par with a four-star restaurant, the service was pleasant and the food was decent enough for a casual stop. I might not rush back, but if I'm in the area and craving sushi, I wouldn't hesitate to return. Just be prepared for a slightly rundown atmosphere.

The food was incredible! We tried a variety of dishes including the crawfish beignet, seafood stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes, crab cake po boy, and seafood flatbread. Each dish was delicious and we left feeling satisfied. Highly recommend trying a little bit of everything!

If you're looking for a Blizzard, this Dairy Queen may be the place for you. However, the young staff may not offer the best service and quality of food. Consider finding a different location if you're looking for something other than a Blizzard.

My husband and I love supporting local businesses when we travel. This shop offers a wide variety of locally-made goods, from clothes to artwork to food items. The shop owner is friendly and the atmosphere is eclectic. We found a unique dragonfly wall sculpture and space age pens designed by a local artist. Definitely worth checking out!

I absolutely love this coffee shop. As a coffee connoisseur from Sacramento, I can confidently say this place is a gem. The matcha lattes are especially delicious. It's now my go-to spot in Reno. Highly recommend!
I recently moved to Idaho and had a great experience at Chipotle thanks to Taylor. She comped one of my meals and had amazing customer service. Truly made my week. Highly recommend!

With an extensive martini menu boasting around 500 options and giant pitchers of Petron margaritas, this place is a must-visit for cocktail lovers. The prices are reasonable, the service is fantastic, and the staff are always willing to help navigate the menu. Don't miss out on this gem!

Claudio's is a must-visit destination for all Italian food enthusiasts. Their old-school, family atmosphere and exceptional knowledge of cheeses and food make them a standout choice. The staff goes above and beyond to help customers and the overall experience is like no other. Even if you're not Italian, you'll be drawn in by the authentic feel of Claudio's. Don't just shop for Italian food, have an experience at Claudio's. Highly recommend.

This hotel is overpriced, with poor service and mislabeled as a resort when it's actually a loud convention hotel. The size of the hotel makes it easy to get lost and getting a quick meal is nearly impossible. Avoid staying here if you want a relaxing experience.

While the service and atmosphere were nice, I was let down by the food at this place. The Dan Dan noodles were tasty but lacked protein, the scallion pancakes were subpar compared to other places, and the Wontons in Chilli oil were disappointing. The Talapia Medallions were fried well but had greens that were difficult to chew. Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again as it felt commercialized and Americanized. I prefer more authentic and flavorful Cantonese or hole in the wall spots.

Despite multiple requests for a feather-free room, the Hyatt failed to deliver, causing concern for the guest's health. Additionally, the high parking fee in St. Louis added to the disappointment. The lack of attention to detail and customer service is concerning.
Delicious pancakes with generous portions and a great variety of breakfast meats, including turkey options. Arrive early to avoid long wait times. Overall, highly recommended.

Overall, the restaurant's food was average at best. As experts on fried green tomatoes, my family was disappointed with their rendition. The meatloaf was good, but the sides were just average. The entertainment was lackluster as well, with only a couple songs played per hour, leaving us wanting more.

Tina provided excellent and prompt service during our visit, despite it being a Sunday morning. The wait time was brief, around 15 minutes. The huevos bruncheros were a standout dish and a must-try for breakfast. Highly recommend trying it for yourself.

I recently received my new glasses from this store and unfortunately they were horribly out of focus. The staff member attempted to reposition them, but it didn't make a difference in my vision. They claimed to have measured the position of the pupils in relation to the lenses, but I don't recall this being done. I requested for the lenses to be redone urgently, but I still have not received them. Overall, I am very disappointed with the service and quality of the glasses.

This place is a hidden gem for computer items at great prices. The staff may have a language barrier but are helpful and patient. They have a variety of products and I highly recommend checking them out for your computer needs.

Overall, I had a great experience at this hotel. The Clue game theme is unique and fun. The staff, from bell boys to bartenders, were respectful and provided excellent service. The customer service over the phone was pleasant. The location is convenient, although the streets can be busy. Coming from California, I found the service to be phenomenal. However, the prices for food and drinks at the hotel can be pricey, so I recommend exploring cheaper options in the area. The only downside was the lack of air vent in the bathroom. Despite this, my girlfriend and I are already planning to return next year. Thank you to the staff for a great stay.

The strawberry flavor at this location in Atlantic City was unexpectedly delicious. Not overly sweet, with bits of real strawberry throughout. Priced at $2 for a small, it was worth every penny. Can't wait to try more flavors next time I'm in the area.

I had a fantastic lunch at this restaurant yesterday. The friendly staff and generous portions made for a great dining experience. The recipes from Mrs. Doll are delicious and it's wonderful to see her son carrying on the family legacy. Highly recommend!

The food at Bridgeport Rib House is good and the prices are fair, but the service experience when picking up take-out orders in the bar is lacking. There are better options for barbecue in the area with better service.

The new menu and raised prices at this place are not worth it. The food is mediocre at best and seems to deteriorate quickly. As a beginner cook, I can tell the quality is lacking. The service was also subpar, with the hostess being the only positive aspect. Not worth the money, even during happy hour. Not a high-end restaurant despite trying to portray itself as one. Avoid this place.

I had a great experience getting a battery replacement and pin fix for my watch at this shop. The staff was extremely nice and didn't charge me for the battery replacement. The service was a bit slow, but the quality and kindness made up for it. I would highly recommend this shop for anyone in the market for jewelry.

This restaurant offers a unique fusion of Jewish deli, southern comfort, and Mexican dive cuisine. The brisket is delicious, but the sauce isn't tomato-based. The latke is a unique shape but incredibly tasty. The Jewish Apple Cake was a hit, despite being slightly overcooked on the bottom. Perfect for bringing on the go - still delicious hours later.

While the food at this Chinese restaurant may be mediocre, the main draw is renting a karaoke room for a large group and bringing your own drinks. The restaurant is well-equipped to handle rowdy groups, and the prices are reasonable with quick service. The karaoke machines offer up-to-date songs in various languages.

Long overdue update to my review of Khyber - still a favorite despite moving further away. Excellent Southern barbecue, especially the brisket. Mac and cheese is a must-try. Vibes are lively but not overwhelming, staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Always a great experience.

The breads at this place are exceptional, particularly the German rye. My go-to breakfast is the perfectly cooked poached eggs. For lunch, I love the eggplant panini or Laurie's salad. Would highly recommend for delicious and satisfying meals.

Tony's in Chalmette offers unexpectedly delicious Mexican food that surpasses expectations. The chiles rellenos are a standout dish and the best I've had in all of Louisiana. Everything on the menu is consistently good, and they even offer Mexican Coca-Cola sweetened with real sugar. A must-try for any Mexican food enthusiast.
The business has a confusing ordering process and unprofessional staff. The sandwich was poorly made with minimal sausage. Overall, a disappointing experience and not recommended.

Overall, the dancewear store has friendly and attentive staff who offer a wide variety of quality products at a decent price. However, they lack options for men's dancewear and often don't have what I'm looking for. Convenient location in the city makes it a go-to stop for dancewear needs.

I visited based on a referral and was pleased with my experience. The service was quick, with three stylists working on my hair simultaneously. I had a medium-sized individuals done, including hair, for $150. The staff was friendly and I would definitely go back. Overall, a great salon experience.

I love the lamb gyros plate at this restaurant. The tiramisu is delicious and the Greek salad is good too. I sometimes get an extra order to take home since it's a bit of a drive for me. The dolmas are good but a bit too vinegary for my taste. Overall, a great place for Greek food.

The Yum Yum Club is a great spot with awesome macaroni salad. Although the service could be friendlier at times, the affordable prices and delicious food keep me coming back. Highly recommended for a tasty meal on a budget.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our first time in Reno and it was a great choice. The room was fantastic with a spa and steam room feature in the shower. The hotel had many dining options and relaxation areas. The casino was clean and enjoyable, even for non-gamblers like myself. Easy checkout from the room was convenient. Overall, a great hotel option if you're looking for a nice, clean, and up-to-date place to stay in Reno.

Based on previous Yelp reviews, we took our kids to hibachi and sushi and were very pleased. The sushi was amazing, the hibachi was awesome, and the fried banana and ice cream dessert was a perfect ending to a great meal. The service was attentive and we will definitely be returning.
I highly recommend this place. The pizza is fantastic and the staff is very friendly. It's a perfect spot to gather with friends and family.
Had a great experience at this place with friends. Excellent service and delicious drinks. Will be returning in the future.

Despite high expectations due to great reviews, this place fell short for me. The lamb was tasty but overpriced, and the garlic Naan was disappointing as it seemed to be store-bought. Additionally, I was misled about American Express being accepted. Overall, I probably won't be back.

Hidden gem in Brentwood! Incredible flavors and innovative combinations that are sure to impress. The owner, Michael, is a delight and always has something new to try. A must-stop for ice cream lovers.
Overall, the food and coffee at this establishment are fantastic. The only downside is the limited options at the espresso bar. The baked goods are especially delicious.

Holly Grove is a fantastic local gem with a wide selection of produce and locally-sourced meats and bread. The atmosphere is inviting, with people tending to the garden outside. The only downside is the location, but it's worth the trip to support local growers and makers. Highly recommend!

Overall, our experience at this restaurant was positive. The service was a bit slow on a busy Saturday night, but the complimentary homemade chips were fantastic. The food was delicious, with the burger and seasoned fries being a highlight. The blackened chicken was slightly over seasoned and spicy, but still good. The kid's menu was well-received, especially the macaroni and cheese. The seating layout inside was a bit odd, with tables close to the bathroom door. Despite this, the 15% military discount was appreciated. Overall, I would recommend this place, with the only drawback being the service speed.

Overall, this hotel in downtown Tampa is a solid choice. The suite with the fold out couch was comfortable and the happy hour with free drinks was a pleasant surprise, even though we missed it. The complimentary breakfast was fantastic, with made-to-order omelets, fresh fruit, cereal, bacon, sausage, juice, and more. The room itself was modern and clean, with two TVs and a strong shower. Great value for the price.

Overall, this restaurant in downtown St. Petersburg has a nice, homey feel. The burgers are flavorful and the arugula adds a nice touch to the chicken and potato gratin dish. While the cheese in the potato gratin wasn't a favorite, the burger was a standout. The wine prices were a bit high, so I skipped that, but the atmosphere was lovely and the waitress was great. Would definitely return for the burgers.

Cd Roma's has been a favorite spot of mine for over a decade. The new modern vibe is a welcome change that shows the restaurant's ability to evolve with the times. The food is still delicious, with standout dishes like Chicken Parm and Alfredo. The alfredo sauce is a must-try and pairs perfectly with their breadsticks. Some appetizers could be improved, but overall, Cd Roma's is still a top choice for Italian cuisine. I do miss the cozy feel of the old location, but the food and service make up for it.

The Waffle House is known for its consistent quality and delicious breakfast offerings. However, the small dining area and loud atmosphere may not be for everyone. Despite this, I still enjoy visiting for a tasty breakfast experience.

Henry was a fantastic rock star when helping us secure a storage locker. He was professional, knowledgeable, and courteous, making the experience extremely pleasant. He was also very personable and even took the time to be gracious to our dog Marley who accompanied us. Overall, a great experience and we highly recommend their services!

This restaurant is phenomenal with great location, ambience, and food. The drinks are exceptional, especially the cocktails created by mixologist Jared. The menu offers a variety of delicious options, and the specials are always wonderful. Don't hesitate to sit at the bar and challenge Jared with your drink preferences. Overall, a fantastic dining experience with consistently outstanding food and drinks.

Overall, while this place has a great location and a variety of fresh vegan options, I personally found it to be just average. The crispy ranch and curry tofu dishes were enjoyable, particularly the chick'n in the crispy ranch, but I expected more from a specialty vegan restaurant. The fries were good, but the green lemonade was too sweet for my taste. While I would recommend trying it for the unique items, I wouldn't say it's amazing for the price.
The service was extremely poor, the environment was dirty, and overall it was a terrible experience. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

The reviewer had an amazing experience at this vegan New Orleans-style food spot, even coming in the pouring rain for their last full day in the city. The staff member, Jamone, was helpful in providing a taste of everything, making it difficult to choose because everything was so delicious. The reviewer highly recommends trying this place as there is no bad choice on the menu. They were especially impressed with the flavorful food and generous portion sizes without breaking the bank. The bread pudding was a standout dish. Overall, the reviewer suggests coming hungry to fully enjoy the diverse and tasty options available.

Magical vegan heaven with delicious food. My non-vegan wife devoured their Philly steak and couldn't get enough. The curry tofu wrap was amazing. Limited seating but worth it for the kale lemonade alone. Will definitely be back next time we're in Philly.

My wife and I absolutely love this place! The management is attentive and the service is excellent. Be sure to try the Tiger Roll, Pink Lady Roll, and Tornado Roll. Ask for Billy, he's our favorite. Highly recommend this restaurant to others in the area. Enjoy!

Love this place for lunch in New Orleans! The fried chicken is delicious and the red beans and rice are a must-try. Always a staple on our trips to town. Friendly, attentive staff and great prices make it a perfect choice.

Mint is a neighborhood gem with no bad choices on the menu. The Taro Tapioca Smoothie is a perfect treat for those with a sweet tooth. A must-visit for locals looking for a delicious and satisfying meal.
I appreciated the freshness of the salsa, guacamole, and homemade chips at this restaurant. The shrimp burrito was delicious and generously sized. However, I found the wait staff to be just average.

Overall, I was disappointed with this place. The calzones were tasty but the crust was too bread-y for my liking. The fillings were good but a bit sparse on the meat. The dessert, an apple pie calzone, had a weird spice and lacked apple chunks. Despite the convenient location and nice vibe, I felt it was overhyped and underwhelming. I may give it another try, but I wasn't thrilled the first time.

This Philadelphia gem offers an amazing view, impeccable professional service, and great fare. Nick, our incredible server, recommended a delicious 2010 Bordeaux to complement our meal. Don't miss out on this must-see spot in the city. Can't wait to come back for the sunsets.

The food at this restaurant is delicious, but the long wait times and inability to turnover tables quickly make it difficult to enjoy. Waited over an hour to be seated and an hour to get food on a busy day. There were upset customers and empty tables not being seated. The staff was overwhelmed and management needs to improve staffing schedules. Unfortunately, I will not be returning due to the long wait times.

The breakfast at Terraza was a satisfying choice for a picky eater like me. Though the hashbrowns were undercooked, all other elements of the meal were enjoyable. The portions were large, prices were affordable, and the shaded patio was a nice touch. The service was prompt and friendly despite being short-staffed. I look forward to trying their lunch menu in the future. Overall, a solid breakfast spot with potential for further exploration.

This all you can eat place offers good value at $27 per adult, but the quality of the regular menu items is mediocre. Maki rolls were okay but appeared to be premade and cold. The oyster ponzu lacked ponzu and had a heavy coating. Good option for those craving a variety of rolls and greasy tempura, but avoid the squid dish.

After being treated rudely by another locksmith, I called this company and was pleasantly surprised. They arrived quickly, completed the job in less than an hour, and even gave me 4 free keys. Their service was unbeatable. Highly recommend.
Avoid this place at all costs. Crowded, smelly, and dirty with mediocre food and service. There are much better dining options in Philly. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

The beer selection and staff knowledge at this place are great, but the food left much to be desired. The fries were undercooked and inedible, one burger was well done and the other medium rare, both served on cold, hard buns. Service was lackluster and we were charged full price even though we couldn't eat the food. Not recommended for sober dining.

After a rocky first experience, I decided to give them a second chance and was pleasantly surprised. The pizza steak was delicious with plenty of mozzarella cheese and a generous amount of meat. Although my first order was mixed up, they made it right and the food ended up being good. I may have a new favorite pizza steak spot.

The longest bar in the City, IBP is a perfect spot for unwinding after a show or watching sports games. With a relaxed late-night crowd on Fridays and Saturdays, there is always a place to sit. The upstairs bar features pool tables and a separate jukebox, making it a versatile option for a night out. Ideal for those looking for a laid-back atmosphere without going to Chinatown or a Dive bar. Great for watching out-of-town sports games as well.

Overall, I would give the Village Pub four stars for their beer, atmosphere, and service. The happy hour deals, dog-friendly deck, and key lime pie are definite highlights. However, the smoking on the deck can be off-putting. In terms of food, I would only give it two stars. The pretzels are decent, but the cheese dip is subpar. The pretzel bun sandwiches are overpriced and underwhelming, especially compared to neighboring options. I would suggest focusing more on their strengths in beer and ambiance and allowing patrons to bring in food from other establishments.

I am extremely impressed with Modern Laundry. The establishment is always clean, the employees seem to genuinely enjoy their work, and the fluff and fold service was immaculate. My clothes were returned perfectly folded and clean, using environmentally friendly detergent. Laundry has now become a quick and convenient task thanks to Modern Laundry. Highly recommended.

The food and atmosphere at this CBD spot are excellent, with a recommendation for the raw oysters and burgers. However, be wary of the back room getting stuffy on busy days. Prices lean towards the higher side for lunch.
This small shop is definitely worth the drive. The wine cakes are excellent and the overall experience was great. I visited based on Yelp reviews and will definitely be going back.

I am usually critical of restaurants, but The Love exceeded all expectations with their exceptional Father's Day lunch. The menu was extensive and the atmosphere was lovely. The omelet was perfectly cooked and the surprises added to the dish were a nice touch. The Belgium waffles made with corn meal were a unique twist, and the La Columbe coffee was a favorite. Overall, there was nothing left to desire at The Love.

Overall, the sushi roll was good but options were limited. The hibachi grill experience was disappointing with steak cooked well done despite requesting medium, and chicken lacking seasoning. Additionally, beware of false advertising for a late happy hour as staff claimed it was for a different location not specified on the website. Make sure to clarify details before visiting.

While the small size of Lee How Fook didn't bother me, the underwhelming food left me disappointed. The appetizers were tasty, but the entrees fell flat - the sweet & sour chicken was overly sweet, vegetables undercooked, and the pan fried noodle dishes lacked flavor. The service was okay, but communication was a bit difficult. Overall, I left feeling full but unsatisfied. It's important to make reservations due to limited seating.
The hot chicken is delicious and one of the best I've ever had, even as a native Southerner. However, the small portion size comes at a high cost. The drinks are also top-notch.
Lee How Fook's general tso chicken is some of the best I have ever had. Try it for yourself and see what I mean. - Coolie

Chef John Besh at Luke in the Hilton hotel on St. Charles exceeded expectations with delicious New Orleans fare. The traditional dishes were well-executed, but the real standout was the unexpected stellar burger. Juicy, flavorful, and massive, it was a pleasant surprise that left a lasting impression. The bread pudding a la mode was also a must-try, with a mouth-watering, warm, and comforting taste. Despite the business suit crowd, the quality of the food at Luke makes it a repeat dining destination.
I was disappointed to discover that this location is closed, as I was craving their delicious fish tacos. Hoping they reopen or have another location nearby.

Jacob from Alpine Locksmith provided excellent and efficient service when I lost my car keys at Squaw. He arrived promptly, gave a fair price quote, and quickly made new keys for me. I highly recommend Alpine for their honest and quick service.

Service at this restaurant was extremely poor on New Years Day 2017. Despite being seated at 7:30, we were left waiting without even water until 8:15. Multiple waiters introduced themselves, but none provided service. After 45 minutes of trying to get water, we left and went to Dat Dog across the street, where we were blown away by the hot dogs. Thanks Dat Dog!
My order was 75% wrong and missing items, including a burger. Very disappointing experience.

Farmhaus was definitely worth the wait - the smoked fish dip and escolar with prawns were fantastic. The mushroom salad and tapenade were very good, while the meatloaf was a bit dry. The service was solid considering how busy they were. Looking forward to trying the blue plate special lunches and dining outdoors next time.

While the food at Dish is good, the lack of customer service really ruins the dining experience. Despite making a reservation two weeks in advance for 3 people, we were seated at a table meant for two with barely enough room to eat comfortably. When we requested a larger table, we were rudely told that it was not possible. This experience has unfortunately led us to remove Dish from our list of go-to restaurants.

Overall, I had a pretty good experience at this restaurant. The milkshake was amazing and the food and service were good as well. However, I couldn't shake the strange vibe I got from the place. But maybe that was just me being paranoid.

This restaurant does not deliver on its promise of authentic Greek cuisine. The dishes are Americanized versions of Mediterranean classics, and many traditional recipes are incorrectly prepared. For a true Greek dining experience, look elsewhere. Just say no.

The best meal in New Orleans! Amazing set price menu with a fresh strawberry salad, delicious chicken entrée with crispy skin and moist meat, and a rich chocolate cake. Attentive staff led by Travis, Susan & Caroline, with great vegetarian and pork options. Excellent location and overall the best meal in NOLA.

Kris at the front desk provided exceptional service by walking us with an umbrella to the car during heavy rain. Dr. Deutsch has been great with my nervous dog Leo, taking the time to ensure his comfort during appointments. Highly recommend this vet clinic.

The restaurant truly lives up to the "farm fresh" label with inventive, flavorful dishes and just-right portions. The cozy dining room, friendly atmosphere, and attentive service create the perfect setting to catch up with friends and loved ones. Be sure to grab a good bottle as it's BYO. Don't miss the delicious Bloody Beet Steak!
Bomb never disappoints with their island bowl. It's the perfect combination of flavors and always leaves me satisfied. Dr. Steve Bruhle's endorsement only adds to the appeal - "For your health!"

The burger was juicy and delicious, with high-quality ingredients that set it apart from other burger joints. The bacon, however, was too thick and fatty. The communal table setup was off-putting, leading to unwanted interactions with strangers.

I've been a member of LA Fitness for a few weeks now and overall, I'm really enjoying it. The gym is conveniently located, reasonably priced, and offers all the basic amenities you need for a good workout. The staff are friendly and helpful, and I appreciated the free personal trainer session when I signed up. It's also nice that my membership allows me to use any of their locations at no extra cost.

One downside for me is that they don't open until 8am on weekends, which is a bit late for my early morning workout routine. Additionally, the only group fitness class offered before work is a 5:45am spin class, which is too early for me. 

If you're looking for a gym with all the bells and whistles like a smoothie bar and high-tech equipment, LA Fitness may not be for you. But if you're simply looking for a clean, friendly gym with good equipment and a variety of classes, then you'll find value in joining LA Fitness.

If you're looking for top-notch sushi in Santa Barbara, look no further than Hiro San's restaurant. His exceptional skills as a chef and his high-quality ingredients ensure a fantastic dining experience. Hiro San is not only talented, but also a delightful person to interact with. Sitting in front of him will guarantee a memorable sushi experience.

This theater may be dated, but the cheap prices and friendly staff make it worth visiting. It's never crowded and offers a selection of major movies as well as unique Indie films. A great alternative to mainstream theaters.

Overall, this place has a fun and inviting atmosphere with great brunch food and an exceptional beer selection. However, our experience was dampened by the awful waiter who was rude, unhelpful, and made multiple mistakes. Would have been 4 stars if not for him.

Overall, the restaurant has a great atmosphere and a creative menu. The addition of La Mulita next door is a nice bonus. However, the lack of reservations and the requirement for the whole party to sit down at once can be inconvenient, especially on weekends. Be prepared for a bit of a wait if you have a latecomer in your group.
Cool Springs is a great option on a busy Thursday night when Bonefish Grill is packed. With a comfortable 15-minute wait, you can enjoy amazing food without the crowds.

Great experience in Tarpon Springs! The restaurant has a lot of staff who are efficient and friendly. The food was delicious, especially the Gyro and Chicken Slouvaki. The Spanokopita was good but had a slightly harder crust. The cheese was also a hit. Definitely our go-to spot for future visits.

The Gryphon Cafe is a cozy, intimate spot that exudes a chill and serene vibe. The lattes are excellent and made with strong espresso, attracting coffee connoisseurs away from the nearby Starbucks. However, their baked goods can be hit or miss, with some items being dry and stale. The cafe also supports a lively local music scene, with performances starting at 9 p.m. on Fridays and Saturdays. Overall, a great spot for a relaxing coffee experience.

Metamorphosis Tattoo is a rare gem in a sea of disappointing experiences at other tattoo shops in Indy. Trevor provided a professional, fun, and respectful experience during my rib tattoo, and I couldn't be happier with the result. The artists here are cool, chill, and actually care about their customers. Prices are fair and the non-refundable deposit ensures they take their work seriously. If you want a quality tattoo without the hassle, go to Metamorphosis. Highly recommend.
The lengua burrito was delicious, non-greasy, and neatly presented. Affordable and simple food. Can't wait to try the flan next time.
The poor lighting at this restaurant makes it difficult to see your food, which was only average in quality. I wanted to like it more, but unfortunately, the overall experience was mediocre.

The banana pudding at this shop is delicious, whether with extra toppings or just plain. The staff is welcoming and clearly cares about their customers. I love supporting this local business and hope it sticks around for a long time.

Shepard's provides extremely poor customer service when it comes to lost belongings. Despite initially denying finding the organizer, it was later discovered in their possession, missing only a $100 bill. The assistant manager refused to investigate the matter or help track down the missing money. This lack of responsibility and disregard for customer concerns is unacceptable.

Although this restaurant has received negative feedback in the past, they still do not seem to address their issues. My recent dining experience here was disappointing, with overpriced prime rib that was mostly fat and gristle. The fries were cold and I never received the correct accompaniments. It seems like the restaurant owner, Jeanne, does not make an effort to resolve customer complaints.

I recently tried the vegan general tso's pizza from this restaurant and was impressed. The crust was crispy and fluffy, packed with flavor, and the "chicken" had a delicious sauce with a slight kick. The staff was accommodating and the delivery was prompt. I will definitely be ordering from them again. Highly recommend giving them a try for their tasty vegan options!

This restaurant attached to the Drury Plaza hotel is a convenient choice for dinner, especially for large groups. The service was good overall, with only a few forgotten drinks expected with a party of 20+. The portions are huge and the food was delicious - especially the massive Cuban sandwich. The shandy is recommended, but the margaritas are not up to par, especially the patron one. The shrimp tacos have a kick but are also tasty.

Papertini deserves every one of those 5 stars for their creatively designed wedding flowers. They are not your typical florist, adding unique elements that truly stand out. The team is friendly and a valuable asset to any wedding. For those looking for something traditional, look elsewhere. But for those wanting a unique touch, Papertini is highly recommended.

Mr. B's in New Orleans provided a delicious and satisfying brunch experience on New Year's Day. The ambiance was welcoming with jazz music playing, and the service was friendly and efficient. The gumbo ya-ya was spicy and savory, while the bbq shrimp were rich and flavorful, despite being messy to eat. The fresh loaf of bread served at the beginning was a nice touch. Although slightly pricey, the overall experience was worth it. Would highly recommend trying their brunch if you have the opportunity.

Great Steakhouse in St. Louis with a view of the arch. Appetizers were decent, but the filet mignon was exceptional. Perfect size, perfectly cooked. Wine list was above average. Overall, a great dining experience.
Disappointing first experience with San Antonio Taco. Sides of refried beans and rice were too salty and clumpy, beef enchiladas had stringy, inedible meat. Unsure if I'll give them a second chance.

Cousin's in North Philly is the go-to spot for affordable essentials. While there are some issues with the produce and the hours, the convenience and prices can't be beat. Perfect for quick trips or when Trader Joe's is too far or too pricey.

Overall, my experience at this place was a bit hit or miss. The Sausage and Pepper Pizza and the cream puff pastry were standouts that I will definitely be going back for. The other sweets and bagels were good, but not exceptional. The pepperoni pizza was a disappointment with sparse toppings and bland flavor. The wait time for my order was also a downside. However, the proximity and variety of treats to try will likely bring me back in hopes of more great finds.

This speakeasy is a cool and chill spot with a classy ambience and casual vibe. Highly recommended for good cocktails and drinks with good music. Just know they only serve one appetizer that isn't that tasty, so don't expect great food. Overall, a true speakeasy experience.
Avoid this place at all costs. Ordered a large order and got spoiled food. Over 50% of the order was incorrect. Will not be returning.

Overall, I would rate this place 3 1/2 stars. I was disappointed that they did not have everything I wanted, such as the option to get a chicken slider on a biscuit and buttermilk bites. The glazed donuts were also thick and dry. However, the sliders I did have were enjoyable, especially the fried chicken one. The brown buttered cream sundae was delicious and came with the buttermilk bites I wanted. Good for a first try, but I probably won't be returning.

This small cafe near my apartment is a gem for breakfast and brunch. The salmon scramble with egg whites and tofu with brown rice breakfast plate were both delicious. The service is quick and welcoming. Highly recommend for a tasty meal.

Went for dinner on a Friday at 6pm and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't busy. Staff was friendly and the atmosphere had a cozy Magnolia Journal vibe. Food and drinks were delicious, but deducted a star for slow cocktail service and appetizers arriving with entrees. Understandable as they are new and working out kinks. Overall, a great experience!

This quiet restaurant with a 1960's business style offers a menu featuring dishes like Risotto, linguine with shrimp and lobster, and strip steak. The food was excellent and everyone at the table enjoyed their meals. The service was attentive and fantastic. Highly recommend for a great dining experience.

I highly recommend this sushi spot for their large rolls and excellent service. The Heat Attack appetizer is a must-try, and the Sapporo and Honey rolls are personal favorites. The deep-fried rolls are a unique and delicious option. The food is always fresh and well-presented. Don't miss out on the spicy sashimi bowl for a new and exciting dish!

The service at the bar was terrible on both of my visits. The first bartender seemed bothered by serving me, and the second bartender completely ignored me in favor of a larger group. I ended up leaving and going somewhere else due to the lack of acknowledgement and poor service. Maybe the experience is better at a table, but I would not recommend the bar area.
I love it here. Great atmosphere, variety of options, delicious bento boxes and boba. Those complaining should stick to eating at home. Don't miss the beef braised soup.

The restaurant has beautiful decor and a great atmosphere. The food was amazing, with better quality than expected for the price point. My husband had the udon noodles and I had several rolls, including the must-try Spicy Salmon. The flavors were great and not overpowering. Overall, we had a wonderful experience and would highly recommend it.

Overall, the hotel is lovely with extremely friendly and helpful front desk staff. We had a great stay away from the club, allowing for a peaceful night's sleep. If you're looking for a quiet stay, this may not be the best option, but if you're seeking a fun atmosphere, this hotel is perfect.

Absolutely outstanding pizza and gnocchi at this quaint family restaurant in Middle Tennessee. The fresh ingredients and variety on the menu made for a delightful dining experience. Reminiscent of a cozy spot in Europe, this is hands down the best pizza in the area.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of service I received for a $16 haircut. The student stylist exceeded my expectations by giving me a very professional-looking haircut that improved the health of my hair. The shampoo smelled amazing and the stylist was thorough. The only downside was the long wait time, but I appreciated that they took their time to ensure a good result. Overall, a great experience for a budget-friendly price. Just make sure to allocate enough time for the appointment.

My daughter's wedding at the Presidio Chapel in May, 2015 was absolutely magical. Rain Longo, who coordinates special events at the Chapel, was patient, supportive, and enthusiastic. The venue itself was outstanding and authentic, with a beautiful adjoining room for the bride and bridesmaids to get ready. The rental was affordable and included 6 hours of use. Thanks to all involved for making this special day perfect. Highly recommend!

While the waxing specialist Miriam was prompt and knowledgeable, the overall experience fell short of expectations. The specialist spent too much time marketing EWC products and criticizing regular shaving rather than focusing on the waxing treatment. Brows and lower legs were well done, but underarms were left with stray hairs and bits of wax residue. Overall, I did not feel fully prepared for my vacation after the appointment.

Overall, the food at this restaurant was very good. The pad see ew and The King and I stir fry received great reviews. The portion sizes were decent and the service was attentive. However, the noise level was too high, requiring us to shout to hear each other. If the restaurant could address this issue, it would definitely receive a higher rating.

Beware of potential theft at this rental location. Despite reporting a lost radar detector, complete with a case, it was not found and the employees claimed it was unlikely to go missing. The cars are poorly cleaned with plastic bottles left underneath seats and sticky substances on the dashboard. The lack of cleanliness and potential theft make this a disappointing rental experience.

This place offers a laid back atmosphere perfect for dining with your dog. The cozy wrap-around porch outside is a great spot to enjoy a delicious breakfast. The bananas foster French toast is amazing but very rich, while the vegetable omelet is a tasty and healthier option. The portion sizes are generous which left me full for a long car ride home. Can't wait to return and try more items on the menu, including their famous juices.
The food is delicious with generous portions at a great price. The staff, especially the girl behind the counter, is extremely friendly and always smiling. Wish I could come more often.

I absolutely loved the natural scenery along the trail, perfect for running, walking, hiking, and biking. There are plenty of spots to take a break and enjoy the surroundings. A great place to recharge and stay active.

Service was extremely slow due to kitchen delays, with a 40-minute wait for a pasta and salad. Not recommended for those looking for a quick meal, but could be suitable for those wanting to extend their dining experience.

This Mexican restaurant is wonderful, with delicious chips, salsa, beans, guacamole, and fantastic chimichanga bites. The street tacos and enchiladas are amazing, and the margaritas pack a punch. The service is excellent, with attentive staff. Overall, it's a great restaurant with 4 out of 5 stars, just shy of being a favorite. The location downtown is convenient, but it doesn't have a full bar yet.
I highly recommend trying the sushi at this place. The rolls are delicious, the service is great, prices are reasonable, and there are plenty of healthy options. Definitely worth every penny!
Fantastic lunch with great food and service. The Gumbo Ya Ya, BBQ shrimp, and crab cakes were all delicious. Highly recommend this place for a satisfying meal.

Incredible 20-minute workout that leaves you feeling amazing. I was skeptical at first, but now I'm hooked and feeling better than ever. Chelsey is an excellent trainer to work with. Highly recommend!

The atmosphere is adorable and the location is outstanding, earning 5 stars each, but the overall rating is 3 due to the food quality. The smoked turkey club was mostly good, with 2 sides included, but the meat was not impressive. The creamed spinach was good, but the mac n cheese was dry and bland despite being an upcharge. Willing to give it another chance and try something else in hopes of a better experience.
I had brunch on NYE weekend and loved the cozy decor. The Eggs Veney was delicious and the whole plate was devoured quickly. Great food and a great experience!

Ali ba ba's is a must-try for late night kabab, shwarma, or gyro in NYC. The gyros are bigger in size and more expensive ($6) than what you might find in the city, but they hit the spot. The limited demand and different food preferences in NOLA may explain the higher price. The only downside is the lack of variety in hot sauce options and sometimes slow service. Overall, Ali ba ba's gyros are superior to other options nearby, making it worth the visit.
I highly recommend this place. The food is delicious, the customer service is top-notch, and the location is convenient. A hidden gem worth checking out!

I had a fantastic experience at this place. The Turkish coffee was a delightful discovery and the veggie wrap and cheese steak were both delicious. The cafe section added to the great vibes of the restaurant. I will definitely be returning whenever I'm in West Philly. 5 stars.

Jones is a must-try for anyone who loves comfort food with a gourmet twist. The mac and cheese, sliders, pigs in a blanket, and calamari are all divine. The roast beef dinner is a standout, with succulent, perfectly cooked meat and creamy mashed potatoes. The Duncan Hines slice of cake is pure genius. Can't wait to go back for more delicious food and cocktails. Yum yum yum.

The Penang chicken with chicken-infused white rice is hands down one of the best meals I've ever had. The quality is consistent whether in Boston or Philly, and the fast service made the long line worth the wait. The juicy chicken was mouthwatering and I regret not getting an order to go for the drive back to Virginia. Next time, I won't hesitate to be greedy and bring some home!
The wait time at this establishment is too lengthy, even when the restaurant is not at full capacity. This can be frustrating for customers looking to dine in a timely manner.

Screamagedon is hands down the best haunted attraction around. The houses feel incredibly real and the haunted hayride is spectacular with fire torches, machine guns, chainsaws, churches, and even a demonic priest. Walking through the woods with just a glow stick is both awesome and frightening. Forget about other popular Halloween events like Bush Gardens Howl O Scream and Halloween Horror Nights - Screamagedon is the ultimate experience. Can't wait to go again next year.

Great service overall with quick response time and informative staff. Shanna was punctual and thorough in checking and treating for lice. Pricey but worth it for effective treatment. Unique comb not available in stores works well for removing nits. Only downside is the comb is not included in the session and must be purchased separately. Highly recommend for those struggling with lice.

The BBQ Chicken Sandwich is a great deal at $5.75. The chicken was nicely grilled and there are a variety of topping and sauce options to choose from. The choice of bread options, including sourdough, wheat bun, and white bun, adds to the appeal of this sandwich. Overall, a neat and tasty option at a great price.

Overall, the delivery was slow and disappointing, with a nearly two-hour wait for a strange shrimp scampi dish. The only redeeming factor was the delicious sweet potato cheesecake, which I would give five stars. Wouldn't order from here again except for the cheesecake.
This burger joint has top-notch service and a bit of a wait, but it's all worth it for the best burger you'll ever taste. Highly recommend.

I highly recommend this high-energy gym in Tampa. I was able to use my membership from Atlanta and took a great yoga class. The gym is spacious with a wide variety of equipment. Parking in the garage was free for two hours and I received guest passes for a coworker. Overall, a fantastic experience.

This restaurant always serves fresh, delicious food and the friendly staff make for a great dining experience. The Italian specialties are consistently tasty and the rolls are a standout. Disregard any negative comments as the owners strive to satisfy their customers.

Overall, the purchase of a used 09 Rav4 from Glanzmann Subaru was hindered by the lack of accurate description of the vehicle's conditional issues. The sales process was simple, but as an out of state buyer, the defects (large dents, cracked paint, cuts in leather) were not highlighted or depicted, leading to disappointment upon arrival. While the automobile itself is fine, the defects detract from the value. A more honest and direct interaction is needed from this small family-owned dealership to improve customer satisfaction.

I agree with the 5-star reviews! The boutique is clean and Lori did an excellent job with waxing. The blue hard wax is amazing and I love the option of a "custom wax". I will definitely be returning! Thank you Yelp reviewers for helping me find this gem!
This dealership consistently disappoints and takes advantage of customers. Despite multiple chances to improve, they continue to disappoint. I would recommend avoiding them at all costs.

We dined at the Creole House for dinner during a rainstorm. The bacon garlic oysters were disappointing, but the buffalo wings were tasty. The jumbalaya pasta lacked flavor and the sautéed veggies were overly salty. The blackened red fish was just ok, while the canal street red fish lacked garlic sauce. The paddle boat drinks were weak on alcohol. Our server, Alexander, was fantastic. Overall, a solid 3-star experience due to mediocre food.

BlackFinn fell short of expectations due to multiple errors in our order, including incorrect ingredients and low portions. The atmosphere was nice and the staff were polite, but the overall experience was disappointing. Willing to give them another chance to redeem themselves. Two stars.

While the food at Bob Evans is always delicious, the service at this particular location left much to be desired. Despite being seated with my family, we were ignored for 10 minutes before two servers finally acknowledged us. It seemed there was confusion about who was supposed to serve our table, even though the restaurant wasn't very busy. The food was great, but the slow and disorganized service was disappointing. Management should definitely work on improving the overall customer experience at this location.
I have been using their business mail services for years and have nothing but positive experiences. The staff is great and the service is excellent. Highly recommend them.

The Ox Tail pho at this small family-owned restaurant in Reno was amazing! Perfect portions, delicious homemade dipping fish sauce, and affordable pricing made for a great dining experience. We will definitely be coming back here every time we visit Reno. Highly recommended!

This Bosnian restaurant is amazing! The take-out service is convenient and the gyros are delicious. The atmosphere is diverse and the restaurant is reported to be clean. Definitely recommend trying it out! Cheers to a great dining experience.

Hidden gem in the world of hookah bars! Authentic decor, smooth shisha, and a calm atmosphere make this place a must-visit. Affordable drinks and a friendly staff add to the overall positive experience. Perfect for a low key and relaxing time with friends. Highly recommend spreading the word about this unique spot!

I found the best salon for a gel manicure in the area thanks to Yelp. The staff was friendly, the salon was beautiful and clean, and my nail tech Kim did a wonderful job. Overall, a pleasant experience that I will definitely repeat in the future.

The food was exceptional, with perfectly cooked dishes such as the jambalaya, shrimp etouffe, and seafood gumbo. The shrimp was fresh and clean tasting. The bread pudding with praline sauce was a perfect ending to the meal, complemented by Cafe du Monde coffee. Overall, one of the top dining experiences during our New Orleans visit. Highly recommended.
The cheesesteaks and cheese fries are solid, but not worth going out of your way for as you can find similar options in most of Philadelphia.

The takoyaki at this place was tasty but doughy and left a greasy aftertaste. The curry chicken was disappointing with a rich roux that wasn't to my liking. Worth trying for a first venture into Japanese fast food, but not the best I've had.
Great location with nice wines. Unfortunately, no food available, but you can bring your own and enjoy the view with your pup. Dog-friendly atmosphere adds to the charm. Lovely experience overall.

I had a fantastic experience at this restaurant. The atmosphere was great, the service from Connor was excellent, and my dinner meal was delicious. The cakes, barley soup, and shrimp ravioli were all fantastic. The Malbec wine was a perfect accompaniment. I was excited to learn that they serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Highly recommend trying this place out. I will definitely be returning in the future.

I have had breakfast at this restaurant and the juevos rancheros were amazing. The chips and salsa were great, with a spicy salsa that I enjoyed. The homemade tamale was delicious as well. Will definitely be returning in the future.

Burger Up in Nashville offers upscale burgers in a trendy atmosphere. The bacon cheeseburger was tasty but lacked flavor in the actual patty. The truffle fries were a standout side dish worth trying. The beer menu included unique options from the Deep South. Overall, a good option for a change from the regular dive bar burger experience. 3.50 stars.

Mandala offers a wide selection of massage supplies at great prices. Lisa is friendly and knowledgeable, helping me choose essential oils from their aroma bar and blending them perfectly. The prices are affordable and comparable, if not cheaper, than online options. Shopping locally at Mandala supports a fantastic small business. The new location in a Victorian-style home adds to the charm of the experience. Highly recommend!

This shop is a gem with delicious food and generous portions. The ciders are the highlight, while the meads weren't my favorite. I loved it so much I even took a cider back home with me to the east coast.
