If you're craving beignets in Metarie, Morning Call is the better choice over this shop. However, if you're set on Cafe Du Monde, it's only a twenty-minute drive to Decatur, including parking.

I recently visited the beautiful new nail salon on West Chester Pike and was impressed by the friendly staff, brand new salon, good prices and serene colors. The pedi chairs even have phone chargers! I highly recommend this salon for a relaxing and pampering experience.

Wow! Simon's full body massages are worth every penny. His talented hands can coax your muscles to relax and take out any kinks with skill. The atmosphere is relaxing and comfortable, making for a truly enjoyable experience. Don't underestimate the power of human touch until you've experienced a professional massage like this. Whether you're getting a foot massage or a full body one, this place is a little slice of heaven that I highly recommend indulging in. Affordable prices and great service make it a must-visit spot for relaxation. Schedule an appointment for the best experience during the early evening hours.

Tuna Bar is a new must-visit spot for sushi lovers in the city. The ambiance, service, and food/drink were all excellent during our soft opening experience. The top quality fish and Asian fusion options were impressive. The owner/executive chef seemed proud of his accomplishments, and rightfully so. A definite two-minute walk away gem worth checking out. Highly recommended for sushi enthusiasts.
This dive bar goes beyond authentic with old wood panel walls, a disgusting smell, and tiny drinks. Not worth a return visit.

I absolutely love this place! The food is delicious, the atmosphere is great, and the hostess is so welcoming with a positive energy. My friend, who was visiting for the first time, also enjoyed it and is already planning to come back. The shrimp salad with lime chili dressing was especially refreshing and tasty.

The food quality at this place has noticeably declined. The pork steak was dry and tough, and the BBQ nachos were soggy and tasteless. Despite good service, we probably won't be returning due to the disappointing experience.

I had an excellent professional service at this salon. My experience was wonderful and the stylist who did my haircut was incredibly good. I didn't get her name, but she earned my confidence. Highly recommend this salon.

Spiro's was a fantastic dining experience! The Greek salad was prepared table side and delicious. The Dolmades and combo plate were both outstanding, especially the lamb. The complimentary dessert for first-time diners was a nice surprise. Our server Ben was amazing and made us feel welcome. Spiro's will definitely be my new go-to spot. Thank you for a wonderful evening!

Extremely disappointed with the lack of compassion at this facility. Waited 2 hours only to be seen for 5 minutes and discharged with no medications for my pain. Would not recommend for anyone seeking quality care.
Great food, polite and respectful cashier named Alessandra. The meal box was reasonably priced and tasted delicious. Will definitely return if in the area.

Overall, I appreciate the effort to reduce straw usage for environmental reasons. However, I was disappointed by the quality of ingredients in the mixers. The energy from the bar staff on Saturday evening was lacking, and the Margarita I tried was subpar. It's a simple drink that should have been executed better.

The BarreAmped class at the Music Row location was a great experience with a family vibe and a very hands-on instructor. The room was small but luckily not crowded during my visit. However, the location within a house gym was confusing with no visible signage, making it difficult to find. Overall, a positive experience and I would consider going back.

I had a terrible experience with this establishment. The employee I spoke with was rude, put me on hold multiple times, and hung up on me when I tried to address a wrong order delivery. The service was unacceptable and I would not recommend going there.
Delicious chicken and French toast, with a lack of shade on the patio but still a pleasant experience. Pet-friendly and will definitely return.

This place was a lifesaver for a late-night snack in Nashville. Despite initial doubts, the pizza was surprisingly delicious. Pick-up at 2 AM was a huge bonus. Only regret was not ordering a larger size. Highly recommend for a late-night bite.

The delivery service was terrible with an incorrect food order arriving an hour later than expected. The food was poorly cooked, either under or overcooked. Will not be ordering from here again. Very disappointing experience.

If you find yourself in Nashville, this is a great spot to check out for drink deals on Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. The food is okay, but the atmosphere and drink specials make it worth a visit.

I highly recommend this place for their delicious salads, flavorful tea, and crispy french fries. The servers are fantastic and I have always had a positive experience during my visits. Will definitely be returning in the future!

My family had a fantastic brunch experience at this place. The cleanliness, excellent staff, and charming decor made for a pleasant dining atmosphere. Even my picky four-year-old enjoyed the food, which is a big win in my book. Highly recommend!

I had a wonderful experience at this charming tea shop. The selection of loose leaf teas and tea accessories was impressive, and the drinks and sweets were both delicious and creative. The ambience was perfect for a relaxing tea session, and I enjoyed reading the books about tea provided by the passionate owner. I look forward to returning in the future and highly recommend this spot to other tea lovers.

This restaurant offers great food and service. The antipasto is the best I have ever had, and the fresh pasta is full of flavor. The Fisherman's stew is delicious, with tender fish in a flavorful saffron sauce.

Muriel's in NOLA is a must-visit for incredible food and quintessential French Quarter atmosphere. The goat cheese and shrimp crepes are outstanding and the rest of the menu does not disappoint. The service is top-notch, though ghost tours outside the window may be a distraction. Despite rumors of hauntings, the only other-worldly thing at Muriel's is the delicious cuisine. Highly recommended.

Despite the initial confusion and lack of attention, Taco Bell ultimately provided satisfactory service when the staff member at the window was willing to serve us. Timing and communication could be improved for a more positive customer experience.

The atmosphere at this restaurant is charming, but I was disappointed with the limited breakfast menu and mediocre food. The omelet was average and the biscuit lacked flavor. Seating was quick during the week, but could get crowded on weekends.

This gym may be on the pricier side, but the executive locker rooms make it worth the cost for me. The facility is well-maintained and offers a variety of classes and equipment options. Despite a few machines not working properly, the overall atmosphere is welcoming. My only complaints are the limited weekend hours and lack of class schedule variation. Overall, I'm happy with my decision to join and have found the gym to be a great motivator for getting back into shape.

Incredible atmosphere with a top-notch bar staff, especially Ally who goes above and beyond for every customer. Cool vibe with indoor and outdoor seating, a must-visit spot in the Funk Zone. High recommendation, don't miss out! Say hi to Ally for me!

Overall, my experience at this bar was pretty good. The bartender was great, the lunch menu was decent, and the beer was cold. I recommend going when it's not too busy to ensure consistent service. I will definitely be returning.

Overall, this hotel provides a friendly environment for adults and families with plenty of dining options and a fun atrium to explore. The only downside was that not all pools were open during Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is located a bit far from town but is a good middle point between music row and the airport. The staff was exceptional and the hotel maintained its old charm while still being clean. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Nashville.

Great treat to beat the heat at this self-service fro-yo establishment in Manayunk! Countless options of flavors and toppings to choose from, with the ability to sample before you commit. I enjoyed the toasted coconut yogurt with fresh fruit toppings, but chocolate lovers will also find plenty of options. Clean and well-maintained, with friendly service. Highly recommend stopping by for a refreshing treat.

While the trendy appeal of this chain may have faded, the over-priced, fried food of questionable quality remains. The batters are repetitive and the coconut shrimp and hush puppies were overcooked. The portions are large but lack quality. The atmosphere is nice and it's located by the Boise river, but there are better local options worth exploring. Consider visiting once, but don't expect anything extraordinary.

This dive bar allows smoking, which left my hair smelling terrible and woke me up in the middle of the night. The atmosphere is dim and smokey, with a friendly bartender. Not impressed with the weak bloody mary.

I had a great experience at this friendly family restaurant just north of Gulfport. Despite arriving after the morning rush, the staff immediately welcomed me and ensured I had coffee and a full breakfast menu. The ham omelet with home fries and toast was delicious and kept me filled for hours. The atmosphere was cozy with golden oldies playing in the background. Overall, a welcoming and appreciated dining experience.

This place is a must-visit for anyone looking for a diverse and enjoyable dining experience. The wine selection is top-notch, the hookah's are a fun addition, and the Lebanese food is simply outstanding - arguably the best in the city. Highly recommend checking it out!

Red Mess came highly recommended by a local colleague and did not disappoint. Chris provided excellent service, showing patience and expertise with the menu. Our group thoroughly enjoyed the delicious food and drinks from start to finish. Highly recommend.

The Brick House chain consistently impresses me with their unique menu offerings and great service. This location stood out with better-than-average service, making it a favorite when I'm in town. Will definitely be back.
Siam is the classiest spot in town with top-grade sashimi, a perfect outdoor patio, and killer deep house music. The crowd is diverse and looking for a quality night out. Highly recommended.

16th Street Seafood may not impress with its decor or seafood selection, but the mussels in butter and garlic sauce were a worthwhile order. The to-go only setup was convenient and the messy order was well wrapped. The fried shrimp was decent, but slightly overpriced. Overall, worth a visit for seafood lovers in the area.

We used a Groupon to try this place out and were pleased with the lobster, despite them being out of some sizes. Our waitress, Jessica, was attentive and made some excellent suggestions. Overall, a good spot for delicious lobster, without all the fancy extras.
This upscale cafe offers a great variety of options at reasonable prices. A must-try, though, is the lox bagel sandwich. It's a perfect spot for a casual lunch with someone special.

Animo Juice in Haddonfield is a hidden gem, offering a delicious menu of juices, burritos, and breakfast items. The Haight & Ashbury burrito is a must-try, and the juices are fresh and filling. The addition of quinoa to any dish is a game-changer, and the overall selection puts other juice bars to shame. Highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area.

Had a fantastic birthday experience with Wine Edventures in Santa Barbara. Sean was a great guide, very friendly and knowledgeable. Visited 3 wineries and 1 brewery, had a delicious lunch, and received souvenir wine glasses. Highly recommend for a fun day out in the SB area.

Tokyo in Delaware is my favorite sushi spot. The menu is simple yet perfectly executed, with rolls that are reasonably priced, artfully made, and packed with fish. The spicy tuna roll is the best I've ever had, thanks to the kewpie mayo, sriracha, and sichimi powder they use. The introduction of short-grain brown sushi rice has been a great addition. Watching Sushiman YC Park in action is amazing - he's incredibly skilled and the nigiri and temaki are top-notch. Skip Kooma and save Mikimotos for a special night out - Tokyo is the place to go for lunch. Highly recommend supporting this gem in the tough economy. I give it 4 stars, reserving the fifth for places that serve locally caught fresh fish.

Despite the negative reviews, I had a great experience at this place. The staff was friendly, service was quick, and prices were affordable. The chicken fingers were not dry, but rather delicious, especially with their honey mustard sauce. Their salads were fresh and loaded with veggies, and the fries were tasty. I appreciated the cole slaw that came with the chicken finger platter. Overall, it's a convenient spot with decent food, perfect for a quick and affordable meal. And let's not forget, it's a pizza joint, not a fine dining establishment. Don't expect fancy ambiance, just good value for your money.
Lazo's cheesesteak was amazing, the service was friendly and fast. It really made my day.

Despite the average ambience and location in a mall in New Hope, the service at this restaurant was extremely pleasant, despite being understaffed. The wait was worth it, with delicious vegetable samosas and flavorful chicken tikka masala. The chicken was slightly dry, but the chicken tagine was amazing. The mix of cuisines on the menu was just right, and the BYOB policy was unexpected but we will definitely be back to try more dishes. Overall, a unique dining experience with exceptional food once you get past the slow service.

This charming local ice cream spot in Tucson is undeniably cute and offers delicious high-quality treats. However, it is on the pricey side with a regular single scoop costing $4.50, earning it 4 stars out of 5.

The brewery/bar has a cool and unique decor that fits its name well. Despite being busy, we easily found seating. The beer selection, especially for those who love imperial stouts, was great. No food is served, but you can bring your own or find options across the street.
Colorful and laid back atmosphere with delicious beef brisket and smoked sausage. A must-try for BBQ lovers!

Amazing breakfast deal for early birds! Delicious food, bottomless coffee, and great service for only $4. A steal compared to commuting costs. Highly recommend arriving between 7-9am on weekdays for this bargain.

This popular spot is always crowded for good reason. Despite the long wait times, it's worth it for the chance to rub elbows with celebrities and enjoy some of the best sushi around. Just be prepared for a potentially lengthy wait.
I absolutely loved my stay at this inn! The room was beautiful and the location was perfect, with the streetcar right outside to take you to the canal. Highly recommend staying here!
This restaurant offers delicious and healthy food with excellent service and ambiance. The prices are reasonable and it is clear that lots of love goes into each dish. Highly recommended.

Just discovered my new favorite pizza spot where I was able to customize my own pizza with pepperoni, red onions, and roasted garlic. The ingredients were perfectly balanced and the garlic cloves added a unique touch. The 10" size was just right for sharing between two people. Excited to return soon and try out their other menu options. Highly recommend giving this place a try!
This place offers delicious and healthy breakfast options in a welcoming atmosphere. The service is excellent and the food is both tasty and visually appealing. Highly recommended for a morning meal!

I had a great experience at this body shop. The service was fantastic, the body work was excellent, and they even vacuumed the inside of my car. Randy provided consistent updates through text, keeping me informed throughout the process. Highly recommend.

Initially had a negative experience, but upon returning for a third time, my opinion completely changed. The food was delicious, especially the Bubble Tea. If craving Greek/Mediterranean food, definitely worth another try. First visit was disappointing, but the second visit redeemed the experience. Gyros were savory and moist, and the service was much improved. Highly recommend giving this place another chance.

I will not be returning to this place. The service was not what I asked for and ended up costing double what I expected. The advisor was rude and unprofessional when confronted about the issue. The work done was not what was agreed upon and overall, a disappointing experience.

We love M.L. Rose for their beer flights and neighborhood hangout feel, with awesome service. However, the food can be hit or miss, with some dishes not meeting expectations. The steak and Gouda sandwich was particularly disappointing. Overall, we are big fans but hope the kitchen can improve for a consistently great experience.
If you don't mind the wait, it's definitely worth it for the delicious biscuits and chicken. A great choice for a quick and satisfying meal.

Overall, our visit to the water park on a non typical day during the school year was enjoyable. The facility was clean, the staff was friendly, and the off-season pricing was reasonable. However, the water and air temperature were a bit chilly for our liking and the park was smaller than expected. The occasional closure of the big slides was a minor inconvenience. Despite these issues, I believe that with good timing, visitors could have a pleasant experience. Using AAA for a discount was a bonus, although we missed out on additional savings for my son's birthday month due to lack of proof.

The interior design is impeccable, the staff is friendly, and the food is spot on. The sauce and toss special is a must-try for something unique and delicious. I'll definitely be back to explore the rest of the menu. Well done!

The food at this restaurant is great, but the service leaves much to be desired. Our waitress was hardly present, and other staff members had to pick up her slack. I was still eating when she brought the check, which was frustrating. Overall, good food but disappointing service.

The squid steak at this restaurant was the best I've ever had, with amazing flavor. However, slow service and high prices were major downsides. Would have rated higher with better service and pricing.

I absolutely loved our experience at this restaurant! The food was delicious, the waiter was exceptional, and the cheesecake was amazing. I can't wait to come back for their cinnamon rolls. We will definitely be returning.

Meijer is a convenient and amazing store, but the Starbucks inside is hit or miss. The employees seem to lack proper training as they frequently have to check prices and the quality of drinks can be inconsistent. Not worth the price if you end up with a cup full of milk.

I highly recommend the eggs at Dawn Patrol. They have the best tasting eggs I've ever had at a restaurant. The hash is also a must-try, with generous portions. My brother enjoyed his burger, although it could have used some cheese. The homemade pastries, bread, and jellies are delicious as well.

Came to eat late on a Friday night, limited options left. Tried an individual pizza with thick crust which was just okay. Stumbled upon Scharffenberger chocolate while waiting, that was a highlight. Staff seemed tired at 8pm.
I had a delicious cheeseburger with avocado on top and tried the ranchero fries which were tasty. Although the food was great, the slow service kept this lunch spot from earning a 5-star rating.
I highly recommend this restaurant. Amazing food and excellent service, particularly from George. The crab cakes were delicious. Overall, a fantastic dining experience.

Our wedding at Winters Creek Lodge was a fantastic experience thanks to Judit. She was organized, flexible, and helped us bring our vision to life. The views were stunning, our guests were impressed, and the food was delicious despite no tastings offered. Pricing was competitive. Highly recommend working with Judit at Winters Creek Lodge.

I was pleasantly surprised by the amazing brunch selection at Kanella. The cozy atmosphere and attentive staff make you feel right at home. The Cyprus Breakfast is a must-try, with a delicious mediterranean twist on classic breakfast staples. The menu offers a variety of traditional Greek, Mediterranean, and Middle Eastern dishes that are sure to satisfy any palate. Reservations are highly recommended, but definitely worth it for a stellar weekend morning experience. Can't wait to come back for dinner.

The gravy fries at this place are good, but the sandwiches are awful. The meat is thick, tough, and dry, making for a disgusting eating experience. I made the mistake of trying their pork sandwich and couldn't even bite through the rubbery meat. Locals who rave about this place likely haven't had anything better. You're better off going to Wawa for a sandwich that is actually edible.

Based on my experience, this place is solely focused on making money and not on providing quality products or customer service. They only accept cash and are hesitant to accept returns. It seems like they prioritize large contractors over smaller customers. The items they sell may be damaged, so be sure to thoroughly inspect your purchase before leaving. I do not recommend supporting this business at all.

Despite the poor service and rude staff, the food at this restaurant was impressive. The pulled pork, brisket tacos, and pulled chicken were all delicious, although the sides were only average. The prices were reasonable, but the lack of ribs for lunch and dirty bathrooms were definite drawbacks. Overall, a mixed experience.

Overall, my experience at this restaurant was disappointing. While some dishes were authentic and tasty, others seemed more suited to American Chinese restaurants. The duck was overly fatty and lacked meat, and the stir fry dishes had odd vegetable combinations. Additionally, the service left much to be desired, with no smiles or warmth from the staff. Inconsistent quality makes it hard to recommend this restaurant.

If you dread going to the hair salon, Andre's salon is the place for you. The warm and personable atmosphere, talented stylists like Christopher, and genuine connections make for a comfortable and enjoyable experience. Not only will you leave with fantastic hair, but you will also leave feeling like you've made new friends. The convenient online scheduling and reasonable prices make it a no-brainer to choose Andre's salon for your next cut or color. Highly recommended!
The food at this place is absolutely amazing and unique. I highly recommend trying their bobba and pork pancake.

Prohibition is a nice, old school space with a long bar that might be more fitting out west rather than in the heart of Philadelphia. It's not too loud, making conversations easy, and has a jukebox that could crank up later in the evening. The service from the staff behind the bar was great and there is a good selection of beers on tap including a local IPA. The small menu offers delicious food, with the brat plate being a standout dish. However, the neighborhood may be a bit sketchy, so caution should be taken when walking to and from the establishment.

On the Run at Lambert-St. Louis International Airport is a convenient stop for those returning rental cars. The location is perfect for quick gas fill-ups before heading to the airport. Paying at the pump is easy, but note the unique procedure of pressing the button before swiping your card. Overall, a convenient pit stop for travelers needing gas before returning their rental cars.
The historical building is well maintained and we enjoyed a private tour with the Park Ranger since we were the only visitors. Great spot for collecting National Park Stamps as well.

While the service and cleanliness of the restaurant were excellent, the food at this establishment only received mixed reviews. The linguine with marinara was fine, but the rotini primavera was a major disappointment. The vegetables in the dish were clearly frozen, which detracted from the overall quality of the meal. With fresh produce abundant in Tucson, there is no excuse for using subpar ingredients like frozen vegetables.

Fresh Market may have a helpful staff and a clean store, but the quality of their products and selection fall short. The poorly cut cheese, expired ricotta, and quick spoiling produce were disappointing. Additionally, the high prices and lackluster desserts were not worth it. The conflicting information regarding the ATM limit was frustrating. It may be best to stick with other grocery stores such as Weaver's Way, Whole Foods, or Wegmann's.
The Dugout is a hidden gem in Fletcher Place with a simple atmosphere and great drink specials. The hot pepper cheese balls are a must-try and I can't wait to go back for more.

Big Scoop is a great addition to Warminster's ice cream scene, offering a wide range of tasty treats beyond just ice cream. The service is quick and friendly, and the shop is clean and inviting. The ice cream was delicious, with generous portions and a variety of flavors to choose from. With little competition in the area, Big Scoop is definitely worth a visit and earns a solid four stars.

Saguaro East is a decent park with friendly staff and a nice visitor center. However, the hiking trails didn't offer much scenery beyond what you can find in the Phoenix area, making it feel average in comparison.

The staff at this store is amazing and always willing to help, even close to closing time. The coupons on their website offer 40 percent off regular priced items, so you're always getting a good deal. Great store overall.

This coffee shop is a convenient spot for getting work done, people watching, or grabbing a drink to go. It's located in a busy area where locals hang out, making it a good stop on the way to Fenchmen for live music. The food is healthier than typical fast food options, but service can be hit or miss depending on the crowd. It's a great place to sit and work for a while, and their tall cookies are a must-try. Plus, where else can you get a shot in your coffee in New Orleans?

The bouncer at this club was extremely rude and unprofessional. Despite being on the guest list, I was denied entry and belittled by the bouncer for trying to verify my status. I would not recommend this club due to the poor treatment received at the door.

Nick's is a great spot with generous salad portions, particularly the Greek salad. The rustic roast beef sandwich is a standout item that I highly recommend. The pizza is decent, especially in an XL size for sharing with guests. Surprisingly, it may be their better dish. Overall, Nick's is worth a visit for a satisfying meal.

I really enjoyed this hipster-ish spot, reminiscent of Este Sugarhouse in Salt Lake. The pizza and beer selection are top-notch, and I look forward to trying more of the menu. The different locations all have their own charm, and whoever is running them is doing a fantastic job. The only downside is the clunky ordering system, but it's worth it for the great food and vibe. I definitely recommend it for pizza and a brew.

New St. Louis Wok is a reliable and efficient Chinese delivery option in our area. The website makes ordering easy and delivery is consistently fast. The food is not greasy, comes hot with plenty of sauces, and even includes fortune cookies. It's our top choice for fulfilling Chinese cravings.
Osaka is my go-to sushi spot. Affordable prices and amazing rolls make it a must-try for sushi lovers. Highly recommend giving it a try.

Kelly's has undergone a change in ownership and completely revamped their menu, much to the disappointment of some regular customers. The new crew emphasizes the cleanliness of the restaurant as a positive change. However, the classic burger and fries I tried were lackluster and overpriced, with the burger being dry and flavorless. It's now easier to walk in during dinner time, which was previously unheard of. Unfortunately, the changes at Kelly's may not be for the better.

I highly recommend this place for anyone looking to improve their strength and flexibility. The teachers are unique and offer beneficial classes. With a monthly membership, I saw huge changes in my fitness level. Great place to go everyday.

I used to be a loyal customer of this neighborhood restaurant, but lately I have been experiencing long wait times for change and receiving incorrect orders. Unfortunately, the recent incident of receiving the wrong food and having my order be cold has completely turned me off from continuing to dine here. I will not be returning as a customer.

The pizza and service at this establishment are usually good, but my experience with their delivery service was disappointing. The driver was insulting and made me feel uncomfortable by commenting on the car across the street and implying I was potentially involved in something shady. It was unwarranted and left a bad taste in my mouth.

Cake Life is a welcome addition to Fishtown with top quality bakers and a clean, inviting atmosphere. The Bourbon Pecan cookie was a stand out, with perfect balance of sweetness and pecan. The cupcakes were moist and delicious, although the icing was not a favorite. The chocolate chip cookie was raved about by others. Will definitely return and consider a custom order.

Last Thursday we took advantage of the $5 domestic pitchers during happy hour at this spot. Service was a bit slow at first, but improved. The wings were delicious, although not sure if it was really a pound. The gyro and fries were surprisingly good, as were the French onion soup and potato skins. Rock n roll bingo was a blast, and the pool table and darts were fun too. We'll definitely be back!

Johnny Tucci and his crew are top-notch videographers. Professional, prompt, and incredibly talented, they turned our wedding footage into a beautiful movie production that brought everyone to tears. Splurging on a videographer is worth every penny when it's Johnny Tucci behind the camera. Highly recommend.

Citizens Bank Park is one of the best places to see a game in the entire country. The park offers a variety of interesting places to eat and drink, including a rooftop bar. Tickets are still affordable even with the success of the Phillies in recent years, especially compared to New York parks. The staff is helpful in recommending seating options, such as the 3rd base field level to avoid direct sunlight. The crowds are great and despite negative stereotypes, most fans are respectful. It's a fun atmosphere, a beautiful park, and a great team to watch.
Disappointed with recent visits to Cosi. Signature salads consistently made wrong with no dressing. Frustrating to see decline in quality at a restaurant known for their salads.

Unfortunately, the reopening of Rembrandt's was a huge disappointment. The new owners have transformed the charming old church into a modern, cold coffee shop that lacks the cozy atmosphere we all loved. It's a shame to see Eagle's charm fading so quickly. Let's hope the other shop owners in the area can learn from this and work to preserve the town's quaintness and beauty in their own spaces.

Service was lacking at this establishment. The waitstaff seemed uninformed about the menu and continuously forgot requests. The food was visually appealing but lacked quality - waffles were stale, biscuits were hard, and the chorizo was not authentic. The only positives were the atmosphere and drink selection.
Overall, this restaurant is a pleasant spot to enjoy a meal. The burgers are particularly delicious, but the pizza crust can be tough. The dining room is comfortable and inviting.

We used to frequent this restaurant in our neighborhood, but our recent experience was disappointing. The bathrooms were filthy, one even had toilet paper clogging the toilet. Our server, Ashley, was rude and uninterested in providing good customer service. The chicken quesadilla was mostly fat and not appetizing. We likely won't be returning with so many better quality restaurants in the area.
This bar/restaurant offers typical menu offerings for its type. The food was decent, but nothing extraordinary. The standout feature was the excellent service.

Based on a recommendation, we tried this unassuming place and were blown away by the comfort food offerings. The BLT was flavorful and well-stacked, with fresh bacon and veggies. The fries and coleslaw were top-notch, and the pies we took home were delicious. We'll definitely be returning for more.
The staff was friendly, the wait for food was short, and the chicken bacon croissant with chipolte sauce was delicious and served quickly. Highly recommended.

This Thai restaurant in Nashville may have dated decor, but the food is absolutely fantastic. As a self-proclaimed Thai food junkie who has traveled extensively throughout Southeast Asia, I can confidently say that this place serves up some great Thai dishes. Highly recommend for fellow Thai food enthusiasts.

This place is a gem for donut lovers and skeptics alike. The apple fritter and chocolate long john are outstanding and will make you a believer in their delicious offerings. Skip the other donut shops in STL and give this place a try. Highly recommended.

This New Orleans restaurant was our favorite out of all we tried. We had both lunch and dinner on separate occasions and the service was excellent. The cozy yet lively ambiance was a standout. Make sure to call ahead for a reservation if opentable seems full. The lunch special spicy fried chicken is a must-try. For the best dining experience, request the corner booth by the window if you are a party of two or three. Overall, a fantastic dining experience.

Located near City Park, this inexpensive shaved ice shop is a must-visit. With a wide variety of flavors to choose from, you'll be spoiled for choice with over 50 options. The shaved ice is a perfect treat after a hot and sticky day in New Orleans, especially after a visit to the park. Even the smallest size is quite generous and only costs $1.50, making it a budget-friendly option. Toppings are also available for just a few dollars more, making it a great choice to beat the summer heat. Highly recommended! 5/5 stars.

Mr. X offers delicious NY style pizza with hand-tossed crust and excellent flavor. The staff is friendly and the wait time for carry out is only 20 minutes, much shorter than at chain pizzerias. Overall, a great option for a quick and tasty meal.

Overall, my first experience at this bar was pleasant. The atmosphere was nice but empty, with only a few other patrons in the establishment. The beer selection was good, with options like Magic Hat, Fat Tire, and Blue Moon available at reasonable prices. The decor was clean and attractive, with dark woods and a few TVs scattered throughout the space. The bartender was friendly and attentive, but the lack of a crowd made for a somewhat dull experience. It served as a decent spot to kill time before heading to another bar, but lacked the energy and excitement that would make me want to return.

The in-store service at this place has severely declined. Despite visiting six times, only one order was completed without a mistake. Today, it took close to 20 minutes to receive 2 tall decaf coffees, causing our bagels to become cold. The staff's lack of training and poor customer service was evident, with no apology or attempt to make things right. Overall, a disappointing experience that will make me choose a different Starbucks in the future.

Overall, the evening at this restaurant for a double date with a long-lost friend was pleasant, with beautiful ambiance and good food. Despite some minor issues with undercooked potatoes and rice in dishes, the scallops and crab stuffed grouper were superb. The creve brûlée was excellent and the attentive service from Tim added to the experience. Worth a return visit, but improvements needed for a higher rating.

My wife and I had a wonderful experience at this hidden gem. The shop was clean, bright, and colorful, making it a comfortable environment. We enjoyed sampling all the flavors and learning about the history behind them. The owners were incredibly kind and helped us find the perfect popcorn based on our preferences. We left with multiple bags of delicious treats and will definitely be returning soon. Highly recommend!

This new coffee shop is a cute spot for a caffeine break. The iced coffee was delicious, with a variety of milk and sweetener options available. Limited food options, mainly donuts, but the vegan banana bread was a bit dense. No outdoor seating, but neighboring restaurant's tables were available. Will return to try more fancy coffee options and hope for a expanded food menu soon.

I was recommended to check out this coffee place in Philly and it did not disappoint. The cafe was clean and inviting, with the added bonus of tap and sparking water for customers. Prices were fair and the staff was friendly. I even got some great espresso tips from one of the baristas. Will definitely be returning soon!

This college-town bar is a Villanova tradition with a good tap selection, alcohol, pub/bar food, and specials. It offers a good atmosphere for a casual night out, but don't expect anything upscale or a great lunch spot. It's simply a no-frills bar that delivers on the essentials.

I had a fantastic experience at this store thanks to Mary's exceptional customer service. She helped me pick out frames and was very personable. The entire staff was friendly and welcoming. I will definitely be returning in the future.

This furniture store offers discounted prices compared to name brand stores, with friendly staff and unique accent pieces available. While customer service and furniture quality may vary, the potential for great deals makes it worth a visit.
I have visited this place multiple times for brunch, dinner, and lunch take-out, and can attest to the consistently friendly staff and delicious food.

The dinner at this restaurant was amazing. The menu was unique and the service from Adrian was top notch. The endive and beet salad was lovely and the tongue dish was spectacular. The wine list was good and the dessert was yummy. Overall, a wonderful meal and I will definitely be back next time I'm in town. Bravo!
Avoid this place at all costs! The food is subpar and not worth the price. Save your time and money for a better dining experience elsewhere.

The restaurant was cozy and family friendly, perfect for a private engagement party. The special menus and homemade desserts were a nice touch, but the limited menu left something to be desired. The Penne Fellini was drowning in sauce and lacked balance. The bruschetta and salad were forgettable. The wait staff was friendly, but overall the food was underwhelming. Not a place I would rush back to, but the unique event space made for a fun celebration.

The staff at the dealership is friendly and keeps you updated while fixing recalls on our 1999 Nissan Pathfinder. We received excellent service and were treated with the same level of care as if we were purchasing a new car. Highly recommend their service.

This hidden gem is a must-visit for those seeking a unique dining experience. The atmosphere may not be fancy, but the food speaks for itself. Generous portions at affordable prices, with standout dishes like the chicken hot pot and seafood combination. Perfect for those who appreciate good food without the pretentiousness. A great find for those willing to step out of their comfort zone.

Despite the initial impression, this festival is a must-visit for a fun weekend afternoon. The dance performances were breathtaking, and the food was worth the long lines. The gyros and spankopitas were delicious, and it's best to come with a group to share and try everything. A great way to spend Labor Day weekend, even for little ones. Will definitely be returning every year in town.

The food at this restaurant is delicious, especially the brisket and cheese grits. However, our experience with takeout has been consistently disappointing as items were missing on three separate occasions. This is a blemish on an otherwise fine establishment.
Provi is a gem and the chipotle chicken avocado sandwich and chicken noodle soup are absolutely amazing. 10/10 would recommend.

The Fountain offers quick, affordable, and quality meals with a menu featuring sandwiches, salads, and soups. The Cuban sandwich was excellent with a unique twist on the traditional ingredients. The Royal Grille grilled cheese was delicious and satisfying. The spicy carrots side was a standout with great flavors and just the right amount of spice. Service was quick and friendly. Looking forward to returning and trying more dishes. Highly recommend.

Burger Up in Nashville is a must-visit spot with outstanding burgers and endless options for all dietary preferences. The Woodstock burger with truffle fries is a standout, and the Troyathalon is a great vegetarian option. The 12 South Lemonade is a refreshing drink choice to accompany your meal. The customer service is attentive and knowledgeable, making for a pleasant dining experience. Though parking may be tricky, it's worth it to enjoy this cool hipster vibe restaurant. Don't miss out on trying Burger Up!

Overall, I have mixed feelings about this place. The wait time without a reservation was longer than expected, but the cheese fondue was delicious. The entree we tried was just okay, with the oil cooking method not being to my liking. The private booth was romantic and perfect for a leisurely dinner, but next time I would stick to just the cheese fondue. Good for those seeking privacy and a lengthy dining experience.

Las Cazuelas is a hidden gem for Mexican BYOB dining. The food here is delicious, with creative dishes and an attractive presentation. The margaritas made with your own tequila are a hit with friends, and the attentive waitress was accommodating to dietary needs. Prices are reasonable, making it a great choice for a fun foodie experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking for something beyond your typical Mexican fare.

This restaurant completely changed my perception of Pakistani/Indian cuisine. The lamb was cooked perfectly, the rice had just the right amount of spice. It's a great option for both spicy lovers and those with a milder palate. The hospitality was fantastic and I would recommend this place to anyone, even those who may not typically enjoy this type of food. A trip to St. Louis just for this meal would be worth it.

Overall, the food at this place was incredible. I tried multiple dishes and everything was delicious. The Bloody Mary was disappointing, but that's not what they are known for. The mojitos, however, were excellent. Would definitely recommend for the food alone.

Jones has become my go-to restaurant for any special occasion or date night. The atmosphere, staff, and food are all consistently excellent. From the filet to the deviled eggs, every dish is prepared perfectly. I've never had a bad experience here and I don't think I ever will. Jones has definitely won my loyalty.

Held my husband's surprise birthday party at Black Sheep's basement bar for 35 people. From the initial inquiry with James to the night of the party with Adam as our bartender, the experience was fantastic. Great service and smooth event coordination. Highly recommend.

Quack & Cheese is a must-visit, especially for lunch. The duck fries are a standout, and the staff is accommodating and attentive. Even when there was a mix-up with my order, they handled it with grace and made sure I left satisfied. I'll definitely be returning, especially for a special date night. Highly recommend!

Casa Garcia is a pleasant restaurant with delicious chips, salsa, and bean dip. The tortilla soup was excellent, but the entrees were average at best. The quesadillas were lacking in flavor. Overall, not a bad meal but better options are available nearby.

Joe's is the go-to spot for delicious seafood. The service is quick and welcoming, making for a pleasant dining experience. The clam chowder and crab dishes are particularly outstanding. A must-visit for seafood lovers!
Disappointed with my iced coffee from this Starbucks location. Found a ton of coffee grinds at the bottom of my cup. Not the quick and easy boost I was hoping for. (1 star)
Horrible experience at Dunkin. Employees more interested in being on their phones than serving customers. Donuts were inedible and clearly old. Poor quality control. Will not be returning.

I had an amazing experience at this place. It was clean, beautiful, and the food was outstanding. The staff was lovely, very attentive and accommodating. I brought my 11-month-old for lunch with a friend and we both had a great time. This is now my favorite spot to visit. Highly recommend!

My first time dining at this restaurant was fantastic! The food was delicious and arrived quickly. Our waiter Lyndel was incredible and made our experience even better. The only downside was the slightly cramped feeling in the restaurant. Overall, an awesome experience.

Moreno Bakery is a fantastic family-owned bakery in the heart of Brandon that offers a wide variety of delicious baked goods, including fresh bread, cupcakes, flan, and cookies. Their Cuban sandwich with special sauce spread is a must-try, and my personal favorite are the almond sticks - a perfect treat for almond lovers. If you have a sweet tooth, Moreno Bakery is the place to go!

I would strongly advise against eating at this Chinese restaurant. Not only did my husband and child experience severe stomach aches after eating here, but the delivery service was extremely slow. This place used to be our favorite, but we will never eat here again. 0/5 stars.

I called for a price on fixing a flat tire and was quoted $35.99, which I found to be excessively high. This seems unfair in a city where wages are not sufficient for many people to live on. #tragic #smdh
The food at this place was delicious and the milkshakes were amazing! I will definitely return the next time I am in town.

I love the convenience of having a groomer come to me for my dogs. The pricing is competitive and includes essential grooming services. The only drawbacks are no teeth cleaning, flat pricing regardless of dog size, and potential feelings of judgment. Overall, highly recommended for efficient and affordable grooming services.

Thursday night at this restaurant is a wonderful experience filled with James Taylor-style live music. The food is delicious, the service is friendly, and the red Sangria is especially tasty. A great spot for a relaxing evening out.

Disappointing lunch experience. Bland, expensive food that was nearly tasteless and lukewarm. A waste of time and money. Would recommend trying a locally owned, authentic Mexican restaurant instead. Wishing I had gone to Mi Pueblo instead.
This place offers an awesome selection of beer, great music, and friendly service. Definitely worth checking out!
This bar is a new local favorite with amazing cocktails and the best burger in town. The brunch is also delicious. Highly recommend to anyone, whether local or passing through.

I have visited this salon a few times with okay experiences, but today's visit was awful. Multiple nail shapes were offered without consultation, no hand lotion or cuticle care provided. Despite a wide selection of polish options, the lack of professionalism and poor results make me hesitant to return. Beautiful salon, but may lack skilled technicians.

The food at this restaurant was delicious and the service was excellent. Despite the long wait for the formal side, we were able to enjoy the full menu at the bar area. The firecracker shrimp came out quickly, and both the salmon and swordfish were great. The live band added to the great atmosphere, and the servers were attentive. We also enjoyed the view and seeing the huge fish tank from the TV show Tanked. Overall, a fantastic experience and we would definitely go back.

The atmosphere at this small spot is nice, but be prepared for a busy brunch with a 30-45 minute wait. The spinach, caramelized onion, and goat cheese omelet is a must-try, just ask for less goat cheese as it was overwhelming. The fruit was also perfectly ripe. Note that it is cash only.

Passing through Tuscon and craving Native American inspired breakfast food? Look no further than this place! The pueblo, a green corn waffle with eggs and a choice of side, was simply amazing. The waiter's recommendation of combining syrup, hot sauce, egg, chorizo, and red sauce created a flavor explosion in every bite. I wish I could have this unique and flavorful meal every day! Five stars!

Fantastic Vietnamese restaurant in a strip mall setting. The pho is a must-try, a little bowl of heaven with customizable condiments. Delicious BBQ pork sandwiches with tender meat and fresh herbs. Cash only, but reasonably priced. The best pho in Nashville.

The Cake Bake Shop in Broad Ripple is a charming and magical must-visit for anyone with a sweet tooth. The stunning decor and delicious desserts make it a perfect spot for an Instagram-worthy treat. The Red Velvet Cake is hands down the best I've ever had, and the Lavender Latte was perfect. While prices are on the higher side, the quality and portion sizes make it worth it. The friendly staff and attention to detail make you feel like you're in a Disney movie. This hidden gem will definitely be a go-to for dessert cravings. Make sure to check out my Instagram highlight for more pictures!

If you're a fan of lobster, this is the place to be. With great prices, excellent service, and delicious food, it's the perfect spot for a casual dining experience. The Lobster special is a must-try, offering a generous portion of lobster, mussels, and steamers for a great price. The clam chowder and lobster roll are also highly recommended. Overall, a fantastic choice for lobster lovers.

While I only visited this facility briefly to pick up my father, I was greeted warmly by the receptionist who easily located him despite his difficult last name. She mentioned he was a great patient and told me to have a seat while he finished up. He was out in about 5 minutes and seemed happy and mostly pain-free. Though my experience was limited, the staff treated me well while I waited.

The mojo chicken sandwich at this intimate restaurant is absolutely delicious! The atmosphere is laid back with a Caribbean and Spanish flair, and the staff are friendly and provide great service. The prices are affordable, making it a must-visit for those looking for a tasty meal in a cozy setting.
Overall, disappointed with the food and failed to see the appeal of this place. It seems to cater more to beer snobs, but doesn't offer anything unique compared to other local bars.

I highly recommend this brewery for their great IPA, friendly staff, and nice outdoor seating area. Prices are reasonable compared to other breweries in the area, ranging from $6-$7 per pint. A must-visit for beer lovers!
Delivery issues resulted in our pizza being over 30 minutes late and arrived lukewarm at best. Disappointing experience, will not be ordering from this location again.

This ice cream shop is amazing. I love that they offer bananas foster and their freshly made waffle cones are top-notch. The atmosphere is adult-friendly and the owner is down to earth despite being a Harvard grad. My only complaint is that I wish it was located closer to the movie theater for a more convenient outing. Overall, a fantastic spot for some good motherfuckin ice cream.

Western Cycle is a one-stop shop for all things biking, catering to both kids and serious athletes. The staff are knowledgeable and dedicated to providing excellent customer service. One of the standout features is their discount drawer for returned items, where you can score great deals on high-quality products. Their commitment to customer loyalty and honesty makes them a top choice for bike enthusiasts.
My husband and I love this place! We have never had a bad meal and always receive wonderful service. Everything about this restaurant is wonderful - definitely worth your time!

Five Star pizza is a great option for delicious and reasonably priced pizza. The pepperoni bites are a must-try, but I would steer clear of the cinnamon bites. The pizzas are large and always come with coupons and deals from their website. The staff may not be the best, but the food is worth it. Delivery is quick, with orders ready in 20-30 minutes.

Overall, my experience at this place was just okay. They were able to accommodate our large party on short notice, which was a plus. I decided to try the black spaghetti, which other patrons raved about, but I found it to be pretty disgusting. It had a weird texture and almost tasted like plastic. However, my co-workers enjoyed their meals, so maybe it was just what I ordered that was subpar. I would give them another try if I'm ever in Nashville again. On the bright side, the drinks were great as expected.
The restaurant offers fast service with quality ingredients, a pleasant staff, and perhaps the healthiest meal in the entire mall. Highly recommended for a quick and nutritious meal option.

This restaurant offers amazing friendly service and an approachable atmosphere. The food is delicious, especially the sweet potatoes and gnocchi with blue cheese. I almost don't want to share how good it is because it's that amazing! Highly recommend trying it out.

If you haven't tried the homemade ice cream at this place yet, you're missing out! The different flavor selections based on the seasons and the friendly customer service make it a must-visit. Plus, they let you sample until you find the perfect flavor. Highly recommend!

I highly recommend asking for Phil when dining at this restaurant. While he may be a bit talkative, his service is exceptional. The recommendations he provides are top-notch, although the octopus was slightly overcooked during my last visit. You can dine affordably by ordering a few tapas, but I typically spend around $100 for two people including wine and dessert. The lack of private party space is a downside, but overall I would recommend giving this place a try. 4 stars.
Urban South Brewery in New Orleans has some of the best IPAs we've tasted, even coming from Cincinnati. The atmosphere is casual and low key, making for a great spot to enjoy quality craft beer.
The restaurant has a nice ambiance, but the sushi rolls were disappointing with flavors that were off. The tuna tartare was decent. Despite receiving a discount coupon, I'm unsure if I would return.

A reliable choice for group dining, this restaurant delivered great food and service consistently during my three visits in one weekend. Whether you're looking for breakfast or sandwiches, everyone in my party left satisfied. Great spot for fueling up during a busy weekend in town.

This store is my favorite - I love walking around and feel comfortable with every purchase. Prices are not inflated, and the staff is always friendly and helpful. One employee went above and beyond to help me pick out the perfect tree stand, and I'm grateful for his expertise. Highly recommend shopping here!

I was extremely disappointed with my recent stay at this Aloft hotel. The facility was poorly kept and dirty, with neighboring guests being loud and disruptive late into the night. The staff showed apathy and did little to address the issue. I would recommend finding a better option for accommodation in the area.

I recently moved to Nashville and was worried about finding a good and affordable vet. Dr. K at Parker's Paws exceeded my expectations. She was personable, great with my dog, and honest about pricing. She always tries the least expensive treatment first and discusses all options. I highly recommend Parker's Paws!

If you do not have a California license, do not bother going to this place. The bouncer was incredibly rude and did not accept my passport ID or other valid forms of identification. He singled me out of a group of people and refused to let me in without even asking me specific questions to confirm my identity. Absolutely unacceptable and unprofessional treatment. Avoid at all costs.

I absolutely love this Market! The ground beef and babyback ribs are the freshest ever! Despite being a bit pricey, it's worth it. Highly recommend for your grocery shopping needs, even if you have to travel a bit to get there.
El Limon is a hidden gem with the freshest ingredients and flavorful spices. The adjacent market sells spices at amazingly low prices. A must-try dining experience!

Despite rumors of closure, this restaurant is definitely still open. I had a delicious meal there today, including a beef dish and chicken on a stick. The food was so good that I even brought some home, including an amazing egg roll. The location is a bit hidden, but it's worth finding next to Burger King at the intersection of Keystone on Raymond.
A tongue-in-cheek review suggesting that people who meet certain criteria are likely to be perceived as douchey.
We visited a few months ago and enjoyed a delicious appetizer platter featuring cheese and honey. The prices are fair and the atmosphere is pleasant.

One of my top 2 favorite places in Brandon. The food is fresh, with a great blend of flavors. The pad-thai is a must-have. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the prices are low considering the quality. The restaurant is super clean- spotless, in fact. A must-visit in the Tampa/Brandon area. Highly recommend checking it out!

Avoid this salon at all costs. I experienced bugs in the past and received a subpar spray tan with outdated equipment during my most recent visit. I was never given the option for a better machine and felt like I was taken advantage of. I will be switching to Shine Salon for more consistent service.

My first experience with Mongolian BBQ was at this spot and I loved it. You can fill your bowl with as much ingredients as you want, hand it to the chef, and watch him work his magic. The sesame bread is a must-have, I always get an extra piece. Overall, a must-try dining experience.
This fantastic spot offers amazing Sno-balls with a variety of natural flavors. The service is super friendly, making for a wonderful experience. Can't wait to go back.

We really enjoyed our meal at this restaurant. The General Tsao chicken was delicious and the Curry Chicken was a hit with my wife. The portions were good sized and the prices were reasonable. The customer service was friendly and attentive. The small seating area was not an issue for us. Overall, a great dining experience and we will definitely be returning.

The food at this restaurant is absolutely top notch. I had the 3 course meal and each dish was beyond delicious. Our waiter Jenna was fantastic, making our experience sheer perfection. Overall, a fantastic dining experience - highly recommended for a special occasion.

Mellow Mushroom is hands down the best pizza spot in the bay. The Maui Wowie is a must-try with its delicious combination of pesto, chicken, bacon, pineapple, and banana peppers. The crust is consistently crunchy and perfect. The staff is friendly and we never have to wait for a table. Highly recommend for any pizza lover.
The food is great and the staff is attentive to allergies, but the drink pours are small and the bourbon tasted watered down, which was a disappointing aspect of the dining experience.
Perfectly crafted donut with a balanced sweetness that doesn't overpower the delicious dough. One of the best I've ever tasted.

Taste of Havana is a must-try. Delicious sandwiches, friendly service, and a welcoming atmosphere make it a gem. We will definitely be back and highly recommend it to others. Great food and great company.

Amazing drinks, delicious food, and a fun Tiki bar atmosphere. The scorpion bowl, piña colada, fried shrimp taco, and Jell-O-Shots/gummy tiki cocktails were all fantastic. The bar mixer was very friendly and the interior was unique and enjoyable. Perfect for a group of friends or a romantic date. YES YES YES I LOVE LOVE LOVE Tiki Tolteca in the French Quarter! Highly recommend for anyone in New Orleans or visiting. Incredibly enjoyable and non-commercial. A must-visit spot for a great night out. Enjoy! :-)

Extremely disappointed with our experience at this restaurant. After a 40-minute wait to get in, we were served a hot breakfast that was cold. Food was not prepared as requested, with burnt sausage links and runny egg whites. Had to repeatedly ask for coffee refills and the waitress seemed apathetic. To top it off, we waited over 10 minutes for our check. Not worth the $40 spent on a simple breakfast for two.

Sukho Thai may not be the most authentic Thai place in the area, but it consistently delivers in terms of food quality and service. I always go for the red or green curry, which I get "native Thai hot" and find delicious. The owner is kind and attentive, often waiting tables herself. The location beside a go-cart track adds a quirky touch. I only wish they had Kee Mao on the menu, but I can easily find that elsewhere. Overall, Sukho Thai is a reliable choice for a tasty meal.

Muriel's is a must-visit dining spot with a haunted history and a fantastic view of Jackson Square from the 2nd level wrap-around balcony. The indoor patio dining area is a personal favorite for a quieter dining experience. The dinner pre-fix menu is a great deal with delicious options like seafood gumbo, dijon mustard encrusted salmon, and bread pudding. The wood grilled pork chop at lunch was flavorful and moist, although the red beans and rice were a bit bland. Overall, Muriel's offers a great ambiance and delicious food that will make you want to return.

I had a fantastic lunch at this spot with fried green tomatoes and vegan Barq. The beer selection was great and the vibes were top-notch. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the music was pleasant. Will definitely be returning.

Overall, this Walmart in Meadowlark is convenient for a quick stop, especially for food items with good prices. The selection in the produce section is limited, but the snacks and canned food sections have good prices. Other items in the store can be hit or miss, with limited selection and potentially higher prices. Don't expect much help from associates, and the checkouts usually have enough staff to keep wait times short.

This yoga studio charges a premium price without a justification. Their two-for-one session deal for new customers has a restrictive 14-day expiration date. The location is inconveniently located off the busy highway.
